entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aarakocra makes two Wind Staff attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Gust of Wind.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The aarakocra casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Elementalism, Gust of Wind, Mage Hand, Message1/day: Lightning Bolt

entries.name: Wind Staff
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Dive Attack
entries.description: If the aarakocra is flying and dives at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage to the target.

entries.name: Simulacra
entries.description: When a simulacrum drops to 0 hit points or is subjected to a successful dispel magic spell (Difficulty (17)), it reverts to ice and snow and is destroyed.

entries.name: Talon
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Summon Air Elemental
entries.description: Five aarakocra within Close of each other can magically summon an air elemental. Each of the five must use its action and movement on three consecutive turns to perform an aerial dance and must maintain concentration while doing so (as if concentrating on a spell). When all five have finished their third turn of the dance, the elemental appears in an unoccupied space within Far of them. It is friendly toward them and obeys their spoken commands. It remains for 1 hour, until it or all its summoners die, or until any of its summoners dismisses it as a bonus action. A summoner can't perform the dance again until it finishes a short rest. When the elemental returns to the Elemental Plane of Air, any aarakocra within Very Close of it can return with it.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage, or 9 (3d4 + 2) Slashing damage if the aarakocra moved 30+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit.

entries.name: Wind Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Thunder damage. Hit or Miss: The javelin magically returns to the aarakocra's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The aarakocra is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The aarakocra has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The aartuk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aartuk makes two Branch attacks, two Radiant Pellet attacks, or one of each.

entries.name: Branch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Radiant Pellet
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (4d4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The aartuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):1/day each: calm emotions, detect magic, sending

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The aartuk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aartuk makes two Branch attacks, two Radiant Pellet attacks, or one of each.

entries.name: Branch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Radiant Pellet
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +2 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (3d4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The aartuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: revivify, speak with plants

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The aartuk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aartuk makes two Branch attacks, two Radiant Pellet attacks, or one of each.

entries.name: Branch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Radiant Pellet
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (3d4 + 1) radiant damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes two Tentacle Lash attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Mind Rot.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Thoughts, Minor Illusion

entries.name: Tentacle Lash
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of two tentacles, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Mind Rot
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (15), one creature the cultist can see within Far. Failure: 27 (6d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the cultist's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

name: Aberrant Spirit

entries.name: Regeneration (Slaad Only)
entries.description: The spirit regains 5 Hit Points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Whispering Aura (Mind Flayer Only)
entries.description: At the start of each of the spirit's turns, the spirit emits psionic energy if it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, each creature (other than you) within Very Close of the spirit. Failure: 2d6 Psychic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Claw (Slaad Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d10 + 3 + the spell's level Slashing damage, and the target can't regain Hit Points until the start of the spirit's next turn.

entries.name: Eye Ray (Beholderkin Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range Very Far. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level Psychic damage.

entries.name: Psychic Slam (Mind Flayer Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level Psychic damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Aberrant Form
entries.description: The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the zealot must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Weirdly Pliable
entries.description: The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zealot makes one Psychic Rend attack and two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Rend
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until the start of the zealot's next turn.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect thoughts, minor illusion1/day each: arcane gate, hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Aberrant Form
entries.description: The zealot exudes the chaos of the Far Realm. Any non-Aberration creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the zealot must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Weirdly Pliable
entries.description: The zealot, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is unnaturally flexible. The zealot can move through any space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zealot makes one Psychic Rend attack and two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Rend
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until the start of the zealot's next turn.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The zealot magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the stunned condition on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The zealot casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect thoughts, minor illusion1/day each: arcane gate, hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The abhorrent overlord's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (15)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: confusion, crown of madness, suggestion

entries.name: Insatiable Greed
entries.description: The abhorrent overlord can sense the presence of gold within 1,Melee of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The abhorrent overlord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abhorrent overlord makes two attacks with its claws.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The abhorrent overlord regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt if the target is a creature.

entries.name: Storm of Crows (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The abhorrent overlord conjures a swarm of spectral crows and harpies in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the overlord can see within Very Far of it. The sphere remains for 1 minute or until the overlord loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell), and its area is lightly obscured and difficult terrain.Any creature that moves into the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15). A creature takes 16 (3d10) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Force Blast
entries.description: Each creature in a Close cube originating from the abjurer must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is pushed up to Very Close away from the abjurer. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The abjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, message, prestidigitation2/day each: dispel magic, lightning bolt, mage armor1/day each: arcane lock, banishment, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, wall of force

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Eldritch Restoration
entries.description: If destroyed, the aboleth gains a new body in 5d10 days, reviving with all its Hit Points in the Far Realm or another location chosen by the DM.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the aboleth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Mucus Cloud
entries.description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by mucus. Finesse Reaction Roll (14), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the aboleth at the end of the aboleth's turn. Failure: The target is cursed. Until the curse ends, the target's skin becomes slimy, the target can breathe air and water, and it can't regain Hit Points unless it is underwater.While the cursed creature is outside a body of water, the creature takes 6 (1d12) Acid damage at the end of every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to its skin before those minutes have passed.

entries.name: Probing Telepathy
entries.description: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aboleth makes two Tentacle attacks and uses either Consume Memories or Dominate Mind if available.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of four tentacles.

entries.name: Consume Memories
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (16), one creature within Close that is Charmed or Grappled by the aboleth. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The aboleth gains the target's memories if the target is a Humanoid and is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this action.

entries.name: Dominate Mind (2/Day)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (16), one creature the aboleth can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Charmed condition until the aboleth dies or is on a different plane of existence from the target. While Charmed, the target acts as an ally to the aboleth and is under its control while within Far of it. In addition, the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.The target repeats the save whenever it takes damage as well as after every 24 hours it spends at least 1 mile away from the aboleth, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Abolethic Vessel
entries.description: The spawn must obey its aboleth master.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The spawn can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries.description: The spawn takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes it goes without being immersed in water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spawn makes one Spear attack, two Tentacle attacks, and one Psychic Lash attack.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) and takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The spawn has four tentacles, each of which can grapple one creature.

entries.name: Psychic Lash
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Fear of Fire
entries.description: If the yeti takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two attacks, using Claw or Ice Throw in any combination.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage.

entries.name: Ice Throw
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +11, range Far. Hit: 12 (2d4 + 7) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage.

entries.name: Chilling Gaze
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (18), one creature the yeti can see within Close. Failure: 21 (6d6) Cold damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the yeti's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage. Success: The target is immune to this yeti's Chilling Gaze for 1 hour.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 45 (10d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Bad Flier
entries.description: The abyssal chicken falls at the end of a turn if it's airborne and the only thing holding it aloft is its flying speed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abyssal chicken makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Claw

entries.description: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Strength Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, the creature takes 45 (10d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (19), each creature in a Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 60 (11d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

Second Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to wake it.

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:Dream Breath. The dragon exhales mist in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.Moonlight Breath. The dragon exhales a beam of moonlight in a Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 49 (9d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Aversion to Fire
entries.description: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The oblex makes two pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Eat Memories
entries.description: The oblex targets one creature it can see within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from its ability checks and attack rolls. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends.The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):3/day each: charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts, hypnotic pattern

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries.description: Each creature of the dracolich's choice that is within Very Far of the dracolich and aware of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (19) or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dracolich's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

Second Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.description: The dragon doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Nebulous Thoughts
entries.description: Magical attempts to read the dragon's mind or glean its thoughts fail automatically.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

Each creature in the sphere must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (19), taking 55 (10d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Time-Warping Breath
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (18), each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a Far Cone. Failure: The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

entries.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a Far cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, and it has the poisoned condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Fabricate (1/Day)
entries.description: The dragon can cast fabricate, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Desiccating Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales yellowish necrotic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) necrotic damage and is weakened until the end of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on Strength-based ability checks and Strength saving throws, and the creature's weapon attacks that rely on Strength deal half damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):1/day each: bane, control water, create or destroy water

entries.name: Ice Walk
entries.description: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (19), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 54 (12d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The drone regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Spell Storing
entries.description: A spellcaster who wears the drone's amulet can cause the drone to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the drone. The spell has no effect but is stored within the drone. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the drone casts the stored spell with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The drone makes two fist attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Detention Orb
entries.description: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within Close of itself. The creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to Close in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (Difficulty (15)) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The absorber has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the absorber moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits its claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the absorber can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The absorber makes three attacks: one with its bite or Mind Bolt and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

entries.name: Mind Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 22 (4d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Horrid Gnashing
entries.description: The nullifier's mouths gnash incoherently while it can see any enemies. Each creature that starts its turn within Close of the nullifier and can hear it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). Unless the save succeeds, the creature rolls a d8 to determine what it does during the current turn:1-4: The creature is stunned until the end of the turn.5-6: The creature is frightened until the end of the turn and uses its movement to get as far as possible from the nullifier.7-8: The creature doesn't move, and it uses its action to make one melee attack against a random creature (other than itself) if one is within reach. It otherwise does nothing

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The nullifier's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (16)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: counterspell (see "Reactions" below), detect magic, dispel magic, see invisibility1/day: antimagic field

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nullifier has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nullifier makes three attacks: one with its bites and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bites
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if it's a creature. The nullifier has two claws, each of which can grapple one creature.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The reverser has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The reverser makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The aerosaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aerosaur makes one Bite attack and one Talons attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the aerosaur can't Bite another target.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Wing Gusts (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The aerosaur beats its wings, creating bursts of thunderous force. Each creature within Very Close of the aerosaur must make a Strength Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) thunder damage, is pushed up to Close horizontally from the aerosaur, and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed up to Close horizontally from the aerosaur.

entries.name: Air Form
entries.description: The elemental can enter a creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elemental makes two Thunderous Slam attacks.

entries.name: Thunderous Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Thunder damage.

entries.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (13), one Medium or smaller creature in the elemental's space. Failure: 24 (4d10 + 2) Thunder damage, and the target is pushed up to Close straight away from the elemental and has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The myrmidon makes three Flail attacks.

entries.name: Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The myrmidon makes one Flail attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 18 (4d8) lightning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be stunned until the end of the myrmidon's next turn.

entries.name: Hold the Line
entries.description: While the hoplite is holding a spear, other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from the hoplite when they move within Very Close of it. When the hoplite hits a creature with an opportunity attack using its spear, the creature takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, and the creature's speed becomes 0 for the rest of the turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hoplite makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The dwarf's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: hunter's mark, jump, pass without trace, speak with animals, speak with plants

entries.name: Handaxe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Handaxe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The aldani can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aldani makes two attacks with its claws.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (11)). The aldani has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The alhoon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The alhoon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The alhoon makes two Chilling Grasp or Arcane Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Chilling Grasp
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the alhoon regains 14 hit points.

entries.name: Arcane Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 28 (8d6) force damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The alhoon magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (16) or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The alhoon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: dancing lights, detect magic, detect thoughts, disguise self, mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: dominate monster, globe of invulnerability, invisibility, modify memory, plane shift (self only), wall of force

entries.name: Abyssal Rift
entries.description: If the alkilith surrounds a door, window, or similar opening continuously for 6d6 days, the opening becomes a permanent portal to a random layer of the Abyss.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The alkilith can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the alkilith is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the alkilith move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the alkilith isn't ordinary slime or fungus.

entries.name: Foment Confusion
entries.description: Any creature that isn't a demon that starts its turn within Close of the alkilith must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (18), or it hears a faint buzzing in its head for a moment and has disadvantage on its next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.If the saving throw against Foment Confusion fails by 5 or more, the creature is instead subjected to the confusion spell for 1 minute (no concentration required by the alkilith). While under the effect of that confusion, the creature is immune to Foment Confusion.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The alkilith has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The alkilith can climb difficult surfaces, such as upside down on ceilings, without making an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The alkilith doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The alkilith makes three Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) acid damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The allip can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The allip doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Maddening Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Howling Babble (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Each creature within Close of the allip that can hear it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, a target takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage, and it is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Whispers of Compulsion
entries.description: The allip chooses up to three creatures it can see within Far of it. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14), or it takes 12 (2d8 + 3) psychic damage and must use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against one creature of the allip's choice that the allip can see. Constructs and Undead are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the allosaurus moved 30+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition, and the allosaurus can make one Bite attack against it.

entries.name: Fear of Fire
entries.description: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Chilling Gaze
entries.description: The yeti targets one creature it can see within Close of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) against this magic or take 21 (6d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to this yeti's gaze for 1 hour.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The yeti exhales a Close cone of frigid air. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18), taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Fear of Fire
entries.description: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Chilling Gaze
entries.description: The yeti targets one creature it can see within Close of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

entries.name: Familiar
entries.description: With the DM's permission, the find familiar spell can summon an almiraj.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries.description: The almiraj has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Horn
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hide in Plain Sight
entries.description: The alseid has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide while it is in grassland.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The alseid's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: cure wounds, charm person, sleep1/day each: calm emotions, lesser restoration, plant growth

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The alseid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The alseid makes two radiant touch attacks.

entries.name: Radiant Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The altisaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The altisaur makes one Stomp attack and one Tail attack. The altisaur can't make both attacks against the same target.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 33 (7d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (22) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 45 (8d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage, and the target is pushed up to Close horizontally from the altisaur.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Mucous Cloud
entries.description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by a cloud of sticky mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be restrained until the end of the aboleth's next turn.

entries.name: Probing Telepathy
entries.description: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aboleth makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Ruidium Dart
entries.description: The golem can conjure a magic dart made of ruidium and hurl it at another creature it can see within Very Far of itself. The dart strikes the target unerringly and vanishes on contact. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failed saving throw, the target takes 24 (7d6) psychic damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. In addition, if the target is not already suffering from ruidium corruption, it becomes corrupted when it fails the saving throw. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: If the assassin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The assassin makes two Poison Blade attacks.

entries.name: Poison Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The drake has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the drake's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the drake surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) force damage.

entries.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Strength Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (5d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):1/day each: protection from evil and good, Tenser's floating disk, unseen servant

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within Very Far of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to Far in any direction, but not beyond Very Far of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the amnizu's darkvision.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The amnizu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The amnizu uses Blinding Rot or Forgetfulness, if available. It also makes two Taskmaster Whip attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The amnizu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (19)):At will: command3/day: dominate monster1/day: feeblemind

entries.name: Taskmaster Whip
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Blinding Rot
entries.description: The amnizu targets one or two creatures that it can see within Far of it. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (19) or take 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and be blinded until the start of the amnizu's next turn.

entries.name: Forgetfulness (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The amnizu targets one creature it can see within Far of it. That creature must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (18) or take 26 (4d12) psychic damage and become stunned for 1 minute. A stunned creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is stunned for the full minute, it forgets everything it sensed, experienced, and learned during the last 5 hours.

entries.name: Two Heads
entries.description: The amphisbaena has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The amphisbaena makes two bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 3 (1d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The amphisbaena makes two attacks, only one of which can be a constrict attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the anarch can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The anarch deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Spiked Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The anchorite can use its action to polymorph into a boar or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The anchorite's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day: thunderwave (2d8 damage)1/day each: augury, bless, lightning bolt (8d6 damage), revivify

entries.name: Clawed Gauntlet (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tusk (Boar Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Strength Reaction Roll (23). On a failed save, the creature takes 63 (14d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23), +15 to hit with spell attacks):1/day each: blink, control water, dispel magic, freedom of movement, globe of invulnerability, plane shift, protection from evil and good, sending

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Melf's Acid Arrow (level 4 version).

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach Close. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Acid damage.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (22), each creature in a Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 67 (15d8) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21), +13 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Detect Magic, Fear, Melf's Acid Arrow (level 4 version)1/day each: Create Undead, Speak with Dead, Vitriolic Sphere (level 5 version)

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Shatter (level 3 version).

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +16, reach Close. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (23), each creature in a Very Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 88 (16d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (22)):At will: Detect Magic, Invisibility, Mage Hand, Shatter (level 3 version)1/day each: Scrying, Sending

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of (A) Sleep Breath or (B) Spellcasting to cast Scorching Ray (level 3 version).

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach Close. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (21), each creature in a Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 58 (13d8) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Sleep Breath
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (21), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save. Second Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to wake it.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: Detect Magic, Minor Illusion, Scorching Ray (level 3 version), Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell), Speak with Animals1/day each: Control Weather, Detect Thoughts

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack

name: Ancient Dragon Turtle

entries.name: Amphibious

entries.description: If the dragon turtle would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 350 hit points, and it recharges its Steam Breath. Additionally, the dragon turtle can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 62,000 XP (124,000 XP total) for defeating the dragon turtle after its Blessing of the Sea activates.

entries.name: Time-Warping Breath
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (22), each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a Far Cone. Failure: The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Cycle of Rebirth
entries.description: If the dragon dies, its soul coalesces into a steely egg and teleports to a random plane of existence. The egg is immune to all damage and hatches into a time dragon wyrmling after 1d100 years. The dragon retains all memories and knowledge it gained in its previous life.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

entries.name: Time Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a wave of shimmering light in a Far cone. Nonmagical objects and vegetation in that area that aren't being worn or carried crumble to dust. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (24). On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage, it has the poisoned condition, and other creatures have resistance to all damage it deals. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves.

entries.name: Time Gate (1/Day)
entries.description: The dragon conjures a Close-diameter, circular portal in the space between its horns or in an unoccupied space it can see within Close of itself. The portal links to a precise location on any plane of existence at a point in time up to 8,000 years from the present, whether past or future. The portal lasts for 24 hours or until the dragon's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). The portal has a front and a back on each plane where it appears. Travel through the portal is possible only by moving through its front. Anything that does so is transported to the destination, appearing in the unoccupied space nearest to the portal. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent portals created by the dragon from opening in the rulers' presence or anywhere within their domains.

entries.description: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

entries.description: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.
