entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (26). On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) acid damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

original_cr: 27 (XP 105,000, or 210,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that hits the pudding with a melee attack roll takes 4 (1d8) Acid damage. Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the pudding and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative -1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the pudding and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the weapon.In 1 minute, the pudding can eat through Melee of nonmagical wood or metal.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Dissolving Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) Acid damage. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the armor.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the bearer takes damage or makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, roll a d6. On a 5 or 6, the bearer goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the bearer has advantage on melee attack rolls, it can Dash as a bonus action, and it must attack the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the bearer attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the bearer goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed or its creator gives it a pristine black rose.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the bearer to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a successful save, the bearer drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bearer makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blackguard makes three attacks, using Glaive, Shortbow, or both.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dreadful Aspect (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: Each enemy within Close of the blackguard must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened of the blackguard for 1 minute. If a frightened target ends its turn more than Close away from the blackguard, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The blackguard casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):2/day each: command, dispel magic, find steed

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The bullywug's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries.description: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bullywug makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its spear.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. A creature hit by a bullywug's Spear attack must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature poisoned in this way is also paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The lieutenant has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lieutenant's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lieutenant makes three Longsword or Javelin Launcher attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 20 (3d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Javelin Launcher
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target has the prone condition.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The scout has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the scout's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes three Armblade or Bolt Launcher attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Snare Trap.

entries.name: Armblade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bolt Launcher
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Snare Trap (1/Day)
entries.description: The scout deploys a Tiny mechanical trap on a solid surface within Very Close of itself. The trap is hidden, requiring a successful Difficulty (17) Intelligence (Investigation) check to find. The trap lasts for 1 minute. Whenever an enemy enters a space within Very Close of the trap or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (16) or take 21 (6d6) piercing damage and have the prone condition. A creature makes this saving throw only once per turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The blazebear has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Mist Sight
entries.description: The blazebear can see normally through heavily obscured areas created by mist or fog, including areas created by spells such as Fog Cloud.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blazebear makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with Stunning Gaze if available.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d12 + 7) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

entries.name: Stunning Gaze (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The blazebear targets two creatures it can see within Very Far of itself. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until the start of the blazebear's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The void soother makes two Mace or Void Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The void soother casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: guidance, light1/day each: calm emotions, lesser restoration, remove curse, protection from energy

entries.name: Void Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Feed on Fire
entries.description: If the weird takes fire damage from a spell or other magical effect, its size increases by one category. If there isn't enough room for the weird to increase in size, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available. While the weird is Large or bigger, it makes Strength checks and saving throws with advantage. If the weird starts its turn at Gargantuan size, the weird releases energy in an explosion. Each creature within Close of the weird must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. The weird's size then becomes Medium.

entries.name: Form of Fire and Water
entries.description: The weird can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. In addition, the weird can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the weird enters another creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Heated Body
entries.description: A creature that touches the weird or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The weird sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, or 11 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage if the weird is Large or bigger.

entries.name: Astral Implosion
entries.description: If the blob is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it implodes and ejects any creatures and objects engulfed by it into the Astral Sea. The blob itself vanishes, leaving behind a layer of slime on everything that was within Out of Range of it. In 1d20 years, the blob reconstitutes on a random world in the Material Plane.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the blob fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The blob has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blob makes two Pseudopod attacks and uses Engulf. It can replace one attack with a use of Restraining Glob.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +15, reach Close. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) Force damage.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: The blob moves up to its Speed and can move through the spaces of Huge or smaller creatures and objects. Strength Reaction Roll (23), each creature or object whose space the blob enters for the first time during this move. Failure: The target is engulfed. While engulfed, a target has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the blob, and when the blob moves, the engulfed target moves with it. A nonmagical object is destroyed after spending 1 minute engulfed.While engulfed, a creature takes 21 (6d6) Force damage at the start of each of its turns, is suffocating, has the Restrained condition, and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. An engulfed creature that is reduced to 0 Hit Points dissolves into ash, which is ejected into the Astral Sea. Success: The target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Restraining Glob
entries.description: The blob lobs a slimy glob at one Large or smaller creature it can see within Out of Range of itself. Agility Reaction Roll (23), the targeted creature. Failure: 18 (3d6 + 8) Acid damage. The glob rolls the target Far straight toward the blob, and the target has the Restrained condition until the end of its next turn, when the glob harmlessly dissolves. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes three melee attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be charmed by the vampire for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target is infatuated with the vampire. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Rapier
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The vampire can also grapple the target (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a creature and the vampire has a hand free.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hawk has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hawk's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage if the target is Bloodied.

entries.name: Blood Curse of Binding (1/Day)
entries.description: As a bonus action, the blood hunter targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or have its speed reduced to 0 and be unable to take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The blood hunter has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
entries.description: The blood hunter can innately cast hex. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The blood hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blood hunter attacks twice with a weapon.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Blood Witch Dance
entries.description: The witch can use a bonus action to control the movement of one creature cursed by its hex spell that it can see within Close of it. The creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or use its reaction to move up to Close in a direction of the witch's choice.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the witch's darkvision.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The witch's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). The witch can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: alter self, detect magic, eldritch blast (at 11th level), false life, levitate (self only), mage armor (self only)3/day each: hellish rebuke, hex, scorching ray (at 3rd level)1/day each: circle of death, enthrall, suggestion

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The witch makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its shortsword.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The harpy has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Dark Devotion
entries.description: The harpy has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The harpy makes two melee attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Chain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (17)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the giant can't use this attack on anyone else.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abishai makes three Bite or Lightning Strike attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 36 (8d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The abishai casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: disguise self, mage hand, minor illusion2/day each: charm person, dispel magic, greater invisibility, wall of force

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 21 (6d6) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The slaad makes three Mutating Claw attacks.

entries.name: Mutating Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage. If the target is a Humanoid not cursed by a slaad, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (15). Failure: The target is cursed. The cursed target can't regain Hit Points, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) after every 24 hours and doesn't return to normal after finishing a Long Rest. If the curse reduces the target's Hit Point maximum to 0, the curse ends, and instead of dying, the target instantly transforms into a Red Slaad or, if it can cast spells of level 3 or higher, a Green Slaad. Only a Wish spell can reverse this transformation.

entries.name: Bloodied Fury
entries.description: While Bloodied, the boar has Advantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the boar moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Death Gaze
entries.description: When a creature that can see the bodak's eyes starts its turn within Close of the bodak, the bodak can force it to make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) if the bodak isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points unless it is immune to the frightened condition. Otherwise, a creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage on a failed save.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the bodak until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the bodak in the meantime, that creature must immediately make the saving throw.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: The bodak takes 5 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The bodak doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Withering Gaze
entries.description: One creature that the bodak can see within Far of it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13), taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Podling Link
entries.description: The plant can see through and communicate telepathically with any of its podlings within 10 miles of it.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: When the plant dies, it returns to life in the place where it died 1d12 months later, unless the ground where it took root is sown with salt or soaked with poison.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The plant doesn't require sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The plant makes three Vine Lash attacks.

entries.name: Vine Lash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained. The plant has four vines, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Entrapping Pod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature grappled by the plant. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) acid damage, and the target is pulled into the plant's space and enveloped by the pod, and the grapple ends. While enveloped, the target is restrained, and it has total cover against attacks and effects originating outside the pod. The enveloped target must also immediately succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be stunned by the plant's sapping enzymes until it is removed from the pod or the plant dies. The enveloped target doesn't require air and gains 1 level of exhaustion for each hour it spends in the pod. If the target dies while enveloped, it immediately emerges from the pod as a living podling, wearing or carrying all of the original creature's equipment.As an action, a creature within Very Close of the bodytaker plant that is outside the pod can open the pod and pull the target free with a successful Difficulty (15) Strength check. If the plant dies, the target is no longer restrained and can escape from the pod by spending Very Close of movement, exiting prone. The plant has one pod, which can envelop one creature at a time.

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Oil Puddle
entries.description: The boggle creates a puddle of nonflammable oil. The puddle is 1 inch deep and covers the ground in the boggle's space. The puddle is difficult terrain for all creatures except boggles and lasts for 1 hour. The oil has one of the following additional effects of the boggle's choice:Slippery Oil. Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (11) or fall prone.Sticky Oil. Any non-boggle creature that enters the puddle or starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (11) or be restrained. On its turn, a creature can use an action to try to extricate itself, ending the effect and moving into the nearest unoccupied space of its choice with a successful Difficulty (11) Strength check.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Infernal Sting attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Infernal Sting
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the devil's next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points.

entries.name: Commander of Bones
entries.description: As a bonus action, the knight can target one skeleton or zombie it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the target must obey the knight's commands until the knight dies or until the knight releases it as a bonus action. The knight can command up to twelve undead at a time this way.

entries.name: Master of the Pallid Banner
entries.description: While within Far of the knight, any undead ally of the knight has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The knight is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:1st level (4 slots): command, compelled duel, hellish rebuke, wrathful smite2nd level (3 slots): branding smite, crown of madness, darkness, find steed, magic weapon

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight attacks twice with one of its weapons.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The naga makes two Bite attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Serpentine Gaze.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Serpentine Gaze
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), one creature the naga can see within Far. Failure: 13 (3d6 + 3) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the naga's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Mage Hand, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Command, Detect Thoughts, Lightning Bolt

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bone roc makes one Beak attack and two Talons attacks.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Adhesive
entries.description: The bone whelk can cause Medium or smaller objects to adhere to it. A Medium or smaller creature that touches the bone whelk is grappled by it (escape Difficulty (10)).

entries.name: Death Scream
entries.description: When the bone whelk dies, it emits a blood-curdling shriek than can be heard out to a range of Very Far. This shriek causes nonmagical, organic material within Very Close of the bone whelk to rot. Each creature within Very Close of the bone whelk when it dies takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The bone whelk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: While its master lives, a destroyed boneclaw gains a new body in 1d10 hours, with all its hit points. The new body appears within 1 mile of the boneclaw's master.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The boneclaw doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The boneclaw makes two Piercing Claw attacks.

entries.name: Piercing Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, the boneclaw can pull the target up to Very Close toward itself, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)). The boneclaw has two claws. While a claw grapples a target, the claw can attack only that target.

entries.name: Shadow Jump (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: If the boneclaw is in dim light or darkness, each creature of the boneclaw's choice within Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 34 (5d12 + 2) necrotic damage.The boneclaw then teleports up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see. It can bring one creature it's grappling, teleporting that creature to an unoccupied space it can see within Very Close of its destination. The destination spaces of this teleportation must be in dim light or darkness.

entries.name: Compression
entries.description: The boneless can move through any opening at least 1 inch wide without squeezing. It can also squeeze to fit into a space that a Tiny creature could fit in.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The boneless doesn't require sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The boneless makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Large or smaller creature, the creature is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)), and the boneless can use Crushing Embrace.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Crushing Embrace
entries.description: The boneless wraps its body around a Large or smaller creature grappled by it. While the boneless is attached, the target is blinded and is unable to breathe. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) at the start of each of the boneless' turns or take 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If something moves the target, the boneless moves with it. The boneless can detach itself by spending Very Close of its movement. A creature, including the target, can use its action to try to detach the boneless and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful Difficulty (13) Strength check. When the boneless dies, it detaches from any creature it is attached to.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The goblin has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

entries.name: Wild Magic
entries.description: Each time the goblin casts a spell (including cantrips), there is an accompanying surge of wild magic; roll on the Wild Magic Surge table in the Player's Handbook to determine the wild magic effect.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin can cast a randomly determined 1st-level wizard spell once per day. Intelligence is its spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (10), +2 to hit with spell attacks).

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save Difficulty (15)), requiring no material components:At will: disguise self, mage armor (self only), silent image, speak with animals1/day: conjure fey

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:Cantrips (at will): dancing lights, eldritch blast, friends, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, vicious mockery1st-5th level (3 5th-level slots): blink, charm person, dimension door, dominate beast, faerie fire, fear, hold monster, misty step, phantasmal force, seeming, sleep

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: When the goblin makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a d10 to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save Difficulty (15)), requiring no material components:At will: alter self, false life, levitate (self only), mage armor (self only), silent image1/day each: feeblemind, finger of death, plane shift

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:Cantrips (at will): eldritch blast, fire bolt, friends, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp1st-5th level (4 5th-level slots): banishment, burning hands, flame strike, hellish rebuke, magic circle, scorching ray, scrying, stinking cloud, suggestion, wall of fire

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

id: Booyahg Slave of the Great Old One_qwvt4tmw8
name: Booyahg Slave of the Great Old One

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells (spell save Difficulty (15)), requiring no material components:At will: detect magic, jump, levitate, mage armor (self only), speak with dead1/day each: arcane gate, true seeing

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, shocking grasp1st-5th level (3 5th-level slots): armor of Agathys, arms of Hadar, crown of madness, clairvoyance, contact other plane, detect thoughts, dimension door, dissonant whispers, dominate beast, telekinesis, vampiric touch

entries.name: Whispering Aura
entries.description: At the start of each of the goblin's turns, each creature of its choice within Very Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage, provided that the goblin isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Khurgorbaeyag's Gift
entries.description: Khurgorbaeyag saw fit to gift this goblin with powers that enable it to dominate others. The goblin has 1d3 other goblins that slavishly obey its orders.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: The goblin found a magic item (a necklace of fireballs, a circlet of blasting, or the like) and learned how to use it.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Borborygmos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Poor Depth Perception
entries.description: Borborygmos has disadvantage on any attack roll against a target more than Close away.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: Borborygmos deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Borborygmos can use his Frightful Presence. He also makes two attacks: one with his maul and one with his stomp.

entries.name: Maul
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (6d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (21) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries.description: Each creature of Borborygmos's choice that is within Far of him and can see or hear him must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or become frightened of him for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Borborygmos's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The worm regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The worm makes two attacks: one with its grinding jaws and one with its stinger.

entries.name: Grinding Jaws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail Stinger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (19), taking 42 (12d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Hustle
entries.description: The smuggler can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size, but it can't stop there.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Pistol
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Hustle
entries.description: The underboss can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size, but it can't stop there.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The underboss makes three attacks, using Poisoned Blade or Arcane Firearm in any combination.

entries.name: Poisoned Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the underboss's next turn. If the target is already Poisoned, it instead takes an extra 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Arcane Firearm
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Close. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) Force damage.

entries.name: Glacial Aura
entries.description: At the end of the borthak's turn, slippery ice covers surfaces within Very Close of the borthak. This ice is difficult terrain. When a creature other than the borthak enters the ice's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (16) or have the prone condition. The ice disappears at the start of the borthak's next turn.

entries.name: Webbed Feet
entries.description: The borthak can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The borthak makes one Bite attack or uses Noxious Regurgitation if available, and it makes two Stomp attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Noxious Regurgitation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The borthak spews acid at a creature it can see within Very Far of itself. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, the creature takes 24 (7d6) acid damage and has the poisoned condition until the start of the borthak's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: Augustus wields a +2 Longsword.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Augustus regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Augustus dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Augustus makes any combination of two Bite, Claw, or Magic Longsword attacks.

entries.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the werewolf stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

entries.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Magic Longsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If Delour is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if he fails, provided he doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries.description: Delour can move through the space of a Medium or larger creature.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Delour regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Delour dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Delour makes any combination of three Bite, Shortsword, or Hand Crossbow attacks.

entries.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be cursed with lycanthropy. While cursed in this way, the target retains its alignment, languages, and equipment but otherwise uses the wererat stat block, excluding actions that require equipment the target doesn't have. During any night when there's a full moon in the sky, the target becomes an NPC under the DM's control and remains so until the night ends. A Remove Curse spell or similar magic ends this curse.

entries.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away, and then its bones explode. Each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (10) or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to Melee horizontally for every Melee it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Trident melee attacks or two Lightning Discharge attacks.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Lightning Discharge
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):1/day each: enlarge/reduce, invisibility, stinking cloud, web

entries.name: Fungal Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the trudge to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the trudge drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Tusk
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: The brain breaker is aware of creatures within 1 mile of itself that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The brain breaker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: The brain breaker can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The brain breaker can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The brain breaker makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The brain breaker casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The brain breaker can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Creatures of the brain breaker's choice within Far of itself must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Detect Sentience
entries.description: The brain can sense the presence and location of any creature within Very Far of it that has an Intelligence of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers, unless the creature is protected by a mind blank spell.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The brain's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), detect thoughts, mage hand, zone of truth3/day each: charm person, hold person1/day each: compulsion, hold monster, sleep (3rd-level version), Tasha's hideous laughter

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The brain doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the brain's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against the brain until the end of the brain's next turn.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The brain magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (14) or take 17 (3d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 14 (4d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Sleep Breath
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it repeats the save. Second Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to wake it.

name: Brass Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:Elemental Breath. The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 84 (13d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Sapping Breath. The greatwyrm exhales gas in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

original_cr: 28 (XP 120,000, or 240,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Intellect Fortress
entries.description: The braxat's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The braxat makes two Greatclub attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The braxat exhales a Close cone of acid. Each creature in the cone must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18), taking 26 (4d12) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The braxat casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):1/day each: compulsion, fear

entries.name: Flame Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the gorgon's turns, each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the gorgon takes 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The gorgon sheds Bright Light in a Very Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Very Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gorgon makes two Gore attacks.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Smelting Charge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The gorgon moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and can move through the spaces of Medium or smaller creatures. Each time the gorgon enters a creature's space for the first time during this move, that target is subjected to the following effect. Agility Reaction Roll (16). Failure: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) Fire damage, and the target is pulled into the gorgon's space and has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)); if the gorgon already has a creature Grappled, the target has the Prone condition instead. Until the grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition. When the gorgon moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing no extra movement.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The breath drinker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Radiant Absorption
entries.description: When the breath drinker is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The breath drinker makes two Enervating Claw attacks. It can also use Drink Breath.

entries.name: Enervating Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)). The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Drink Breath
entries.description: The breath drinker targets a creature that has the incapacitated condition or that the breath drinker is grappling and that isn't a Construct or an Undead. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the target takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage, and its Charisma score is reduced by 1d6. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If this reduces the target's Charisma to 0, the target dies. Until the breath drinker dies, the dead target can't be returned to life by any means short of divine intervention. On a successful save, the target takes half as much necrotic damage only. On a successful or failed save, the breath drinker regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The breath drinker has the invisible condition. This invisibility ends immediately after the breath drinker hits or misses with an attack roll or uses Drink Breath.

entries.name: Fungus Stride
entries.description: Once on its turn, the bridesmaid can use Very Close of its movement to step magically into one living mushroom or fungus patch within Very Close and emerge from another within Far of the first one, appearing in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the second mushroom or fungus patch. The mushrooms and patches must be large or bigger.

entries.name: Hallucination Spores
entries.description: The bridesmaid ejects spores at one creature it can see within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: The bridesmaid releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a Very Close-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (10). On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The brigganock has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Soul Light
entries.description: The brigganock is accompanied by an insubstantial, invulnerable ball of light that contains its soul. The brigganock can't turn off the light or control its brightness. The soul light sheds bright light in a Very Close radius and dim light for an additional Very Close. If the brigganock dies, its soul light fades away.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: Using a pickaxe or similar tool, a brigganock can burrow through solid rock at a speed of Very Close, leaving a 6-inch-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Pickaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The brigganock casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)):At will: minor illusion, spare the dying1/day each: animal friendship, faerie fire, meld into stone, silence

entries.name: Time Lapse (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The brigganock accelerates the passage of time around itself, enabling it to accomplish up to 1 hour of work in a matter of seconds. This work can't affect any creature other than the brigganock, or any object being worn or carried by another creature, and the activity must take place within a Very Close cube. For example, the brigganock could use this action to rapidly carve a pumpkin, cook and eat dinner, move a pile of stones, or tie a dozen knots in a length of rope.

entries.name: Bladed Hide
entries.description: At the start of each of its turns, the moorbounder deals 5 (2d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The moorbounder's long jump is up to Far and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The moorbounder makes two attacks: one with its blades and one with its claws.

entries.name: Blades
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If Antigonos moves at least Very Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be pushed up to Very Close away and knocked prone.

entries.name: Decrepit State
entries.description: Antigonos has disadvantage on his attack rolls.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: Antigonos can perfectly recall any path he has traveled.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of his turn, Antigonos can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphora
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If there is not already a creature inside the amphora, the target is restrained inside. As an action, the restrained creature can make a Difficulty (14) Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, escaping from the amphora on a success. The effect also ends if the amphora is destroyed. The amphora has AC 8, 20 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 16 (3d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Repulsion Breath
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target is pushed up to Close straight away from the dragon and has the Prone condition.

name: Bronze Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:Elemental Breath. The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 84 (13d12) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Sapping Breath. The greatwyrm exhales gas in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the sable remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The sable has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sable's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the sable surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sable makes two bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The broom is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the broom must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries.description: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the broom remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal broom.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The broom makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Broomstick
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bear makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The scavver doesn't require air.

entries.name: Swallowing Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be swallowed by the scavver. The scavver can have one creature swallowed at a time.A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the scavver, and takes 13 (3d8) poison damage at the start of each of the scavver's turns from the poisonous gas in the scavver's gullet.If the scavver takes 15 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the scavver must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the swallowed creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the scavver. If the scavver dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Very Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Demonic Ritual
entries.description: Brusipha can spend 3 hours performing a ritual that summons 1d3 + 1 barlguras or 1 hezrou. She must sacrifice a Medium or larger living creature to Baphomet during this ritual, and the ritual can be performed only at night. The demons vanish at dawn.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: Brusipha can perfectly recall any path she has traveled.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Brusipha makes two Eldritch Blast attacks.

entries.name: Eldritch Blast
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If Brusipha moved at least Very Close straight toward the target immediately before she hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be pushed up to Very Close from Brusipha and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Incite the Hunters (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: Brusipha allows each ally within Close of herself that has the Unerring Tracker trait to make one weapon attack as a reaction against the target of that ally's Unerring Tracker.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Brusipha casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Prestidigitation, Speak with Animals1/day each: Bestow Curse, Command, Crown of Madness

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Heart of Hruggek
entries.description: The bugbear has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or put to sleep.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bugbear makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage at range.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the bugbear hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the bugbear surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with both hands.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage in melee or 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage at range.

entries.name: Abduct
entries.description: The bugbear needn't spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

entries.name: Multiattack
