entries.description: The bugbear makes two Javelin or Morningstar attacks.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5 (with Advantage if the target is Grappled by the bugbear), reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Abduct
entries.description: The bugbear needn't spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

entries.name: Grab
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Light Hammer
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4 (with Advantage if the target is Grappled by the bugbear), reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 9 (3d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bulette makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Deadly Leap
entries.description: The bulette spends Very Close of movement to jump to a space within Close that contains one or more Large or smaller creatures. Agility Reaction Roll (15), each creature in the bulette's destination space. Failure: 19 (3d12) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage, and the target is pushed Very Close straight away from the bulette.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Rotting Presence
entries.description: When any creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within Close of the bulezau, that creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The bulezau's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The bulezau has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Barbed Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) against disease or become poisoned until the disease ends. While poisoned in this way, the target sports festering boils, coughs up flies, and sheds rotting skin, and the target must repeat the saving throw after every 24 hours that elapse. On a successful save, the disease ends. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by 4 (1d8). The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bullywug makes two Bog Staff attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness.

entries.name: Bog Staff
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The bullywug casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Dancing Lights, Druidcraft, Ray of Sickness1/day each: Speak with Plants, Vitriolic Sphere

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The croaker can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The croaker can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The croaker's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries.description: The croaker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Glaaar-pat (3/Day)
entries.description: The croaker sings a song of marshy doom. Each chosen creature within Close of the croaker that can hear the song must make a Presence Reaction Roll (12), taking 9 (2d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw also has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Rooooo-glog (1/Day)
entries.description: The croaker sings an ode to an elder froghemoth. Each bullywug within Close of the croaker that can hear the song gains 10 temporary hit points.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The knight can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The knight can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The knight's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two Glaive attacks.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The royal can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the royal hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Frog Rider
entries.description: The royal has advantage on melee attacks made while riding a frog mount.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The royal can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The royal's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries.description: The royal has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The royal makes two attacks: one with its royal spear and one with its bite.

entries.name: Royal Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Croaked Decree (1/Day)
entries.description: The royal makes a loud pronouncement. Each bullywug within Far of the royal that can hear the pronouncement has advantage on its next attack roll.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
entries.description: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

entries.name: Insectile Rapier
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the hart moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with an antlers attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Heated Body
entries.description: A creature that touches the hart or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The hart has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hart makes two attacks: one with its antlers and one with its hooves.

entries.name: Antlers
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

entries.name: Bond of the Black Earth
entries.description: The burrowshark is magically bound to a bulette trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on its bulette, the burrowshark shares the bulette's senses and can ride the bulette while it burrows. The bonded bulette obeys the burrowshark's commands. If its mount dies, the burrowshark can train a new bulette to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The burrowshark makes three melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The cackler's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (11), +3 to hit with spell attacks). The cackler can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: fire bolt1/day: Tasha's hideous laughter

entries.name: Last Laugh
entries.description: When the cackler dies, it releases a dying laugh that scars the minds of other nearby creatures. Each creature within Very Close of the cackler must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The cackler can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (11) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spiked Chain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The collector has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The collector doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The collector makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The collector releases paralyzing gas in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a successful Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A paralyzed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cairnwight makes two Slam attacks or two Rock attacks, and it uses its Petrifying Touch if available.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Petrifying Touch (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cairnwight touches one creature it can see within Very Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or take 26 (4d12) force damage and have the restrained condition as it begins to turn to stone. The affected target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target has the petrified condition instead of the restrained condition.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the magen dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The magen has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The magen makes two attacks, using Extended Fist or Acid Spittle in any combination.

entries.name: Extended Fist
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) Acid damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of two fists.

entries.name: Acid Spittle
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Acid damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cambion makes two attacks, using Claw or Fire Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Very Far. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cambion casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):2/day each: Alter Self, Command (level 3 version), Detect Magic1/day each: Dominate Person (level 8 version), Plane Shift (self only)

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The campestri can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

entries.name: Head Butt
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: A Very Close radius of spores extends from the campestri. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (10). On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The artificer makes two attacks, using Battering Mace or Artillery Strike in any combination.

entries.name: Battering Mace
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Artillery Strike
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) Force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The artificer casts one of the following spells, using its Tinker's Tools as an Arcane Focus and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Burning Hands (level 3 version), Mending, Thunderwave (level 3 version)1/day each: Cure Wounds, Invisibility

entries.name: Dimensional Lock
entries.description: Other creatures can't teleport to or from a space within Far of the canoloth. Any attempt to do so is wasted.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The canoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Uncanny Senses
entries.description: The canoloth can't be surprised unless it's incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The canoloth makes one Bite or Tongue attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Tongue
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)), pulled up to Close toward the canoloth, and restrained until the grapple ends. The canoloth can grapple one target at a time with its tongue.

entries.name: Limited Spell Immunity
entries.description: The golem automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 7th level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: Crystal Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: Limited Telepathy
entries.description: The plant can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within Very Far of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn't allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The plant makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) against disease or become poisoned until the disease is cured. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The target dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the disease is cured.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)) and restrained until the grapple ends. The plant has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Tentacle Slam
entries.description: The plant slams creatures grappled by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage and be stunned until the end of the plant's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't stunned.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The carrion crawler can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The carrion crawler uses Paralyzing Tentacles and makes one Bite attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (12), one creature the carrion crawler can see within Very Close. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Tied Down
entries.description: While lashed to the floor, the creature is prone and restrained. It also suffers from two levels of exhaustion.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The creature makes two attacks: one with its tentacles and one with its bite.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The carrion stalker makes three Tentacle attacks. If it is attached to a creature, it can replace one Tentacle attack with Larval Burst, if available.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the carrion stalker attaches to the target and pulls itself into the target's space. While attached, the carrion stalker moves with the target and has advantage on attack rolls against it.A creature can use its action to try to detach the carrion stalker and force it to move into the nearest unoccupied space, doing so with a successful Difficulty (11) Strength check. On its turn, the carrion stalker can detach itself from the target by using Very Close of movement. When it dies, the carrion stalker detaches from any creature it is attached to.

entries.name: Larval Burst (1/Day)
entries.description: The carrion stalker releases a burst of larvae in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned. A creature poisoned in this way takes 7 (2d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns as larvae infest its body. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any effect that cures disease or removes the poisoned condition instantly kills the larvae in the creature, ending the effect on it.If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by the infestation, it dies. The larvae remain in the corpse, and one survives to become a fully grown carrion stalker in 1d4 weeks. Any effect that cures diseases or removes the poisoned condition that targets the corpse instantly kills the larvae.

entries.name: False Object
entries.description: If the carrionette is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the carrionette move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the carrionette is animate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The carrionette doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Silver Needle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or become cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target's speed is reduced by Very Close, and it must roll a 1d4 and subtract the number rolled from each ability check or attack roll it makes.

entries.name: Soul Swap
entries.description: The carrionette targets a creature it can see within Close of it that is cursed by its Silver Needle. Unless the target is protected by a protection from evil and good spell, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or have its consciousness swapped with the carrionette. The carrionette gains control of the target's body, and the target is unconscious for 1 hour, after which it gains control of the carrionette's body. While controlling the target's body, the carrionette retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. It otherwise uses the controlled body's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.If the carrionette's body is destroyed, both the carrionette and the target die. A protection from evil and good spell cast on the controlled body drives the carrionette out and returns the consciousness of both creatures to their original bodies. The swap is also undone if the controlled body takes damage from the carrionette's Silver Needle.

entries.name: Jumper
entries.description: The cat's jump distance is determined using its Dexterity rather than its Strength.

entries.name: Scratch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The krasis can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The krasis makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The krasis can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The krasis makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The krasis can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The krasis makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its claws, and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 33 (6d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (19) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature other than a catoblepas that starts its turn within Very Close of the catoblepas must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of any catoblepas for 1 hour.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be stunned until the start of the catoblepas's next turn.

entries.name: Death Ray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The catoblepas targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target instead takes 64 necrotic damage. The target dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this ray.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The badger has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: When the badger burrows, it leaves tunnels behind.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The badger makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Flammable Blood
entries.description: If the cave fisher drops to half its hit points or fewer, it gains vulnerability to fire damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The cave fisher can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cave fisher makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Retract Filament
entries.description: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the cave fisher's Adhesive Filament must make a Strength Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within Very Close of the cave fisher, and the cave fisher makes one Claw attack against it. Anyone else who was attached to the filament is released. Until the grapple ends on the target, the cave fisher can't use Adhesive Filament.

name: Celestial Spirit

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Radiant Bow (Avenger Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range Out of Range. Hit: 2d6 + 2 + the spell's level Radiant damage.

entries.name: Radiant Mace (Defender Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d10 + 3 + the spell's level Radiant damage, and the spirit can choose itself or another creature it can see within Very Close of the target. The chosen creature gains 1d10 Temporary Hit Points.

entries.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
entries.description: The spirit touches another creature. The target regains Hit Points equal to 2d8 + the spell's level.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the centaur mummy moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The centaur mummy makes two melee attacks, one with its pike and one with its hooves, or it attacks with its pike and uses Dreadful Glare.

entries.name: Pike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: The centaur mummy targets one creature it can see within Far of it. If the target can see the mummy, the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies (but not mummy lords) for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The centaur makes two attacks, using Pike or Longbow in any combination.

entries.name: Pike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The centaur makes two attacks, using Forest Staff or Sun Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Forest Staff
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The centaur casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Druidcraft, Speak with Animals

entries.name: Sun Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Far. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Radiant damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the start of the centaur's next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ceratops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ceratops makes one Gore attack and one Stomp attack.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) piercing damage. If the ceratops moved at least Close in a straight line toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) piercing damage; if the target is a creature, it also must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (19) or be pushed up to Close from the ceratops and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes two Chain attacks and uses Conjure Infernal Chain.

entries.name: Chain
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of two chains, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Conjure Infernal Chain
entries.description: The devil conjures a fiery chain to bind a creature. Agility Reaction Roll (15), one creature the devil can see within Far. Failure: 9 (2d4 + 4) Fire damage, and the target has the Restrained condition until the end of the devil's next turn, at which point the chain disappears. If the target is Large or smaller, the devil moves the target up to Close straight toward itself. Success: The chain disappears.

entries.name: Mushroom Portal
entries.description: The chamberlain counts as a mushroom for the Fungus Stride feature of the bridesmaid of Zuggtmoy.

entries.name: Poison Spores
entries.description: Whenever the chamberlain takes damage, it releases a cloud of spores. Creatures within Very Close of the chamberlain when this happens must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chamberlain makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Infestation Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: The chamberlain releases spores that burst out in a cloud that fills a Very Close-radius sphere centered on it, and the cloud lingers for 1 minute. Any flesh-and-blood creature in the cloud when it appears, or that enters it later, must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12). On a successful save, the creature can't be infected by these spores for 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature is infected with a disease called the spores of Zuggtmoy and also gains a random form of indefinite madness (determined by rolling on the Madness of Zuggtmoy table in appendix D) that lasts until the creature is cured of the disease or dies. While infected in this way, the creature can't be reinfected, and it must be repeat the saving throw at the end of every 24 hours, ending the infection on a success. On a failure, the infected creature's body is slowly taken over by fungal growth, and after three such failed saves, the creature dies and is reanimated as a spore servant if it's a type of creature that can be (see the "Myconids" entry in the Monster Manual).

entries.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries.description: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes three Greatsword or Shortbow attacks.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage, plus 7 (2d6) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The champion has advantage on saving throws against the frightened condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes two Lightning Mace attacks or three Handaxe attacks.

entries.name: Lightning Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Handaxe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes three Longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes two Arcane Burst attacks or makes one Arcane Burst attack and uses Spellcasting.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The champion casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Light, Mage Armor (self only), Mage Hand, Minor Illusion2/day each: Charm Person, Disguise Self, Silent Image1/day each: Crown of Madness, Shatter

entries.name: Change Appearance
entries.description: The changeling can use its action to polymorph into a Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The changeling makes two attacks with its dagger.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: Each creature within Close of the changeling must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The chaos quadrapod has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chaos quadrapod makes up to two tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The chaos quadrapod can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

entries.name: Chaos Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The chaos quadrapod shoots forth a knot of roiling ethereal light that explodes at a point it can see within Far of it. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on that point must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Chardalyn Madness
entries.description: The berserker must roll a d6 at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the berserker does nothing on its turn except speak to a nonexistent, evil master whom it has pledged to serve.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The berserker attacks three times with a melee weapon.

entries.name: Chardalyn Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Chardalyn Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon uses its Malevolent Presence. It then makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its tail. If the dragon isn't flying, it can also make one attack with its wings.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Wings
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d4 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Malevolent Presence
entries.description: Any creature with an Intelligence of 4 or more that is within Close of the dragon must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or be charmed by it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Malevolent Presence for the next 24 hours. A creature charmed in this way fixates on another creature or object that the dragon mentally chooses and must, on each of its turns, move as close as it can to that target and use its action to make a melee attack against it. If the dragon doesn't choose a target, the charmed creature can act normally on its turn.

entries.name: Radiant Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a ray of radiant energy in a Very Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 31 (7d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the chasme dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The chasme has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The chasme can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Proboscis
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chimera makes one Ram attack, one Bite attack, and one Claw attack. It can replace the Claw attack with a use of Fire Breath if available.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage, or 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage if the chimera had Advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 31 (7d8) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The baboon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the baboon's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage, plus an extra 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

entries.name: Chimeric Creation
entries.description: The fox has fur that changes color to match its surroundings, giving it advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Escape
entries.description: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Chimeric Creation
entries.description: The rat has gills, iridescent scales, and the ability to breathe air and water.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The rat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Chimeric Creation
entries.description: The weasel has glowing eyes that emit bright light out in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The weasel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The chitine has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the chitine to sleep.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the chitine has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the chitine knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The chitine ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chitine makes three Dagger attacks.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Aberrant Quickness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The choker can take an extra action on its turn.

entries.name: Boneless
entries.description: The choker can move through and occupy a space as narrow as 4 inches wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The choker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The choker makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the choker can't use this tentacle on another target. The choker has two tentacles. If this attack is a critical hit, the target also can't breathe or speak until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The choldrith has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the choldrith to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The choldrith can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the choldrith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the choldrith knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The choldrith ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The choldrith casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: guidance, thaumaturgy1/day each: bane, hold person

entries.name: Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a Difficulty (11) Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The chuul can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sense Magic
entries.description: The chuul senses magic within Very Far of itself. This trait otherwise works like the Detect Magic spell but isn't itself magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chuul makes two Pincer attacks and uses Paralyzing Tentacles.

entries.name: Pincer
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of two pincers.

entries.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), one creature Grappled by the chuul. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spore servant makes two pincer attacks.

entries.name: Pincer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (Escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the spore servant doesn't have two other creatures grappled.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The chwinga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

entries.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries.description: The chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within Very Close of it. The target gains a supernatural charm of the DM's choice. See chapter 7 of the Dungeon Masters Guide for more information on supernatural charms.

entries.name: Natural Shelter
entries.description: The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The chwinga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

entries.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries.description: The chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within Very Close of it. The target gains a supernatural charm of the DM's choice. See chapter 7 of the Dungeon Masters Guide for more information on supernatural charms.

entries.name: Natural Shelter
entries.description: The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The chwinga's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components:At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a handful of flower petals, a cloud of pollen, a stone statuette resembling its former self, a tiny sphere of smooth stone, or a puddle of fresh water (your choice).

entries.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries.description: The chwinga targets a humanoid it can see within Very Close of it. The target gains a supernatural charm of the DM's choice. See chapter 7 of the Dungeon Masters Guide for more information on supernatural charms.

entries.name: Natural Shelter
entries.description: The chwinga magically takes shelter inside a rock, a living plant, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while inside this shelter, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the chwinga is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The chwinga doesn't require air, food, or drink. When it dies, it turns into a tiny pile of moondust, a cloud of glittering spores, a statuette resembling its former self, a chunk of ice, or a sponge shaped like a dodecahedron (DM's choice).

entries.name: Magical Gift (1/Day)
entries.description: The chwinga targets a Humanoid it can see within Very Close of itself. The target gains a supernatural charm of the DM's choice. See chapter 7 for more information on supernatural charms.

entries.name: Natural Shelter
entries.description: The chwinga takes shelter inside a rock, a bush, a tree, or a natural source of fresh water in its space. The chwinga can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect while it is magically protected in this way, and the shelter doesn't impair the chwinga's blindsight. The chwinga can use its action to emerge from a shelter. If its shelter is destroyed, the chwinga is forced out and appears in the shelter's space, but is otherwise unharmed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The chwinga casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: druidcraft, guidance, pass without trace, resistance

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the cinder hulk dies, it leaves behind a cloud of cinders and smoke that fills a Very Close-radius sphere centered on its space. The sphere is heavily obscured. Any creature that moves into the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or take 10 (3d6) fire damage. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until it is dispersed by strong wind.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cinder hulk makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Wave of Cinders (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cinder hulk emits a wave of smoldering ash from its face, hands, or chest in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 31 (7d8) fire damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the spider fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spider makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Web Bomb.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Web Bomb
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range Very Far/Out of Range, one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage, and the target and all creatures within Very Close of it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (19) or take 10 (3d6) acid damage and have the restrained condition until the start of the spider's next turn.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The clawfoot has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the clawfoot's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the clawfoot moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (11) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the clawfoot can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The clawfoot makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Climbing
entries.description: The gladiator can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Steadfast
entries.description: The gladiator can't be disarmed, and cannot make ranged attacks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gladiator makes three melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Acid Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to Acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Acid damage dealt.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn Bloodied, roll 1d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to be berserk until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two Slam attacks, or it makes three Slam attacks if it used Hasten this turn.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage plus 6 (1d12) Acid damage, and the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Acid damage taken.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: While in Bright Light, the cloaker has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cloaker makes one Attach attack and two Tail attacks.

entries.name: Attach
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the cloaker attaches to it. While the cloaker is attached, the target has the Blinded condition, and the cloaker can't make Attach attacks against other targets. In addition, the cloaker halves the damage it takes (round down), and the target takes the same amount of damage.The cloaker can detach itself by spending Very Close of movement. The target or a creature within Very Close of it can take an action to try to detach the cloaker, doing so by succeeding on a Difficulty (14) Strength (Athletics) check.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Avoidance
entries.description: If the mutate is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: While in bright light, the mutate has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mutate makes one Corpse Swipe attack and two Tail attacks, or it makes four Tail attacks.

entries.name: Corpse Swipe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a creature can't regain hit points.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Earth Armor
entries.description: The clockwork doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it burrows.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Flare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: Each creature in contact with the ground within Close of the clockwork must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 14 (4d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The defender doesn't need air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Electrified Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). A creature grappled by the defender takes the damage again at the start of each of the defender's turns. The defender can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time, and the defender can't make Electrified Bite attacks while grappling.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the clockwork dragon remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a metal statue.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The clockwork dragon exhales fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (11), taking 14 (4d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or suffer one random effect (roll a d6):1–2: Confusion. On its next turn, the target must use its action to make one weapon attack against a random creature it can see within Close of it, using whatever weapon it has in hand and moving beforehand if necessary to get in range. If it's holding no weapon, it makes an unarmed strike. If no creature is visible within Close, it takes the Dash action, moving toward the nearest creature.3–4: Paralysis. The target is paralyzed until the end of its next turn.5–6: Poison. The target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Beast of Burden
entries.description: The mule is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

entries.name: Maintainable
entries.description: Repairing 1 hit point of damage to the clockwork mule takes 1 hour and requires replacement parts, which can be bought in a large city for 20 gp. If the mule drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and unrepairable.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The mule has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The clockwork makes two Lancing Bolt attacks or one Lancing Bolt attack and one Harpoon attack.

entries.name: Lancing Bolt
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Harpoon
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). While grappled in this way, a creature's speed isn't reduced, but it can move only in directions that bring it closer to the clockwork. A creature takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The clockwork can grapple only one creature at a time with its harpoon.

entries.name: Explosive Bolt (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The clockwork launches an explosive charge at a point within Very Far. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The observer doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the observer is within 1 mile of its creator, it can magically convey what it sees to its creator, and the two can communicate telepathically.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The observer doesn't need air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Shriek
entries.description: The observer emits a mechanical shriek until the start of its next turn or until it drops to 0 hit points. This shriek can be heard within a range of Very Far.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The clockwork has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The clockwork doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is knocked prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Thunderous Mace or Thundercloud in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Fog Cloud.

entries.name: Thunderous Mace
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Thunder damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Magic, Fog Cloud, Light1/day each: Control Weather, Gaseous Form, Telekinesis

entries.name: Thundercloud
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range Very Far. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) Thunder damage, and the target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Cloud Rune
entries.description: The giant has a cloud rune inscribed on a mask in its possession. While holding or wearing the mask bearing the rune, the giant has truesight within a range of Close and can use its Thunderous Clap action and Negate Spell reaction.The mask bearing the cloud rune has AC 15; 45 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The mask regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a cloud rune on a mask in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three Flying Staff attacks.

entries.name: Flying Staff
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) thunder damage. Hit or Miss: The staff magically returns to the giant's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion1/day each: dream (as an action), gaseous form, major image

entries.name: Thunderous Clap (Requires Cloud Rune)
entries.description: The giant magically summons a thundercloud that fills a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the giant can see within Far of itself. The cloud spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) as the cloud emits a thunderous boom. On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) thunder damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The thunderclap is audible within Very Far of the cloud's center point.The cloud's area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers until the start of the giant's next turn or until a strong wind disperses it.

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries.description: The ghost can see Very Far into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The ghost regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the ghost takes radiant damage or damage from a magic weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the ghost's next turn. The ghost dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghost makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Spectral Weapon
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage.

entries.name: Etherealness
entries.description: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ghost casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability and requiring no material components:At will: fog cloud3/day: telekinesis1/day: control weather

entries.name: Wind Howl (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The ghost emits a dreadful howl that summons a cold, biting wind. This wind engulfs up to three creatures of the ghost's choice that it can see within Far of it. Each target is pulled up to Close toward the ghost and must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 16 (3d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light3/day each: feather fall, fly, misty step, telekinesis1/day each: control weather, gaseous form

entries.name: Keen Smell
