entries.description: The giant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two morningstar attacks.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Control Weather (8th-level Spell)
entries.description: The giant can cast the control weather spell, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Slam attacks or two Telekinetic Strike attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light, minor illusion3/day each: invisibility, silent image, suggestion, tongues1/day each: gaseous form, major image

entries.name: Telekinetic Strike
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The giant magically transforms to look and feel like a Beast or a Humanoid it has seen or to return to its true form. Any equipment the giant is wearing or carrying is absorbed by the new form. Its statistics, other than its size, don't change. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The giant doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Scimitar attacks and one Storm Boomerang attack.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: detect magic, fog cloud, light2/day: telekinesis1/day: gaseous form

entries.name: Storm Boomerang
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 15 (3d4 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn. Hit or Miss: The boomerang magically returns to the giant's hand immediately after the attack.

entries.name: Petrifying Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (11). First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition. The target repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition, instead of the Restrained condition, for 24 hours.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The cockatrice doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cockatrice makes one Petrifying Bite attack and two Talons attacks.

entries.name: Petrifying Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (14). First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The archivist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The archivist makes two Grasping Limb attacks.

entries.name: Grasping Limb
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)). The archivist can have no more than two targets grappled at a time.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The archivist casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: dancing lights, prestidigitation2/day: silence

entries.name: Blinding Light
entries.description: The walker sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close. As a bonus action, the walker can target one creature in its bright light that it can see and force it to succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be blinded until the start of the walker's next turn.

entries.name: Icy Doom
entries.description: Any creature killed by the walker freezes for 9 days, during which time it can't be thawed, harmed by fire, animated, or raised from the dead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The walker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The walker makes two attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) cold damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The colossus can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the colossus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The colossus has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The colossus makes three attacks, using Slam or Radiant Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +18, reach Close. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) Bludgeoning damage, and the colossus pushes the target up to Close straight away from itself.

entries.name: Radiant Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +18, range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d10) Radiant damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Divine Beam (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (26), each creature in a Very Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 65 (10d12) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this beam disintegrates into dust, leaving behind any magic items it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Crumbling Destruction
entries.description: When the colossus drops to 0 hit points, it crumbles and is destroyed. Any creature on the ground within Close of the crumbling statue must make a Agility Reaction Roll (22), taking 22 (4d10) bludgeoning damage and 22 (4d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Fire Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the colossus is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The colossus's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The colossus of Akros makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) piercing damage, or 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the colossus makes a ranged attack with this spear, the spear magically returns to its hand after the attack.

entries.name: Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 36 (6d8 + 9) slashing damage.

entries.name: Flames of Akros (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Magical flames issue from the colossus toward up to three creatures the colossus can see within Far of it. Each target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (24), taking 36 (8d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a target also magically catches fire for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the burning target repeats the saving throw. It takes 18 (4d8) fire damage on a failed save, and the effect ends on a successful one.

entries.name: Lightning Overload
entries.description: When the robot takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or have the stunned condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The robot makes two Tentacle attacks or three Laser Beam attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). While grappled, the target also has the restrained condition. The robot has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Laser Beam
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) radiant damage.

entries.name: Grenade Launcher (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The robot fires a grenade at a point it can see within Very Far of itself. The grenade explodes in a Close-radius sphere centered on that point, creating one of the following effects (robot's choice):

entries.name: Concussion Grenade
entries.description: Each creature in the sphere must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 21 (6d6) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Sleep Grenade
entries.description: Each creature in the sphere must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have the unconscious condition for 1 hour. The condition ends on a creature early if the creature takes damage or if another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

entries.name: Training
entries.description: The commoner has proficiency in one skill of the DM's choice and has Advantage whenever it makes an ability check using that skill.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 2 (1d4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (17)). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: druidcraft3/day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth, spike growth1/day each: moonbeam, grasping vine, wall of thorns

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries.description: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they and the dryad shared a language.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dryad makes three attacks, using its vine staff, its longbow, or both.

entries.name: Vine Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (17) or become restrained by twisting vines for 1 minute. A target restrained in this way can use an action to make a Difficulty (17) Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Summon Mount (1/Day)
entries.description: The dryad magically summons a mount, which appears in an unoccupied space within Far of the dryad. The mount remains for 8 hours, until it or the dryad dies, or until the dryad dismisses it as an action. The mount uses the stat block of an elk (see the Monster Manual) with these changes: it is a plant instead of a beast, it has an Intelligence of 6, and it understands Sylvan but can't speak. While within 1 mile of the mount, the dryad can communicate with it telepathically.

entries.name: Suppress Magic (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dryad targets one magic item it can see within Very Far of it. If the magic item isn't an artifact, its magical properties are suppressed for 10 minutes, until the dryad is incapacitated or dies, or until the dryad uses a bonus action to end the effect.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The conjurer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The conjurer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: fireball, mage armor, unseen servant1/day each: fly, stinking cloud, web

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (12), one Medium or smaller creature the snake can see within Very Close. Failure: 7 (3d4) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)).

name: Construct Spirit

entries.name: Heated Body (Metal Only)
entries.description: A creature that hits the spirit with a melee attack or that starts its turn in a grapple with the spirit takes 1d10 Fire damage.

entries.name: Stony Lethargy (Stone Only)
entries.description: When a creature starts its turn within Very Close of the spirit, the spirit can target it with magical energy if the spirit can see it. Wisdom Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, the target. Failure: Until the start of its next turn, the target can't make Opportunity Attacks, and its Speed is halved.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of Slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell's level Bludgeoning damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The commoner doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. When it drops to 0 hit points, it becomes a lifeless object.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 18 (4d8) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Slowing Breath
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. This effect lasts until the end of its next turn.

name: Copper Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:Elemental Breath. The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 84 (13d12) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Sapping Breath. The greatwyrm exhales gas in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

original_cr: 28 (XP 120,000, or 240,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The crawler has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the crawler's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The crawler makes four attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or become frightened until the start of the crawler's next turn.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The emissary has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The emissary makes three talons attacks.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Alluring Thrum (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The emissary emits a dreadful yet alluring hum. Each creature within Close of the emissary that can hear it and that isn't an aberration must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be charmed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Crystal Spores (Recharge 6)
entries.description: A Close-radius cloud of toxic crystalline spores extends out from the emissary. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a creature takes 11 (2d10) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: The seer can traverse through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the seer doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The seer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The seer uses Fission Staff twice, Psychedelic Orb twice, or each one once.

entries.name: Fission Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (1d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) radiant damage, and the target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Psychedelic Orb
entries.description: The seer hurls a glimmering orb at one creature it can see within 120 of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (19) or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and suffer a random condition until the start of the seer's next turn. Roll a d6 for the condition: (1-2) blinded, (3-4) frightened, or (5-6) stunned.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The worm sheds dim light in a Close radius.

entries.name: Radiant Mirror
entries.description: If the worm takes radiant damage, each creature within Close of it takes that damage as well.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The worm makes two attacks: one with its barbed tentacles and one with its bite.

entries.name: Barbed Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 25 (5d6 + 8) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (18)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The tentacles can grapple only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 30 (5d8 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (18) or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and takes 21 (6d6) fire damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Corpses
entries.description: When first encountered, a corpse flower contains the corpses of 1d6 + 3 Humanoids. A corpse flower can hold the remains of up to nine Humanoids. These remains have total cover against attacks and other effects outside the corpse flower. If the corpse flower dies, the corpses within it can be pulled free.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The corpse flower can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Stench of Death
entries.description: Each creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the corpse flower or one of its zombies must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), unless the creature is a Construct or an Undead. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Stench of Death of all corpse flowers for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The corpse flower makes three Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Harvest the Dead
entries.description: The corpse flower swallows one unsecured Humanoid corpse within Very Close of it, along with any equipment the corpse is wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The avatar makes two attacks: one with its hooves and one with its horn.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Horn
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 32 (8d6 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be transformed into a wolf under the avatar's control. This transformation lasts for 1 hour, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The target's game statistics are replaced by the wolf's statistics, but it retains its hit points. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its wolf form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form, and it can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

entries.name: Psychic Maelstrom
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Close of the shark must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The shark regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the shark takes radiant damage or suffers a critical hit, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The shark dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or gain 1 level of exhaustion.

entries.name: Agile
entries.description: The rat doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The rat explodes when it dies. Finesse Reaction Roll (9), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the rat. Failure: 1 Acid damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the horror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The horror doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horror makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (18)). Until this grapple ends, the horror can't use this tentacle against other targets. The horror has 1d8 + 1 tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Psychic Whispers (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The horror emits dreadful whispers in a Far-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in the sphere that isn't an Aberration must make a Presence Reaction Roll (21), taking 33 (6d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Empowered Spell (3/Day)
entries.description: When the blastseeker rolls damage for a spell, it can reroll up to four dice of damage. It must use the new dice.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:3/day each: scorching ray, shield, thunderwave2/day: fireball

entries.name: Tides of Chaos (1/Day)
entries.description: The blastseeker makes one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw with advantage.

entries.name: Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Shielded Mind
entries.description: The couatl's thoughts can't be read by any means, and other creatures can communicate with it telepathically only if it allows them.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the couatl's next turn.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (15), one Medium or smaller creature the couatl can see within Very Close. Failure: 8 (1d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The couatl casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)1/day each: Create Food and Water, Dream, Greater Restoration, Scrying, Sleep

entries.name: Counterflux Overcast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The blastseeker can create an additional effect immediately after casting a spell. Roll a d6 to determine the effect:1–3. The blastseeker creates a Close-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.4–6. The blastseeker creates a Close-radius invisible sphere centered on itself that lasts until the end of its next turn. Creatures in the sphere have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:3/day each: enlarge/reduce, mage armor (self only), scorching ray1/day each: counterspell, dispel magic, protection from energy

entries.name: Rapier
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the cow moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Memnor. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body dissipates into cloud wisps. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The cradle doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes three Slam or Wind Javelin attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage.

entries.name: Wind Javelin
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (25) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Vortex (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cradle conjures a vortex of wind at a point it can see within Far of itself. The wind vortex is a Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than the cradle in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, a creature takes 71 (11d12) bludgeoning damage and has the restrained condition within the vortex. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of the cradle's next turn. A creature with the restrained condition falls prone when the vortex ends.A creature with the restrained condition can use its action to try to escape the vortex. The creature makes a Difficulty (19) Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check. On a successful check, the creature escapes and moves 3d6 × Very Close away from the vortex in a random direction.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Surtur. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body hardens and crumbles to ash. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes three Slam or Hurl Lava attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Hurl Lava
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within Very Close of the fire takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 10 (3d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Erupting Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cradle exhales flames and volcanic gases in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (24). On a failed save, a creature takes 55 (10d10) fire damage and has the poisoned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.A creature poisoned in this way can make a Finesse Reaction Roll (24) at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Thrym. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body shatters into shards of ice. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes two Slam or Hurl Icicle attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Hurl Icicle
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (23) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cradle exhales a blast of frost in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (23). On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) cold damage, and its speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the petrified condition, turning into a frozen statue.If the statue takes bludgeoning damage, it shatters, killing the frozen creature. If the statue would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and thaws, ending the petrification.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Grolantor. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body crumbles to dirt and moss. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes three Slam or Spit Rock attacks in any combination and one Grasping Root attack.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spit Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (22) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Grasping Root
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one creature not grappled by the cradle. Hit: the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The root has AC 19 and can be severed by dealing 15 or more slashing damage to it on one attack. Cutting the root doesn't hurt the cradle but ends the grapple.

entries.name: Rolling Hills (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The cradle magically creates a wave of dirt that extends from a point on the ground within Very Far of itself. The wave is up to Close long, up to Close tall, and up to Close wide. Each creature in the wave must make a Strength Reaction Roll (22). On a failed save, a creature takes 58 (9d12) bludgeoning damage, has the prone condition, and is buried under dirt. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.A buried creature has the restrained condition, has total cover, and can't breathe. As an action, a creature buried in this way, or another creature within Very Close of it that isn't buried, can make a Difficulty (17) Strength (Athletics) check. On a successful check, the buried creature no longer has the prone or restrained conditions.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Skoraeus. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body crumbles to dust. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes two Slam or Spit Rock attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spit Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (23) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Shattering Roar (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cradle lets out a painfully load roar. Each creature within Far of the cradle must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (23). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) thunder damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Awakening of the Scion
entries.description: The cradle is a container for the scion of Stronmaus. When the cradle drops to 0 hit points, its body bursts into light. The scion instantly appears in the space the cradle occupied and uses the cradle's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the cradle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cradle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cradle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cradle makes three Slam or Spit Hailstone attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) lightning damage.

entries.name: Spit Hailstone
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Lightning Barrage (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cradle hurls multiple magical lightning bolts at up to two creatures it can see within Out of Range of itself. Each target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (22). On a failed save, the target takes 71 (11d12) lightning damage and has the stunned condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Nondetection
entries.description: The cat cannot be targeted or detected by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the cat moves at least Close straight toward a creature then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the cat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spell Turning
entries.description: The cat has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the cat (not an area). If the cat's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 7th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the cat and instead targets the caster.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Telepathic Shroud
entries.description: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Shared Telepathy
entries.description: Any creature touching the cranium rat can use the rat's telepathy if the rat allows it. If the creature knows any language, the creature can use the telepathy to communicate words and emotions.

entries.name: Telepathic Shroud
entries.description: The cranium rat is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Psychic Messenger
entries.description: The swarm can use its sending spell to target someone familiar to a creature in telepathic contact with the swarm.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Telepathic Shroud
entries.description: The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to divination spells.

entries.name: Bites
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Melee, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The swarm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: command *, detect thoughts *, sending *1/day each: confusion *, dominate monster **To cast this spell, the swarm must have more than half its hit points remaining.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 2 Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The helmed horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spell Immunity
entries.description: The helmed horror is immune to burning hands, fireball, and scorching ray.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The helmed horror makes two longsword attacks.

entries.name: Flaming Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) fire damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The crow can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, ice knife, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): blur, hold person3rd level (2 slots): sleet storm

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sharktoothed Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands. Against a target is wearing no armor, the reaver deals an extra die of damage with this sword.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The battleaxe is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the battleaxe must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the battleaxe remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal battleaxe.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Scintillating Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a burst of brilliant radiance in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 18 (4d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dragon then gains 5 temporary hit points by absorbing a portion of the radiant energy.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: dancing lights, guidance

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The golem magically sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close. This light goes out when the golem is destroyed.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Light Intensity
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the illuminated golem and can see the golem must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or be blinded until the start of the creature's next turn.A creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the golem until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the golem in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within Very Far of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to Far in any direction, but not beyond Very Far of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Ritual Sickle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) Slashing damage plus 1 Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Pact Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Light, Thaumaturgy2/day: Command1/day: Hold Person

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three attacks, using Pact Blade or Radiant Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Pact Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Radiant Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Very Far. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Thaumaturgy1/day each: Jallarzi's Storm of Radiance (level 7 version), Mass Suggestion

entries.name: Determined Survivor
entries.description: The cultist regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it is Bloodied and has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three attacks, using Gauntlet or Oppressive Burst in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Dominate Person, if available.

entries.name: Gauntlet
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Oppressive Burst
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Very Far. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target can't take Reactions until the start of the cultist's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):2/day each: Calm Emotions, Detect Thoughts1/day: Dominate Person

entries.name: Blood-Soaked Resolve
entries.description: While Bloodied, the cultist has Advantage on saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three Cursed Blade attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Cursed Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7 (with Advantage if the target doesn't have all its Hit Points), reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Slashing damage. Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the cultist's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):2/day: Mind Spike1/day each: Dimension Door, Mislead

entries.name: Ritual Sickle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d4 + 2 Slashing damage plus 1 Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Nearer to the Dead
entries.description: While Bloodied, the cultist has Immunity to the Frightened and Poisoned conditions.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three Necrotic Burst attacks.

entries.name: Necrotic Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 27 (5d10) Necrotic damage and the target can't regain Hit Points until the end of the cultist's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Speak with Dead, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Animate Dead, Circle of Death

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cuprilach makes three Burnished Blade or Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Burnished Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

entries.name: Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cuprilach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, disguise self1/day each: alter self, fog cloud, silence

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The curate has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Raise the Dead (1/Day)
entries.description: In a ritual that takes 8 hours, the curate touches a creature that has died within the past 7 days. That creature returns to life with 1 Hit Point. The curate can't revive a creature that died of old age.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The curate makes three Celestial Radiance attacks.

entries.name: Celestial Radiance
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 18 (4d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Healer's Touch (2/Day)
entries.description: The curate touches another creature. That creature regains 13 (2d8 + 4) Hit Points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cyclops makes three attacks, using Radiant Strike or Flash of Light in any combination.

entries.name: Radiant Strike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Flash of Light
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range Very Far. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Radiant damage, and the target has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the cyclops's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cyclops casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):2/day each: Arcane Eye, Detect Magic, Locate Object1/day: Legend Lore

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cyclops makes two attacks, using Stone Club or Rock in any combination.

entries.name: Stone Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Close. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The bruiser has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bruiser makes three Pummel attacks and uses Glare.

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Glare
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (14), one creature the bruiser can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of the bruiser's next turn.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The raider has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the raider's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Physical Restraint
entries.description: The dabus doesn't make melee attacks or opportunity attacks, even in self-defense.

entries.name: Symbol Speech
entries.description: A dabus communicates by creating illusory symbols and pictures that float in the air in front of itself and disappear a few seconds later. A creature that can see such a message can decipher it with a successful Difficulty (10) Intelligence (Investigation) check (no action required).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dabus makes two Flying Brick attacks.

entries.name: Flying Brick
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Grasping Ground (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The dabus causes a Close-square area of ground it can see within Far of itself to sprout clutching appendages made of stone. Each creature of the dabus's choice in that area must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or take 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and have the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). While grappled in this way, the creature has the restrained condition. The appendages vanish after 1 minute or if the dabus's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Pact of Pain
entries.description: Using a 10-minute ritual, the daemogoth can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the daemogoth dies, or the pact is broken by any effect that can remove a curse.The daemogoth chooses one spell from the necromancy or enchantment school that is 3rd level or lower. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's concentration on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The daemogoth makes three Agonizing Burst attacks. It can use Terrify, if available, in place of one of the attacks.

entries.name: Agonizing Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) force damage. If the target is a creature, the daemogoth regains 5 hit points.

entries.name: Terrify (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The daemogoth targets one creature it can see within Very Far of itself. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the target takes 33 (6d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the daemogoth until the end of the daemogoth's next turn, and the daemogoth regains 5 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't frightened, and the daemogoth doesn't heal.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Pact of Suffering
entries.description: Using a 10-minute long ritual, the titan can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the ritual. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the titan dies, or the pact is broken by a wish spell.The titan chooses one spell from the necromancy or enchantment school that is 8th level or lower. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes 21 (6d6) psychic damage, which can't break the creature's concentration on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The titan makes two Agonizing Burst attacks.

entries.name: Agonizing Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) force damage. If the target is a creature, the titan regains 5 hit points.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The titan teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within Very Far of itself.

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.The golem's creator, if within Far of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Flame
entries.description: The flame sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close. If it leaves the hall or is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and can't re-form for 24 hours.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: The flame ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has charmed. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) fire damage.

entries.name: Charm
entries.description: One humanoid the flame can see within Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys the flame's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this flame's Charm for the next 24 hours.The flame can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

entries.name: Draining Kiss
entries.description: The flame kisses a creature charmed by it or a willing creature. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) against this magic, taking 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The item is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Irrepressible Dance
entries.description: When any creature starts its turn within Very Close of the item, the item can increase or decrease (your choice) the walking speed of that creature by Very Close until the end of the turn, provided the item isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Force-Empowered Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach Very Close, one target you can see. Hit: 1d10 + PB force damage.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: The dao can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the dao doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: If the dao dies outside the Elemental Plane of Earth, its body dissolves into dirt, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Earth.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dao has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: The dao has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the dao knows it, the dao can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the dao can understand. If the dao casts the spell for the creature, the dao suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the dao has cast it three times, the dao can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dao makes three Earthen Maul attacks or two Earth Burst attacks.

entries.name: Earthen Maul
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Earth Burst
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range Very Far. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: Earth explodes from the target's space, creating the following effect. Agility Reaction Roll (16), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from and including the target. Failure: 10 (3d6) Thunder damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dao casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic, Stone Shape1/day each: Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Move Earth, Passwall, Plane Shift, Tongues, Wall of Stone

entries.name: Bonded Mount
entries.description: The knight is magically bound to a beast with an innate swimming speed trained to serve as its mount. While mounted on this beast, the knight gains the beast's senses and ability to breathe underwater. The bonded mount obeys the knight's commands. If its mount dies, the knight can train a new beast to serve as its bonded mount, a process requiring a month.

entries.name: Sneak Attack
entries.description: The knight deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within Very Close of an ally of the knight that isn't incapacitated and the knight doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Lance
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Death Flash
entries.description: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a Very Close radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Death Burn
entries.description: When the darkling elder dies, magical light flashes out from it in a Very Close radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11). On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The darkling elder makes two Scimitar attacks.

entries.name: Darkness (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The darkling elder casts darkness, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Crush
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature and the darkmantle had Advantage on the attack roll, it covers the target, which has the Blinded condition and is suffocating while the darkmantle is attached in this way.While attached to a target, the darkmantle can attack only the target but has Advantage on its attack rolls. Its Speed becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its Speed, and it moves with the target.A creature can take an action to try to detach the darkmantle from itself, doing so with a successful Difficulty (13) Strength (Athletics) check. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself by using Very Close of movement.

entries.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
entries.description: Magical Darkness fills a Close Emanation originating from the darkmantle. This effect lasts while the darkmantle maintains Concentration on it, up to 10 minutes. Darkvision can't penetrate this area, and no light can illuminate it.

entries.name: Shadowy Form
entries.description: While the darkweaver is in dim light or darkness, attack rolls against it are made with disadvantage unless the darkweaver has the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The darkweaver can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: The darkweaver takes 10 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The darkweaver makes two Shadow Web attacks and one Bite attack. It can use Reel after any of these attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 17 (5d6) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Shadow Web
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Far, one creature. Hit: 16 (3d10) necrotic damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)). The shadow web can be attacked and destroyed (AC 16; 20 hit points; vulnerability to radiant damage; immunity to bludgeoning, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage). The darkweaver can grapple up to six creatures at a time using its shadow web.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: The darkweaver pulls each creature it has grappled up to Far toward itself.

entries.name: Culling Aura
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (20), each Bloodied creature in a Close Emanation originating from the scion at the end of the scion's turn. Failure: The target can't regain Hit Points until the start of the scion's next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
