entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes two attacks, using Death Touch or Mindwrack Bolt in any combination.

entries.name: Death Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Mindwrack Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range Very Far. Hit: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the scion's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The scion casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic2/day each: Dimension Door, Invisibility, Scrying1/day each: Circle of Death, Create Undead

entries.name: Bramble Walk
entries.description: Difficult terrain composed of vegetation, such as foliage or thorns, doesn't cost the dryad extra movement.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries.description: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dryad makes two Poisonous Thorn attacks and one Sapping Vine attack.

entries.name: Poisonous Thorn
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or have the poisoned condition until the start of the dryad's next turn.

entries.name: Sapping Vine
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: The target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). Until the grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the dryad can't use the same vine on another target. A creature restrained in this way takes 13 (3d8) necrotic damage at the start of its turn.The dryad has six vines. Each vine can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a vine deals no damage to the dryad, but any creature grappled by that vine no longer has the grappled condition. All vines immediately wither and disappear when the dryad is reduced to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dryad casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Druidcraft2/day each: Pass without Trace, Spike Growth1/day: Dispel Magic

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: meld into stone, stone shape1/day each: stoneskin, time stop

entries.name: Olach Morrah
entries.description: The giant meditates for 1 hour, during which time it can do nothing else. At the end of the hour, provided the giant's meditation has been uninterrupted, it becomes petrified for 8 hours. At the end of this time, the giant is no longer petrified and gains tremorsense out to a range of Close, as well as a measure of innate spellcasting ability for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three attacks, using Dread Scythe or Deathly Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Dread Scythe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage, and the target can't regain Hit Points until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Deathly Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d10) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Speak with Dead, Thaumaturgy

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death dog makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (12). First Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition. While Poisoned, the target's Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and it repeats the save every 24 hours that elapse, ending the effect on itself on a success. Subsequent Failures: The Poisoned target's Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 (1d10).

entries.name: Petrifying Tendrils
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn in the death embrace's space must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed saving throw, the creature is restrained. A creature restrained in this way must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failed saving throw or ending the effect on a successful one. The petrified condition lasts until the effect is ended by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: At the start of each of its turns, the death embrace can pull each creature it is grappling up to Close toward it (no action required).

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The death embrace can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death embrace makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Far, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is also grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). The death embrace has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Scythe or Soul Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Scythe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Soul Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target has the frightened condition, the giant gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Death Rune
entries.description: The giant has a death rune inscribed on a giant's skull in its possession. While holding or wearing the skull bearing the rune, the giant can use its Reaping Scythe action and Shroud of Souls bonus action.The skull bearing the death rune has AC 18; 35 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The skull regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a death rune on another skull in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three Soul Burst attacks. Alternatively, if the giant has its death rune, it can make three Reaping Scythe attacks.

entries.name: Soul Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) necrotic damage. If the target has the frightened condition, the giant gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Reaping Scythe (Requires Death Rune)
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 38 (7d10) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn. The target dies if it is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: detect magic, mage armor3/day each: speak with dead, Tenser's floating disk

entries.name: Lightning Blood
entries.description: A creature within Very Close of the death kiss takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage whenever it hits the death kiss with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death kiss makes three Tentacle attacks. Up to three of these attacks can be replaced by Blood Drain—one replacement per tentacle grappling a creature.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the death kiss can't use the same tentacle on another target. The death kiss has ten tentacles.

entries.name: Blood Drain
entries.description: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the death kiss must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage, and the death kiss regains half as many hit points.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the death knight fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The death knight has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Marshal Undead
entries.description: Undead creatures of the death knight's choice (excluding itself) in a Far Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the death knight is destroyed before it atones for its evil, it gains a new body in 1d10 days, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in a location significant to the death knight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death knight makes three Dread Blade attacks.

entries.name: Dread Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Hellfire Orb (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the death knight can see within Very Far. Failure: 35 (10d6) Fire damage plus 35 (10d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The death knight casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Command, Phantom Steed2/day each: Destructive Wave (Necrotic), Dispel Magic

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The aspirant has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Marshal Undead
entries.description: Undead creatures of the aspirant's choice (excluding itself) in a Far Emanation originating from it have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aspirant makes three Dread Blade attacks.

entries.name: Dread Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Hellfire Orb (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the aspirant can see within Very Far of itself. Failure: 21 (6d6) Fire damage plus 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The aspirant casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Phantom Steed1/day each: Destructive Wave (Necrotic), Dispel Magic

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The slaad makes two Chaos Blade attacks.

entries.name: Chaos Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. Until the start of the slaad's next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, Charmed; on a 2, Frightened; on a 3, Poisoned; or on a 4, Incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Invisibility (self only), Mage Hand, Major Image1/day each: Blight (level 8 version), Cloudkill (level 6 version), Fly, Plane Shift, Tongues

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the death tyrant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death tyrant uses Eye Rays three times.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The death tyrant randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within Very Far of itself (roll 1d10; reroll if the death tyrant has already used that ray during this turn):1: Charm Ray. Presence Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. Success: Half damage only.2: Paralyzing Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (17). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.3: Fear Ray. Presence Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn. Success: Half damage only.4: Slowing Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 18 (4d8) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target can't take Reactions; its Speed is halved; and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. Success: Half damage only.5: Enervation Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 16 (3d10) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.6: Telekinetic Ray. Strength Reaction Roll (17) (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). Failure: The death tyrant moves the target up to Close in any direction. The target has the Restrained condition until the start of the death tyrant's next turn or until the death tyrant has the Incapacitated condition. The death tyrant can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.7: Sleep Ray. Presence Reaction Roll (17) (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to wake it.8: Petrification Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (17). First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.9: Disintegration Ray. Agility Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 36 (8d8) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a Very Close Cube of it disintegrates into dust. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 Hit Points, it disintegrates into dust.10: Death Ray. Agility Reaction Roll (17). Failure: 55 (10d10) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 Hit Points.

entries.name: Beheaded Form
entries.description: When created, a death's head takes one of three forms: Aberrant Head, Gnashing Head, or Petrifying Head. This form determines the creature's attack.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The death's head doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Gnashing Bite (Gnashing Head Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Mind-Bending Bite (Aberrant Head Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (10) or it can't take a reaction until the end of its next turn. Moreover, on its next turn, the target must choose whether it gets a move, an action, or a bonus action; it gets only one of the three.

entries.name: Petrifying Bite (Petrifying Head Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the target is petrified for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Aura of Murder
entries.description: As long as the death's head is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within Very Close of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The death's head has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The death's head uses Stunning Gaze and makes two dagger attacks.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Stunning Gaze
entries.description: The death's head targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Deathly Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Grave Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, mage hand1/day each: dispel magic, hunger of Hadar, invisibility, spider climb

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the deathlock's darkvision.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The deathlock has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deathlock makes two Deathly Claw or Grave Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Deathly Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3 necrotic damage).

entries.name: Grave Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or become restrained as shadowy tendrils wrap around it for 1 minute. A restrained target can use its action to repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor, minor illusion1/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, fly, invisibility

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the deathlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The deathlock doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deathlock makes two Life Drain or Grave Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13), or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the deathlock's control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The deathlock can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

entries.name: Grave Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The deathlock casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: detect magic, disguise self, mage armor1/day each: fear, hold person

entries.name: Exploitation of the Debtors
entries.description: As a bonus action, the angel targets a creature charmed by it that it can see within Close of it. The angel deals 11 (2d10) necrotic damage to the target, and the angel gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The angel doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The angel's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (19), +11 to hit with spell attacks). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: command (as a 2nd-level spell), detect evil and good3/day each: charm person (as a 5th-level spell), darkness, suggestion1/day: raise dead

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The angel makes two attacks with its scythe. It can substitute Chains of Obligation for one of these attacks.

entries.name: Scythe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Chains of Obligation
entries.description: The angel targets one creature charmed by it that it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (19) or become paralyzed for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: If the deathwolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Moon's Grace
entries.description: When the deathwolf falls, it descends at a rate of Far per round and takes no falling damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deathwolf makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Phantom Deathwolf if available.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or have disadvantage on saving throws against the frightened condition. This curse lasts until removed by the Remove Curse spell or other magic.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Phantom Deathwolf (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The deathwolf creates a terrifying phantom of itself in the mind of a creature the deathwolf can see within Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or have the frightened condition for 1 minute.While the target is frightened, the phantom deals 21 (6d6) psychic damage to the target at the start of each of the target's turns. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The decaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Combat Ready
entries.description: The decaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the decaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The decaton makes three Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The decaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the decaton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The decaton has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Lightning Rays (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The decaton unleashes a barrage of lightning bolts from its eyes. Each creature within Close of the decaton must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 38 (7d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entries.name: Allied Knight
entries.description: Some of the deck defender's statistics are based on the character who drew the Knight card. Where the deck defender stat block refers to "you," it refers to that character.

entries.name: Folded Versatility
entries.description: After finishing a long rest, you can refold the deck defender's shape, changing it to acrobat form, berserker form, or guardian form.

entries.name: Fragile
entries.description: If the deck defender is reduced to 0 hit points, it collapses into a haphazard pile of nonmagical playing cards and can't be resurrected or reconstructed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deck defender makes a number of attacks equal to half its proficiency bonus (rounded down).

entries.name: Paper Cut
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: PB + +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Reckless Strike (Berserker Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: PB + +3 to hit (with advantage), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage, and attacks made against the deck defender until the start of its next turn have advantage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The deep crow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the deep crow can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the deep crow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deep crow makes three attacks: one with its mandibles and two with its claws.

entries.name: Mandibles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (17)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the deep crow can't use its mandibles on another target.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Nightmare Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 7 (2d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the dragon's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries.description: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The gnome's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (11)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: nondetection (self only)1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: The gnome has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: War Pick
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Poisoned Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success

entries.name: Beast of Burden
entries.description: The rothé is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

entries.name: Dancing Lights
entries.description: The rothé casts dancing lights, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the rothé moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious (Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: The deep scion can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deep scion makes two Battleaxe attacks, or it makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Bite (Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw (Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Psychic Screech (Hybrid Form Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The deep scion emits a terrible scream audible within Very Far. Creatures within Close of the deep scion must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be stunned until the end of the deep scion's next turn. In water, the psychic screech also telepathically transmits the deep scion's memories of the last 24 hours to its master, regardless of distance, so long as it and its master are in the same body of water.

entries.name: Agile
entries.description: The deer doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 2 (1d4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The degloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The degloth makes two Razor Fist attacks.

entries.name: Razor Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the degloth can't use this fist to grapple another target. The degloth has two fists.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the deinonychus moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the deinonychus can make one Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deinonychus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the demilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the demilich is destroyed, it reforms and regains all its Hit Points in 1d10 days unless a Wish spell is cast on its remains.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The demilich makes three Necrotic Burst attacks.

entries.name: Necrotic Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 24 (7d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Howl (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (19), each creature in a Close Emanation originating from the demilich. Failure: 70 (20d6) Psychic damage. Failure or Success: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of the demilich's next turn.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5 (with Advantage if the target is Grappled by a Demobat), reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)) from all four tentacles.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The demodog has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the demodog's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Baleful Presence
entries.description: Sources of light in a Very Far Emanation originating from the demodragon flicker wildly. Nonmagical sources of Bright Light in that area instead shed Dim Light.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The demodragon regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The demodragon makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) Acid damage.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 22 (4d10) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The demogorgon has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The demogorgon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The demogorgon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the demogorgon takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the demogorgon's next turn. The demogorgon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The demogorgon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Demogorgon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Two Heads
entries.description: Demogorgon has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, deafened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Demogorgon makes two Tentacle attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Gaze.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Demogorgon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: detect magic, major image3/day each: dispel magic, fear, telekinesis1/day each: feeblemind, project image

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (23), or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Gaze
entries.description: Demogorgon turns his magical gaze toward one creature he can see within Very Far of him. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (23) or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):1–2: Beguiling Gaze. The target is stunned until the start of Demogorgon's next turn or until Demogorgon is no longer within line of sight.3–4: Confusing Gaze. The target suffers the effect of the confusion spell without making a saving throw. The effect lasts until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon doesn't need to concentrate on the spell.5–6: Hypnotic Gaze. The target is charmed by Demogorgon until the start of Demogorgon's next turn. Demogorgon chooses how the charmed target uses its action, reaction, and movement.

entries.name: Baleful Presence
entries.description: Sources of light in a Far Emanation originating from the spawn flicker wildly. Nonmagical sources of Bright Light in that area instead shed Dim Light.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The spawn regains 5 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: With a Very Close running start, the spawn can Long Jump up to Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spawn makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). While Grappled, the target has the Blinded condition.

entries.name: Fiery End
entries.description: If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The magen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The magen makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Hooked Spear
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the derro can choose to deal no damage and knock it prone.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Chaos Blast
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) damage. Roll a d4 to determine the damage type: 1, acid; 2, cold; 3, fire; 4, lightning.

entries.name: Force Burst (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Raw arcane magic bursts out from the derro. Each creature within Very Close of it must make a Strength Reaction Roll (11). On a failed save, the creature takes 7 (2d6) force damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The derro casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)):At will: Message, Prestidigitation1/day: Charm Person

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Hooked Spear
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the derro can choose to deal no damage, and instead the target has the prone condition.

entries.name: Throwing Hammer
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The derro has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the derro has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Chromatic Beam
entries.description: The derro launches a brilliant beam of magical energy in a Very Close-wide line that is Far long. Each creature in the line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 21 (6d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The derro casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: mage hand, message, prestidigitation1/day each: invisibility, sleep, spider climb

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Strength Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target falls unconscious if this reduces its Strength to 0. The creature regains consciousness and the reduction to its Strength score disappears after it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Exalted Restoration
entries.description: If the deva dies outside Mount Celestia, its body disappears, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Mount Celestia.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The deva has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deva makes two Holy Mace attacks.

entries.name: Holy Mace
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The deva casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Shapechange (Beast or Humanoid form only, no Temporary Hit Points gained from the spell, and no Concentration or Temporary Hit Points required to maintain the spell)1/day each: Commune, Raise Dead

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The lich regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the lich takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the lich's next turn. The lich dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lich is a 14th-level Golgari spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (17), +9 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): chromatic orb, magic missile, ray of sickness2nd level (3 slots): Melf's acid arrow, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb, web3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, bestow curse, fear, vampiric touch4th level (3 slots): blight, Evard's black tentacles5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, insect plague6th level (1 slot): circle of death, create undead7th level (1 slot): finger of death

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The lich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the lich to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the lich drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Noxious Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: A devourer doesn't require air, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devourer makes two Claw attacks and can use either Imprison Soul or Soul Rend, if available.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Imprison Soul
entries.description: The devourer chooses a living Humanoid with 0 hit points that it can see within Close of it. That creature is teleported inside the devourer's ribcage and imprisoned there. While imprisoned in this way, the creature is restrained and has disadvantage on death saving throws. If the creature dies while imprisoned, the devourer regains 25 hit points and immediately recharges Soul Rend. Additionally, at the start of its next turn, the devourer regurgitates the slain creature as a bonus action, and the creature becomes an undead. If the victim had 2 or fewer Hit Dice, it becomes a zombie. If it had 3 to 5 Hit Dice, it becomes a ghoul. Otherwise, it becomes a wight. A devourer can imprison only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Soul Rend (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The devourer creates a vortex of life-draining energy in a Close radius centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18), taking 44 (8d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dhergoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dhergoloth makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Flailing Claws (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dhergoloth moves up to its speed in a straight line and targets each creature within Very Close of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 22 (3d12 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dhergoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (10)):At will: darkness, fear

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The dhergoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mimic can make three attacks; two with its pseudopods and one with its bite

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the skeleton moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the skeleton can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, it regains only 5 hit points at the start of its next turn. The troll dies only if it is hit by an attack that deals 10 or more acid or fire damage while the troll has 0 hit points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Whirlwind of Claws (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Each creature within Very Close of the troll must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19), taking 44 (8d10) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The wolf has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The worg has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The worg makes three Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the worg's next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points.

entries.name: Dreadful Howl (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (16), each creature within Close that isn't a worg. Failure: 36 (8d8) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the worg's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip)
entries.description: You target one creature you can see within Far of you. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (11) or take 4 (1d8) radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: You cast one the following cleric spells (spell save Difficulty (11)), using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:At will: guidance2/day: cure wounds

entries.name: Avoidance
entries.description: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Displacement
entries.description: Attack rolls against the displacer beast have Disadvantage, since it projects an illusion that makes it appear to be near its actual location. This trait is suppressed while the displacer beast has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The displacer beast makes one Rend attack and one Tentacle attack.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage. If target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Displacement
entries.description: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 bludgeoning damage plus 2 piercing damage.

entries.name: Snake-Swollen
entries.description: When a corpse is reduced to 0 hit points, it splits open, disgorging a swarm of poisonous snakes. The snakes are hungry and fight until slain.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The diva has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The diva makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Broken Bottle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The diviner makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Overwhelming Revelation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The diviner magically creates a burst of illumination in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on a point within Very Far of it. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of the diviner's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The diviner casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: mage hand, message, prestidigitation2/day each: arcane eye, detect magic, detect thoughts, fly, lightning bolt, locate object, mage armor, Rary's telepathic bond1/day: true seeing

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: If the djinni dies outside the Elemental Plane of Air, its body dissolves into mist, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Air.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The djinni has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: The djinni has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the djinni knows it, the djinni can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the djinni can understand. If the djinni casts the spell for the creature, the djinni suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the djinni has cast it three times, the djinni can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The djinni makes three attacks, using Storm Blade or Storm Bolt in any combination.

entries.name: Storm Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The djinni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic2/day each: Create Food and Water (can create wine instead of water), Tongues, Wind Walk1/day each: Creation, Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift

entries.name: Storm Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Very Far. Hit: 13 (3d8) Thunder damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Create Whirlwind
entries.description: The djinni conjures a whirlwind at a point it can see within Very Far. The whirlwind fills a Close-radius, Far-high Cylinder centered on that point. The whirlwind lasts until the djinni's Concentration on it ends. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to Close at the start of each of its turns.Whenever the whirlwind enters a creature's space or a creature enters the whirlwind, that creature is subjected to the following effect. Strength Reaction Roll (17) (a creature makes this save only once per turn, and the djinni is unaffected). Failure: While in the whirlwind, the target has the Restrained condition and moves with the whirlwind. At the start of each of its turns, the Restrained target takes 21 (6d6) Thunder damage. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Merging
entries.description: Two dohwars can have a telepathic conversation with each other and a third willing creature of their choice, provided all three are within Close of one another.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dohwar casts the following spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)):3/day: detect thoughts

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the dolgaunt is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the dolgaunt instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the dolgaunt is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dolgaunt makes two tentacle attacks and two unarmed strikes. Up to two tentacle attacks can be replaced by Vitality Drain.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the dolgaunt can't use the same tentacle on another target. The dolgaunt has two tentacles.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Vitality Drain
entries.description: One creature grappled by a tentacle of the dolgaunt must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11). On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the dolgaunt regains a number of hit points equal to half the necrotic damage taken.

entries.name: Dual Consciousness
entries.description: The dolgrim has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dolgrim makes three attacks.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the dolphin moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The dolphin can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dolphin makes two Dazzling Slam attacks.

entries.name: Dazzling Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the dolphin's next turn.

entries.name: Mechanical Determination
entries.description: If damage reduces the wonder to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 plus the damage taken unless the damage is Lightning or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the wonder drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

entries.name: Wind-Up Operation
entries.description: The wonder has the Unconscious condition until another creature winds it with the wonder's unique key for 1 minute. Once wound, the wonder operates for 10 days or until a creature touches the wonder with its key as a Utilize action to deactivate it, after which the wonder has the Unconscious condition until it is wound again.

entries.name: Aura of Doom
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the doom lord must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the doom lord doesn't have the incapacitated condition, it can suppress or resume this aura at the start of its turn (no action required).

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The doom lord deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The doom lord makes two Entropic Greatsword or Entropic Javelin attacks.

entries.name: Entropic Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

entries.name: Entropic Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The rot blade makes two Entropic Blade or Entropic Javelin attacks.

entries.name: Entropic Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash. Hit or Miss: The rot blade can cause the blade to emit a burst of entropic magic in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on the weapon. Each creature in that area other than the rot blade must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or take 6 (1d12) necrotic damage. The blade can emit entropic magic in this way only once per turn.

entries.name: Entropic Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. A creature killed by this attack has its body and everything it is wearing or carrying, except for magic items, reduced to ash.

entries.name: Aura of Erebos
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the giant must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18), or it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the giant's Aura of Erebos for 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The giant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Noxious Gust (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The giant exhales a mighty gust that creates a blast of deadly mist in a Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The doppelganger makes two Slam attacks and uses Unsettling Visage if available.

entries.name: Read Thoughts
entries.description: The doppelganger casts Detect Thoughts, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6 (with Advantage during the first round of each combat), reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Unsettling Visage (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close Emanation originating from the doppelganger that can see the doppelganger. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: The dracohydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the dracohydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and knocked unconscious.Whenever the dracohydra takes 30 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the dracohydra dies.At the end of its turn, the dracohydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken radiant damage since its last turn. The dracohydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: For each head the dracohydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: While the dracohydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dracohydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

entries.name: Prismatic Breath (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The dracohydra's heads exhale a single breath of multicolored energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) damage of a type chosen by the dracohydra: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dracolich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Life Suppression
entries.description: Creatures within Far of the dracolich can't regain Hit Points.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dracolich has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Gem
entries.description: The dracolich has a magical gem. If the dracolich is destroyed while the gem is on the same plane of existence as it, the dracolich gains a new body in 1d20 days, regaining all its Hit Points and appearing within Very Close of the gem.The gem is a Tiny object that has AC 20; HP 50; and Immunity to Necrotic, Poison, and Psychic damage. The gem regains all its Hit Points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the gem is destroyed, the dracolich can create a new one by completing an 8-hour ritual using a gem worth 1,000+ GP and by expending 5,000 GP, which the ritual consumes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dracolich makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Ray of Sickness (level 2 version).

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (20), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 52 (8d12) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dracolich casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (19), +11 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Detect Magic, Ray of Sickness (level 2 version)1/day each: Create Undead (level 8 version), Finger of Death

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it bursts into flames and is reduced to ashes. Each creature in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on the draconian must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or take 10 (3d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Serrated Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Controlled Fall
entries.description: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its body turns to stone and releases a petrifying gas. Each creature within Very Close of the draconian must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends; otherwise the creature is petrified for 1 minute. After 1 minute, the body of the draconian crumbles to dust.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around it. Each creature within Very Close of the draconian must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (12) or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to Melee horizontally for every Melee it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its scales and flesh immediately shrivel away and its bones explode. Each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (10) or take 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to Melee horizontally for every Melee it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Trident or Necrotic Ray attacks.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Necrotic Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):1/day each: enlarge/reduce, invisibility, stinking cloud

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, its magical essence lashes out as a ball of lightning at the closest creature within Close of it before arcing out to up to two other creatures within Close of the first. Each creature must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) lightning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

entries.name: Multiattack
