entries.description: The draconian makes three Rend or Energy Ray attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Energy Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Noxious Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The draconian exhales a Close cone of noxious gas. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 21 (6d6) poison damage and gains 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, doesn't gain exhaustion, and is immune to all draconians' Noxious Breath for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The draconian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: invisibility, mage hand2/day each: dimension door, disguise self, sending

entries.name: Deflection
entries.description: The shard's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The shard can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the shard fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: When it drops to 0 hit points, the shard disappears and leaves a Tiny cracked gemstone in its space. The gemstone matches the kind of gem dragon it was in life and has AC 20, 15 hit points, and immunity to all damage except force. Unless the gemstone is destroyed, after 1d20 days, the gemstone dissipates and the shard re-forms, regaining all its hit points and appearing in the place the gemstone once occupied or in the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The shard doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shard makes two Telekinetic Rend attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The shard casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: detect thoughts, invisibility, telekinesis

entries.name: Telekinetic Rend
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage.

entries.name: Inhabit Object
entries.description: The shard disappears as it pours its psychic essence into a Medium or smaller nonsentient object it can see within Close of it, magically possessing it. The object uses the shard's AC, and any damage dealt to the object applies to the shard's hit points. The shard inhabits the object until it uses an action to leave; until it is turned; until it is reduced to 0 hit points; or until an effect that ends possession, such as a dispel evil and good spell, is used on it. When it leaves the object, it reappears in the nearest unoccupied space.While inhabited, the object becomes a magic item if it wasn't already, and a Tiny cracked gemstone matching the kind of gem dragon the shard was in life appears somewhere on the object. The shard can cause the object to fly using the shard's own flying speed, use its senses, speak verbally or telepathically, cast spells, and use its legendary actions.If a creature wears or carries the inhabited object, the shard can grant the creature the following benefits:Each of the creature's attacks deals an extra 1d8 force damage on a hit.The creature gains resistance to psychic damage.

entries.name: Psychic Crush (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The shard unleashes a pulse of psychic power. Each creature of the shard's choice in a Far-radius sphere centered on it must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, the creature takes 55 (10d10) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

name: Draconic Spirit

entries.name: Shared Resistances
entries.description: When you summon the spirit, choose one of its Resistances. You have Resistance to the chosen damage type until the spell ends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of Rend attacks equal to half the spell's level (round down), and it uses Breath Weapon.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d6 + 4 + the spell's level Piercing damage.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries.description: Dexterity Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 2d6 damage of a type this spirit has Resistance to (your choice when you cast the spell). Success: Half damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the subject is reduced to 0 hit points, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within Very Close of the subject must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (12) or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: When the subject falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to Melee horizontally for every Melee it descends.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be infected with a disease—a minuscule slaad egg.A Humanoid host can carry only one slaad egg at a time. Over three months, the egg moves to the chest cavity, gestates, and forms a slaad tadpole. In the 24-hour period before the tadpole is born, the host feels unwell; its speed is halved; and it has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. At birth, the tadpole chews its way through vital organs and out of the host's chest in 1 round, killing the host in the process.If the disease is cured before the tadpole's emergence, the tadpole disintegrates.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The draegloth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draegloth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

entries.description: While the officer can see a Dragon that isn't hostile to it, the officer has advantage on attack rolls.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Assault Orders (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The officer shouts orders and targets up to two other creatures within Far of itself. If a target has the Draconic Devotion trait and can hear the officer, the target can use its reaction to make one melee attack.

entries.name: Draconic Devotion
entries.description: While the soldier can see a Dragon that isn't hostile to it, the soldier has advantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) fire damage.

entries.description: The chosen makes one Handaxe attack and two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (20) or be pushed up to Very Close away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

entries.name: Sand Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon tortoise exhales abrasive sand in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18), taking 52 (15d6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

entries.description: The dragon makes three Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Close. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Close. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (19), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 56 (16d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

entries.description: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

entries.description: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ooze makes two Pseudopod attacks. The ooze can replace one Pseudopod attack with its Slime Breath, if available.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Slime Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The ooze expels a spray of its gelatinous mass in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) acid damage and is pulled up to Close straight toward the ooze. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

entries.name: Fear Aura
entries.description: Each creature of the golem's choice that starts its turn within Close of the golem must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15) unless the golem is incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this golem's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes one Pinion attack and two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Pinion
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is pinned beneath the bony pinion and restrained. The golem has two pinions, each of which can restrain one target. If a creature is restrained by one of the pinions, the golem can't attack with it. Any creature restrained by a pinion can free itself at the start of its turn with a successful Difficulty (17) Strength (Athletics) check.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem emits a Far cone of petrifying gas from its mouth. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 35 (10d6) poison damage and be restrained as it begins to turn to stone. The restrained target must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the target. On a failed save, the target is petrified.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries.description: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragonborn makes three Longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage. The dragonborn can cause the sword to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be blinded until the start of the dragonborn's next turn. The sword can flare in this way only once per turn.

entries.name: Healing Touch (1/Day)
entries.description: The dragonborn touches another creature within Very Close of it. The target magically regains 40 hit points. In addition, all diseases and poisons affecting the target are removed.

entries.name: Radiant Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The dragonborn exhales fiery radiance in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 44 (8d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. When the dragonborn uses this action, it can choose up to three creatures in the cone. These creatures take no damage from the radiance and instead regain 22 (4d10) hit points each.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries.description: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Mental Defense
entries.description: While the dragonborn is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragonborn makes three Mind Blade attacks.

entries.name: Mind Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Heat Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The dragonborn exhales a wave of intense heat in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Metal objects in that area glow red-hot until the end of the dragonborn's next turn. Any creature in physical contact with a heated object at the start of its turn must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) fire damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)

entries.description: If the dragonborn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The dragonborn exhales shadowy fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) necrotic damage and is frightened of the dragonborn for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: If damage reduces the dread warrior to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5+the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the dread warrior drops to 1 hit point instead.

Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the mindkiller's next turn. If the target is already Frightened, it instead takes an extra 10 (3d6) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Primal Fear (1/Day)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the mindkiller can see within Very Far. While Frightened in this way, the target can do only one of the following on each of its turns: move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action. Success: Half damage only.

While Poisoned, the creature can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can't take Reactions.

entries.name: Assassinate

Moreover, on each of its turns, it can take either an action or a bonus action, but not both. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Bottom Treader
entries.description: The drowned ascetic cannot swim, and it sinks to the bottom of any body of water. It takes no penalties to its movement or attacks underwater. It is immune to the effects of being underwater at a depth greater than Far.

entries.name: Bound Together
entries.description: The drowned ascetic shares its mind with every other drowned one within 1 mile of it, and can communicate its thoughts and observations to them instantaneously and without limitation.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the drowned ascetic to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned ascetic drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.description: If damage reduces the drowned master to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the drowned master drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.description: The drowned master makes two attacks: one with its greatsword and one with its Life-Draining Tentacle.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or contract bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

entries.name: Life-Draining Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. On a failed save, the target also contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

entries.name: Necrotic Ink (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The drowned master discharges foul ink in front of itself in a Close cone. Each creature caught in the ink must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is blinded until the end of its next turn and contracts bluerot (see the "Bluerot" in notes).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The druid makes two attacks, using Vine Staff or Verdant Wisp in any combination.

entries.name: Vine Staff
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The druid casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Druidcraft, Speak with Animals2/day each: Entangle, Thunderwave1/day each: Animal Messenger, Longstrider, Moonbeam

entries.name: Verdant Wisp
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 10 (3d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The druid deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries.description: The druid can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The druid is a 12th-level Gruul spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, resistance, thorn whip1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, faerie fire, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): beast sense, flame blade, pass without trace3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, dispel magic, plant growth4th level (3 slots): dominate beast, freedom of movement, wall of fire5th level (2 slots): commune with nature, conjure elemental, scrying6th level (1 slot): transport via plants, wall of thorns

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dryad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries.description: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dryad makes one Vine Lash or Thorn Burst attack, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Charm Monster.

entries.name: Vine Lash
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dryad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Animal Friendship, Charm Monster (lasts 24 hours; ends early if the dryad casts the spell again), Druidcraft1/day each: Entangle, Pass without Trace

entries.name: Thorn Burst
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Detect Life
entries.description: The dryad can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The dryad can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

entries.name: Corrupting Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Horrifying Visage
entries.description: Each non-undead creature within Far of the dryad that can see her must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the dryad is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the dryad's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Wail (1/Day)
entries.description: The dryad releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within Close of her that can hear her must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Duergar Resilience
entries.description: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being charmed or paralyzed.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

entries.name: War Pick
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage while enlarged.

entries.name: Acid Vial
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Alchemist's Fire
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a successful Difficulty (10) Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

entries.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be pushed up to Close away in a straight line and be knocked prone.

Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect.

name: Dullahan

entries.name: Headless Summoning (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the dullahan is reduced to 0 hit points, it doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, it regains 97 hit points. In addition, it summons three death's heads, one of each type, in unoccupied spaces within Very Close of it. The death's heads are under the dullahan's control and act immediately after the dullahan in the initiative order. Additionally, the dullahan can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section. Award a party an additional 5,900 XP (11,800 XP total) for defeating the dullahan after it uses Headless Summoning.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: If the dullahan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dullahan doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dullahan makes two attacks.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. If the dullahan scores a critical hit against a creature, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or the dullahan cuts off the target's head. The target dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature that doesn't have or need a head, or has legendary actions, instead takes an extra 27 (6d8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Fiery Skull
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

entries.name: Air Form

Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or have the blinded condition for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: The dybbuk casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: dimension door3/day: phantasmal force

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its hit point maximum is also reduced by 3 (1d6). This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Possess Corpse (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The dybbuk disappears into an intact corpse within Very Close of it that belonged to a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid. The dybbuk gains 20 temporary hit points. While possessing the corpse, the dybbuk adopts the corpse's size and can't use Incorporeal Movement. Its game statistics otherwise remain the same. The possession lasts until the temporary hit points are lost or the dybbuk ends it as a bonus action. When the possession ends, the dybbuk appears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the corpse.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries.description: If a creature tries to read Dyrrn's thoughts or deals psychic damage to it, that creature must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (23) or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Dyrrn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Dyrrn has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Dyrrn regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If Dyrrn takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Dyrrn dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: As a bonus action, Dyrrn can teleport up to Close to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Dyrrn makes one Tentacle Whip attack and uses its Corruption once. Dyrrn can replace its Tentacle Whip attack with Extract Brain if it has a creature grappled.

entries.name: Tentacle Whip
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (23)), pulled into an unoccupied space within Very Close of Dyrrn, and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (23) or be stunned until this grapple ends. Dyrrn can't use the same tentacle whip on another target until this grapple ends. Dyrrn has two tentacle whips.

entries.name: Corruption
entries.description: Dyrrn targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (23) or take 22 (4d6 + 8) necrotic damage and become corrupted for 1 minute.A corrupted creature's flesh twists in alien ways. The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, its speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a Difficulty (15) Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted. The corrupted creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated creature grappled by Dyrrn. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, Dyrrn kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elemental makes two attacks, using Slam or Rock Launch in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock Launch
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Far. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The myrmidon makes two Maul attacks.

entries.name: Maul
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Thunderous Strike (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The myrmidon makes one Maul attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 22 (4d10) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Insatiable Greed
entries.description: The eater of hope can sense the presence of gold within 1,Melee of itself. It can determine which location has the greatest amount of gold and can sense the direction to that site. If the gold is being moved, it knows the direction of the movement. It can't locate gold if any thickness of clay or lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between it and the gold.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The eater of hope has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eater of hope makes two attacks with its claws.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Breath of Hopelessness (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The eater of hope exhales a miasma of Underworld winds in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the target takes 26 (4d12) necrotic damage and is cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target takes an extra 6 (1d12) necrotic damage whenever the eater of hope hits it with an attack. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't cursed.

entries.name: Brains Devoured
entries.description: When the eater of knowledge is first encountered, roll 1d10 to determine the number of brains it has already consumed.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The eater of knowledge has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eater of knowledge makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature and the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one Humanoid with the incapacitated condition. Hit: 45 (10d8) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the eater of knowledge kills the target by extracting and consuming its brain.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The eater of knowledge casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:1/day each: plane shift (self only, 0 brains), detect magic (1 brain), silent image (2 brains), invisibility (3 brains), hypnotic pattern (4 brains), major image (5 brains), telekinesis (6 brains), arcane eye (7 brains), mislead (8 brains), greater invisibility (9 brains), mass suggestion (10 or more brains)

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The eblis's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (11)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: blur, hypnotic pattern, minor illusion

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eblis attacks twice with its beak.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The echo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: When one of the echo's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The echo makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: If the efreeti dies outside the Elemental Plane of Fire, its body dissolves into ash, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Fire.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The efreeti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: The efreeti has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the efreeti knows it, the efreeti can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the efreeti can understand. If the efreeti casts the spell for the creature, the efreeti suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the efreeti has cast it three times, the efreeti can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The efreeti makes three attacks, using Heated Blade or Hurl Flame in any combination.

entries.name: Heated Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Slashing damage plus 13 (2d12) Fire damage.

entries.name: Hurl Flame
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Very Far. Hit: 24 (7d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The efreeti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Detect Magic, Elementalism1/day each: Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Major Image, Plane Shift, Tongues, Wall of Fire (level 7 version)

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the egg hunter is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the egg hunter move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the egg hunter is animate. Dragons have disadvantage on this check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The egg hunter makes two Barbed Proboscis attacks, and it can use Torpor Spores if it's available.

entries.name: Barbed Proboscis
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the egg hunter regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Torpor Spores (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The egg hunter releases a billow of sparkling blue spores. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on the egg hunter must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both, and it can't take reactions. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this egg hunter's Torpor Spores for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The egg hunter can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The egg hunter makes two Egg Tooth attacks.

entries.name: Egg Tooth
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage if the target is an object.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object other than a sacred statue.

entries.name: Sacred Animation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: When the eidolon moves into a space occupied by a sacred statue, the eidolon can disappear, causing the statue to become a creature under the eidolon's control. The eidolon uses the sacred statue's stat block in place of its own.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The eidolon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Divine Dread
entries.description: Each creature within Far of the eidolon that can see it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be frightened of it for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature must take the Dash action and move away from the eidolon by the safest available route at the start of each of its turns, unless there is nowhere for it to move, in which case the creature also becomes stunned until it can move again. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any eidolon's Divine Dread for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: The elder brain is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the elder brain fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The elder brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate3/day: modify memory1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (4d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Creatures of the elder brain's choice within Far of it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (18) or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The dragon deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tentacle attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d6 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 12 (1d8 + 8) psychic damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (18)). The dragon can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

entries.name: Tadpole Brine Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales brine in a Very Far line that is Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (22), taking 55 (10d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, if the creature isn't a Construct or an Undead, it becomes infested with illithid tadpoles.While infested, the creature takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves. If the creature is targeted by magic that ends a curse or restores 40 hit points or more, the tadpoles infesting the creature are killed instantly, ending the effect on the creature.If a Humanoid is reduced to 0 hit points while infested, the creature is stable but remains unconscious for 6d12 hours. When the period of unconsciousness ends, the creature transforms into a mind flayer (see the Monster Manual) with all its hit points. Casting a wish spell on the unconscious creature rids it of the infestation and prevents it from turning into a mind flayer.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The lizard can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lizard makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the lizard can't bite another target.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target not grappled by the lizard. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Aversion to Fire
entries.description: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elder oblex makes two Pseudopod attacks, and it uses Eat Memories.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Eat Memories
entries.description: The oblex targets one creature it can see within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (18) or take 44 (8d10) psychic damage and become memory drained until it finishes a short or long rest or until it benefits from the greater restoration or heal spell. Constructs, Oozes, Plants, and Undead succeed on the save automatically.While memory drained, the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from any ability check or attack roll it makes. Each time the target is memory drained beyond the first, the die size increases by one: the d4 becomes a d6, the d6 becomes a d8, and so on until the die becomes a d20, at which point the target becomes unconscious for 1 hour. The effect then ends.The oblex learns all the languages a memory-drained target knows and gains all its skill proficiencies.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The oblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: charm person (as 5th-level spell), detect thoughts3/day each: dimension door, dominate person, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

entries.name: Air Form
entries.description: The tempest can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The tempest doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the tempest fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Living Storm
entries.description: The tempest is always at the center of a storm 1d6 + 4 miles in diameter. Heavy precipitation in the form of either rain or snow falls there, causing the area to be lightly obscured. Heavy rain also extinguishes open flames and imposes disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. In addition, strong winds swirl in the area covered by the storm. The winds impose disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. They also extinguish open flames and disperse fog.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The tempest deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tempest makes two Thunderous Slam attacks.

entries.name: Thunderous Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) thunder damage.

entries.name: Lightning Storm (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Each creature within Very Far of the tempest must make a Agility Reaction Roll (21), taking 27 (6d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The eddy has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eddy makes two attacks, using Searing Swipe or Arcane Bolt in any combination.

entries.name: Searing Swipe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Fire or Lightning damage (eddy's choice).

entries.name: Arcane Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Very Far. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) Force damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the eldritch horror hatchling can bite only the grappled creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

entries.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The eldritch horror hatchling spits acid in a line that is Close long and Very Close wide, provided that it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: The cataclysm can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the cataclysm doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the cataclysm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The cataclysm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cataclysm makes two Elemental Burst attacks.

entries.name: Control Weather
entries.description: The cataclysm casts the Control Weather spell, requiring no spell components and using Constitution as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Elemental Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +15, reach Close or range Very Far. Hit: 25 (5d6 + 8) damage of a type chosen by the cataclysm: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

entries.name: Cataclysmic Event (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The cataclysm creates one of the following effects at random (roll 1d4):1: Clinging Flames. Agility Reaction Roll (23), each creature in a Far-radius Sphere centered on a point the cataclysm can see within Very Far. Failure: 45 (13d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target starts burning.2: Freezing Waves. Strength Reaction Roll (23), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 22 (5d8) Bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) Cold damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: The target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.3: Raging Storm. A storm cloud fills a Far-radius Sphere centered on a point the cataclysm can see within Very Far. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until the cataclysm uses Cataclysmic Event again. Creatures entirely in the cloud have the Blinded and Deafened conditions and can't cast spells with a Verbal component. Agility Reaction Roll (23), each creature that enters the cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. Failure: 18 (4d8) Lightning damage plus 18 (4d8) Thunder damage. Success: Half damage.4: Swallowing Earth. Strength Reaction Roll (23), each creature in a Far Cube originating from a point on the ground within Very Far. Failure: 18 (4d8) Bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) Acid damage, and the target has the Prone condition and is buried under rubble. A buried target has the Restrained condition, has Total Cover, and is suffocating. As an action, a buried creature or another creature within Very Close of it can make a Difficulty (18) Strength (Athletics) check. On a successful check, the creature is no longer buried. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three attacks, using Elemental Flail or Elemental Claw in any combination.

entries.name: Elemental Flail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) damage of a type chosen by the cultist: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder.

entries.name: Elemental Claw
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d10) damage of a type chosen by the cultist: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the cultist moves the target up to Very Close straight toward or away from itself.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Elementalism, Mage Hand

name: Elemental Spirit

entries.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
entries.description: The spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without it counting as Difficult Terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of Slam attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d10 + 4 + the spell's level Bludgeoning (Earth only), Cold (Water only), Lightning (Air only), or Fire (Fire only) damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elephant makes two Gore attacks.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and the elephant moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: Elise is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever Elise is subjected to lightning damage, she takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Elise has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: Elise's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Elise makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the elk moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) Bludgeoning damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the minotaur moves at least Very Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be pushed up to Very Close away and knocked prone.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Burning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The minotaur exhales a cloud of burning embers in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Aura of Authority
entries.description: While in a Close Emanation originating from the commander, the commander and its allies have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, provided the commander doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The commander makes two attacks, using Flail or Javelin in any combination.

entries.name: Flail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage—plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage if the commander is Bloodied—and the target has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of the commander's next turn.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage—plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage if the commander is Bloodied.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two attacks, using Flail or Javelin in any combination.

entries.name: Flail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage—plus 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage if the knight is Bloodied—and the target has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of the knight's next turn.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage—plus 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage if the knight is Bloodied.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Disorienting Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a wave of psychic dissonance in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, the creature takes 17 (5d6) psychic damage, and until the end of its next turn, when the creature makes an attack roll or an ability check, it must roll a d4 and reduce the total by the number rolled. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible), minor illusion

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The scout has advantage on saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: War Pick
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within Very Far of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to Far in any direction, but not beyond Very Far of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the empyrean fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The empyrean has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The empyrean makes two attacks, using Sacred Weapon or Divine Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Sacred Weapon
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +17, reach Very Close. Hit: 31 (6d6 + 10) Force damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the start of the empyrean's next turn. The target can choose not to be Stunned, in which case it takes an extra 21 Force damage that bypasses Resistance or Immunity.

entries.name: Divine Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +15, range Out of Range. Hit: 35 (6d8 + 8) Necrotic or Radiant damage (empyrean's choice).

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The empyrean casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: Calm Emotions, Greater Restoration, Pass without Trace, Water Breathing1/day each: Commune, Dispel Evil and Good, Plane Shift

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The empyrean can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The empyrean has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Otherworldly Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Necrotic or Radiant damage (empyrean's choice).

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The empyrean casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: Bless, Lesser Restoration (as an action)

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the cluster fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cluster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cluster makes two Slam attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Spawn Progeny if available.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or have the prone condition. If this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target immediately dies and is consumed by the cluster.

entries.name: Spawn Progeny (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The cluster bulges and spews 1d4 mature eggs. Each egg lands in an unoccupied space of the cluster's choice within Close of itself and immediately transforms into an encephalon gemmule. The gemmules obey the cluster's commands and take their turns immediately after it.

entries.name: Encephalon Progeny
entries.description: The gemmule matures into an encephalon cluster if not killed within 30 (4d12 + 4) days of its creation.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The gemmule has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Psychic Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The enchanter makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The enchanter casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: friends, mage hand, message2/day each: charm person, mage armor, hold person, invisibility, suggestion, tongues

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the infiltrator fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Veiled Presence
entries.description: The infiltrator's AC includes its Wisdom modifier, and the infiltrator can't be targeted by divination magic or features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The infiltrator makes two Poison Blade attacks and can use Beguiling Whisper.

entries.name: Poison Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) poison damage.

entries.name: Beguiling Whisper
entries.description: The infiltrator magically whispers to a creature it can see within Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or have the stunned condition due to fear or delight (the infiltrator's choice) until the end of the target's next turn, after which the target is immune to this Beguiling Whisper for 24 hours.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries.description: The gnome has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The gnome is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation1st level (2 slots): burning hands, disguise self, shield

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Reach
entries.description: The tentacle can reach anywhere in the room.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Far, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the tentacle can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Headfirst Charge
entries.description: If the equinal moves at least Close in a straight line toward a creature and ends within Very Close of it, that creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or take 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The equinal makes two Fist attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Shout (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The equinal lets out a booming shout. Each creature within Close of the equinal must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or have the stunned condition until the end of the equinal's next turn.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the erinyes dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The erinyes has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Rope
entries.description: The erinyes has a magic rope. While bearing it, the erinyes can use the Entangling Rope action. The rope has AC 20, HP 90, and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The rope turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points, if it is 5+ feet away from the erinyes for 1 hour or more, or if the erinyes dies. If the rope is damaged or destroyed, the erinyes can fully restore it when finishing a Short or Long Rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The erinyes makes three Withering Sword attacks and can use Entangling Rope.

entries.name: Withering Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Entangling Rope (Requires Magic Rope)
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (16), one creature the erinyes can see within Very Far. Failure: 14 (4d6) Force damage, and the target has the Restrained condition until the rope is destroyed, the erinyes uses a Bonus Action to release the target, or the erinyes uses Entangling Rope again.

entries.name: Bioluminescence
entries.description: While it has at least 1 hit point, the esthetic sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close, and its interior compartments are dimly lit.

entries.name: Spelljamming
entries.description: The esthetic has the properties of a spelljamming helm (see the Astral Adventurer's Guide), but only its reigar creator can attune to it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The esthetic doesn't require air, food, or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The esthetic makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (17)). Until this grapple ends, the creature takes 18 (4d8) acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the esthetic can't use this tentacle against other targets. The esthetic has 1d4 × 2 tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Flaming Weapon (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: As a bonus action, the guard can wreath one melee weapon it is wielding in flame. The guard is unharmed by this fire, which lasts until the end of the guard's next turn. While wreathed in flame, the weapon deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guard makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): control flames, create bonfire, fire bolt, light, minor illusion1st level (4 slots): burning hands, expeditious retreat, mage armor2nd level (3 slots): blur, scorching ray3rd level (2 slots): fireball

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the ettercap knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ettercap makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the ettercap's next turn.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Web Strand (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (12), one Large or smaller creature the ettercap can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Restrained condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Vulnerability to Fire damage; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ettin makes one Battleaxe attack and one Morningstar attack.

entries.name: Battleaxe
