entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage, and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ceremorph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ceremorph makes one Slam attack and one Tentacles attack. The ceremorph can replace one of the attacks with a Mind Bolt attack, if available.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated Humanoid grappled by the ceremorph. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ceremorph kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Bolt (3/Day)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: Euryale carries one half of a pair of Sending Stones; the other half of the pair is held by Asteria.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Euryale fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Euryale makes three attacks. If she is in serpent form, only one of these attacks can be Constrict.

entries.name: Constrict (Serpent Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (19)). Until this grapple ends, the target takes 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and Euryale can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Snake Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or have the poisoned condition until the start of Euryale's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Medusa Form Only)
entries.description: Euryale casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (19)):At will: Druidcraft, Pass without Trace2/day each: Goodberry, Lesser Restoration, Locate Creature, Move Earth, Transport via Plants

entries.name: Verdant Bolt (Medusa Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard's spell list:Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d8 -1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage is a 4th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as its spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13); +5 to hit with spell attacks). The mage knows the following spells from the wizard's spell list:Cantrips (at will): light, mage hand, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): charm person, magic missile2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The evoker makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Sculpted Explosion (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The evoker unleashes a magical explosion of a particular damage type: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The magic erupts in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point within Very Far of the evoker. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15). The evoker can select up to three creatures it can see in the area to ignore the spell, as the evoker sculpts the spell's energy around them. On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) damage of the chosen type and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The evoker casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation2/day each: ice storm, lightning bolt, mage armor1/day: wall of ice

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The messenger doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the messenger is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the expert is not incapacitated and subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it failed.

entries.name: Helpful
entries.description: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action, and the creature who receives the help gains a 1d6 bonus to the d20 roll. If that roll is an attack roll, the creature can forgo adding the bonus to it, and then if the attack hits, the creature can add the bonus to the attack's damage roll against one target.

entries.name: Reliable Talent
entries.description: Whenever the expert makes an ability check that includes its whole proficiency bonus, it can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

entries.name: Tools
entries.description: The expert has thieves' tools and a musical instrument.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries.description: The expert can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the attack action on its turn.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Helpful
entries.description: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Tools
entries.description: The expert has thieves' tools and a musical instrument.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: When the expert is not incapacitated and subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it failed.

entries.name: Helpful
entries.description: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action, and the creature who receives the help gains a 1d6 bonus to the d20 roll. If that roll is an attack roll, the creature can forgo adding the bonus to it, and then if the attack hits, the creature can add the bonus to the attack's damage roll against one target.

entries.name: Tools
entries.description: The expert has thieves' tools and a musical instrument.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries.description: The expert can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the attack action on its turn.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Helpful
entries.description: The expert can take the Help action as a bonus action, and the creature who receives the help gains a 1d6 bonus to the d20 roll. If that roll is an attack roll, the creature can forgo adding the bonus to it, and then if the attack hits, the creature can add the bonus to the attack's damage roll against one target.

entries.name: Tools
entries.description: The expert has thieves' tools and a musical instrument.

entries.name: Extra Attack
entries.description: The expert can attack twice, instead of once, whenever it takes the Attack action on its turn.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Gullet
entries.description: Magical effects, including those produced by spells and magic items but excluding those created by artifacts or deities, are suppressed inside the eye monger's gullet. Any spell slot or charge expended by a creature in the gullet to cast a spell or activate a property of a magic item is wasted. While an effect is suppressed, it doesn't function, but the time it spends suppressed counts against its duration. No spell or magical effect that originates outside the eye monger's gullet, except one created by an artifact or a deity, can affect a creature or an object inside the gullet.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the eye monger is motionless and has its eye and mouth closed at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the eye monger move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the eye monger is animate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The eye monger doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (18) or be swallowed by the eye monger and deposited in the eye monger's gullet (see Antimagic Gullet). The eye monger can swallow one creature at a time. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects originating outside the eye monger, and takes 35 (10d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.If the eye monger takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside its gullet, the eye monger regurgitates the swallowed creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the eye monger. If the eye monger dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Very Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The eyedrake doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The eyedrake emits a magic wave in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 39 (6d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Every spell of 3rd level or lower ends on creatures and objects of the eyedrake's choice in that area.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The eyedrake shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), each ray targeting one creature it can see within Far of it:1: Freezing Ray. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the target takes 17 (5d6) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage with no additional effects.2: Debilitating Ray. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 7 (2d6) thunder damage and become incapacitated until the end of its next turn.3: Repulsion Ray. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or take 14 (4d6) force damage and be pushed up to Far away from the eyedrake.4: Fire Ray. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.5: Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.6: Death Ray. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 28 (8d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The eyestalk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eyestalk attacks with its bite and uses Eradication Gaze.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (19) or be swallowed by the eyestalk. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the eyestalk, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the eyestalk's turns.If the eyestalk takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the eyestalk must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the eyestalk. If the eyestalk dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Eradication Gaze (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The eyestalk creates an area of magical devastation in a Very Far cone. Any creature in that area must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (16) or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine violet dust.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dragon has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Incapacitated, the target uses all its movement on each of its turns to move in a random direction.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Dancing Lights, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion1/day each: Hallucinatory Terrain, Polymorph

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The dragon has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Euphoria Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn and uses all its movement on its turn to move in a random direction.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: Dancing Lights, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The falcon has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the false lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The false lich has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The false lich makes two Death Rend attacks and uses Bloodcurdling Lament if available.

entries.name: Death Rend
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bloodcurdling Lament (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The false lich emits a hideous shriek charged with malignant energy. Each creature within Close of the false lich must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (22) or have the frightened condition for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature also has the unconscious condition. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The false lich casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (22)):At will: Detect Magic, Fly, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation3/day each: Dispel Magic, Invisibility (self only)1/day each: Globe of Invulnerability, Hold Monster

entries.name: Boundless Movement
entries.description: The farastu ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend Very Close of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The farastu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The farastu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The farastu makes two Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15), with disadvantage). The farastu has two claws, each of which can grapple one creature.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage against a creature the farastu is grappling), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The farastu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: invisibility (self only)1/day each: dispel magic, fog cloud

entries.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
entries.description: The farastu has a 40 percent chance of summoning 1 farastu demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within Far of the farastu, acts as an ally of the farastu, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the farastu dies, or until the farastu dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Quickness (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The fastieth can take the Dodge action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: If the hag fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Trace the Threads (1/Day)
entries.description: The hag can cast the Legend Lore spell, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hag makes two Shears attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Shears
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of the hag's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: While holding its shears, the hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Bless, Guidance, Silent Image1/day each: Bane, Bestow Curse, Divination, Scrying (as an action)

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shaker makes two Golden Rod or Radiant Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Golden Rod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

entries.name: Radiant Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shaker casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: mage armor, mage hand1/day each: enlarge/reduce, fly, suggestion

entries.name: Shapechanger (2/Day)
entries.description: The fathomer can use its action to polymorph into a Medium serpent composed of water, or back into its true form. Anything the fathomer is wearing or carrying is subsumed into the serpent form during the change, inaccessible until the fathomer returns to its true form. The fathomer reverts to its true form after 4 hours, unless it can expend another use of this trait. If the fathomer is knocked unconscious or dies, it also reverts to its true form.While in serpent form, the fathomer gains a swimming speed of Far, the ability to breathe underwater, immunity to poison damage, as well as resistance to fire damage and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. It also has immunity to the following conditions: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, poisoned, restrained, prone, unconscious. The serpent form can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if water can pass through a space, the serpent can do so without squeezing.

entries.name: Olhydra's Armor (Human Form Only)
entries.description: The fathomer can cast mage armor at will, without expending material components.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Human Form Only)
entries.description: The fathomer is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has two 3rd-level spell slots, which it regains after finishing a short or long rest, and knows the following warlock spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, eldritch blast, mage hand1st-3rd level (2 3rd-level slots): armor of Agathys, expeditious retreat, hex, invisibility, Vampiric touch

entries.name: Constrict (Serpent Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the fathomer can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Dagger (Human Form Only)
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The knight is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spell:Cantrips (at will): gust, light, message, ray of frost1st level (2 slots): expeditious retreat, feather fall

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The felbarren dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Bonding
entries.description: The felidar can magically bond with one creature it can see, right after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within Close of it. The bond lasts until the felidar bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. This bond has the following effects: The felidar and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to Far. The felidar can sense the direction and distance to the bonded creature if they're on the same plane of existence. As an action, the felidar or the bonded creature can sense what the other sees and hears, during which time it loses its own sight and hearing. This effect lasts until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The felidar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the felidar moves at least Close straight toward a creature and hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the felidar can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The felidar makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Extraordinary Leap
entries.description: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to move Melee.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Sticky Leg
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

entries.name: Death Curse
entries.description: When the fensir starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate, it releases a curse on those around it. Each creature within Close of the fensir when it dies must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be cursed for the next 24 hours.While cursed in this way, an affected creature gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. At the end of every hour, the creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The fensir regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it isn't in sunlight. If the fensir takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the fensir's next turn. The fensir dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: When the fensir starts its turn in sunlight, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have the petrified condition until the fensir is no longer in sunlight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fensir makes two attacks, using Rend, Boulder, or a combination of them.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or have the prone condition. After the fensir throws the boulder, roll a d6; on a roll of 4 or lower, the fensir has no more boulders to throw.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The fensir regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it isn't in sunlight. If the fensir takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the fensir's next turn. The fensir dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: When the fensir starts its turn in sunlight, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have the petrified condition until the fensir is no longer in sunlight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fensir makes three Battleaxe attacks or two Magic Stone attacks.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Magic Stone
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 15 (2d12 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Mud to Stone (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The fensir lobs a magical mass of mud that splashes all creatures in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the fensir can see within Far of itself. Each non-fensir creature in that area must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or take 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage and have the restrained condition as the mud begins to turn to stone. An affected creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the effect ends on the creature. On a failed save, the creature has the petrified condition for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The fensir casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: create or destroy water, detect magic, pass without trace

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ashenwight makes two Necrotic Shard attacks.

entries.name: Necrotic Shard
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Bladed Edges
entries.description: A creature takes 10 (3d6) slashing damage if it starts its turn grappling or being grappled by the ferrumach.

entries.name: Skewering Charge
entries.description: If the ferrumach moves at least Close in a straight line toward a Large or smaller creature and ends within Very Close of it, that creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or have the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)) and take 10 (3d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ferrumach makes three Sharpened Limb or Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Sharpened Limb
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ferrumach casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: detect magic1/day each: dispel magic, ice storm

name: Fey Spirit

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of Fey Blade attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Fey Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 2d6 + 3 + the spell's level Force damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The feyr doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The feyr makes one Frightful Bite attack and one Tentacle attack.

entries.name: Frightful Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and each creature within Very Close of the feyr that can see it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened of the feyr until the end of the feyr's next turn.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) psychic damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the feyr can't use this tentacle against other targets. The feyr has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one creature.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The feyr becomes invisible until it attacks, uses Nightmare Fuel, or uses a bonus action to become visible.

entries.name: Nightmare Fuel (1/Day)
entries.description: The feyr targets one unconscious creature it can see within Very Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage, and the feyr gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cultist makes three Pact Axe attacks.

entries.name: Pact Axe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The cultist casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Scorching Ray (level 5 version), Thaumaturgy2/day: Fireball (level 6 version)

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The auger deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The auger can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Flaming Drill
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the auger moves at least Close in a straight line toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an additional 11 (2d10) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 100 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points. If the golem's creator is within Far of the berserk golem, the creator can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 100 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 7 (2d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The icon has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The icon makes two Slam attacks and uses Fiery Eruption.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fiery Eruption
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the icon. Failure: 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Gruumsh's Fury
entries.description: The orc deals an extra 4 (1d8) damage when it hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The orc makes two attacks with its greataxe or its spear.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (1d12 + 4 plus 1d8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 12 (1d6 + 4 plus 1d8) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
entries.description: Each creature of the war chief's choice that is within Close of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the war chief's next turn. The war chief can then make one attack as a bonus action.

name: Fiendish Spirit

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The spirit has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Death Throes (Demon Only)
entries.description: When the spirit drops to 0 Hit Points or the spell ends, the spirit explodes. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the spirit. Failure: 2d10 plus this spell's level Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Devil's Sight (Devil Only)
entries.description: Magical Darkness doesn't impede the spirit's Darkvision.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Bite (Demon Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d12 + 3 + the spell's level Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claws (Yugoloth Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level Slashing damage. Immediately after the attack hits or misses, the spirit can teleport up to Close to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Fiery Strike (Devil Only)
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 2d6 + 3 + the spell's level Fire damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firbolg makes two Spear or Fire Lance attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Lance
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The firbolg casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: entangle, speak with animals, speak with plants1/day each: commune with nature (as an action), detect magic, disguise self

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firbolg makes two attacks using Longsword, Bewitching Bolt, or a combination of them.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Bewitching Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or have the charmed condition until the start of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The firbolg casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: mage hand, minor illusion, Tasha's hideous laughter1/day each: detect magic, disguise self, dispel magic, polymorph

entries.name: Fire Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the elemental's turns, each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the elemental takes 5 (1d10) Fire damage. Creatures and flammable objects in the Emanation start burning.

entries.name: Fire Form
entries.description: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so, and it can enter a creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) Fire damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The elemental sheds Bright Light in a Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Water Susceptibility
entries.description: The elemental takes 3 (1d6) Cold damage for every Very Close the elemental moves in water or for every gallon of water splashed on it.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elemental makes two Burn attacks.

entries.name: Burn
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it starts burning.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The myrmidon sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light in a Far radius.

entries.name: Water Susceptibility
entries.description: For every Very Close the myrmidon moves in Melee or more of water, it takes 2 (1d4) cold damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The myrmidon makes three Scimitar attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Fiery Strikes (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The myrmidon uses Multiattack. Each attack that hits deals an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Flame Sword or Hammer Throw in any combination.

entries.name: Flame Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Hammer Throw
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +11, range Far. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) Fire damage, and the target is pushed up to Close straight away from the giant and has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Dual Shields
entries.description: The giant carries two shields, which together give the giant +3 to its AC (accounted for above).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Fireshield or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Fireshield
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage plus 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shield Charge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The giant moves up to Close in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature smaller than Huge. The first time it enters a creature's space during this move, that creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (21) or take 36 (8d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage and be pushed up to Close and knocked prone.

entries.name: Fire Rune
entries.description: The giant has a fire rune inscribed on a medallion or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Magma Wave action and Furnace Armor bonus action.The object bearing the rune has AC 15; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a fire rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three Forge Hammer attacks or two Heated Rock attacks.

entries.name: Forge Hammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (5d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: The giant can cause the hammer to emit a burst of heat in a Close-radius sphere centered on the target. Metal objects in that area glow red-hot until the start of the giant's next turn. Any creature in physical contact with a heated object at the start of its turn must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, the creature takes 10 (3d6) fire damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn unless it has immunity to fire damage. The hammer can emit heat in this way only once per turn.

entries.name: Heated Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) fire damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (21) or have the prone condition. After the giant throws the rock, roll a d6; on a roll of 3 or lower, the giant has no more rocks to throw.

entries.name: Magma Wave (Requires Fire Rune)
entries.description: The giant emits a wave of magma from its fire rune in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) fire damage and has the restrained condition. As an action, a creature can make a Difficulty (19) Strength (Athletics) check, freeing itself or a creature within its reach from the rock on a success. The rock restraining each creature has AC 17; 20 hit points; and immunity to fire, poison, and psychic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

entries.name: Greataxe +2
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) slashing damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) slashing damage, or 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage if used with both hands.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shrapnel Explosion
entries.description: When the giant drops to 0 hit points, its armor explodes, destroying the giant's body and scattering the armor as shrapnel. Creatures within Very Close of the giant when its armor explodes must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Searing Scepter attacks or two Bolt of Imix attacks.

entries.name: Searing Scepter
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage, and the target is magically branded. While branded in this way, the target becomes visible if it's invisible, can't become invisible, and sheds dim light in a Very Close radius. The brand disappears after 24 hours, or it can be removed from a creature or an object by any spell that ends a curse.

entries.name: Bolt of Imix
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or have the frightened condition until the end of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hellion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Taker
entries.description: A Giant or a Humanoid that is reduced to 0 hit points by the hellion dies, and its soul rises as a lemure (see the Monster Manual) on Avernus, one of the Nine Hells, in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, it can be restored to life only by a wish spell or by killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hellion makes two Morningstar attacks.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the hellion's next turn.

entries.name: Infernal Orb
entries.description: The hellion hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the hellion can see within Very Far of itself. The sphere spreads around corners. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). A creature takes 18 (4d8) fire damage and 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The firefist is a 9th-level Boros spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, sacred flame, spare the dying1st level (4 slots): guiding bolt, healing word, heroism, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, scorching ray3rd level (3 slots): blinding smite, crusader's mantle, revivify4th level (3 slots): banishment, wall of fire5th level (1 slot): flame strike

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firefist makes two greatsword attacks.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Fire Blood
entries.description: Whenever a creature within Very Close of the firegaunt hits the firegaunt with a melee attack that deals piercing or slashing damage, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firegaunt makes two Heated Maul attacks.

entries.name: Heated Maul
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. The firegaunt can cause the maul to erupt with crimson flames, and the target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (18) or take 10 (3d6) fire damage and 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. The maul can erupt with flames in this way only once per turn.

entries.name: Crimson Rays (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The firegaunt emits beams of fire from its eyes, mouth, and wounds in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, that creature catches fire. Until the burning creature or another creature that can reach it takes an action to extinguish the fire, the burning creature can't regain hit points and takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The angel doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The angel's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: compelled duel, guiding bolt (as a 5th-level spell)1/day each: daylight, fireball (as a 6th-level spell)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the angel takes 21 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The angel makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage, or 11 (1d10 + 6) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) fire or radiant damage (angel's choice).

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the firenewt's darkvision.

entries.name: Imix's Blessing
entries.description: When the firenewt reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the firenewt gains 5 temporary hit points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firenewt makes three Morningstar or Fire Ray attacks.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fire Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The firenewt casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: guidance, light, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The firenewt can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The firenewt makes two Scimitar attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spit Fire (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The firenewt spits fire at a creature within Very Close of it. The creature must make a Agility Reaction Roll (11), taking 9 (2d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Excited to Be Here
entries.description: The student has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Magic Flare
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d12 + 1) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The student casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)):At will: mage hand, prestidigitation1/day: detect magic

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The fish can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Tactical Discipline
entries.description: The fist of Bane has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes six attacks: one with its bite and five with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Shell
entries.description: The snail has advantage on saving throws against spells, and any creature making a spell attack against the snail has disadvantage on the attack roll.If the snail succeeds on its saving throw against a spell or a spell's attack roll misses it, the snail's shell converts some of the spell's energy into a burst of destructive force if the spell is of 1st level or higher; each creature within Close of the snail must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 3 (1d6) force damage per level of the spell on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The snail makes five Flail Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Flail Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Scintillating Shell (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The snail's shell emits dazzling, colored light until the end of the snail's next turn. During this time, the shell sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close, and creatures that can see the snail have disadvantage on attack rolls against it. In addition, any creature within the bright light and able to see the snail when this power is activated must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned until the light ends.

entries.name: Shell Defense
entries.description: The flail snail withdraws into its shell. Until it emerges, it gains a +4 bonus to its AC and is restrained. It can emerge from its shell as a bonus action on its turn.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The flameskull sheds Bright Light in a Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The flameskull has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its Hit Points in 1 hour unless Holy Water is sprinkled on its remains or the Dispel Evil and Good spell is cast on them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The flameskull makes two Fire Ray attacks.

entries.name: Fire Ray
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Fire damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The flameskull casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Mage Hand2/day: Magic Missile (level 2 version)1/day: Fireball

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The flamewrath is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): control flames, fire bolt, friends, light, minor illusion1st level (4 slots): burning hands, color spray, mage armor2nd level (3 slots): scorching ray, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): fireball, hypnotic pattern4th level (1 slot): fire shield (see Wreathed in Flame)

entries.name: Wreathed in Flame
entries.description: For the flamewrath, the warm version of the fire shield spell has a duration of "until dispelled." The fire shield burns for 10 minutes after the flamewrath dies, consuming its body.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The skeleton explodes when it dies. Agility Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the skeleton. Failure: 14 (4d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The skeleton sheds Bright Light in a Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skeleton makes two attacks, using Flame Scepter or Hurl Flame in any combination.

entries.name: Flame Scepter
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Hurl Flame
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Fire damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the lion moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the lion can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: With a Very Close running start, the lion can long jump up to Close.

entries.name: Spell Turning
entries.description: The lion has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the lion (not an area). If the lion's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the lion and instead targets the caster.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lion makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: If the core inside the colossus is destroyed, the colossus goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the colossus attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the colossus attacks an object. Once the colossus goes berserk, it remains berserk until it is destroyed.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The colossus makes two Fist attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit (with advantage if the colossus is berserk), reach Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pulled up to Close toward the colossus, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)), and it has the restrained condition until this grapple ends. The colossus can have up to two creatures grappled this way at a time.

entries.name: Elemental Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The colossus exhales a cloud swirling with elemental energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) damage of a type of the colossus's choosing: acid, cold, fire, or lightning. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.At the same time as the colossus releases this exhalation, creatures inside the colossus's chest cavity take 40 (9d8) force damage from churning elemental energy.

entries.name: Aversion to Fire
entries.description: If the golem takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn Bloodied, roll 1d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object. Once the golem goes berserk, it remains so until it is destroyed or it is no longer Bloodied.The golem's creator, if within Far of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by taking an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check; the golem must be able to hear its creator. If this check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk until the start of its next turn, at which point it resumes rolling for the Berserk trait again if it is still Bloodied.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The flesh meld can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Aura of Death
entries.description: At the start of each of the flesh meld's turns, each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage and have the poisoned condition until the start of the flesh meld's next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The flesh meld has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The flesh meld can climb difficult surfaces, including ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The flesh meld makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)) and is pulled up to Close toward the flesh meld.

entries.name: Aura of Blood Thirst
entries.description: If the flind isn't incapacitated, any creature with the Rampage trait can make a Bite attack as a bonus action while within Very Close of the flind.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The flind makes one Flail of Chaos attack, one Flail of Pain attack, and one Flail of Paralysis attack, or it makes three Longbow attacks.

entries.name: Flail of Chaos
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the target must use its reaction, if available, to make one melee attack against a random creature, other than the flind, within its reach. If there's no creature within reach, the target instead moves half its speed in a random direction.

entries.name: Flail of Pain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Flail of Paralysis
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Blurred Form
entries.description: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the eidolon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the eidolon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eidolon makes two melee attacks. Immediately before or after one of its attacks, it can use Flitterstep if it is available.

entries.name: Flickering Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Flitterstep (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The eidolon magically teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within Close of it. If it makes an attack immediately after teleporting, it has advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Advanced Telepathy
entries.description: The flumph perceives the content of any telepathic communication within Far of it.

entries.name: Prone Deficiency
entries.description: If the flumph receives the Prone condition, roll a die. On an odd number, it has the Incapacitated condition. At the end of each of its turns, the flumph makes a Agility Reaction Roll (10), ending the Incapacitated condition on a success.

entries.name: Telepathic Shroud
entries.description: The flumph's thoughts can't be read by any means, and magic can't detect its location or observe it remotely.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Acid damage.

entries.name: Stench Spray (1/Day)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (10), one creature the flumph can see within Close. Failure: The target is coated in a foul-smelling liquid, exudes a stench for 1d4 hours, and has the Poisoned condition while the stench lasts. Other creatures have the Poisoned condition while in a Very Close Emanation originating from the coated target. The target can remove the stench on itself if it bathes during a Short or Long Rest.

entries.name: Fluxbending Overcast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The blastseeker can create an additional effect immediately after casting a spell. Roll a d6 to determine the effect: 1-3. The blastseeker teleports, swapping places with a creature it can see within Close of it. 4-6. The blastseeker and each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or take 11 (2d10) thunder damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:3/day each: mage armor (self only), scorching ray1/day each: banishment, cone of cold, dimension door, fireball, ice storm

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Amplify Lightning
entries.description: Whenever a spell that deals lightning damage includes one or more fluxchargers in its area, the spell deals an extra 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fluxcharger makes two slam attacks or uses Arc Lightning twice.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Arc Lightning
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d10) lightning damage, and lightning jumps from the target to one creature of the fluxcharger's choice that it can see within Close of the target. That second creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (15) or take 13 (3d8) lightning damage. Hit or Miss: The fluxcharger takes 5 (1d10) force damage after resolving the attack.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The dagger is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the dagger must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the dagger remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal dagger.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fear Frenzy
entries.description: The horror has advantage on attack rolls against frightened creatures.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the horror has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Frightening Screech (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The horror screeches. Each creature within Close of it that can hear it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened of it for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the horror's Frightening Screech for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Familiar
entries.description: With the DM's permission, the find familiar spell can summon a flying monkey.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The flying monkey has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the monkey's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the rocking horse is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the rocking horse move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the rocking horse is animate.

entries.name: Flying Mount
entries.description: The rocking horse can serve as a mount for a Medium or smaller creature and can fly only while mounted.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The rocking horse doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it regains no hit points or Hit Dice at the end of a long rest.

entries.name: Head Butt
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.
