entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The shield is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the shield must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the shield remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal shield.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The snake doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The staff is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the staff must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the staff remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal staff.

entries.name: Knife
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The trident is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the trident must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the trident remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal trident.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The wand is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the wand must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the wand remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal wand.

entries.name: Magic Missile
entries.description: The wand shoots a dart of magical force at one creature that it can detect within Far of it. The target takes 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage as the dart hits it unerringly.

entries.name: Increased Carrying Capacity
entries.description: The wonder can carry up to 100 pounds.

entries.name: Wind-Up Operation
entries.description: The wonder has the Unconscious condition until another creature winds it with the wonder's unique key for 1 minute. Once wound, the wonder operates for 24 hours or until a creature touches the wonder with its key as a Utilize action to deactivate it, after which the wonder has the Unconscious condition until it is wound again.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fomorian makes two Stone Club attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Warping Hex if available.

entries.name: Stone Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Warping Hex (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (16), one creature the fomorian can see within Very Far. Failure: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage, and the target gains 1 Exhaustion level. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Contortionist
entries.description: The fomorian can enter a space large enough for a Large creature without squeezing.

entries.name: Crawling Stance
entries.description: While the fomorian has the prone condition, crawling does not cost it extra movement. In addition, the prone condition does not grant advantage on attack rolls against the fomorian.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The fomorian can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fomorian makes two Slam attacks and uses Crawling Hex if it is available.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Crawling Hex (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The fomorian targets one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 31 (7d8) psychic damage, have the prone condition, and become cursed for 1 hour. While cursed this way, the target can't stand up and end the prone condition on itself.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fomorian makes three Rod attacks.

entries.name: Rod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The fomorian casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: mage armor (self only), mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: chain lightning, cone of cold (6th-level version), fireball (6th-level version), fly, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Blood Rune
entries.description: The fomorian has a blood rune inscribed on an effigy or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Corrupting Hex action and Poisoning Rebuke reaction.The object bearing the blood rune has AC 15; 30 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the fomorian dies. If the rune is destroyed, the fomorian can inscribe a blood rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the fomorian's darkvision.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the fomorian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fomorian makes three Greatclub attacks. If the fomorian has its blood rune, it can replace one of these attacks with a use of Corrupting Hex.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Corrupting Hex (Requires Blood Rune)
entries.description: The fomorian targets one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or take 27 (6d8) necrotic damage and become cursed for 24 hours. While cursed this way, the target's speed is reduced by half, and if it tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a Difficulty (16) Intelligence check or the spell fails and is wasted.

entries.name: Eldritch Burst
entries.description: Magical energy explodes in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the fomorian can see within Very Far of itself. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 32 (5d12) force damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The fomorian casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: detect magic, levitate, mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: detect thoughts, suggestion, telekinesis

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gargoyle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes four sword attacks.

entries.name: Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll attacks five times, once with its bite and four times with its claws. If two or more claws hit the same target, the troll rends the target, dealing an extra 2d6 slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: The fox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Relative Density
entries.description: The fractal can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Quantum Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage, or 6 (2d4 + 1) force damage if the fractal is Medium or bigger.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The law bender makes three Arcane Burst attacks and uses Power of Authority or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Power of Authority
entries.description: The law bender targets a creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (16) or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the incapacitated condition on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw becomes immune to this law bender's Power of Authority for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The law bender casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: dispel magic, fly, mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Fraz-Urb'luu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Fraz-Urb'luu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Undetectable
entries.description: Fraz-Urb'luu can't be targeted by divination magic, perceived through magical scrying sensors, or detected by abilities that sense demons or Fiends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Fraz-Urb'luu makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks, and he uses Phantasmal Terror.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d6 + 9) force damage.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) force damage.

entries.name: Phantasmal Terror
entries.description: Fraz-Urb'luu targets one creature he can see within Very Far of him. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (23), or it takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage and is frightened of Fraz-Urb'luu until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Fraz-Urb'luu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, dispel magic, phantasmal force3/day each: mislead, programmed illusion, seeming1/day each: modify memory, project image

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The frog can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The frog's Long Jump is up to Very Close and its High Jump is up to Very Close with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries.description: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The froghemoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks, and it can use Tongue.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 20 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the froghemoth. If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Very Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

entries.name: Tongue
entries.description: The froghemoth targets one Medium or smaller creature that it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Strength Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within Very Close of the froghemoth.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The froghemoth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the froghemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries.description: If the froghemoth takes lightning damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The froghemoth makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks, and it can use Tongue.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) piercing damage, and the target is swallowed if it is a Medium or smaller creature. A swallowed creature has the blinded and restrained conditions, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the froghemoth, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage at the start of each of the froghemoth's turns.The froghemoth's gullet can hold up to three creatures at a time. If the froghemoth takes 25 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the froghemoth must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which lands in a space within Very Close of the froghemoth and has the prone condition. If the froghemoth dies, any swallowed creatures are no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Very Close of movement, exiting with the prone condition.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (20)). Until this grapple ends, the froghemoth can't use this tentacle on another target. The froghemoth has four tentacles.

entries.name: Tongue
entries.description: The froghemoth targets one Large or smaller creature that it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Strength Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within Very Close of the froghemoth.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The medic is a 3rd-level Boros spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (11)). The medic has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mending, resistance, spare the dying1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, sanctuary2nd level (2 slots): aid, lesser restoration

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: The druid is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14); +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, guidance, resistance1st level (4 slots): animal friendship, fog cloud, speak with animals2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, moonbeam, pass without trace3rd level (3 slots): conjure animals, sleet storm, wind wall4th level (3 slots): hallucinatory terrain, ice storm5th level (1 slot): awaken

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The druid makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Ice Sickle (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage plus 5 (2d4) cold damage.

entries.name: Maul (Beast Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The druid magically polymorphs into a beast form—fox, mountain goat, owl, or wolf—or back into its humanoid form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the beast form (the druid's choice). It reverts to its humanoid form when it dies. The druid's statistics are the same in each form, except where noted in this stat block.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Frost Axe or Great Bow in any combination.

entries.name: Frost Axe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Cold damage.

entries.name: Great Bow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Very Far. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Cold damage, and the target's Speed decreases by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Extra Heads
entries.description: The giant has a 25 percent chance of having more than one head. If it has more than one, it has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The giant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the giant takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The giant dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Greataxe or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) slashing damage, or 30 (3d12 + 11) slashing damage while raging.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Frost Rune
entries.description: The giant has a frost rune inscribed on a chunk of ice or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Ice Wolves action and Ice Armor reaction.The object bearing the rune has AC 16; 40 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a frost rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three attacks using Greataxe, Freezing Ray, or a combination of them.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Freezing Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) cold damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the target has the restrained condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Ice Wolves (Requires Frost Rune)
entries.description: The giant magically summons 1d4 wolves made of ice (use the winter wolf stat block in the Monster Manual to represent them, but they are Elementals instead of Monstrosities). The wolves appear in unoccupied spaces the giant can see within Close of itself. The wolves take their turn immediately after the giant on the same initiative count, and they obey the giant's commands. The wolves gain a +6 bonus to their attack and damage rolls while they are within Close of the giant. The wolves disappear after 1 minute, when the giant dies, or when the giant uses this action again.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skeleton makes two greataxe attacks.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Freezing Stare
entries.description: The skeleton targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or take 35 (10d6) cold damage and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Numbing Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the zombie must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17). Unless the save succeeds, the creature can't make more than one attack, or take a bonus action on that turn.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is fire, radiant, or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zombie makes two weapon attacks.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Hurl Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Freezing Stare
entries.description: The zombie targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or take 35 (10d6) cold damage and be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Battleaxe attacks and one Harpoon attack.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage, or 22 (3d10 + 6) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Harpoon
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). While the target is grappled this way, its speed isn't reduced, but it can't move farther from the giant. The target takes 5 (1d10) slashing damage if it escapes from the grapple or if it tries and fails. The giant can grapple only one target at a time with its harpoon.

entries.name: Burning Fury
entries.description: When the salamander takes fire damage, its Freezing Breath automatically recharges.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The salamander makes one Bite attack and four Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Freezing Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The salamander exhales chill wind in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17), taking 44 (8d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the worm dies, it explodes in a burst of frigid energy. Each creature within Far of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (20), taking 28 (8d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures inside the worm when it dies automatically fail this saving throw.

entries.name: Freezing Body
entries.description: A creature that touches the worm or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 10 (3d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The worm makes two bite attacks, or uses its Trill and makes a bite attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (20) or be swallowed by the worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worm, and takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and 10 (3d6) cold damage at the start of each of the worm's turns.If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the worm.

entries.name: Trill
entries.description: The frost worm emits a haunting cry. Each creature within Far of the worm that can hear it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (20) or be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw each time it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once a creature successfully saves against this effect, or if this effect ends for it, that creature is immune to the Trill of all frost worms for the next 24 hours. Frost worms are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The frostmourn makes one Freezing Touch attack and one Icy Axe attack. It can replace one of these attacks with a Polar Ray attack.

entries.name: Freezing Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) cold damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage. If this damage would reduce the target to 0 hit points, the target drops to 1 hit point instead and has the petrified condition, turning into a frozen statue.If the statue takes bludgeoning damage, it shatters, killing the frozen creature. If the statue would take fire damage, it instead takes no damage and thaws, ending the petrification.

entries.name: Icy Axe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Polar Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 31 (5d10 + 4) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the fume drake dies, it explodes in a cloud of noxious fumes. Each creature within Very Close of the fume drake must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or take 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The fume drake doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) fire damage.

entries.name: Scalding Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The fume drake exhales a Close cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (11), taking 4 (1d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The fungal servant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: A destroyed fungal servant gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within Very Close of the fungal servant's heart.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The fungal servant is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (17), +9 to hit with spell attacks). The fungal servant has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence, spiritual weapon3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic4th level (3 slots): divination, guardian of faith5th level (2 slots): contagion, insect plague6th level (1 slot): harm

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fungal servant can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

entries.name: Rotting Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to spores. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: The fungal servant targets one creature it can see within Far of it. If the target can see the fungal servant, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) against this magic or become frightened until the end of the fungal servant's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all fungal servants for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Chilling Aura
entries.description: A creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the fury must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) or take 11 (2d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The fury has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fury makes two Fist or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage, or 17 (5d6) cold damage if the target took damage from the fury's Chilling Aura since the end of the fury's last turn.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gaj makes one Mandibles attack and uses Mind-Probing Antennae or Paralyze (if available).

entries.name: Mandibles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (11)). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage at the start of each of the gaj's turns. While it is grappling a creature, the gaj can't use its mandibles to attack other creatures.

entries.name: Mind-Probing Antennae
entries.description: The gaj targets one creature grappled by it. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, the target takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage, and the gaj magically pulls one piece of information from the target's mind that the gaj wants to know. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the gaj learns nothing.

entries.name: Paralyze (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The gaj magically targets one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Galazeth fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Galazeth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 13 (1d10 + 8) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d6 + 8) slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is knocked prone.

entries.name: Dancing Elements Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Galazeth exhales a blast of flames and ice in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (22), gaining no benefit from cover (other than total cover) and taking 38 (7d10) fire damage and 38 (7d10) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Galazeth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):1/day each: control water, gust of wind, wall of stone

entries.name: Avalanche Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the galeb duhr moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) Bludgeoning damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Animate Boulders (1/Day)
entries.description: The galeb duhr magically animates one or two boulders it can see within Far of itself. Each boulder uses the Galeb Duhr stat block, except it has Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1 and lacks this action. The boulder takes its turn immediately after the galeb duhr on the same Initiative count, and it obeys the galeb duhr. A boulder remains animate for 1 minute or until it or the galeb duhr dies.

entries.name: Divination Senses
entries.description: The gallows speaker can see Far into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The gallows speaker can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends it turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The gallows speaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Foretelling Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must roll a d4 and subtract the number rolled from the next attack roll or saving throw it makes before the start of the gallows speaker's next turn.

entries.name: Suffering Echoes
entries.description: The gallows speaker targets a creature it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage, and waves of painful memories leap from the target to up to three other creatures of the gallows speaker's choice that are within Close of the target, each of which takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Fiery End
entries.description: If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The magen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The magen makes two Shocking Touch attacks.

entries.name: Shocking Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target (the magen has advantage on the attack roll if the target is wearing armor made of metal). Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Static Discharge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The magen discharges a lightning bolt in a Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14) (with disadvantage if the creature is wearing armor made of metal), taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Galvanic Overcast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: When the blastseeker casts lightning bolt or thunderwave, it can roll a die. On an odd number, the blastseeker takes 9 (2d8) force damage. On an even number, the spell also deals 9 (2d8) lightning damage to each target that fails its saving throw.

entries.name: Gust-Propelled Leap
entries.description: The blastseeker can use a bonus action to fly up to Very Close without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Heart of the Storm
entries.description: When the blastseeker casts lightning bolt or thunderwave, all other creatures within Very Close of the blastseeker each take 3 lightning damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The blastseeker's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). The blastseeker can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components other than its Izzet gear, which doesn't function for others:3/day each: levitate, lightning bolt, thunderwave1/day: stoneskin

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the galvanice weird dies, it explodes in a burst of ice and lightning. Each creature within Very Close of the exploding weird must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 7 (2d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or lose the ability to use reactions until the start of the weird's next turn.

entries.name: Weird Aura
entries.description: At the start of each of the gargantua's turns, each creature of the gargantua's choice within Close of it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, a target sees the gargantua as a manifestation of the target's worst fears; it takes 17 (5d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the start of the target's next turn. On a successful save, a target is immune to this gargantua's Weird Aura for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gargantua makes two Slam or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Damage Transfer
entries.description: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the rug remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

entries.name: Smother
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The creature is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and at risk of suffocating, and the rug can't smother another target. In addition, at the start of each of the target's turns, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The gargoyle doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gargoyle makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The gas spore bursts when it dies. Finesse Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Close Emanation originating from the gas spore. Failure: The target takes 10 (3d6) Poison damage and has the Poisoned condition for 1d12 hours. Unless the Poisoned condition is removed, the target dies at the end of that time and sprouts 2d4 Tiny Gas Spore Fungi (each with 1 Hit Point). After 2d6 days, they become Large and have 13 Hit Points.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +0, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the gauth dies, the magical energy within it explodes, and each creature within Very Close of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 13 (3d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Stunning Gaze
entries.description: When a creature that can see the gauth's central eye starts its turn within Close of the gauth, the gauth can force it to make a Presence Reaction Roll (14) if the gauth isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save is stunned until the start of its next turn.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes at the start of its turn to avoid the saving throw. If the creature does so, it can't see the gauth until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the gauth in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The gauth shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (roll three d6s, and reroll duplicates), targeting one to three creatures it can see within Very Far of it:1: Devour Magic Ray. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or have one of its magic items lose all magical properties until the start of the gauth's next turn. If the object is a charged item, it also loses 1d4 charges. Determine the affected item randomly, ignoring single-use items such as potions and scrolls.2: Enervation Ray. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.3: Fire Ray. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 22 (4d10) fire damage.4: Paralyzing Ray. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5: Pushing Ray. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be pushed up to Close away from the gauth and have its speed halved until the start of the gauth's next turn.6: Sleep Ray. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on Constructs and Undead.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The gazer can mimic simple sounds of speech it has heard, in any language. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The gazer shoots two of the following magical eye rays at random (roll two d4s, and reroll duplicates), choosing one or two targets it can see within Far of it:1: Dazing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be charmed until the start of the gazer's next turn. While the target is charmed in this way, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls.2: Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be frightened until the start of the gazer's next turn.3: Frost Ray. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (12) or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.4: Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature that is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or be moved up to Close directly away from the gazer. If the target is a Tiny object that isn't being worn or carried, the gazer moves it up to Close in any direction. The gazer can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a container.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The gearkeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Rapid Shifting
entries.description: Opportunity attacks made against the gearkeeper have disadvantage.

entries.name: Whirling Blades
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the gearkeeper takes 4 (1d8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gearkeeper makes two Arm Blade attacks, or one Arm Blade attack and one Spear Launcher attack.

entries.name: Arm Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spear Launcher
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Shrapnel Blast (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The gearkeeper jettisons a spray of jagged metal in a Close cone. Each creature in the area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Ooze Cube
entries.description: The cube fills its entire space and is transparent. Other creatures can enter that space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has Disadvantage on the saving throw.Creatures inside the cube have Total Cover, and the cube can hold one Large creature or up to four Medium or Small creatures inside itself at a time.As an action, a creature within Very Close of the cube can pull a creature or an object out of the cube by succeeding on a Difficulty (12) Strength (Athletics) check, and the puller takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage.

entries.name: Transparent
entries.description: Even when the cube is in plain sight, a creature must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Perception) check to notice the cube if the creature hasn't witnessed the cube move or otherwise act.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) Acid damage.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: The cube moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. The cube can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures if it has room inside itself to contain them (see the Ooze Cube trait). Agility Reaction Roll (12), each creature whose space the cube enters for the first time during this move. Failure: 10 (3d6) Acid damage, and the target is engulfed. An engulfed target is suffocating, can't cast spells with a Verbal component, has the Restrained condition, and takes 10 (3d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed target moves with it. An engulfed target can try to escape by taking an action to make a Difficulty (12) Strength (Athletics) check. On a successful check, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space. Success: Half damage, and the target moves to an unoccupied space within Very Close of the cube. If there is no unoccupied space, the target fails the save instead.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The gem stalker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The gem stalker doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gem stalker makes four Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Geryon fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Geryon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Geryon regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Geryon dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Geryon makes one Claw attack and one Stinger attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) cold damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (Difficulty (24)), and it is restrained until the grapple ends. Geryon can grapple one creature at a time. If the target is already grappled by Geryon, the target takes an extra 27 (6d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Geryon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21)):At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, ice storm, invisibility (self only), locate object, suggestion, wall of ice1/day: banishment

entries.name: Stinger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 14 (2d4 + 9) force damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) or take 13 (2d12) poison damage and become poisoned until it finishes a short or long rest. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the poison damage taken. This reduction lasts until the poisoned condition is removed. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Geryon teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied space he can see.

entries.name: Hustle
entries.description: The troubleshooter can move through the space of any creature that is of a larger size, but it can't stop there.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troubleshooter makes two Poisoned Dagger attacks.

entries.name: Poisoned Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the troubleshooter's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The troubleshooter casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):1/day each: Sleep, Unseen Servant

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (10), any creature that starts its turn in a Very Close Emanation originating from the ghast. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a non-Undead creature, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (10). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), any creature that starts its turn in a Very Close Emanation originating from the ghast. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghast makes two Horrific Necrosis attacks. It can replace one attack with a Claw attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target isn't an Undead, it has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Horrific Necrosis
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ghast casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: Speak with Dead, Thaumaturgy

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries.description: The ghost can see Far into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghost makes two Withering Touch attacks.

entries.name: Etherealness
entries.description: The ghost casts the Etherealness spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The ghost is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Horrific Visage
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Far Cone that can see the ghost and isn't an Undead. Failure: 10 (2d6 + 3) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the ghost's next turn. Success: The target is immune to this ghost's Horrific Visage for 24 hours.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), one Humanoid the ghost can see within Very Close. Failure: The target is possessed by the ghost; the ghost disappears, and the target has the Incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The ghost's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the ghost leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours. Success: The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The ghost dragon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the ghost dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The ghost dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghost dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 32 (6d8 + 5) cold damage, and the target's speed is halved until the start of the dragon's next turn.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Terrifying Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The ghost dragon exhales shadowy mist in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, the creature takes 40 (9d8) cold damage and is frightened of the ghost dragon for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened.While frightened of the ghost dragon, a creature is paralyzed. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this ghost dragon's Terrifying Breath for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Blurred Form
entries.description: Attack rolls against the eidolon are made with disadvantage unless the eidolon is incapacitated.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The eidolon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The eidolon has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eidolon makes two ghostblade attacks.

entries.name: Ghostblade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) force damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghoul makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage. If the target is a creature that isn't an Undead or elf, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (10). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ape makes two Fist attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Boulder Toss (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The ape hurls a boulder at a point it can see within Far. Agility Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Very Close-radius Sphere centered on that point. Failure: 24 (7d6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The axe beak makes one Sharpened Beak attack and one Talons attack.

entries.name: Sharpened Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) Slashing damage, and a creature within Very Close of the target (axe beak's choice) takes 6 (1d12) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Bloodied Fury
entries.description: The boar has Advantage on melee attack rolls while it is Bloodied.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the boar moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Peck
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the centipede's next turn.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The snake makes one Bite attack and uses Constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (14), one Large or smaller creature the snake can see within Very Close. Failure: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)).

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be stunned until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the target begins to hallucinate and is afflicted with a short-term madness effect (determined randomly or by the DM; see "Madness" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide). The effect lasts 10 minutes.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The rat explodes when it dies. Constitution Saving Throw Difficulty (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the rat. Failure: 5 (2d4) Acid damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, Reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) Acid damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (11)) from one of two claws.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The giant crayfish can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant crayfish makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). The crayfish has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The crocodile can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The crocodile makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)). While Grappled, the target has the Restrained condition and can't be targeted by the crocodile's Tail.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Drone
entries.description: When it beats its wings, the dragonfly emits a loud droning sound that can be heard out to a range of Very Far.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eagle makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) Radiant damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and the elk moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) Bludgeoning damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The beetle sheds Bright Light in a Very Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Very Close.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +1, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Fire damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a Difficulty (12) Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gargoyle makes five attacks: one with its bite and four with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The frog can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The frog's Long Jump is up to Close and its High Jump is up to Very Close with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (11)).

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The frog swallows a Small or smaller target it is grappling. While swallowed, the target isn't Grappled but has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and it has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog. While swallowing the target, the frog can't use Bite, and if the frog dies, the swallowed target is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse using Very Close of movement, exiting with the Prone condition.At the end of the frog's next turn, the swallowed target takes 5 (2d4) Acid damage. If that damage doesn't kill it, the frog disgorges it, causing it to exit Prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the goat moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) Bludgeoning damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goose makes one Beak attack and two Wing attacks.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Wing
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Thunderous Honk (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The goose honks with ear-splitting volume. Each other creature within Close of the goose must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, a creature takes 16 (3d10) thunder damage and has the deafened condition until the start of the goose's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The honk can be heard within Very Far.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The toad can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Cold Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the toad takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The toad's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the toad can't bite another target.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature the toad is grappling. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the toad, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and 11 (2d10) cold damage at the start of each of the toad's turns. The toad can have only one target swallowed at a time.If the toad dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Very Close of movement, exiting prone.

name: Giant Insect

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The insect can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The insect makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Poison Jab
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + the spell's level Piercing damage plus 1d4 Poison damage.

entries.name: Web Bolt (Spider Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range Far. Hit: 1d10 + 3 + the spell's level Bludgeoning damage, and the target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the start of the insect's next turn.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The eel can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eel makes two bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Jolt (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: One creature the eel touches within Very Close of it outside water, or each creature within Close of it in a body of water, must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12). On failed save, a target takes 13 (3d8) lightning damage. If the target takes any of this damage, the target is stunned until the end of the eel's next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Lynx's Sight (1/Day)
entries.description: The lynx can cast clairvoyance, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Woodland Camouflage
entries.description: The lynx has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in undergrowth or snowy terrain.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage. If the lynx moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the lynx can make another Claws attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (15)). The drow can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: dancing lights1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The drow has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
