entries.name: Psi Strike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The githzerai casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Mage Hand (the hand is Invisible)1/day each: Phantasmal Killer (level 6 version), Plane Shift, See Invisibility

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the glabrezu dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The glabrezu has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The glabrezu makes two Pincer attacks and uses Pummel or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Pincer
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)) from one of two pincers.

entries.name: Pummel
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (17), one creature Grappled by the glabrezu. Failure: 15 (3d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The glabrezu casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Darkness, Detect Magic, Dispel Magic1/day each: Confusion, Fly, Power Word Stun

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gladiator makes three Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Shield Bash.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (15), one creature within Very Close that the gladiator can see. Failure: 9 (2d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the golem is embedded in a window and motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the golem move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the golem is animate.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The golem regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the golem takes bludgeoning or thunder damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the golem's next turn. The golem is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two Glass Sword attacks.

entries.name: Glass Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Death Link
entries.description: If its specter rider is reduced to 0 hit points, the gloamwing is destroyed.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The gloamwing doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the gloamwing has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gloamwing makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shadowstep
entries.description: As a bonus action, the gloomstalker can teleport up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the gloomstalker has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gloomstalker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Snatch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (17)). While grappled in this way, the target is restrained.

entries.name: Shriek (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The gloomstalker emits a terrible shriek. Each enemy within Far of the gloomstalker that can hear it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be paralyzed until the end of the enemy's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gnoll makes two Abyssal Strike attacks.

entries.name: Abyssal Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) Poison damage.

entries.name: Hunger of Yeenoghu (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The gnoll conjures a Close Cube of magical Darkness originating from a point it can see within Far, which lasts for 1 minute or until the gnoll's Concentration ends on it. This area is Difficult Terrain. Agility Reaction Roll (14), any creature that starts its turn in this area or enters it for the first time on a turn. Failure: 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage, and the gnoll or a creature of its choice it can see gains 10 Temporary Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gnoll makes one Bite attack and two Bone Flail attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the gnoll's next turn.

entries.name: Bone Flail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gnoll makes one Bite attack and two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Sudden Rush
entries.description: Until the end of the turn, the gnoll's speed increases by Far and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gnoll makes two Bite, Spear, or Longbow attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gnoll makes two attacks, using Bone Whip or Bone Javelin in any combination, and it uses Incite Rampage if available.

entries.name: Bone Whip
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Bone Javelin
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Incite Rampage (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The gnoll targets another creature it can see within Far of itself that has the Rampage Bonus Action. The target can take a Reaction to make one melee attack.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: If the vampire isn't in sunlight, it can use its action to polymorph into a Large hyena or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.While in hyena form, the vampire can't speak, and its walking speed is Far. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. it is weightless, has a flying speed of Close, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The vampire has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Rampage
entries.description: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the vampire can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The vampire doesn't require air.

entries.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries.description: The vampire has the following flaws:Enraged by Celestial. If it hears words of Celestial spoken, the vampire must try to attack the source of those spoken words on its next turn. If these words come from multiple sources and from opposite directions, the vampire is restrained. Otherwise, it moves to attack what it perceives to be the closest source.Repulsed by Perfume. The vampire has disadvantage on melee attack rolls made against any creature wearing perfume or carrying an open container of it.Stake to the Heart. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: The vampire makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Claws (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Frightful Cackle (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: The vampire emits a bone-chilling cackle. Each creature of the vampire's choice that is within Very Far of the vampire and can hear its cackle must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the vampire's Frightful Cackle for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Sickening Gaze (Hyena or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within Close of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) against this magic or be poisoned for 24 hours. A creature whose saving throw is successful is immune to this vampire's Sickening Gaze for 24 hours.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Bone Bow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +3, range Very Far. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The witherling doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The witherling makes two Bite or Spiked Club attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spiked Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The ceremorph's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (15)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ceremorph has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (9)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the ceremorph. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ceremorph kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Laser Pistol
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) radiant damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The ceremorph magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The squidling's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (7)). It can innately cast levitate at will, requiring no components.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The squidling has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (2d4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (7)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (7) or be stunned until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated creature grappled by the squidling. Hit: 27 (5d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the squidling kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Tickle (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The squidling magically emits psychic energy in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (7) or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Bludgeoning damage, or 2 (1d4) Bludgeoning damage if the goat moved 20+ feet straight toward the target immediately before the hit.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goblin makes two attacks, using Scimitar or Shortbow in any combination.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Slashing damage, plus 2 (1d4) Slashing damage if the attack roll had Advantage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage, plus 2 (1d4) Piercing damage if the attack roll had Advantage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goblin makes two attacks with its scimitar. The second attack has disadvantage.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far/Out of Range, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin commoner can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The goblin can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goblin makes two Hex Stick attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Hex Stick
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The goblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Minor Illusion1/day each: Blindness/Deafness, Faerie Fire, Grease

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Mental Burst
entries.description: When the goblin dies, its pent-up mental energy explodes in a psychic blast. Each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (13) or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The goblin has advantage on saving throws against effects that would make it have the charmed or frightened condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goblin makes two Unarmed Strike attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mental Burst
entries.description: When the goblin dies, its pent-up mental energy explodes in a psychic blast. Each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (13) or take 10 (4d4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The goblin has advantage on saving throws against effects that would make it have the charmed or frightened conditions.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goblin makes three Psychic Blade attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) psychic damage, and the target must subtract 1d4 from the next attack roll or saving throw it makes before the end of the goblin's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The goblin casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible), minor illusion1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, telekinesis

entries.name: Synaptic Rend (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The goblin unleashes a Close-radius sphere of psychic energy, centered on a point the goblin can see within Far of itself. Each creature in that area must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of the goblin's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Slashing damage, plus 2 (1d4) Slashing damage if the attack roll had Advantage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage, plus 2 (1d4) Piercing damage if the attack roll had Advantage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 22 (4d10) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Weakening Breath
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (13), each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a Close Cone. Failure: The target has Disadvantage on Strength-based D20 Tests and subtracts 2 (1d4) from its damage rolls. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

name: Gold Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:Elemental Breath. The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 84 (13d12) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Sapping Breath. The greatwyrm exhales gas in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

original_cr: 28 (XP 120,000, or 240,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the sentinel moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Spell Turning
entries.description: The sentinel has advantage on saving throws against any spell that targets only the sentinel (not an area). If the sentinel's saving throw succeeds and the spell is of 4th level or lower, the spell has no effect on the sentinel and instead targets the caster.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sentinel makes two ram attacks.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The sentinel exhales fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 27 (6d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the elk moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one prone creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The shaman has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shaman is an 8th-level Golgari spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The shaman has the following druid spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): poison spray, shillelagh, thorn whip1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, entangle, ray of sickness2nd level (3 slots): pass without trace, ray of enfeeblement, spike growth3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, dispel magic, plant growth4th level (2 slots): blight, giant insect

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Fungal Rot
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 18 (4d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goliath makes two Spear attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries.description: The goliath is acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,Melee.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries.description: The goliath counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goliath makes two attacks with its greataxe or hurls two javelins.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The werebear can use its action to polymorph into a Large bear-humanoid hybrid or into a Large polar bear, or back into its goliath form. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The werebear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Mountain Born
entries.description: The werebear is acclimated to high altitude, including elevations above 20,Melee.

entries.name: Powerful Build (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: The werebear counts as one size larger when determining its carrying capacity and the weight it can push, drag, or lift.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The werebear makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be cursed with werebear lycanthropy, as described in the Monster Manual.

entries.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the gorgon moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close Cone. First Failure: The target has the Restrained condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success. Second Failure: The target has the Petrified condition instead of the Restrained condition.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the goristro dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The goristro has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The goristro deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The goristro makes one Brutal Gore attack and two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Brutal Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Very Close. Hit: 40 (6d10 + 7) Piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is pushed up to Close straight away from the goristro and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Very Close. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries.description: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within Very Close of the troglodyte must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troglodyte makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its longsword.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The juggernaut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The juggernaut deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the revenant dies, it revives 24 hours later unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another group of corpses elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The revenant makes two Suffocate attacks.

entries.name: Suffocate
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target is suffocating. The revenant can have up to two targets Grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Haunting Glare (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close Emanation originating from the revenant. Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: Nonmagical ammunition is destroyed immediately after hitting the ooze and dealing any damage. Any nonmagical weapon takes a cumulative -1 penalty to attack rolls immediately after dealing damage to the ooze and coming into contact with it. The weapon is destroyed if the penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the weapon.The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal or wood in 1 round.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) Acid damage. Nonmagical armor worn by the target takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the armor.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: Whenever a creature hits the ooze with a melee attack, that creature takes 2 Acid damage.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) Acid damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The gray render makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, plus 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage if the target is prone.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The scavver doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature that is missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The slaad makes two Chaos Claw attacks.

entries.name: Chaos Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Necrotic damage. Until the start of the slaad's next turn, the target has a condition determined by rolling 1d4: on a 1, Charmed; on a 2, Frightened; on a 3, Poisoned; or on a 4, Incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The slaad casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Invisibility (self only), Mage Hand, Major Image1/day each: Cloudkill, Fly, Plane Shift (self only), Tongues

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Graz'zt fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Graz'zt has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Graz'zt makes two Wave of Sorrow attacks. He can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Graz'zt casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: charm person, detect magic, dispel magic3/day each: darkness, dominate person, telekinesis, teleport1/day each: dominate monster, greater invisibility

entries.name: Wave of Sorrow (Greatsword)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) force damage plus 14 (4d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Graz'zt teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied space he can see.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the dragon can't bite a different target.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Cataclysmic Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a wave of ghostly purple flames in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 45 (10d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the breath reduces it to 0 hit points. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by the breath's damage, as well as every corpse of such a creature within the cone, becomes a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the dragon's control. The zombie acts on the dragon's initiative but immediately after the dragon's turn. Absent any other command, the zombie tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the emissary fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The emissary doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The emissary makes three attacks.

entries.name: Lashing Maw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Psychic Orb
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Unearthly Bile (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The emissary expels bile that splashes all creatures in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point within Very Far of the emissary. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (23), taking 55 (10d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each creature that fails the saving throw, a gibbering mouther (see its entry in the Monster Manual) appears in an unoccupied space on a surface that can support it within Close of that creature. The gibbering mouthers act right after the emissary on the same initiative count, gaining a +7 bonus to their attack and damage rolls, and fighting until they are destroyed. They disappear when the emissary dies.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The zombie has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zombie makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Empowered Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abishai makes two Fiendish Claw attacks, or it makes one Fiendish Claw attack and uses Spellcasting.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or take 16 (3d10) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Coven Magic
entries.description: While within Close of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hag makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Dancing Lights, Disguise Self (24-hour duration), Invisibility (self only, and the hag leaves no tracks while Invisible), Minor Illusion, Ray of Sickness (level 3 version)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration

entries.name: Abduct
entries.description: The grell needn't spend extra movement to move a creature it is grappling.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The grell makes one Beak attack and one Paralyzing Tentacles attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)) from two of ten tentacles. The target is also subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (11). Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While Poisoned, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The grell psychic makes one Tentacle attack and one Beak attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (3d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The grell psychic casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: detect thoughts, mage armor, mage hand (the hand is invisible)1/day each: confusion, fear

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. While the target is poisoned, it also has the paralyzed condition. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The target also has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). While grappling the target, the grell can't make Tentacle attacks against other targets. When the grell moves, any Medium or smaller target it is grappling moves with it.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries.description: Gremorly can see Far into the Ethereal Plane when he is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: Gremorly can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. He takes 5 (1d10) force damage if he ends his turn inside an object.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Gremorly fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Gremorly makes three Withering Strike attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Gremorly casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Dancing Lights, Mage Hand, Prestidigitation2/day each: Bestow Curse, Dispel Magic1/day: Slow

entries.name: Withering Strike
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d12) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fell Necromancy
entries.description: Gremorly targets one creature he can see within Far of himself. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 61 (7d8 + 30) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, Gremorly regains 9 (2d8) hit points.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: One Humanoid Gremorly can see within Very Close of himself must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be possessed by him; Gremorly disappears, and the target has the incapacitated condition and loses control of its body. Gremorly can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn Undead, and he retains his alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to the charmed and frightened conditions. He otherwise uses the target's game statistics, but Gremorly doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the target drops to 0 hit points, Gremorly ends it as a bonus action, or Gremorly is turned or forced out by an effect like the Dispel Evil and Good spell. When the possession ends, Gremorly reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the target. The target is immune to this Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The grick makes one Beak attack and one Tentacles attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)) from all four tentacles.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The grick makes one Beak attack, one Slam attack, and one Tentacles attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from all four tentacles.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The griffon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from both of the griffon's front claws.

entries.name: Lance
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit (with disadvantage against a target within Very Close), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) piercing damage, or 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage while mounted.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Feather Fall
entries.description: The rider wears a magic ring with which it can cast the feather fall spell on itself once as a reaction to falling. After the spell is cast, the ring becomes nonmagical.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes four Blazing Morningstar attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Blade Storm, if available.

entries.name: Blazing Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Blade Storm (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The champion conjures a churning storm of spectral blades that fills a Close cube centered on a point it can see within Very Far of itself. The storm lasts until the start of the champion's next turn. While the storm is active, the area of the storm is difficult terrain. Whenever a creature enters the storm for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19), taking 27 (6d8) slashing damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes two Leeching Blade attacks and uses Hollow Void.

entries.name: Leeching Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 33 (6d10) cold damage, and the champion regains 10 hit points.

entries.name: Hollow Void
entries.description: The champion summons a hungering rift around a creature it can see within Very Far of itself. The creature must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (22). On a failed save, the creature takes 49 (11d8) force damage and has the stunned condition until the start of the champion's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, the creature dies, and its body crumbles to dust.

entries.name: Halo of Pestilence
entries.description: The champion is surrounded by an aura of deadly magic that takes the form of a host of glowing white insects. Each creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the champion must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or have the incapacitated condition until the start of its next turn, as the insects ravage its body.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes two Blight Staff attacks, two Plague Bolt attacks, or one of each.

entries.name: Blight Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Plague Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) poison damage, and the target has the poisoned condition until the start of the champion's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The champion casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Detect Magic, Mage Armor (self only)2/day each: Blight, Blindness/Deafness1/day each: Cloudkill, Contagion

entries.name: Bone Cudgel
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The grinning cat has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage. If the grinning cat was invisible before it attacked, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the cat can make a Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Fade Away
entries.description: The grinning cat magically becomes invisible for 1 hour or until it attacks, gradually fading away over the course of its turn. It can choose to leave part of its body visible, such as its tail, its head, or its grinning mouth. Any equipment the cat wears or carries is invisible with it.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The grippli can hold its breath for 20 minutes.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The grippli can leap Close horizontally or Close vertically from a standing position.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The grippli makes one attack with its tongue. If this attack hits, the grippli can make a melee attack using its trident against the same target.

entries.name: Tongue
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the grippli can't grab another creature.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage if the grippli had advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the groff is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the groff move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the groff isn't an ordinary moss-covered bog patch.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The groff can hold its breath for up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The groff makes one Bite attack and one Swamp Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Swamp Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or become engulfed by the groff. While engulfed, the target can't breathe, is restrained, and takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. When the groff moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The groff can have only one target engulfed at a time.An engulfed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns. On a success, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The grung can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries.description: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The grung's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries.description: If the grung isn't immersed in water for at least 1 hour during a day, it suffers 1 level of exhaustion at the end of that day. The grung can recover from this exhaustion only through magic or by immersing itself in water for at least 1 hour.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

entries.name: Amphibious

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries.description: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

entries.name: Mesmerizing Chirr (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The grung makes a chirring noise to which grungs are immune. Each Humanoid or Beast that is within Close of the grung and able to hear it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be stunned until the end of the grung's next turn.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The grung can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries.description: Any creature that grapples the grung or otherwise comes into direct contact with the grung's skin must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with the grung can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.description: The grung's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Water Dependency

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The grung casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: druidcraft3/day each: cure wounds, spike growth2/day: plant growth

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guard makes two attacks, using Javelin or Longsword in any combination.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guard drake makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries.description: The giant can't be surprised.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three spear attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage, or 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Celestial Restoration
entries.description: If the naga dies, it returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its Hit Points unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The naga makes two Bite attacks. It can replace any attack with a use of Poisonous Spittle.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) Piercing damage plus 22 (4d10) Poison damage.

entries.name: Poisonous Spittle
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (16), one creature the naga can see within Far. Failure: 31 (7d8) Poison damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the start of the naga's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Thaumaturgy1/day each: Clairvoyance, Cure Wounds (level 6 version), Flame Strike (level 6 version), Geas, True Seeing

entries.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries.description: The portrait is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the portrait must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or become unconscious for 1 minute.

entries.name: Constructed Nature
entries.description: An animated object doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.The magic that animates an object is dispelled when the construct drops to 0 hit points. An animated object reduced to 0 hit points becomes inanimate and is too damaged to be of much use or value to anyone.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the figure in the portrait remains motionless, the portrait is indistinguishable from a normal painting.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The portrait's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12)). The portrait can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: counterspell, crown of madness, hypnotic pattern, telekinesis

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wolf makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against the frightened condition.

entries.name: Lightning Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Handaxe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blight Seeds
entries.description: When it finishes a Long Rest, the blight expels 1d6 seeds into unoccupied spaces on the ground within Close of itself. After 24 hours, the seeds become creatures under the blight's control. Roll 1d8 for each seed to determine the creature it becomes: on 1-4, Twig Blight; on 5-6, Needle Blight; on 7-8, Vine Blight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blight makes two attacks, using Slam or Thorn Volley in any combination. It also uses Life-Draining Root.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Thorn Volley
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +12, range Far. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Life-Draining Root
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (20), one Huge or smaller creature the blight can see within Close. Failure: 14 (2d6 + 7) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)) from one of six roots. Until the grapple ends, the target has the Restrained condition and takes 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the blight regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: If it isn't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, the hadozee can extend its skin membranes to move up to Very Close horizontally for every Melee it descends in the air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hadozee makes two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Musket
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: If it isn't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, the hadozee can extend its skin membranes to move up to Very Close horizontally for every Melee it descends in the air.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: If it isn't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, the hadozee can extend its skin membranes to move up to Very Close horizontally for every Melee it descends in the air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hadozee makes two Shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

name: Hag of the Fetid Gaze

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The hag's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (12)). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: dancing lights, minor illusion, vicious mockery

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The hag can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Shared Spellcasting (Coven Only)
entries.description: While all three members of a hag coven are within Close of one another, they can each cast the following spells from the wizard's spell list but must share the spell slots among themselves:1st level (4 slots): charm person, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): alter self, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, glyph of warding, slow4th level (3 slots): blight, polymorph5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming6th level (1 slot): Otto's irresistible danceFor casting these spells, each hag is a 12th-level spellcaster that uses Intelligence as her spellcasting ability. The spell save DC is 12 + the hag's Intelligence modifier, and the spell attack bonus is 4 + the hag's Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Illusory Appearance
entries.description: The hag covers herself and anything she is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes her look like another creature of her general size and humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if she dies.The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching her would feel her rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a Difficulty (20) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

entries.name: Invisible Passage
entries.description: The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

original_cr: 3 (XP 700, or 1,800 when part of a coven; PB +2)

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The haint doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The haint makes two Sorrowful Touch attacks.

entries.name: Sorrowful Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The haint magically assumes the appearance of the Humanoid it was in life, while retaining its game statistics. The assumed appearance ends if the haint is reduced to 0 hit points or uses an action to end it.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The Halaster horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spell Immunity
entries.description: The Halaster horror is immune to the cone of cold, disintegrate, and fireball spells.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Halaster horror makes two staff attacks.

entries.name: Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The half-dragon has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the half-dragon hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The half-dragon makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close and range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The half-dragon exhales lightning in a Close line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Draconic Origin
entries.description: The half-dragon is related to a type of dragon associated with one of the following damage types (DM's choice): Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Poison. This choice affects other aspects of the stat block.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The half-dragon makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) damage of the type chosen for the Draconic Origin trait.

entries.name: Dragon's Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (14), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 28 (8d6) damage of the type chosen for the Draconic Origin trait. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: During its first turn, the half-dragon has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the half-dragon scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the half-dragon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the half-dragon instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries.description: The half-dragon deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within Very Close of an ally of the half-dragon that isn't incapacitated and the half-dragon doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The half-dragon makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The half-dragon exhales poisonous gas in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The half-dragon has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the half-dragon hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The half-dragon makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close and range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The half-dragon exhales fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 24 (7d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
