entries.description: The fire starter makes two Havoc Hammer or Havoc Flask attacks.

entries.name: Havoc Hammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

entries.name: Havoc Flask
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d12) fire damage. If the target is a creature, magical flames cling to it, causing it to take 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns. Immediately after taking this damage on its turn, the target can make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), ending the effect on itself on a successful save.After the fire starter throws the flask, roll a d6; on a 3 or lower, the fire starter has no more flasks to throw.

entries.name: Escape
entries.description: The hare can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The harengon has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the harengon's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The harengon's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The harengon's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit (the target gains no benefit from less than total cover), range Out of Range, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. Hit or Miss: Immediately after making this attack, the harengon can use the Hide action.

entries.name: Aura of Command
entries.description: Allies within Close of the captain are immune to the charmed and frightened conditions. This aura is suppressed while the captain has the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The captain makes three Harmonium Blade attacks. The captain can also use Dictate if available.

entries.name: Harmonium Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Dictate (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The captain verbally commands up to three creatures it can see within Far of itself. This magical command must be to undertake an action or to refrain from taking actions (for example, "Throw down your weapons").A target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or have the charmed condition for 1 minute, during which time it follows the captain's command. The effect ends early if the target takes damage or if it successfully completes the command. A target automatically succeeds on its saving throw if the command is directly harmful to itself, such as commanding it to walk into fire.A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The peacekeeper has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacekeeper's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Electrified Mancatcher
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Until the grappled condition ends, the target has the restrained condition and can't teleport, the peacekeeper can't make Electrified Mancatcher attacks, and the target takes 8 (1d10 + 3) lightning damage at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Luring Song
entries.description: The harpy sings a magical melody, which lasts until the harpy's Concentration ends on it. Presence Reaction Roll (11), each Humanoid and Giant in a Very Far Emanation originating from the harpy when the song starts. Failure: The target has the Charmed condition until the song ends and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns. While Charmed, the target has the Incapacitated condition and ignores the Luring Song of other harpies. If the target is more than Very Close from the harpy, the target moves on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within Very Close of the harpy. It doesn't avoid Opportunity Attacks; however, before moving into damaging terrain (such as lava or a pit) and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target repeats the save. Success: The target is immune to this harpy's Luring Song for 24 hours.

entries.name: Luring Maestro
entries.description: While within Far of the matriarch, creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the matriarch's Luring Song.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The matriarch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The matriarch makes two claws attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Fleeting Form
entries.description: The matriarch can magically disguise itself to resemble a humanoid of roughly similar size and shape for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. This illusion does not hold up to close scrutiny.

entries.name: Luring Song
entries.description: The matriarch sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within Very Far of the matriarch that can hear the song must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be charmed until the song ends. The matriarch must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the matriarch is incapacitated.While charmed by the matriarch, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than Very Close away from the matriarch, the target must move on its turn toward the matriarch by the most direct route, trying to get within Very Close. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the matriarch, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.A target that successfully saves is immune to this matriarch's song for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Visage of Desire (1/Day)
entries.description: The matriarch projects a vision into the minds of creatures within Close of it that aren't constructs or undead, showing each creature achieving whatever it most desires. An affected creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or drop whatever it is holding and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Plane Shift (2/Day)
entries.description: The hawk casts Plane Shift on itself, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hound has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within Very Close of the target and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Supernatural Tracker
entries.description: The hound knows the distance to and direction of any creature that has come within Close of it, even if that creature is on a different plane of existence. If the creature being tracked by the hound dies, the hound knows.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Diabolic Ward
entries.description: Attack rolls against the devil have Disadvantage. If the devil makes an attack roll, this trait is suppressed until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes two attacks, using Infernal Blade or Confounding Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Infernal Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage and 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Confounding Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Very Far. Hit: 13 (2d12) Psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of the devil's next turn.

entries.name: Compelling Contract (1/Day)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (14), one creature within Close of the devil. Failure: The target has the Charmed condition. While it is Charmed, it has the Stunned condition, except the target can speak. If the target agrees to the devil's contract, the effect ends. Otherwise, the target repeats the save whenever it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The quori's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: charm person3/day each: detect thoughts, disguise self, suggestion1/day: dominate person, dream

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The quori uses its Mind Thrust twice.

entries.name: Idyllic Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or fall prone in a fit of laughter.

entries.name: Mind Thrust
entries.description: The quori targets a creature it can see within Far of it. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16), taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: One humanoid that the quori can see within Very Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

entries.name: Haunted Zone
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (17), any creature that casts a spell while inside the revenant's space. Failure: The spell fails and is wasted.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the revenant dies, it revives 24 hours later unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its remains. If it revives, it animates another Gargantuan object or structure elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The revenant makes two Object Slam attacks and uses Invitation.

entries.name: Object Slam
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9 (with Advantage if the target is inside the revenant's space), reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Invitation
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: The target is teleported inside the revenant's space and swallowed. A swallowed creature has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the revenant.While the revenant has Hit Points, a swallowed creature can leave the revenant's space only by using magic that enables planar travel, such as the Plane Shift spell.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Slashing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hazvongel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hazvongel makes three Talon attacks.

entries.name: Talon
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Blood Barrage (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The hazvongel launches a spray of blood in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Fire Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

entries.name: Headless
entries.description: The golem is blinded and deafened, giving it disadvantage on all its attack rolls, and it can't use its Poison Breath.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) slashing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hound has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hound makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 17 (5d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The hellfire engine is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hellfire engine has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The hellfire engine doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Flesh-Crushing Stride
entries.description: The hellfire engine moves up to its speed in a straight line. During this move, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. A creature whose space the hellfire engine enters must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18). On a successful save, the creature is pushed to the nearest space out of the hellfire engine's path. On a failed save, the creature falls prone and takes 28 (8d6) bludgeoning damage.If the hellfire engine remains in the prone creature's space, the creature is also restrained until it's no longer in the same space as the hellfire engine. While restrained in this way, the creature, or another creature within Very Close of it, can make a Difficulty (18) Strength check. On a success, the creature is shunted to an unoccupied space of its choice within Very Close of the hellfire engine and is no longer restrained.

entries.name: Hellfire Weapons
entries.description: The hellfire engine uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):1–2: Bonemelt Sprayer. The hellfire engine spews acidic flame in a Far cone. Each creature in the cone must make a Agility Reaction Roll (20), taking 11 (2d10) fire damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the saving throw are drenched in burning acid and take 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 9 (2d8) acid damage at the end of their turns. An affected creature or another creature within Very Close of it can take an action to scrape off the burning fuel.3–4: Lightning Flail. Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 22 (5d8) lightning damage. Up to three other creatures of the hellfire engine's choice that it can see within Close of the target must each make a Agility Reaction Roll (20), taking 22 (5d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.5–6: Thunder Cannon. The hellfire engine targets a point within Very Far of it that it can see. Each creature within Close of that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (20), taking 27 (5d10) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.If the chosen option kills a creature, the creature's soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The hellwasp's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hellwasp makes two attacks: one with its sting and one with its sword talons.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Sword Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The helmed horror has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spell Immunity
entries.description: The helmed horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical choices include Heat Metal, Lightning Bolt, and Magic Missile.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The helmed horror makes two Arcane Sword attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) Force damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The drone has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spell Immunity
entries.description: The drone is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include fireball, heat metal, and lightning bolt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The drone makes two longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Detention Orb
entries.description: The drone launches a tiny orb of magical force at a creature it can see within Close of itself. The creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be encased in the orb, which expands to a size just large enough to contain the creature. While encased, the creature doesn't need to breathe, eat, or drink, and it doesn't age. Nothing can pass through the orb, nor can any creature teleport or use planar travel to enter or exit the orb. As a bonus action, the drone can move the orb and its contents up to Close in any direction. A successful casting of the Dispel Magic spell on the orb (Difficulty (15)) destroys it. The orb otherwise remains intact until the drone spends an action to end the effect or the drone is destroyed. A drone can have only one detention orb active at a time; if the drone creates a detention orb when it already has one active, the first orb disappears, freeing the creature inside.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The remnant makes two Necrotic Surge attacks.

entries.name: Necrotic Surge
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The remnant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: bane, dimension door, web

entries.name: Legendary Resistances (3/Day)
entries.description: If the hertilod fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hertilod has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Shock Susceptibility
entries.description: If the hertilod takes lightning damage, its speed is halved until the end of its next turn, and it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or immediately regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which lands in a space within Very Close of the hertilod and has the prone condition.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The hertilod can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hertilod makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (20) or be swallowed by the hertilod. A swallowed creature has the blinded and restrained conditions, and it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the hertilod. At the start of each of the hertilod's turns, each swallowed creature takes 13 (2d12) poison damage from the poisonous secretion in the hertilod's gullet.The hertilod's gullet can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the hertilod takes 40 damage or more on a single turn from a swallowed creature, the hertilod must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which lands in a space within Very Close of the hertilod and has the prone condition. If the hertilod dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained and can escape from the corpse by using Very Close of movement, exiting with the prone condition.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The hexton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Combat Ready
entries.description: The hexton has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the hexton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the hexton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hexton makes one Pincer attack and two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Pincer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or have the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hexton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the hexton can't use this tentacle against other targets. The hexton has six tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the hezrou dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hezrou has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (16), any creature that starts its turn in a Very Close Emanation originating from the hezrou. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hezrou makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Poison damage.

entries.name: Devotion's Call (1/Day)
entries.description: The medusa can cast the Resurrection spell, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the medusa fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The medusa makes one Constrict attack, one Final Blade attack, and one Snake Hair attack. Alternatively, it makes two Wrathful Strike attacks.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (20)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the medusa can't constrict another creature.

entries.name: Final Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) force damage. If the target has at least one head and the medusa rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it fails a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) and can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 28 (8d6) force damage from the hit.

entries.name: Snake Hair
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The medusa casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: Light, Spare the Dying, Thaumaturgy2/day: Mass Cure Wounds (cast at 8th level)1/day each: Blade Barrier, Divination, Greater Restoration

entries.name: Wrathful Strike
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) radiant damage, and the target has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Comet's Voice (1/Day)
entries.description: The hierophant can cast Contact Other Plane, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hierophant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Thought Shield
entries.description: The hierophant's thoughts can't be read by any means unless the hierophant allows it.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hierophant makes two Herald's Axe attacks or three Comet Blast attacks.

entries.name: Herald's Axe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Comet Blast
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: All-Consuming Star (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The hierophant conjures a manifestation of the All-Consuming Star: brilliant light and haunting screams that fill a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the hierophant can see within Far of itself. Each creature within the sphere has the blinded and deafened conditions. Each creature that enters the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage and has the incapacitated condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. The manifestation persists until the hierophant dies, has the incapacitated condition, uses a bonus action to end the effect, or uses this action again.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hierophant casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Detect Thoughts, Mage Hand, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Dimension Door, Mass Suggestion

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Tree Club or Trash Lob in any combination.

entries.name: Tree Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Trash Lob
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Far. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Hill Rune
entries.description: The giant has a hill rune inscribed on a rock or some other object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Stone Avalanche action and Hill Rebuff reaction.The object bearing the rune has AC 15; 20 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a hill rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes one Greatclub attack and uses Stone Bolas.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: druidcraft, guidance1/day each: stone shape, wall of stone

entries.name: Stone Bolas
entries.description: The giant conjures three stone balls connected by lines of magical force and throws them at one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the target has the restrained condition until the start of the giant's next turn, and the stones erupt in a burst of thunderous energy that deals 14 (4d6) thunder damage to the target and each creature within Very Close of the target. On a successful save, the stones vanish without erupting.

entries.name: Stone Avalanche (Requires Hill Rune)
entries.description: The giant conjures a hail of rocks in a Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on a point on the ground it can see within Very Far of itself. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 28 (8d6) bludgeoning damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.The rocks turn the ground in that area into difficult terrain until the start of the giant's next turn, when the rocks vanish.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greatclub attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hippocamp can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the hippocamp moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The hippogriff doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hippogriff makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The hippopotamus can hold its breath for 10 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hippopotamus makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Piercing damage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Hoard Form Only)
entries.description: If the mimic is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the mimic move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mimic is animate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mimic makes one Bite attack and two Pseudopod attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the mimic adheres to the target. A creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: Caustic Mist (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mimic sprays a fine mist of acid in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 27 (6d8) acid damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic transforms into a hoard or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the scarab is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the scarab move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the scarab is animate.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Aura of Authority
entries.description: While in a Very Close Emanation originating from the hobgoblin, the hobgoblin and its allies have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, provided the hobgoblin doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hobgoblin makes two attacks, using Greatsword or Longbow in any combination.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Army Arcana
entries.description: When the hobgoblin casts a spell that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the spell and to succeed on the required saving throw.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hobgoblin makes two Quarterstaff or Devastating Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) force damage.

entries.name: Devastating Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) force damage, and the target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: fireball, fly, fog cloud, gust of wind, lightning bolt

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the hobgoblin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hobgoblin makes four attacks, each of which can be an Unarmed Strike or a Dart attack. It can also useShadow Jaunt once, either before or after one of the attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shadow Jaunt
entries.description: The hobgoblin teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Close to an unoccupied space it can see. Both the space it leaves and its destination must be in dim light or darkness.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hobgoblin casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: minor illusion, prestidigitation1/day each: charm person, disguise self, silent image

entries.name: Aura of Authority
entries.description: While in a Close Emanation originating from the hobgoblin, the hobgoblin and its allies have Advantage on attack rolls and saving throws, provided the hobgoblin doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hobgoblin makes three attacks, using Javelin or Longsword in any combination.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target's Speed decreases by Very Close until the start of the hobgoblin's next turn.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hobgoblin has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hobgoblin's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d10 + 1) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +3, range Very Far. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) Piercing damage plus 7 (3d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the hollow dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries.description: When the hollow dragon is reduced to 0 hit points, its body breaks into nine pieces: two arms, two legs, two wings, a tail, a torso, and a head. Each piece is a Large object with AC 19, 27 hit points, and immunity to psychic and poison damage. After 1d6 days, if all pieces are still within 6 miles of each other, they all teleport to the location of the head piece and merge with it, whereupon the hollow dragon regains all its hit points and becomes active again.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hollow dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, and it can use Sapping Presence.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Sapping Presence
entries.description: Each creature of the hollow dragon's choice within Far of it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, the creature's speed is halved and it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this hollow dragon's Sapping Presence for 24 hours.

entries.name: Radiant Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The hollow dragon exhales radiant flames in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19), taking 54 (12d8) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Aura of Invulnerability
entries.description: An invisible aura forms a Very Close-radius sphere around the hollyphant for as long as it lives. Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells. The hollyphant can use an action to suppress this trait until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The hollyphant's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (15)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: light2/day each: bless, cure wounds, protection from evil and good1/day each: banishment, heal, raise dead, shapechange (into a golden-furred mammoth with feathered wings and a flying speed of Very Far), teleport (with no chance of error)

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The hollyphant's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Tusks
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Trumpet (3/Day)
entries.description: The hollyphant blows air through its trunk, creating a trumpet sound that can be heard out to a range of Out of Range. The trumpet also creates a Close cone of energy that has one of the following effects, chosen by the hollyphant:

entries.name: Trumpet of Blasting
entries.description: Each creature in the cone must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, a creature takes 17 (5d6) thunder damage and is deafened for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't deafened. Nonmagical objects in the cone that aren't being held or worn take 35 (10d6) thunder damage.

entries.name: Trumpet of Sparkles
entries.description: Creatures in the cone must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 22 (4d8 + 4) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Evil creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw. Good creatures in the cone take no damage.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the homunculus is on the same plane of existence as its master, the two of them can communicate telepathically with each other.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage, and the target is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (12). Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the homunculus's next turn. Failure by 5 or More: The target has the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. While Poisoned, the target has the Unconscious condition, which ends early if the target takes any damage.

name: Homunculus Servant

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the homunculus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the homunculus instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Magic Bond
entries.description: Add the spell's level to any ability check or saving throw the homunculus makes.

entries.name: Force Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 1d6 + the spell's level Force damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hook horror makes two Hook attacks.

entries.name: Hook
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the hook horror moves the target Very Close straight toward or away from itself.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spore servant makes two hook attacks.

entries.name: Hook
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The tortoise can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Massive Frame
entries.description: The tortoise can carry up to 20,000 pounds of weight atop its shell, but moves at half speed if the weight exceeds 10,000 pounds. Medium or smaller creatures can move underneath the tortoise while it's not prone.Any creature under the tortoise when it falls prone is grappled (escape Difficulty (18)). Until the grapple ends, the creature is prone and restrained.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shell Defense (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The tortoise withdraws into its shell, falls prone, and gains a +5 bonus to AC. While the tortoise is in its shell, its speed is 0 and can't increase. The tortoise can emerge from its shell as an action, whereupon it is no longer prone.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The horncaller's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14)). The horncaller can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: bless, conjure animals

entries.name: Speak with Beasts
entries.description: The horncaller can communicate with beasts as if they shared a language.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horncaller makes two melee attacks with its staff and uses One with the Worldsoul.

entries.name: Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: One with the Worldsoul
entries.description: The horncaller chooses one beast it can see within Close of it. If the beast can hear the horncaller, the beast uses its reaction to make one melee attack against a target that the horncaller can see.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes three attacks, using Searing Fork or Hurl Flame in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Infernal Tail.

entries.name: Searing Fork
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Fire damage.

entries.name: Hurl Flame
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Very Far. Hit: 26 (5d8 + 4) Fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it starts burning.

entries.name: Infernal Tail
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (17), one creature the devil can see within Very Close. Failure: 10 (1d8 + 6) Necrotic damage, and the target receives an infernal wound if it doesn't have one. While wounded, the target loses 10 (3d6) Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. The wound closes after 1 minute, after a spell restores Hit Points to the target, or after the target or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to stanch the wound, doing so by succeeding on a Difficulty (17) Wisdom (Medicine) check.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the horrid plant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the horrid plant move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Nature) check to discern that the horrid plant isn't an ordinary plant.

entries.name: Horrid Plant Varieties
entries.description: A horrid plant comes in one of three varieties (choose or roll a d6): 1-2, dew drinker; 3-4, purple blossom; or 5-6, snapper saw. This form determines certain traits in this stat block.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horrid plant makes two Tendril attacks.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)), and the horrid plant can pull the target up to Close closer to itself. Until the grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the horrid plant can't use the same tendril on another target. The horrid plant has two tendrils.

entries.name: Aura of Menace
entries.description: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within Close of the archon must make a Presence Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The archon makes two Bite attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a Shining Blade attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Shining Blade (True Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: detect evil and good1/day each: aid, continual flame

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within Very Far of itself.

entries.name: Cloak of Shadows
entries.description: The hound appears with a number of temporary hit points equal to half your sorcerer level.

entries.name: Ever at Your Heels
entries.description: On its turn, it can move only toward its target by the most direct route, and it can use its action only to attack its target. The hound can make opportunity attacks, but only against its target. Additionally, while the hound is within Very Close of the target, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against any spell you cast. The hound disappears if it is reduced to 0 hit points, if its target is reduced to 0 hit points, or after 5 minutes.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The hound can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. The hound takes 5 force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Omen Sight
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the hound automatically knows its target's location. If the target was hidden, it is no longer hidden from the hound.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hound has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hound's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: A howler has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the howler's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The howler makes two Rending Bite attacks.

entries.name: Rending Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage if the target is frightened. This attack ignores damage resistance.

entries.name: Mind-Breaking Howl (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The howler emits a keening howl in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or take 16 (3d10) psychic damage and be frightened until the end of the howler's next turn. While a creature is frightened in this way, its speed is halved, and it is incapacitated. A target that successfully saves is immune to the Mind-Breaking Howl of all howlers for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Guiding Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: As a bonus action, the initiate gains advantage on the next ranged attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The initiate can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The priest can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): blade ward, gust, light, prestidigitation, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): feather fall, shield, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): dust devil, gust of wind3rd level (2 slots): gaseous form

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The priest makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Banded Claw
entries.description: On one of its claws, the crab wears a rune-covered copper band that makes it immune to being charmed, frightened, and paralyzed. The copper band is worthless as a treasure, as the magic is keyed to this crab.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled, escape Difficulty (14). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrode Metal
entries.description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: As an action, it can make two attacks with its pseudopods.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (6d6) acid damage, or 42 (12d6) acid damage while the ooze is enlarged. If the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: For 1 minute, the ooze magically increases in size. While enlarged, the ooze is Gargantuan, doubles its damage dice with its pseudopod attack, and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage.

entries.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The ooze magically turns invisible for up to 1 hour until it attacks, it uses its Enlarge, or its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The bear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bear makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Hulgaz fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Hulgaz has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Hulgaz makes two Claw attacks and one Intoxicating Sting attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Intoxicating Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or have the charmed condition until the start of Hulgaz's next turn.

entries.name: Brimstone Vapor (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Hulgaz exhales a Close cone of noxious, scorching-hot vapor. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, a creature takes 31 (7d8) fire damage at the start of each of its turns and has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws. A target can repeat the Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Hulgaz casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Charm Person2/day each: Dispel Magic, Fog Cloud1/day: Teleport

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Shell Camouflage
entries.description: While the crab remains motionless with its eyestalks and pincers tucked close to its body, it resembles a natural formation or a pile of detritus. A creature within Close of it can discern its true nature with a successful Difficulty (15) Intelligence (Nature) check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The crab makes two attacks with its claws.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target

entries.name: Acid Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the shadow is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the shadow starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the shadow goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the shadow attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the shadow attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the shadow goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The shadow is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The shadow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The shadow's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadow makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

entries.name: Haste (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Until the end of its next turn, the shadow magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the mutate has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mutate makes two Unarmed Strike or Nightmare Blast attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Nightmare Blast
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or have the frightened condition until the start of the mutate's next turn.

entries.name: Reactive
entries.description: The giant can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

entries.name: Vigilant
entries.description: The giant can't be surprised.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes four longsword attacks or two rock attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (21) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Life Hunger
entries.description: If a creature within Far of the sorrowsworn regains hit points, the sorrowsworn gains two benefits until the end of its next turn: it has advantage on attack rolls, and its Bite deals an extra 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a hit.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sorrowsworn makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)), and it is restrained until the grapple ends. While grappling a creature, the sorrowsworn can't make a Claw attack.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6 (with Advantage if the target doesn't have all its Hit Points), reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hurricane is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (11), +3 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): blade ward, gust, light, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): feather fall, jump, thunderwave2nd level (2 slots): gust of wind

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the hurricane is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Unarmored Movement
entries.description: While the hurricane is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by Close (included in its speed).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hurricane makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Curse of the Husk
entries.description: A humanoid slain by a melee attack from the zombie revives as a husk zombie on its next turn.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zombie makes two claw attacks. For each of these attacks that reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the zombie can make an additional claw attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Infernal Despair
entries.description: Each creature within Close of Hutijin that isn't a devil makes saving throws with disadvantage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Hutijin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Hutijin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Hutijin regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Hutijin dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Hutijin makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, one Mace attack, and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) fire damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (22) or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 10 (3d6) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) cold damage.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Hutijin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (22)):At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), detect magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only), lightning bolt, suggestion, wall of fire3/day: dispel magic

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) thunder damage.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Hutijin teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing and carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied space he can see.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hybrid can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hybrid makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hybrid makes two javelin attacks. It can replace one javelin attack with Spit Acid.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spit Acid
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 10 (4d4) acid damage.

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: During its first turn, the hybrid poisoner has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the hybrid scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Poisonous Skin
entries.description: Any creature that touches the hybrid or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Toxic Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of each of the poisoned target's turns, it must repeat the save, taking 3 (1d6) poison damage on a failed save, or ending the effect on itself on a successful one.

entries.name: Electrified Body
entries.description: Any creature that touches the hybrid or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The hybrid sheds bright light in a Very Close radius and dim light for an additional Very Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hybrid makes two attacks: one with its shocking touch and one with its tentacles.

entries.name: Shocking Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (11)), and the hybrid pulls the target up to Close straight toward it. Until this grapple ends, the target takes 5 (1d10) lightning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the hybrid shocker can't use its tentacles on another creature.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries.description: The hybrid has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The hybrid can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hybrid makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: The hydra has five heads. Whenever the hydra takes 25 damage or more on a single turn, one of its heads dies. The hydra dies if all its heads are dead. At the end of each of its turns when it has at least one living head, the hydra grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken Fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 20 Hit Points when it grows new heads.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra Reaction that can be used only for Opportunity Attacks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hydroloth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hydroloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Secure Memory
entries.description: The hydroloth is immune to the waters of the River Styx, as well as any effect that would steal or modify its memories or detect or read its thoughts.

entries.name: Watery Advantage
entries.description: While submerged in liquid, the hydroloth has advantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hydroloth makes two Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Claw
