entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) force damage plus 9 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hydroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only)3/day each: control water, crown of madness, fear, suggestion

entries.name: Steal Memory (1/Day)
entries.description: The hydroloth targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage, and it must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (16). On a successful save, the target becomes immune to this hydroloth's Steal Memory for 24 hours. On a failed save, the target loses all proficiencies; it can't cast spells; it can't understand language; and if its Intelligence and Charisma scores are higher than 5, they become 5. Each time the target finishes a long rest, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A greater restoration or remove curse spell cast on the target ends this effect early.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The hydroloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hyena has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hyena's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d6) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Fiery End
entries.description: If the magen dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The magen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The magen doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Psychic Lash
entries.description: The magen's eyes glow silver as it targets one creature that it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Suggestion
entries.description: The magen casts the suggestion spell (save Difficulty (12)), requiring no material components. The target must be a creature that the magen can communicate with telepathically. If it succeeds on its saving throw, the target is immune to this magen's suggestion spell for the next 24 hours. The magen's spellcasting ability is Intelligence.

name: Hythonia

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Hythonia's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (18)). She can innately cast animate objects once per day requiring no material components.1/day: animate objects

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Hythonia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: When a creature that can see Hythonia's eyes starts its turn within Close of her, Hythonia can force it to make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) if she isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, on a failed save the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see Hythonia until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at Hythonia in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If Hythonia sees herself reflected on a polished surface within Close of her and in an area of bright light, she is affected by her own gaze.

entries.name: Shed Skin (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If Hythonia is reduced to 0 hit points, she doesn't die or fall unconscious. Instead, she sheds her skin, regains 199 hit points, and moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Hythonia makes three attacks: one with her claws, one to constrict, and one with her snaky hair.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and Hythonia can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Snaky Hair
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and Hythonia can pull the target up to Very Close closer to her if it is a Large or smaller creature.

original_cr: 17 (XP 18,000, or 36,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +6)

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes three Ice Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a Tail attack.

entries.name: Ice Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Cold damage. Until the end of its next turn, the target can't take a Bonus Action or Reaction, its Speed decreases by Very Close, and it can move or take one action on its turn, not both. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the devil's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Ice Wall (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The devil casts Wall of Ice (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)).

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) Bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) Cold damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The mephit explodes when it dies. Finesse Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the mephit. Failure: 5 (2d4) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) Slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) Cold damage.

entries.name: Fog Cloud (1/Day)
entries.description: The mephit casts Fog Cloud, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Frost Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 7 (3d4) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the ice piercer remains motionless on the ceiling, it is indistinguishable from a normal stalactite.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The ice piercer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Drop
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, one creature directly underneath the ice piercer. Hit: 10 (3d6) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage. Miss: The ice piercer takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Icy Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing, and takes 1 cold damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, the restrained target can make a Difficulty (12) Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: Cold Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the spider takes 5 (2d4) cold damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Icy Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing, and takes 2 (1d4) cold damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, the restrained target can make a Difficulty (12) Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The toad can breathe air or water.

entries.name: Cold Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the toad takes 3 (1d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The toad's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Very Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape Difficulty (11)). Until this grapple ends, the toad can't bite another target.

entries.name: Cold Aura
entries.description: While it's alive, the troll generates an aura of bitter cold that fills the area within Very Close of it. At the start of the troll's turn, all nonmagical flames in the aura are extinguished. Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the troll takes 10 (3d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The ice troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The ice troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The ice troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage. If the target takes any of the cold damage, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have disadvantage on its attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 1 (1d6 - 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The illithilich's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (20)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components.At will: detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the illithilich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed illithilich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within Very Close of the phylactery.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The illithilich is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (20), +12 to hit with spell attacks). The lich has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, invisibility, Melf's acid arrow, mirror image3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, dispel magic, fireball4th level (3 slots): blight, dimension door5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, scrying6th level (1 slot): disintegrate, globe of invulnerability7th level (1 slot): finger of death, plane shift8th level (1 slot): dominate monster, power word stun9th level (1 slot): power word kill

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The illithilich has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (20) or be stunned until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the lich. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the lich kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The illithilich magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (18) or take 27 (5d8 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The illusionist makes two Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The illusionist casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, minor illusion2/day each: disguise self, invisibility, mage armor, major image, phantasmal force, phantom steed

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The monk makes two attacks.

entries.name: Force Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) force damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The imp has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The imp casts Invisibility on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: The imp shape-shifts to resemble a rat (Speed Close), a raven (Close, Fly Far), or a spider (Close, Climb Close), or it returns to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The imp has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d6 + 3 Piercing damage plus 2d6 Poison damage.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The imp has the Invisible condition for 1 minute. This effect ends early immediately after the imp makes an attack roll or deals damage, or if the imp has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: The imp shape-shifts to resemble a rat (Speed Close), a raven (Close, Fly Far), or a spider (Close, Climb Close), or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Ephemeral Movement
entries.description: The incarnation can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain, and its movement doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The incarnation has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The incarnation makes three attacks, using Bite or Miasmic Globule in any combination.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Miasmic Globule
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Far. Hit: 15 (6d4) Acid damage, and the target's Speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of the incarnation's next turn.

entries.name: Spectral Stampede
entries.description: The incarnation moves up to Far in a straight line. Each creature whose space the incarnation enters is targeted once by the following effect. Agility Reaction Roll (16). Failure: 18 (4d8) Force damage. If the target is the incarnation's size or smaller, it has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The incarnation has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The incarnation makes two Vine attacks and uses Radiant Blast. It can replace one vine attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast Blindness/Deafness if available.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The incarnation casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: Daylight, Druidcraft, Plant Growth1/day: Blindness/Deafness

entries.name: Vine
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is the incarnation's size or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)) from one of two vines.

entries.name: Radiant Blast
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (17), each creature of the incarnation's choice in a Close Emanation originating from the incarnation. Failure: The creature takes 14 (2d8 + 5) Radiant damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Succubus Form
entries.description: When the incubus finishes a Long Rest, it can shape-shift into a Succubus, using that stat block instead of this one. Any equipment it's wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The incubus makes two Restless Touch attacks.

entries.name: Restless Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target is cursed for 24 hours or until the incubus dies. Until the curse ends, the target gains no benefit from finishing Short Rests.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The incubus casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Disguise Self, Etherealness1/day each: Dream, Hypnotic Pattern

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Withering Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 1 poison damage.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries.description: The hook horror can't use its blindsight while deafened.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: The hook horror has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: The elder brain is aware of creatures within 1 mile of itself that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The elder brain has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The elder brain makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The elder brain casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) and takes 9 (1d8 + 5) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until the grapple ends. The elder brain can have up to four targets grappled at a time.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Creatures of the elder brain's choice within Far of itself must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or take 32 (5d10 + 5) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the townsperson can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Psychic Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The initiate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The initiate makes two Comet Strike attacks.

entries.name: Comet Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The initiate casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Mage Hand, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Dimension Door, Divination, Enthrall

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The inkling can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Blot
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Ink Spray (1/Day)
entries.description: The inkling sprays viscous ink at one creature within Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be blinded until the end of the inkling's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The inquisitor attacks twice with its Silver Longsword or uses Mind Fire twice.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The inquisitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: arcane eye, calm emotions, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, sending, suggestion1/day each: mass suggestion, modify memory

entries.name: Silver Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

entries.name: Mind Fire
entries.description: The inquisitor targets one creature it can see within Very Far of it. The target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 17 (3d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned until the start of the inquisitor's next turn.

entries.name: Inquisitor's Command (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Each creature of the inquisitor's choice that it can see within Far of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be charmed until the start of the inquisitor's next turn. On the charmed target's turn, the inquisitor can telepathically control the target's move, action, or both. When controlled in this way, the target can take only the Attack (inquisitor chooses the target) or Dash action.

entries.name: Metabolic Control
entries.description: At the start of each of its turns, the inquisitor regains 10 hit points and can end one condition on itself, provided the inquisitor has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The inquisitor attacks twice with its Silver Longsword. After it hits or misses with an attack, the inquisitor can teleport up to Close to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The inquisitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, sending1/day each: dimension door, fly, greater invisibility

entries.name: Silver Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The inquisitor attacks twice.

entries.name: Force Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) force damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, the inquisitor can push it up to Very Close away.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The inquisitor casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, levitate, mage armor, mage hand, sending1/day each: Otiluke's resilient sphere, telekinesis

entries.name: Silver Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) if used with two hands, plus 18 (4d8) force damage.

entries.name: Implode (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point the inquisitor can see within Very Far of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 31 (6d8 + 4) force damage and be knocked prone and moved to the unoccupied space closest to the sphere's center. Large and smaller objects that aren't being worn or carried in the sphere automatically take the damage and are similarly moved.

entries.name: Dual Mind
entries.description: The Inspired has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The Inspired's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (13)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: mage hand, vicious mockery (see "Actions" below)1/day each: charm person, dissonant whispers, hex, hold person, mage armor

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Inspired makes two crysteel dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with vicious mockery.

entries.name: Crysteel Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) force damage.

entries.name: Vicious Mockery (Cantrip)
entries.description: The Inspired unleashes a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at one creature it can see within Far of it. If the target can hear the Inspired, the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or take 2 (1d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Detect Intelligence
entries.description: The intellect devourer magically senses the location of any creature within Very Far of itself that has an Intelligence score of 3 or higher, regardless of interposing barriers.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The intellect devourer makes one Claw attack and uses Devour Intellect.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Devour Intellect
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (12), one creature the intellect devourer can see within Very Close. Failure: 11 (2d10) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

entries.name: Steal Body
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (12), one Small or Medium creature within Very Close that has the Incapacitated condition, is a Humanoid or Beast, and has 10 Hit Points or fewer. Failure: The intellect devourer possesses the target, consumes its brain, and teleports inside its skull. While there, the intellect devourer has Total Cover against attacks and other effects originating outside its host. The intellect devourer retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; its understanding of Deep Speech; its telepathy; and its Detect Intelligence trait. It otherwise adopts the target's game statistics. It knows everything the target knew, including spells and languages.If the host body dies, the intellect devourer must leave it. The intellect devourer is also forced out if the target regains its devoured brain by means of a Wish spell. By spending Very Close of its movement, the intellect devourer can voluntarily leave the body, teleporting to the nearest unoccupied space within Very Close of it. The body then dies unless its brain is restored before the end of the intellect devourer's next turn.

entries.name: Cacophony of Minds
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Close of the intellect snare must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or have the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. An incapacitated creature can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this intellect snare's Cacophony of Minds for 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The intellect snare has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The intellect snare makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) force damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)).

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The pudding's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: dancing lights, mage hand3/day each: darkness, faerie fire, shield1/day: Melf's acid arrow

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Air Form
entries.description: The stalker can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The stalker has the Invisible condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The stalker makes three Wind Swipe attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Vortex.

entries.name: Wind Swipe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Force damage.

entries.name: Vortex
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (14), one Large or smaller creature in the stalker's space. Failure: 7 (1d8 + 3) Thunder damage, and the target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Until the grapple ends, the target can't cast spells with a Verbal component and takes 7 (2d6) Thunder damage at the start of each of the stalker's turns.

entries.name: Tactical Discipline
entries.description: The iron consul has advantage on all ability checks and saving throws made during combat.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The iron consul makes one attack with its spear and can use its Voice of Command ability.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage when used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Voice of Command
entries.description: The iron consul selects up to two allies within Far of it that can hear its commands. Each ally can immediately use its reaction to make one melee attack.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries.description: The defender has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the defender is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or take an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage and be grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). The defender can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Fire Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to Fire damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Fire damage dealt.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two attacks, using Bladed Arm or Fiery Bolt in any combination.

entries.name: Bladed Arm
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fiery Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range Very Far. Hit: 36 (8d8) Fire damage.

entries.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 55 (10d10) Poison damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Acidic Blood
entries.description: When the hydra takes piercing or slashing damage, each creature within Very Close of the hydra takes 9 (2d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiple Heads
entries.description: The hydra has five heads. While it has more than one head, the hydra has advantage on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious. Whenever the hydra takes 35 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 hit points for each head regrown in this way.

entries.name: Reactive Heads
entries.description: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Wakeful
entries.description: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hydra makes as many bite attacks as it has heads.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries.description: The AC of Isolde includes her Charisma bonus.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Isolde's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14)). Isolde can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:3/day each: alter self, command, detect magic1/day: plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Magic Resistance Aura
entries.description: While holding Nepenthe, Isolde creates an aura in a Very Close radius around her. While this aura is active, Isolde and all creatures friendly to her in the aura have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Isolde makes two melee attacks or uses its Fire Ray twice.

entries.name: Nepenthe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 7) slashing damage, or 12 (1d10 + 7) slashing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack. If the target is a fiend or an undead, it takes an extra 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

entries.name: Fire Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Fiendish Charm
entries.description: One humanoid Isolde can see within Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be magically charmed for 1 day. The charmed target obeys Isolde's spoken commands. If the target suffers any harm from Isolde or another creature or receives a suicidal command from Isolde, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Isolde's Fiendish Charm for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Isperia's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (23)). Isperia can innately cast imprisonment twice per day, requiring no material components.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: Isperia is immune to any effect that would sense her emotions or read her thoughts, as well as any divination spell that she refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain her intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Isperia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Isperia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Isperia is a 15th-level Azorius spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (23), +14 to hit with spell attacks). Isperia has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, resistance, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, ensnaring strike, sanctuary, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): arcane lock, augury, calm emotions, hold person, silence, zone of truth3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, clairvoyance, counterspell, dispel magic, tongues4th level (3 slots): divination, locate creature5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, scrying6th level (1 slot): word of recall7th level (1 slot): divine word8th level (1 slot): antimagic field

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Isperia makes two claw attacks. She can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action in place of one claw attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (23) or take 14 (4d6) psychic damage after each attack it makes against Isperia before the start of her next turn.

entries.name: Supreme Legal Authority
entries.description: Isperia chooses up to three creatures she can see within Far of her. Each target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (23) or Isperia chooses an action for that target: Attack, Cast a Spell, Dash, Disengage, Dodge, Help, Hide, Ready, Search, or Use an Object. The affected target can't take that action for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can end the effect on itself with a successful Instinct Reaction Roll (23). A target that succeeds on the saving throw becomes immune to Isperia's Supreme Legal Authority for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The drone can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The drone doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The drone makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). The drone has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

entries.name: Crystalline Spit (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The drone spits crackling gel in a line Very Close wide and Close long. Each creature in the line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) lightning damage and is restrained by the gel, which hardens into crystal. The creature is restrained until the crystal is destroyed. The crystal has AC 15, 15 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and vulnerability to thunder damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't restrained.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ixitxachitl is a 5th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11), +3 to hit with spell attacks). The ixitxachitl has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): charm person, create or destroy water2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, tongues

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Confusing Burble
entries.description: The jabberwock burbles to itself unless it is incapacitated. Any creature that starts its turn within Close of the jabberwock and is able to hear its burbling must make a Presence Reaction Roll (18). On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and it rolls a d4 to determine what it does during its current turn:1-2. The creature does nothing.3. The creature does nothing except use all its movement to move in a random direction.4. The creature either makes one melee attack against a random creature it can see or does nothing if no visible creature is within its reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the jabberwock fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The jabberwock regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the jabberwock takes slashing damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The jabberwock dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Uncanny Tracker
entries.description: The jabberwock can unerringly track any creature it has wounded in the last 24 hours, and it knows the distance and direction to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The jabberwock makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fiery Gaze (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Unless it is blinded, the jabberwock emits a Very Far-long, Very Close-wide line of fire from its eyes. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +1, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The jackalwere has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the jackalwere's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The jackalwere makes two Rend or Slam attacks.

entries.name: Rend (Jackal or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Slam (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sleep Gaze (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (10), one creature the jackalwere can see within Close (Constructs and Undead succeed automatically). Failure: The target has the Unconscious condition for 10 minutes or until it takes damage or a creature within Very Close of it takes an action to wake it. Success: The target is immune to this jackalwere's Sleep Gaze for 24 hours.

entries.name: Camouflage
entries.description: The jaculi has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The jaculi has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spring
entries.description: The jaculi springs up to Close in a straight line and makes a bite attack against a target within its reach. This attack has advantage if the jaculi springs at least Very Close. If the attack hits, the bite deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The spider is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The spider has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The spider's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spider makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The spider targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spelljammer Overload
entries.description: If the leech is reduced to 0 hit points while attached to a ship that has a spelljamming helm, the creature attuned to that helm must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the creature takes 10 (4d4) psychic damage and is incapacitated for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The leech doesn't require air or sleep.

entries.name: Spiked Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Jarad fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Jarad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Jarad regains 25 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. He dies only if he starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Jarad is a 14th-level Golgari spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (20), +12 to hit with spell attacks). Jarad has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, chill touch, mage hand, poison spray, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): entangle, ray of sickness, sleep2nd level (3 slots): Melf's acid arrow, ray of enfeeblement, spider climb, web3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, plant growth, vampiric touch4th level (3 slots): blight, giant insect, grasping vine5th level (2 slots): cloudkill, insect plague6th level (1 slot): circle of death, create undead7th level (1 slot): finger of death, forcecage

entries.name: Spore Infusion
entries.description: Jarad is surrounded by a cloud of spores. As a bonus action, he can cause the spores to deal 11 (2d10) poison damage to a creature he can see within Very Close of him.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: Jarad has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces Jarad to 0 hit points, he must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, he drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Jarad makes two attacks: one with his Noxious Touch and one with his Staff of Svogthir. He can cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action in place of one of these attacks.

entries.name: Noxious Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 28 (8d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Staff of Svogthir
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) poison damage and 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Jiangshi Weaknesses
entries.description: The jiangshi has the following flaws:Fear of Its Own Reflection. If the jiangshi sees its own reflection, it immediately uses its reaction, if available, to move as far away from the reflection as possible.Susceptible to Holy Symbols. While the jiangshi is wearing or touching a holy symbol, it automatically fails saving throws against effects that turn Undead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The jiangshi doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The jiangshi makes three Slam attacks and uses Consume Energy.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Consume Energy
entries.description: The jiangshi draws energy from a creature it can see within Close of it. The target makes a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 18 (4d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The jiangshi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. After regaining hit points from this action, the jiangshi gains the following benefits for 7 days: its walking speed increases to Far, and it gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed and can hover.A Humanoid slain by this necrotic damage rises as a wight (see its entry in the Monster Manual) at the end of the jiangshi's turn. The wight acts immediately after the jiangshi in the initiative order. If this wight slays a Humanoid with its Life Drain, the wight transforms into a jiangshi 5 days later.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The jiangshi polymorphs into a Beast, a Humanoid, or an Undead that is Medium or Small or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the jiangshi's choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Lucky
entries.description: When the medic rolls a 1 on the d20 of a D20 Test, it can reroll the die, and it must use the new roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The medic makes two Radiant Burst attacks.

entries.name: Radiant Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 7 (2d6) Radiant damage, and the creature has the Blinded condition until the start of the medic's next turn.

entries.name: Foul
entries.description: Any creature other than an Ooze that starts its turn within Very Close of Juiblex must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Juiblex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Juiblex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Juiblex regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Juiblex dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: Juiblex can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Juiblex makes three Acid Lash attacks.

entries.name: Acid Lash
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 21 (4d6 + 7) acid damage. Any creature killed by this attack is drawn into Juiblex's body, where the corpse is dissolved after 1 minute.

entries.name: Eject Slime (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Juiblex spews out a corrosive slime, targeting one creature that it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (21) or take 55 (10d10) acid damage. Unless the target avoids taking all of this damage, any metal armor worn by the target takes a permanent −1 penalty to the AC it offers, and any metal weapon the target is carrying or wearing takes a permanent −1 penalty to damage rolls. The penalty worsens each time a target is subjected to this effect. If the penalty on an object drops to −5, the object is destroyed. The penalty on an object can be removed by the mending spell.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Juiblex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: detect magic3/day each: contagion, gaseous form

entries.name: Divine Eminence
entries.description: As a bonus action, the priestess can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 (3d6) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the priestess expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The junior drow priestessess of lolth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the junior drow priestessess of lolth to sleep.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The junior drow priestessess of lolth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (11)). The junior drow priestessess of lolth can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: dancing lights1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priestess is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priestess has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, guiding bolt, sanctuary2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, spiritual weapon3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, spirit guardians

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the junior drow priestessess of lolth has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eldritch horror makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if the eldritch horror isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The eldritch horror exhales a line of lightning that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The eldritch horror casts one of the following spells, requiring no components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save Difficulty (14)):2/day each: blindness/deafness, blur1/day: project image

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The eldritch horror makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the eldritch horror, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the eldritch horror's turns. A eldritch horror can have only one creature swallowed at a time.If the eldritch horror takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the eldritch horror must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the eldritch horror. If the eldritch horror dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries.description: The hook horror can't use its blindsight while deafened.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: The hook horror has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hook horror makes two hook attacks.

entries.name: Hook
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kraken can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Freedom of Movement
entries.description: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend Very Close of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kraken makes two tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with a use of Fling.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the kraken's turns. One Medium or two smaller creatures can be swallowed at the same time.If the kraken takes 35 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (23) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in spaces within Very Close of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Very Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to Far in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every Very Close it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries.description: The kraken magically create a bolt of lightning, which can strike a target the kraken can see within Far of it. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The mimic can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) acid damage.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: The mimic polymorphs into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Living Shadow
entries.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the dragon has Resistance to damage that isn't Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the dragon has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Shadow Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 17 (5d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies, and a Shadow rises from its corpse. The shadow is under the dragon's control and shares the dragon's Initiative count but acts immediately after the dragon.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The kakkuu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The kakkuu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: When in contact with a web, the kakkuu knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The kakkuu ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kakkuu makes a Web Snare attack, uses Reel, and makes a Bite attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: The kakkuu pulls each creature within Far of itself that is grappled by its Web Snare up to Close straight toward itself.

entries.name: Web Snare
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). While grappled, the target also has the restrained condition. A web snare grappling a creature can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; 10 hit points; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The soldier makes two Longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: All-Around Vision
entries.description: The quori can't be surprised while it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The quori can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The quori's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (21), +13 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: arcane eye3/day each: clairvoyance, confusion, dream, eyebite

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The quori has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The quori makes two Soul Binding attacks. Alternatively, it can make four attacks with Arcane Blast.

entries.name: Arcane Blast
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) force damage.

entries.name: Soul Binding
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and has its soul imprisoned in one of the quori's eyes. The target can't be revived by any means short of a wish spell until the quori is destroyed.

entries.name: Mind Seed (1/Day)
entries.description: The quori touches one humanoid, which must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (21) or be cursed. The curse lasts until it's removed by a remove curse or greater restoration spell.The cursed target suffers 1 level of exhaustion every 24 hours, and finishing a long rest doesn't reduce its exhaustion. If the cursed target reaches exhaustion level 6, it doesn't die; it instead becomes a thrall under the quori's control, and all its exhaustion is removed. Only the wish spell can free the thrall from this control.

entries.name: Swarm of Eyes (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The quori creates a swarm of spectral eyes that fills a Close-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within Far of it. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (21). On a failure, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage, and it is blinded for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. A blinded creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: One humanoid that the quori can see within Very Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (21) or be possessed by the quori; the quori then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the quori ends it as a bonus action, or the quori is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the quori reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the body. The target is immune to this quori's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

entries.name: Dual Mind
entries.description: The kalashtar has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Mind Thrust
entries.description: The kalashtar targets a creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The kamadan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the kamadan moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone. If the target is knocked prone, the kamadan can make two attacks—one with its bite and one with its snakes—against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kamadan makes two attacks: one with its bite or claw and one with its snakes.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Snakes
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Sleep Breath (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The kamadan exhales sleep gas in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points, it dissolves into acid that splashes on those around it. Each creature within Very Close of the draconian must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (12) or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature.

entries.name: Glide
entries.description: When the draconian falls and isn't incapacitated, it subtracts up to Far from the fall when calculating the fall's damage, and it can move up to Melee horizontally for every Melee it descends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Dagger attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned until the end of the target's next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The soldier has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the soldier's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the soldier to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the soldier drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The soldier attacks three times with one of its weapons.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Longbow
