entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Customizable Storage
entries.description: A keg robot can hold up to three types of liquid payload totaling 12 gallons within its hollow, barrel-shaped body. A full keg robot can make one liquid attack per gallon before the liquid must be refilled. Filling a keg robot takes 2 rounds per gallon. Differing payloads can alter the keg robot's attacks from those presented here.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Acid Squirt
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) acid damage.

entries.name: Beer Shower
entries.description: The keg robot spews an unnaturally potent beer in a Close cone or in a Close line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a creature has its speed halved by exposure to the potent brew. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.Additionally, the beer shower extinguishes any fires or open flames in its area.

entries.name: Hot Oil Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The keg robot sprays hot oil in a Close cone or in a Close line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in the area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, a creature takes 7 (1d8 + 3) fire damage and falls prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone.Any creature affected by the hot oil spray that takes fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute) takes an additional 3 (1d6) fire damage, and the oil burns away.If the oil that remains in the area of the spray is lit, it burns for 1d4 rounds and deals 3 (1d6) fire damage to any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kelpie can breathe air and water.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the kelpie remains motionless in its true form, it is indistinguishable from normal seaweed.

entries.name: Seaweed Shape
entries.description: The kelpie can use its action to reshape its body into the form of a humanoid or beast that is Small, Medium, or Large. Its statistics are otherwise unchanged. The disguise is convincing, unless the kelpie is in bright light or the viewer is within Close of it, in which case the seams between the seaweed strands are visible. The kelpie returns to its true form if takes a bonus action to do so or if it dies.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kelpie makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Drowning Hypnosis
entries.description: The kelpie chooses one humanoid it can see within Very Far of it. If the target can see the kelpie, the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be magically charmed while the kelpie maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). The charmed target is incapacitated, and instead of holding its breath underwater, it tries to breathe normally and immediately runs out of breath, unless it can breathe water. If the charmed target is more than Very Close away from the kelpie, the target must move on its turn toward the kelpie by the most direct route, trying to get within Very Close. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks.Before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the kelpie or drowning, the target can repeat the saving throw. A charmed target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.A target that successfully saves is immune to this kelpie's hypnosis for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Acidic Secretions
entries.description: A creature that touches the kelubar or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 5 (2d4) acid damage.

entries.name: Boundless Movement
entries.description: The kelubar ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend Very Close of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The kelubar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kelubar makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The kelubar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: invisibility (self only)1/day each: dispel magic, scrying (as an action)

entries.name: Spit Acid
entries.description: The kelubar spits acid in a line Far long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17), taking 27 (6d8) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
entries.description: The kelubar has a 40 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d2 farastu demodands or 1 kelubar demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within Far of the kelubar, acts as an ally of the kelubar, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the kelubar dies, or until the kelubar dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Hoopak
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage if the kender used the hoopak's sling to make a ranged attack.

entries.name: Taunt
entries.description: The kender launches a barrage of insults at a creature it can see within Far of itself. If the target can hear the kender, the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The kenku can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Shadow Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Necrotic damage. Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the kenku's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the ki-rin fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ki-rin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ki-rin makes two Hoof attacks and one Horn attack, or it makes two Sacred Fire attacks.

entries.name: Hoof
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: Horn
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) radiant damage.

entries.name: Sacred Fire
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ki-rin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: light, major image (6th-level version), thaumaturgy3/day each: cure wounds, dispel magic, lesser restoration, sending1/day each: banishment, calm emotions, create food and water, greater restoration, plane shift, protection from evil and good, revivify, wind walk

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The kiddywidget doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kiddywidget makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled by the kiddywidget (escape Difficulty (8)).

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The whale can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The kindori doesn't require food, drink, or air.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two attacks, using Greatsword or Heavy Crossbow in any combination.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +2, range Far. Hit: 11 (2d10) Piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Dark Devotion
entries.description: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Icy Doom
entries.description: When the cultist dies, its corpse freezes for 9 days, during which time it can't be thawed, harmed by fire, animated, or raised from the dead.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (11), +3 to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, inflict wounds, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The knight of the mithral shield has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Possessed
entries.description: While the knight is possessed by yakfolk, its alignment is lawful evil and it can speak Yikaria (the yakfolk tongue).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

entries.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within Close of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The knight regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the knight takes fire or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the knight's next turn. The knight's body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: When the knight's body is destroyed, its soul lingers. After 24 hours, the soul inhabits and animates another humanoid corpse on the same plane of existence and regains all its hit points. While the soul is bodiless, a wish spell can be used to force the soul to go to the afterlife and not return.

entries.name: Turn Immunity
entries.description: The knight is immune to effects that turn undead.

entries.name: Vengeful Tracker
entries.description: The knight knows the distance to and direction of any creature against which it seeks revenge, even if the creature and the knight are on different planes of existence. If the creature being tracked by the knight dies, the knight knows.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes two longsword attacks or two fist attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature against which the knight has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature against which the knight has sworn vengeance, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the knight can grapple the target (escape Difficulty (14)) provided the target is Large or smaller.

entries.name: Vengeful Glare
entries.description: The knight targets one creature it can see within Close of it and against which it has sworn vengeance. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failure, the target is paralyzed until the knight deals damage to it, or until the end of the knight's next turn. When the paralysis ends, the target is frightened of the knight for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if it can see the knight, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The trout can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The koalinth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Martial Advantage
entries.description: Once per turn, the koalinth can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within Very Close of an ally of the koalinth that isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The koalinth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Martial Advantage
entries.description: Once per turn, the sergeant can deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within Very Close of an ally of the sergeant that isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sergeant makes two melee attacks with its trident.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Hooked Net
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the target is restrained. A creature can use its action to make a Difficulty (12) Strength check to free itself or another creature in a hooked net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 5 slashing damage to the net (AC 12) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold commoner has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of their allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, The kobold commoner has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Dragon's Resistance
entries.description: The kobold has resistance to a type of damage based on the color of dragon that invested it with power (choose or roll a d10): 1–2, acid (black or copper); 3–4, cold (silver or white); 5–6, fire (brass, gold, or red); 7–8, lightning (blue or bronze); 9–10, poison (green).

entries.name: Heart of the Dragon
entries.description: If the kobold is frightened or paralyzed by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within Close of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kobold makes two Spear attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Weapon Invention
entries.description: The kobold uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d8); the kobold can use each one no more than once per day:1: Acid. The kobold hurls a flask of acid. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) acid damage.2: Alchemist's Fire. The kobold throws a flask of alchemist's fire. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) fire damage at the start of each of the target's turns. The target can end this damage by using its action to make a Difficulty (10) Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.3: Basket of Centipedes. The kobold throws a small basket into a Very Close-square space within Close of it. A swarm of insects (centipedes) with 11 hit points emerges from the basket and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.4: Green Slime Pot. The kobold throws a clay pot full of green slime at the target, and it breaks open on impact. Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) acid damage, and the target is covered in slime until a creature uses its action to scrape or wash the slime off. A target covered in the slime takes 5 (1d10) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.5: Rot Grub Pot. The kobold throws a clay pot into a Very Close-square space within Close of it, and it breaks open on impact. A swarm of rot grubs (in this book) emerges from the shattered pot and remains a hazard in that square.6: Scorpion on a Stick. The kobold makes a melee attack with a scorpion tied to the end of a Very Close-long pole. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (9), taking 4 (1d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.7: Skunk in a Cage. The kobold releases a skunk into an unoccupied space within Very Close of it. The skunk has a walking speed of Close, AC 10, 1 hit point, and no effective attacks. It rolls initiative and, on its turn, uses its action to spray musk at a random creature within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (9), or it retches and is incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that doesn't need to breathe or is immune to poison automatically succeeds on the saving throw. Once the skunk has sprayed its musk, it can't do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.8: Wasp Nest in a Bag. The kobold throws a small bag into a Very Close-square space within Close of it. A swarm of insects (wasps) with 11 hit points emerges from the bag and rolls initiative. At the end of each of the swarm's turns, there's a 50 percent chance that the swarm disperses.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kobold makes two Dagger or Chromatic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Chromatic Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) of a type of the kobold's choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The kobold casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: charm person, fog cloud, levitate

entries.name: Inquiring Mind (1/Day)
entries.description: The kobold can cast detect magic, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Alchemical Flame (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The kobold unleashes fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Messy End
entries.description: The kobold explodes 3 rounds after it dies, or immediately if it was killed by a critical hit. The explosion destroys the kobold's body, leaving its equipment behind. Each creature within Very Close of the exploding kobold must make a Agility Reaction Roll (10), taking 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The vampire has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the vampire's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The vampire doesn't require air.

entries.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries.description: The vampire has the following flaws:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.Harmed by Running Water. The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it starts its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is incapacitated in its resting place.Sunlight Hypersensitivity. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 5 (2d4) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kobold has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the prawn moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (11) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The prawn can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The kolyarut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the kolyarut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The kolyarut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kolyarut makes four Unerring Blade attacks.

entries.name: Unerring Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 force damage plus one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):1-2: Disarm. The target drops one item it is holding of the kolyarut's choice.3-4: Imbalance. The target can't take reactions until the start of the kolyarut's next turn.5-6: Push. If the target is Large or smaller, the target is pushed up to Close away from the kolyarut.

entries.name: Edict of Blades (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The kolyarut moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can make one Unerring Blade attack against each creature it moves past. Whenever it hits a creature with an Unerring Blade attack during this movement, each spell of 5th level or lower on the creature ends, and the creature has the incapacitated condition until the end of the kolyarut's next turn.

entries.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
entries.description: The kolyarut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The kolyarut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within Far of itself. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (18) or be sent to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: The korred has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The korred makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, or 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage if the korred is on the ground.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The korred casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: commune with nature (as an action), meld into stone, stone shape1/day: Otto's irresistible dance

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kraken can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kraken makes two Tentacle attacks and uses Fling, Lightning Strike, or Swallow.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +17, reach Close. Hit: 24 (4d6 + 10) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (20)) from one of ten tentacles, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: The kraken throws a Large or smaller creature Grappled by it to a space it can see within Far of itself that isn't in the air. Agility Reaction Roll (25), the creature thrown and each creature in the destination space. Failure: 18 (4d8) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Lightning Strike
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (23), one creature the kraken can see within Very Far. Failure: 33 (6d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (25), one creature Grappled by the kraken (it can have up to four creatures swallowed at a time). Failure: 23 (3d8 + 10) Piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is swallowed and no longer Grappled. A swallowed creature has the Restrained condition, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and takes 24 (7d6) Acid damage at the start of each of its turns.If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (25) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within Very Close of the kraken with the Prone condition. If the kraken dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using Close of movement, exiting Prone.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The priest can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The priest makes two Thunderous Touch or Thunderbolt attacks.

entries.name: Thunderous Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (5d10) thunder damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priest casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: command, create or destroy water3/day each: control water, darkness, water breathing, water walk1/day: Evard's black tentacles

entries.name: Thunderbolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage, and the target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Voice of the Kraken (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: A kraken speaks through the priest with a thunderous voice audible within Very Far. Creatures of the priest's choice that can hear the kraken's words (which are spoken in Abyssal, Infernal, or Primordial) must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be frightened of the priest for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Feed on Death
entries.description: When a creature within Close of the kraul drops to 0 hit points, the kraul or another creature of its choice within Close of it gains 5 (1d10) temporary hit points, provided the kraul isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Hive Mind
entries.description: The kraul is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions while within Close of at least one other kraul.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The kraul's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kraul can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: chill touch, poison spray3/day each: ray of enfeeblement, ray of sickness1/day each: animate dead, blight, vampiric touch

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kraul has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kraul's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The kraul can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kraul makes one attack with its quarterstaff and casts one of its spells with a casting time of 1 action.

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Hive Mind
entries.description: The kraul is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions while within Close of at least one other kraul.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kraul has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kraul's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The kraul can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The kruthik has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kruthik's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The kruthik can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kruthik makes two Stab or Spike attacks.

entries.name: Stab
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spike
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The kruthik sprays acid in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 22 (4d10) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The warden has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The warden makes two Arcane Whip attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Shackling Glyph if available.

entries.name: Arcane Whip
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Force damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition. If the target already has the Prone condition, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) Force damage.

entries.name: Shackling Glyph (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (14), one creature the warden can see within Far. Failure: The creature has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). While Grappled, the creature has the Restrained condition.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The warden casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Alarm, Arcane Lock, Mage Armor (included in AC)1/day: Dispel Magic

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Sticky Net (1/Day)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (10), one Large or smaller creature the kuo-toa can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Restrained condition until the net is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; Immunity to Bludgeoning, Poison, and Psychic damage). A creature can take an action to make a Difficulty (10) Strength (Athletics) check to free itself or another creature in a net within Very Close, destroying the net on a success.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kuo-toa makes three Strange Scepter attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The kuo-toa casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Magic, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Destructive Wave, Divination, Hold Monster (level 6 version), Scrying, Tongues

entries.name: Strange Scepter
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Brine Slicer
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kuo-toa makes two Bone Whip attacks.

entries.name: Bone Whip
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Lightning damage, and the target can't make Opportunity Attacks until the start of the kuo-toa's next turn.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kuo-toa can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the kuo-toa has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Pincer Staff
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)). Until the grapple ends, the kuo-toa can't make Pincer Staff attacks.

entries.name: Conjure Slimy Glob
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 9 (3d4 + 2) Acid damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an elf or undead, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ghoul makes two Icy Bite attacks.

entries.name: Icy Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Cold damage, and the target's Speed decreases by Very Close until the start of the ghoul's next turn.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage. If the target is a creature that isn't an Undead or elf, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (10). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Illmarrow fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Illmarrow has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: Illmarrow's body turns to dust when she drops to 0 hit points, and her equipment is left behind. She gains a new body after 1d10 days, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within two hundred miles of the location at which she was destroyed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Illmarrow is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (23), +15 to hit with spell attacks). Illmarrow has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), fire bolt, mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): magic missile, shield, sleep2nd level (3 slots): blur, detect thoughts, mirror image3rd level (3 slots): animate dead, counterspell, fireball, fly, lightning bolt4th level (3 slots): blight, confusion, polymorph5th level (3 slots): cloudkill, cone of cold, hold monster, scrying6th level (2 slots): chain lightning, circle of death, create undead7th level (2 slots): finger of death, forcecage, prismatic spray8th level (1 slot): incendiary cloud, maze9th level (1 slot): power word kill, time stop

entries.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of Illmarrow's next turn. If the target is undead, it also has disadvantage on attack rolls against Illmarrow until the end of her next turn.

entries.name: Paralyzing Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Poison Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Illmarrow exhales poisonous gas in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the creature can't regain hit points. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned.A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises at the start of Illmarrow's next turn as a zombie. The zombie acts immediately after Illmarrow in the initiative count and is permanently under her command, following her verbal orders.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lamia makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Corrupting Touch.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Corrupting Touch
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), one creature the lamia can see within Very Close. Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage, and the target is cursed for 1 hour. Until the curse ends, the target has the Charmed and Poisoned conditions.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lamia casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Disguise Self (can appear as a Large or Medium biped), Minor Illusion1/day each: Geas, Major Image, Scrying

entries.name: Corpse Stride
entries.description: Once on its turn, the lampad can use Very Close of its movement to step magically into one creature's corpse within its reach and emerge from a second creature's corpse within Far of the first corpse, appearing in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the second corpse. Both corpses must be Medium or bigger.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The lampad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (+6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: chill touch (see "Actions" below), gentle repose

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The lampad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lampad attacks twice with its necrotic touch or chill touch.

entries.name: Necrotic Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the lampad's next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the lampad until the end of the lampad's next turn.

entries.name: Aura of Menace
entries.description: As long as the archon doesn't have the incapacitated condition, each creature of the archon's choice that starts its turn within Close of the archon must make a Presence Reaction Roll (11). On a failed save, the creature has the frightened condition until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to all archons' Aura of Menace for 24 hours.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The archon sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The archon can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it takes 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The archon makes two Radiant Strike attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Teleport.

entries.name: Radiant Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The archon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: detect evil and good1/day: aid

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The archon teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within Very Far of itself.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mimic makes three attacks: two with its pseudopods and one with its bite.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +1, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Metal Immunity
entries.description: The lava child can move through metal without hindrance, and it has advantage on attack rolls against any creature wearing metal armor or using a metal shield.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lava child makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lawmage is an 8th-level Azorius spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The lawmage has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, friends, light, message1st level (4 slots): alarm, expeditious retreat, shield2nd level (3 slots): arcane lock, detect thoughts, hold person3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, dispel magic, slow4th level (2 slots): locate creature, stoneskin

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Elusive
entries.description: No attack roll has advantage against Lazav unless he is incapacitated.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Lazav's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (20)). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: detect thoughts, encode thoughts (see chapter 2), freedom of movement, vicious mockery (4d4 psychic damage)3/day each: blur, confusion, mirror image1/day each: modify memory, Rary's telepathic bond

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Lazav fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Psychic Defenses
entries.description: Unless Lazav is incapacitated, he is immune to magic that allows other creatures to read his thoughts, determine whether he is lying, know his alignment, or know his creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with Lazav only if he allows it.

entries.name: Shapechanger Savant
entries.description: Lazav can use a bonus action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid he has seen. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Lazav makes three shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before Lazav's next turn.

entries.name: Hellish Restoration
entries.description: If the lemure dies in the Nine Hells, it revives with all its Hit Points in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a creature under the effects of a Bless spell or its remains are sprinkled with Holy Water.

entries.name: Vile Slime
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the leonin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails. It can't use this trait if it's incapacitated.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The leonin's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: banishment, detect evil and good

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the leonin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The leonin makes three weapon attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Industrious
entries.description: The leprechaun is proficient with all artisan's tools and adds double its proficiency bonus to ability checks made with them.

entries.name: Reluctant Refusal
entries.description: When a creature offers the leprechaun the chance to partake in merriment or revelry such as a song, a dance, or a good meal, the leprechaun must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or have the charmed condition for 24 hours. While charmed in this way, the leprechaun partakes of the offering, treats the creature as a trusted friend, and seeks to defend it from harm. The charmed condition ends if the creature or any of its allies damage the leprechaun, force the leprechaun to make a saving throw, or steal from the leprechaun.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The leprechaun makes two Cobbler's Hammer attacks and can use Spellcasting.

entries.name: Cobbler's Hammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) force damage. If the target is a creature, its speed is halved until the start of the leprechaun's next turn.

entries.name: Gift of Luck (1/Day)
entries.description: The leprechaun touches a creature and magically gifts the target a measure of luck. The creature gains the leprechaun's Astonishing Luck reaction. The creature can use the reaction three times, after which this gift goes away. The leprechaun can revoke this gift from a creature at any time (no action required). A creature can benefit from only one leprechaun's Gift of Luck at a time.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The leprechaun casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Mending (as an action), Prestidigitation2/day each: Invisibility, Phantasmal Force1/day each: Fabricate (as an action), Mislead

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The dragon has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Cataclysmic Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a wave of ghostly purple flames in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature dies if the breath reduces it to 0 hit points. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by the breath's damage, as well as every corpse of such a creatures within the cone, becomes a zombie (see the Monster Manual) under the dragon's control. The zombie acts on the dragon's initiative but immediately after the dragon's turn. Absent any other command, the zombie tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: The mummy wears a ring of fire resistance.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mummy lord has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within Very Close of the mummy lord's heart.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mummy can use its Dreadful Glare and makes one attack with its rotting fist.

entries.name: Rotting Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or be cursed with mummy rot. The cursed target can't regain hit points, and its hit point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) for every 24 hours that elapse. If the curse reduces the target's hit point maximum to 0, the target dies, and its body turns to dust. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or other magic.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: The mummy lord targets one creature it can see within Far of it. If the target can see the mummy lord, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) against this magic or become frightened until the end of the mummy's next turn. If the target fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Dreadful Glare of all mummies and mummy lords for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Aberrant Rejuvenation
entries.description: When the emissary drops to 0 hit points, its body melts away. A greater star spawn emissary instantly appears in an unoccupied space within Far of where the lesser emissary disappeared. The greater emissary uses the lesser emissary's initiative count.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the emissary fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The emissary doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The emissary makes three attacks.

entries.name: Lashing Maw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Psychic Orb
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) psychic damage.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The emissary polymorphs into a Small or Medium creature of its choice or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The leucrotta can mimic Beast sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations only with a successful Difficulty (14) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature other than a leucrotta or gnoll that starts its turn within Very Close of the leucrotta must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all leucrottas for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The leucrotta makes one Bite attack and one Hooves attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the leucrotta scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the leviathan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Partial Freeze
entries.description: If the leviathan takes 50 cold damage or more during a single turn, the leviathan partially freezes; until the end of its next turn, its speeds are reduced to Close, and it makes attack rolls with disadvantage.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The leviathan deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Water Form
entries.description: The leviathan can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The leviathan makes one Slam attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) acid damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Tidal Wave (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The leviathan magically creates a wave of water that extends from a point it can see within Very Far of itself. The wave is up to Very Far long, up to Very Far tall, and up to Far wide. Each creature in the wave must make a Strength Reaction Roll (24). On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (7d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within Very Far of it, and then it vanishes.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Spirit Jar
entries.description: If destroyed, the lich reforms in 1d10 days if it has a spirit jar, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the lich's lair.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lich makes three attacks, using Eldritch Burst or Paralyzing Touch in any combination.

entries.name: Eldritch Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) Force damage.

entries.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) Cold damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the lich's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lich casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic, Fireball (level 5 version), Invisibility, Lightning Bolt (level 5 version), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation2/day each: Animate Dead, Dimension Door, Plane Shift1/day each: Chain Lightning, Finger of Death, Power Word Kill, Scrying

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the lich fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within Very Close of the phylactery.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lich makes four attacks.

entries.name: Poisonous Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 17 (5d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (19) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lich casts one of the following spells using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save Difficulty (19)):At will: druidcraft3/day each: detect magic, fog cloud, pass without trace1/day each: antilife shell, dispel magic, speak with plants, transport via plants

entries.name: Wither
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fire Storm (7th-Level Spell; 1/Day)
entries.description: The lich fills up to ten Very Close cubes with fire. Every cube must be within Very Far of the lich and occupy a space the lich can see, and each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19), taking 38 (7d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If the lich chooses, plant life in the area is unaffected by the spell.

entries.name: Light Absorption
entries.description: If the light devourer spends any part of its turn in an area of bright light or is subjected to radiant damage, it radiates dim light in a Very Close radius for 1 hour.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The light devourer can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The light devourer makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) piercing damage, or radiant damage if the light devourer is radiating light (see Light Absorption).

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.The golem's creator, if within Far of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The lightning hulk sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Lightning Form
entries.description: The lightning hulk can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time the lightning hulk enters a creature's space on a turn, or if it begins its turn in a creature's space, that creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. The hulk can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing. A creature that touches the lightning hulk or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage.

entries.name: Arc Lightning
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn, and lightning jumps from the target to another creature of the lightning hulk's choice that it can see within Close of the target. The second creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (18) or take 18 (4d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The lion has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: With a Very Close running start, the lion can Long Jump up to Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lion makes two Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Roar.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Roar
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), one creature within Close. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of the lion's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The liondrake makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood-Chilling Roar (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The liondrake lets out a terrifying roar audible out to Very Far. Any creature within Close of the liondrake that can hear its roar must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be frightened of the liondrake for 1 minute. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also paralyzed for the same duration. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this liondrake's Blood-Chilling Roar for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Force Fist
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the living spell can move it up to Very Close and move with it, without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Grasping Hand
entries.description: The living spell attempts to grab a Huge or smaller creature within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (15) or be grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The living spell can grapple only one creature at a time and can't use Force Fist until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unfettered
entries.description: The living spell can move through any barrier, even a wall of magical force.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Force Blade
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d12) force damage, unless the living spell rolled an 18 or higher on the d20 for the attack, in which case the attack is a critical hit that deals 78 (12d12) force damage instead.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magical Strike
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) fire damage.

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The living spell unleashes a thin sheet of flames in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

entries.name: Magical Strike
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) poison damage.

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The living spell creates a Far-diameter sphere of fog within Far of it (the fog spreads around corners). When a creature enters the fog for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 22 (5d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.The fog moves Very Close away from the living spell at the start of each of its turns, rolling along the ground and through openings. The fog lasts for 10 minutes or until the living spell's concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

entries.name: Dimensional Form
entries.description: The living spell can enter another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. The living spell can't detach from a solid surface, such as a wall, ceiling, or floor. If it has no surface to attach to, the living spell is destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

entries.name: Extradimensional Chamber
entries.description: When the living spell enters another creature's space (or vice versa) for the first time on a turn, the other creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (10) or be pulled into the living spell's extradimensional space, an unfurnished stone chamber Close in every dimension. A creature too big to fit in this space succeeds on the saving throw automatically. Creatures in the chamber never run out of breathable air. Magic that enables transit between planes, such as plane shift, can be used to escape the chamber, which has no exits otherwise.
