Creatures trapped inside the extradimensional chamber can't see, target, or deal damage to the living spell; however, they can damage the room around them. Each Very Close-square section of ceiling, wall, and floor in the chamber has AC 17, 50 hit points, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage that is nonmagical. If any section is reduced to 0 hit points, the living spell and its chamber are destroyed (see "Planar Destruction" below).

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Planar Destruction
entries.description: The living spell is destroyed when it or a Very Close-square section of its extradimensional chamber is reduced to 0 hit points, or when the living spell has no surface to attach to. When the living spell is destroyed, the contents of its extradimensional chamber are expelled, appearing as close to the living spell's previous location as possible. Each expelled creature appears in a randomly determined unoccupied space, along with whatever it is wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The living spell doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the doll is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the doll move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the doll is animate.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The doll regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If the doll takes fire or psychic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the doll's next turn. The doll is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The doll doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Grabby Hands
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (6)) and takes 11 (2d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until this grapple ends. The doll can grapple only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes two attacks: one with its blade and one with its hammer.

entries.name: Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Hammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Whirl (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The statue can use its action to spin at the waist, targeting creatures of its choice within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 19 (3d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

entries.name: Magical Strike
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) lightning damage.

entries.name: Spell Mimicry (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The living spell unleashes a stroke of lightning in a line Far long and Very Close wide. Each creature in the line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Brilliance (True Form Only)
entries.description: The living portent sheds bright light for Close and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The living portent makes two Radiant Strike attacks.

entries.name: Radiant Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) radiant damage.

entries.name: Prophetic Blessing
entries.description: The living portent magically infuses the power of its prophecy into another willing creature the living portent can see within Close of itself. The target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 7 (1d8 + 3), and it gains a prophecy die, a d8. Once during each of the creature's turns, when it fails an ability check or saving throw or misses an attack roll, it can roll the prophecy die and add the number rolled to the total, potentially changing the outcome. The blessing ends after 1 hour or when the living portent ends the blessing (no action required) or uses this action again.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The living portent casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:2/day: Cure Wounds1/day each: Divination, Greater Restoration

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The unseen servant is invisible.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The lizard can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lizardfolk makes two Earth Burst attacks.

entries.name: Earth Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hail of Stone (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close-radius, Far-high Cylinder centered on a point the lizardfolk can see within Far. Failure: 15 (6d4) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The lizardfolk casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: Elementalism1/day each: Meld into Stone, Speak with Plants, Spike Growth

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The render has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The render can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The render makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its bite.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Rend the Field (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The render makes a claw attack against each creature of its choice within Very Close of it. A creature hit by this attack must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The scaleshield can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scaleshield makes two melee attacks, each one with a different weapon.

entries.name: Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spiked Shield
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lizardfolk makes one Bite attack and one Earthen Maul attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature that isn't a Construct or an Undead, the lizardfolk gains Temporary Hit Points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Earthen Maul
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The subchief can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The subchief is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): command, guiding bolt, purify food and drink2nd level (3 slots): hold person, lesser restoration, silence3rd level (2 slots): bestow curse, dispel magic

entries.name: Tooth Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Jaws of Semuanya (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The subchief invokes the primal magic of Semuanya, summoning a spectral maw around a target it can see within Far of it. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 22 (5d8) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is also frightened until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The lizardfolk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The lizardfolk makes one Bite attack and one Bone Pike attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Bone Pike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Poison Spit
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) Poison damage.

entries.name: Leviathan Will
entries.description: The locathah has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, stunned, or put to sleep.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The locathah can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The locathah makes two melee attacks with its spear.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Leviathan Will
entries.description: The hunter has advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that control its actions.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The hunter can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hunter makes two attacks with its envenomed crossbow.

entries.name: Envenomed Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Psychic Leech
entries.description: At the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Thrives on Company
entries.description: The sorrowsworn has advantage on attack rolls while it is within Close of at least two other creatures. It otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sorrowsworn makes one Harpoon Arm attack, and it uses Sorrowful Embrace.

entries.name: Harpoon Arm
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Far, one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)) if it is a Large or smaller creature. The sorrowsworn has two harpoon arms and can grapple up to two creatures at once.

entries.name: Sorrowful Embrace
entries.description: Each creature grappled by the sorrowsworn must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15), taking 18 (4d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In either case, the sorrowsworn pulls each of those creatures up to Close straight toward it.

entries.name: Detect Life
entries.description: The banshee can magically sense the presence of living creatures up to 5 miles away that aren't undead or constructs. She knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The banshee can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 (1d10) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

entries.name: Spectral Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Horrifying Visage
entries.description: Each non-undead creature within Far of the banshee that can see her must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the banshee is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the banshee's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Wail (1/Day)
entries.description: The banshee releases a mournful wail, provided that she isn't in sunlight. This wail has no effect on constructs and undead. All other creatures within Close of her that can hear her must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failure, a creature drops to 0 hit points. On a success, a creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The guard has advantage on saving throws against poison.

entries.name: Halberd
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

entries.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries.description: The spy deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within Very Close of an ally of the spy that isn't incapacitated and the spy doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spy makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Scroll Bash
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage.

entries.name: Reduce to Memory (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Thundering golden energy erupts around a creature the apprentice can see within Far of it. The creature must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 33 (6d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has disadvantage on the saving throw.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: guidance, light1/day each: comprehend languages, locate object, mage armor

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The pledgemage makes two Scroll Bash attacks.

entries.name: Scroll Bash
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) thunder damage.

entries.name: Reduce to Memory (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Thundering golden energy erupts around a creature the pledgemage can see within Far of it. The creature must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13), taking 44 (8d10) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Construct has disadvantage on the saving throw.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The pledgemage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: guidance, light2/day each: comprehend languages, locate object1/day each: mage armor, speak with dead, stone shape

entries.name: Voice from the Past (1/Day)
entries.description: The professor can cast the contact other plane spell to contact a long-dead spirit, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Spectral Scroll attacks. It can also use Weight of History, if available.

entries.name: Spectral Scroll
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: comprehend languages, dancing lights, guidance2/day each: locate object, mage armor, passwall

entries.name: Weight of History (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The professor magically compresses time around up to six creatures of its choice that it can see within Close of itself. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be restrained for 1 minute, but the restrained target's speed is halved instead of being reduced to 0. At the start of each of its turns, the restrained target takes 4 (1d8) force damage. A restrained target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Voice from the Past (1/Day)
entries.description: The professor can cast the contact other plane spell to contact a long-dead spirit, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Repelling Burst attacks. It can also use Force Barrier, if available.

entries.name: Repelling Burst
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) force damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be pushed up to Very Close directly away from the professor and become restrained until the start of professor's next turn.

entries.name: Force Barrier (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The professor magically creates a wall of translucent, golden force within Far of itself. The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the professor uses this action again. The barrier can be a vertical or horizontal plane up to Close on a side or a Very Close-radius hemispherical dome with a floor. The wall provides total cover. It has AC 17, 30 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: comprehend languages, guidance, light2/day each: dimension door, locate object, mage armor, stone shape

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Stone Sword or Boulder in any combination.

entries.name: Stone Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Close. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +8, range Far. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sorrowsworn makes two Arm Spike attacks.

entries.name: Arm Spike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Embrace (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is frightened, and it takes 27 (6d8) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns. The sorrowsworn can grapple only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The loup garou has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: When the loup garou fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The loup garou regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the loup garou takes damage from a silver weapon, this trait doesn't function at the start of the loup garou's next turn. The loup garou dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The loup garou makes two attacks: two with its Longsword (humanoid form) or one with its Bite and one with its Claws (dire wolf or hybrid form).

entries.name: Bite (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or be cursed with loup garou lycanthropy.

entries.name: Claws (Dire Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Longsword (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a blast of frost in a Close cone. Each creature in the cone must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the creature takes 13 (3d8) cold damage, and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the lycanthropickle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a pickle.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes two Thunderbolt attacks and uses Spellcasting.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The scion casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Elementalism, Gust of Wind, Thunderwave

entries.name: Thunderbolt
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Lightning damage plus 9 (2d8) Thunder damage. Critical Hit: The creature also has the Deafened condition for 1 minute.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The maelephant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The maelephant makes one Barbed Trunk attack and two Glaive attacks.

entries.name: Barbed Trunk
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. While it is grappling a creature, the maelephant can't use its barbed trunk to attack other creatures.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Mind Poison (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The maelephant expels poisonous gas from its trunk in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 39 (6d12) poison damage and has the poisoned condition. While poisoned in this way, the creature loses all weapon and skill proficiencies, it can't cast spells, it can't understand language, and it has disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only and is immune to this maelephant's Mind Poison for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mage makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) Force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Magic, Light, Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation2/day each: Fireball (level 4 version), Invisibility1/day each: Cone of Cold, Fly

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) Force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Mage Hand, Prestidigitation1/day each: Disguise Self, Ice Knife, Mage Armor (included in AC), Thunderwave

entries.name: Magic Sense
entries.description: The hunter knows the location of every spellcaster, active spell, and magic item within Very Far of itself.

entries.name: Spider Climb (Hunter Form Only)
entries.description: The hunter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack (Hunter Form Only)
entries.description: The hunter makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw (Hunter Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the hunter can't make a Tail attack against another target.

entries.name: Mage Tracker (Sentry Form Only)
entries.description: The hunter emits a pulse of energy that helps it better locate its magical quarry. Each creature within Very Far of the hunter that has the ability to cast spells must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be mystically marked by the hunter for 1 hour.While marked, a creature can't become hidden from the hunter and gains no benefit from the invisible condition against the hunter. Additionally, while a marked creature is on the same plane of existence as the hunter, the hunter always knows the distance and direction to the creature.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: Light, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion1/day each: Charm Person, Disguise Self, Silent Image

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The magewright's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12)). To cast one of its rituals, the magewright must provide additional material components whose value in gold pieces is 20 times the spell's level. These components are consumed when the ritual is finished. The magewright knows the following spells:At will: mage hand, prestidigitationRituals: knock

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The mephit explodes when it dies. Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the mephit. Failure: 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The magmin explodes when it dies. Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the magmin. Failure: 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object that isn't being worn or carried, it starts burning.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Malaxxix fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Malaxxix has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Malaxxix makes two Forge Hammer or Whip attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Forge Hammer
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of Malaxxix's next turn. Hit or Miss: The hammer then magically returns to Malaxxix's hand.

entries.name: Whip
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, and the target has the restrained condition for 1 minute. The restrained target can make a Strength Reaction Roll (20) at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Only one creature can be restrained by the whip at a time.

entries.name: Mezzoloth Vortex (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Malaxxix summons a vortex of whirling mezzoloths at a point it can see within Far of itself. The vortex is a Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on that point. Each creature other than Malaxxix in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, a creature takes 35 (10d6) force damage and has the restrained condition while within the cylinder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder. The vortex lasts until the start of Malaxxix's next turn.

entries.name: Extraordinary Leap
entries.description: The distance of the steeder's long jumps is tripled; every foot of its walking speed that it spends on the jump allows it to jump Melee.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The steeder can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Sticky Leg
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one Small or Tiny creature. Hit: The target is stuck to the steeder's leg and grappled (escape Difficulty (12)). The steeder can have only one creature grappled at a time.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The kraken can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The kraken makes three tentacle attacks. One of them can be replaced with a bite attack, and any of them can be replaced with Fling.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d6 + 7) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Fling
entries.description: One Medium or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken's tentacles is thrown up to Far in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every Very Close it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (16) or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Lightning Storm
entries.description: The kraken creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within Very Far of it. A target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mammoth makes two Gore attacks.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) Piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature and the mammoth moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (2d4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Contortionist
entries.description: The manes can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Sickening Vapors
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the manes at the end of the manes's turn. Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this manes's Sickening Vapors for 24 hours.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Slashing damage plus 5 (2d4) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The manticore makes three attacks, using Rend or Tail Spike in any combination.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail Spike
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Attractive Pollen (1/Day)
entries.description: When the mantrap detects any creatures nearby, it can use its reaction to release pollen out to a radius of Close. Any beast or humanoid within the area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be forced to use all its movement on its turns to get as close to the the mantrap as possible. An affected target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the mantrap remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary tropical plant.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: The target is trapped inside the mantrap's leafy jaws. While trapped in this way, the target is blinded and restrained, has total cover from an attacks and other effects outside the mantrap, and takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the target's turns. If the mantrap dies, the creature inside it is no longer restrained by it. A mantrap can engulf only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The marid can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Elemental Restoration
entries.description: If the marid dies outside the Elemental Plane of Water, its body dissolves into brine, and it gains a new body in 1d4 days, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere on the Plane of Water.

entries.name: Wishes
entries.description: The marid has a 30 percent chance of knowing the Wish spell. If the marid knows it, the marid can cast it only on behalf of a non-genie creature who communicates a wish in a way the marid can understand. If the marid casts the spell for the creature, the marid suffers none of the spell's stress. Once the marid has cast it three times, the marid can't do so again for 365 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The marid makes three Aquatic Lash attacks.

entries.name: Aquatic Lash
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Close. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Cold damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The marid casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Create or Destroy Water, Detect Evil and Good, Detect Magic, Purify Food and Drink1/day each: Control Water, Gaseous Form, Invisibility, Plane Shift, Tongues

entries.name: Water Jet
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Far-long, Very Close-wide Line. Failure: 31 (9d6) Cold damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is pushed up to Close straight away from the marid and has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the marilith dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The marilith has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Reactive
entries.description: The marilith can take one Reaction on every turn of combat.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The marilith makes six Pact Blade attacks and uses Constrict.

entries.name: Pact Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (17), one Medium or smaller creature the marilith can see within Very Close. Failure: 15 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The adept makes three Unarmed Strike attacks or five Dart attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. Once per turn, the adept can cause one of the following additional effects (choose one or roll a d4):1–2: Knock Down. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.3–4: Push. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be pushed up to Very Close directly away from the adept.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The marut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the marut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The marut has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The marut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The marut makes two Unerring Slam attacks.

entries.name: Plane Shift (3/Day)
entries.description: The marut casts plane shift, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability. The marut can cast the spell normally, or it can cast the spell on an unwilling creature it can see within Far of it. If it uses the latter option, the targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (20) or be banished to a teleportation circle in the Hall of Concordance in Sigil.

entries.name: Unerring Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: automatic hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 60 force damage, and the target is pushed up to Very Close away from the marut if it is Huge or smaller.

entries.name: Blazing Edict (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Arcane energy emanates from the marut's chest in a Far cube. Every creature in that area takes 45 radiant damage. Each creature that takes any of this damage must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (20) or be stunned until the end of the marut's next turn.

entries.name: Overheat
entries.description: When the maschin-i-bozorg is reduced to 0 hit points, its power source overloads, briefly superheating its outer shell. Each creature within Very Close of the maschin-i-bozorg must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The maschin-i-bozorg makes two Poison Jab attacks.

entries.name: Poison Jab
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or have the poisoned condition for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Steam Jet (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The maschin-i-bozorg emits scalding steam in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Lightning Eruption (3/Day)
entries.description: The sage creates an eruption of magical lightning centered on a point it can see within Very Far of it. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks):At will: light, mage hand, mending, prestidigitation3/day each: comprehend languages, detect magic, dispel magic, identify, levitate, locate object, Tenser's Floating Disk, unseen servant1/day each: banishment, contact other plane, Drawmij's instant summons, legend lore, locate creature, planar binding, polymorph, protection from evil and good, scrying, sending, true seeing

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the thief is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the thief instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided the thief isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The thief makes three Shortsword or Shortbow attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Aura of Blood Lust
entries.description: When any other creature starts its turn within Close of the master, that creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17), or it must immediately take the Attack action, making one melee attack against a random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, it makes a ranged attack against a random creature within range, throwing its weapon if necessary.

entries.name: Feed on the Crowd
entries.description: Whenever a creature within Far of the master dies, the master gains 15 temporary hit points and has advantage on all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The master's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (17)). The master can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: charm person (as a 3rd-level spell), crown of madness1/day: dominate person

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The master has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The master makes two melee attacks with its spear.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Captivating Presence (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Each creature within Very Far of the master must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or be charmed by the master for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, a creature's speed is 0. If the charmed creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A target that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Captivating Presence of all masters of cruelties for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Grave Magic
entries.description: When the master of souls cast a spell that deals damage, it can change the spell's damage type to necrotic.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The master of souls is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): chill touch (see "Actions" below), mage hand, message, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): burning hands, detect magic, ray of sickness (see "Actions" below), shield2nd level (3 slots): darkness, misty step, scorching ray (see "Actions" below)3rd level (2 slots): animate dead, fireball

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The master of souls attacks twice with its flail.

entries.name: Silvered Skull Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of the master of souls' next turn.

entries.name: Chill Touch (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the master of souls' next turn. If the target is undead, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the master of souls for the same duration.

entries.name: Ray of Sickness (1st-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be poisoned until the end of the master of souls' next turn. If the master of souls casts this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

entries.name: Scorching Ray (2nd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target per ray (3 rays if a 2nd-level spell slot is used, 4 rays if a 3rd-level spell slot is used). Hit: 7 (2d6) fire damage per ray.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Assume Form
entries.description: The maurezhi can assume the appearance of any Medium Humanoid it eats. It remains in this form for 1d6 days, during which time the form gradually decays until, when the effect ends, the form sloughs from the demon's body.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The maurezhi has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The maurezhi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, its Charisma score is reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if this reduces its Charisma to 0. It rises 24 hours later as a ghoul unless it has been revived or its corpse has been destroyed.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an Undead, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Raise Ghoul (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The maurezhi targets one dead ghoul or ghast it can see within Close of it. The target is revived with all its hit points.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Disgorge (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The demon vomits in a Close cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (11) or take 11 (2d10) acid damage and fall prone in the spew.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The maw has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The maw makes two Bite or Fang Fling attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fang Fling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gorging Charge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The maw moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can move through the spaces of Large or smaller creatures. Each time the maw enters a creature's space for the first time during this move, that creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or take 25 (3d12 + 6) piercing damage and have the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)); if a creature is already grappled this way, it has the prone condition. Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition. The maw can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Garrote
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target of the meazel's size or smaller. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (13) with disadvantage). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the meazel's turns. The meazel can't make weapon attacks while grappling a creature in this way.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage

entries.name: Shadow Teleport (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The meazel, any equipment it is wearing or carrying, and any creature it is grappling teleport to an unoccupied space within Out of Range of it, provided that the starting space and the destination are in dim light or darkness. The destination must be a place the meazel has seen before, but it need not be within line of sight. If the destination space is occupied, the teleportation leads to the nearest unoccupied space.Any other creature the meazel teleports becomes cursed for 1 hour or until the curse is ended by remove curse or greater restoration. Until this curse ends, every Undead and every creature native to the Shadowfell within Very Far of the cursed creature can sense it, which prevents that creature from hiding from them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Horns
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon head exhales fire in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 31 (7d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d3) piercing damage, and the bird is destroyed by the impact.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The inquisitive makes three Crooked Staff attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Inquisitive Eye.

entries.name: Crooked Staff
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition. If the target already has the Prone condition, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Inquisitive Eye
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (13), one creature the inquisitive can see within Far. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target is marked. The inquisitive has Advantage on attack rolls against a target it has marked. While marked, the target can't become hidden from the inquisitive, and if it has the Invisible condition, it gains no benefit from that condition against the inquisitive. The mark disappears after 1 minute or when the inquisitive uses this action again. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The inquisitive casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At Will : Guidance1/day each: Detect Thoughts, See Invisibility

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within Close of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) if the medusa isn't incapacitated and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within Close of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The medusa makes either three melee attacks—one with its snake hair, one to constrict, and one with its shortsword—or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

entries.name: Snake Hair
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (11)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the medusa can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The medusa makes two Claw attacks and one Snake Hair attack, or it makes three Poison Ray attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Snake Hair
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Poison Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Very Far. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Poison damage.

entries.name: Fear Aura
entries.description: Any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within Very Close of the meenlock must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be frightened until the start of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: While in bright light, the meenlock has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The megapede makes one Bite attack and uses either Life Drain or Psychic Bomb.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: The megapede magically drains life energy from other creatures nearby. Each creature within Close of the megapede must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Psychic Bomb
entries.description: The megapede targets one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, the target takes 22 (5d8) psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hoplite is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)1st level (4 slots): color spray, expeditious retreat, sleep2nd level (2 slots): blur, cloud of daggers, invisibility

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hoplite makes three weapon attacks. It can replace one weapon attack with ray of frost.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Ray of Frost (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the start of the hoplite's next turn.

entries.name: Damage Transfer
entries.description: While it is grappling a creature, the memory web takes only half the damage dealt to it, and the creature grappled by the web takes the other half.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the memory web is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the memory web move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the memory web is animate.

entries.name: Memory Flood
entries.description: When the memory web is reduced to 0 hit points, it discharges any memories it consumed over the past 24 hours in a telepathic deluge. Hazy, dreamlike visions of these discharged memories lodge in the minds of creatures up to Very Far from the memory web.

entries.name: Ensnare
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: The target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition and takes 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The memory web can grapple only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Mercane Telepathy
entries.description: The mercane can communicate telepathically with any other mercane it knows, regardless of the distance between them.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mercane makes three Psi-Imbued Blade attacks.

entries.name: Psi-Imbued Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be frightened of the mercane until the end of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The mercane casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, light1/day each: dimension door, invisibility, mage armor (self only)

entries.name: Portal Sense
entries.description: The bloodhound can sense the presence of portals within Close of itself, including inactive portals, and instinctively knows the destination of each portal.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bloodhound makes three Clawed Gauntlet attacks.

entries.name: Clawed Gauntlet
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The salvager can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The salvager makes two attacks with its coral rapier.

entries.name: Coral Rapier
entries.description: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Inject Toxin (2/Day)
entries.description: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage, and the creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merfolk scout can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Ocean Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 3 (1d6) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Cold damage. If the target is a creature, its Speed decreases by Very Close until the end of its next turn. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the merfolk's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merfolk makes two Aquatic Burst attacks.

entries.name: Aquatic Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) Cold damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The merfolk casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Elementalism, Light1/day each: Control Water, Create or Destroy Water

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the merregon's darkvision.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The merregon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merregon makes three Halberd attacks.

entries.name: Halberd
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The merrenoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merrenoloth makes one Oar attack and uses Fear Gaze.

entries.name: Oar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) fire damage.

entries.name: Fear Gaze
entries.description: The merrenoloth targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or become frightened of the merrenoloth for 1 minute. The frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The merrenoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: charm person, darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, gust of wind3/day: control water

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merrow makes two attacks, using Bite, Claw, or Harpoon in any combination.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the merrow's next turn.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Harpoon
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the merrow pulls the target up to Close straight toward itself.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The merrow can mimic voices and animal sounds. A creature that hears the mimicries can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merrow makes three Spined Tail attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with a use of Spellcasting to cast Command.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The merrow casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Command, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion

entries.name: Spined Tail
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merrow makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The merrow makes three attacks, using Coral Scepter and Poisoned Longbow in any combination.

entries.name: Coral Scepter
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Poisoned Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Very Far. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Invective
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (15), up to three creatures the merrow can see within Far. Failure: 14 (4d6) Psychic damage, and the creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of the merrow's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The merrow is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). The merrow has the following druid spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, minor illusion, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): cure wounds, fog cloud, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): hold person, mirror image, misty step3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, lightning bolt (see "Actions" below), sleet storm

entries.name: Harpoon
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the merrow can pull it Very Close closer.

entries.name: Lightning Bolt (3rd-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries.description: The merrow unleashes a stroke of lightning in a line Far long and Very Close wide. Each creature in the line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The peacekeeper is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the peacekeeper is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The peacekeeper makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Calming Mist (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The peacekeeper releases a calming gas in a Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or become charmed by the peacekeeper for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The warbler is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the warbler is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Calming Mist (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The warbler releases a calming gas in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or become charmed by the warbler for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

entries.name: Fiendish Restoration
entries.description: If the mezzoloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mezzoloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mezzoloth makes two attacks, using Claws or Mercurial Trident in any combination.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from two of four claws, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Mercurial Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The trident magically returns to the mezzoloth's claw immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mezzoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):1/day each: Cloudkill, Darkness, Dispel Magic

entries.name: Immutable Existence
entries.description: The servant is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form or send it to another plane of existence.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The servant has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks made against it have disadvantage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The servant regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If it is reduced to 0 hit points, this trait doesn't function until an attuned creature spends 24 hours repairing the artifact or until the artifact is subjected to lightning damage.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The servant's long jump is up to Far and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The servant doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Destructive Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage. If the target is an object, it takes triple damage.

entries.name: Crushing Leap
entries.description: If the servant jumps at least Close as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures is pushed to an unoccupied space within Very Close of the servant and must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, a creature takes 26 (4d12) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.
