entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have Disadvantage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5 (with Advantage if the target is Grappled by the mimic), reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage—or 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage if the target is Grappled by the mimic—plus 4 (1d8) Acid damage.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) Acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have Disadvantage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (10)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The vampire's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: message3/day each: charm person, hold person, mirror image, sleep1/day each: gaseous form, major image

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the vampire can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the vampire has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The vampire can also grapple the target (escape Difficulty (13)) if it is a creature and the vampire has a hand free.

entries.name: Mind Siphon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The vampire targets a creature it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (14), with disadvantage if the vampire has previously consumed the target's blood. On a failed save, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage, and the vampire discerns the target's surface emotions and thoughts. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the vampire discerns the target's general emotional state but not its thoughts.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mind flayer has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Thoughts1/day each: Dominate Monster, Plane Shift (self only)

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) Psychic damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from all the mind flayer's tentacles, and the target has the Stunned condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (15), one creature that is Grappled by the mind flayer's Tentacles. Failure: 55 (10d10) Piercing damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the mind flayer kills it and devours its brain.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 31 (6d8 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the end of the mind flayer's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mind flayer has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mind flayer makes three Arcane Tentacles attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Tentacles
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) Psychic damage, and the mind flayer can teleport the target up to Close to an unoccupied space the mind flayer can see on a surface or liquid large enough to support the target. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the mind flayer kills it and magically devours its brain.

entries.name: Mind Burst (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Far Emanation originating from the mind flayer. Failure: 41 (8d8 + 5) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the end of the mind flayer's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Disguise Self, Mage Hand (the hand is Invisible)1/day each: Clairvoyance, Dimension Door, Fireball (level 5 version), Lightning Bolt (level 5 version), Plane Shift (self only), Sending

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the mind flayer fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mind flayer makes two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or have the incapacitated condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated Humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills it by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, mage hand (the hand is invisible)3/day each: clairvoyance (as an action), dispel magic1/day: plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Unleash Void (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mind flayer opens a rift into the Far Realm, centered on a point the mind flayer can see within Far of itself, and a tentacle lashes across creatures near the rift. Each creature other than mind flayers within Close of the rift must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (17), after which the tentacle disappears and the rift closes. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) cold damage from the rift plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage from the tentacle and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The nothic has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nothic makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The nothic magically emits psychic energy in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (12) or take 10 (2d8 + 1) psychic damage and have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Weird Insight
entries.description: The nothic targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being charmed.

entries.name: Awareness
entries.description: The mind flayer has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised as long as it doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (16) or have the stunned condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one Humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills it by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Whip (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mind flayer lashes out with psychic energy, targeting up to two creatures it can see within Far of itself. Each target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (16) or take 23 (4d8 + 5) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The mind flayer casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only), true seeing

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The mind flayer is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (15); +7 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: guidance, mage hand, vicious mockery, true strike, detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, plane shift (self only)1st level (4 slots): charm person, command, comprehend languages, sanctuary2nd level (3 slots): crown of madness, phantasmal force, see invisibility3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, fear, meld into stone4th level (3 slots): confusion, stone shape5th level (2 slots): scrying, telekinesis

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mind flayer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) psychic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated humanoid grappled by the mind flayer. Hit: The target takes 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the mind flayer kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mind flayer magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or take 22 (4d8 + 4) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: The mage wears a spies' murmur (see chapter 5).

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The mage's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: encode thoughts (see chapter 2), friends3/day each: charm person, detect thoughts, mage armor, sleep, suggestion1/day each: dominate person, mass suggestion, modify memory

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The matter smith makes two Manifested Force attacks.

entries.name: Manifested Force
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The matter smith casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: mage armor, mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: create food and water, fabricate (as an action)

entries.name: Telepathic Hub
entries.description: When the mindwitness receives a telepathic message, it can telepathically share that message with up to seven other creatures within Out of Range of it that it can see.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mindwitness makes one Bite attack and one Tentacles attack, or it uses Eye Ray three times.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 20 (4d8 + 2) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)), and it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (13) or be restrained until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Eye Ray
entries.description: The mindwitness shoots one magical eye ray at random (roll a d6, and reroll if the ray has already been used this turn), choosing one target it can see within Very Far of it:1: Aversion Ray. The targeted creature must make a Presence Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.2: Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.3: Psychic Ray. The target must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (13) or take 27 (6d8) psychic damage.4: Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn but not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5: Stunning Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be stunned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.6: Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must make a Strength Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the mindwitness moves it up to Close in any direction, and it is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the mindwitness's next turn or until the mindwitness is incapacitated.If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is telekinetically moved up to Close in any direction. The mindwitness can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage. If the minotaur moved at least Very Close straight toward the target immediately before it hit, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) piercing damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (11) or be pushed up to Very Close from the minotaur and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage while enlarged. If the minotaur moved at least Very Close straight toward the target immediately before it hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) piercing damage, or 9 (2d8) piercing damage if the minotaur is enlarged. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be pushed up to Very Close from the minotaur and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Mattock
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 17 (2d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage while enlarged. If the target is a creature and the minotaur is enlarged, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: For 1 minute, the minotaur magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the minotaur is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the minotaur lacks the room to become Large, the minotaur doesn't change size.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes two attacks: one with its greataxe and one gore attack.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d12 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the skeleton moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Abyssal Glaive
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Gore (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature and the minotaur moved 10+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the mirror shade is within Very Close of a reflective surface—such as a mirror, glass pane, or still water—it has advantage on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the mirror shade move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the mirror shade isn't the creature's own reflection.

entries.name: Mirror Movement
entries.description: The mirror shade can move along the surface of reflective or translucent objects, such as mirrors, without provoking opportunity attacks. It can move through translucent objects as if they were difficult terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mirror shade makes two Phantasmal Strike attacks and uses Reflect Fear.

entries.name: Phantasmal Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) radiant damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Reflect Fear
entries.description: The mirror shade targets one creature it can see within Far of itself and projects an illusion of that creature's greatest fear. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage and has the frightened condition until the start of the mirror shade's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Air Form
entries.description: The mist hulk can enter another creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the mist hulk dies, it bursts in a wave of water. Each creature within Very Close of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mist hulk makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) cold damage.

entries.name: Hideous Wailing (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mist hulk releases a wail infused with magical anguish. Each creature within Close of it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (14). A creature in the mist hulk's space has disadvantage on the saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage and has the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the modron dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The modron makes two Clockwork Blade attacks.

entries.name: Clockwork Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The blade magically returns to the modron's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the modron dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Gear
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Gear Flinger
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the modron dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The modron makes five Slam attacks or five Electrical Discharge attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Electrical Discharge
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Paralysis Gas (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Constitution Saving Throws: Difficulty (11), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the incarnate fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The incarnate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The incarnate deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The incarnate makes two Slam or Energy Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) force damage.

entries.name: Energy Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 32 (5d12) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Planar Exhalation (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The incarnate exhales concentrated energy native to its plane in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (23). On a failed save, a creature takes 52 (8d12) necrotic damage, and the creature has the blinded condition until the end of the incarnate's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the modron dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The modron makes four Slam attacks or four Gears Launcher attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Gears Launcher
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Out of Range. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the modron dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The modron makes three Clockwork Spear attacks.

entries.name: Clockwork Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the modron's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Moloch fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Moloch has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Moloch regains 20 hit points at the start of his turn. If he takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of his next turn. Moloch dies only if he starts his turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Moloch makes one Bite attack, one Claw attack, and one Many-Tailed Whip attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) fire damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage.

entries.name: Many-Tailed Whip
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d4 + 8) lightning damage plus 11 (2d10) thunder damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (24) or be pulled up to Close in a straight line toward Moloch.

entries.name: Breath of Despair (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Moloch exhales in a Close cube. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (21) or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage, drop whatever it is holding, and become frightened of Moloch for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from Moloch by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the Dash action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to Moloch, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Moloch casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21)):At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing his appearance), confusion, detect magic, fly, major image, stinking cloud, suggestion, wall of fire

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Moloch teleports, along with any equipment he is wearing or carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied space he can see.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries.description: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a Difficulty (15) Strength check against it.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) fire damage.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Far, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) fire damage and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target. A creature takes 4 (1d8) fire damage each time it ends its turn grappled by the roper.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to Close straight toward it.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the molydeus fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The molydeus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The molydeus makes one Demonic Weapon attack, one Snakebite attack, and one Wolf Bite attack.

entries.name: Demonic Weapon
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) force damage. If the target has at least one head and the molydeus rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target is decapitated and dies if it can't survive without that head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has legendary actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra 27 (6d8) force damage from the hit.

entries.name: Snakebite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) poison damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (22), or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target transforms into a manes if this reduces its hit point maximum to 0. This transformation can be ended only by a wish spell.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The molydeus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (22)):At will: dispel magic, polymorph, telekinesis, teleport3/day: lightning bolt

entries.name: Wolf Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (3d10 + 9) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the high curator is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The high curator makes three Force Strike attacks and uses Brain Burn (if available).

entries.name: Force Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage.

entries.name: Brain Burn (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The high curator targets up to two creatures it can see within Close of itself. Each target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18). On a failed saving throw, the target takes 28 (8d6) psychic damage and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no other effect.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The high curator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: detect magic2/day each: detect thoughts, identify (as an action), scrying (as an action)

entries.name: Guarded Mind
entries.description: Spells and other effects can't read the infiltrator's thoughts or determine if the infiltrator is lying. Creatures can communicate telepathically with the infiltrator only if it allows such contact.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the infiltrator is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The infiltrator makes three Unarmed Strike attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The infiltrator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: disguise self2/day each: detect thoughts, invisibility1/day each: dimension door, zone of truth

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the operative is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The operative makes three Unarmed Strike attacks, three Cobalt Dart attacks, or a combination thereof.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Cobalt Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

entries.name: Extraordinary Feature
entries.description: The mongrelfolk has one of the following extraordinary features, determined randomly by rolling a d20 or chosen by the DM:1–3: Amphibious. The mongrelfolk can breathe air and water.4–9: Darkvision. The mongrelfolk has darkvision out to a range of Far.10: Flight. The mongrelfolk has leathery wings and a flying speed of Far.11–15: Keen Hearing and Smell. The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.16–17: Spider Climb. The mongrelfolk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.18–19: Standing Leap. The mongrelfolk's long jump is up to Close and its high jump up to Very Close, with or without a running start.20: Two-Headed. The mongrelfolk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The mongrelfolk can mimic any sounds it has heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (12) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mongrelfolk makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claw or dagger.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The peryton doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries.description: The peryton has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the peryton fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The peryton makes two attacks: one with its gore and one with its talons.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Warp Shadow
entries.description: The peryton chooses up to three creatures within Far of it that it can see. Each creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or become cursed. While cursed, whenever the creature makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, it must roll a d4 and subtract that number from the roll. A cursed creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this peryton's Warp Shadow for 24 hours.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The guardian is immune to any spell or other effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Radiant Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the guardian is subjected to radiant damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the radiant damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guardian makes two Moonlight Slam attacks.

entries.name: Moonlight Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

entries.name: Moonlight Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The guardian unleashes a magical blast of moonlight in a line Far long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). Creatures that aren't in their true form have disadvantage on the save. On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (5d8) radiant damage, and if it isn't in its true form, it is forced into its true form and can't change forms until the end of the guardian's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Silver Spear
entries.description: A character within Very Close of the shark can use an action to try to dislodge the spear, doing so with a successful Difficulty (13) Strength (Athletics) check. While the spear is lodged in the shark, the shark glows with silvery illumination, shedding bright light in a Very Close radius and dim light for an additional Very Close.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the shark misses, it can use a bonus action to swim up to Close. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:Dream Breath. The dragon exhales mist in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.Moonlight Breath. The dragon exhales a beam of moonlight in a Close line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The moorbounder's long jump is up to Far and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Mordakhesh's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks). Mordakhesh can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: chromatic orb (see "Actions" below), detect thoughts, disguise self1/day each: banishing smite, destructive wave, fly, mass suggestion, staggering smite, suggestion, true seeing

entries.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries.description: Mordakhesh can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless he wishes to be. Mordakhesh has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Mordakhesh makes three greatsword attacks.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Chromatic Orb
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The morkoth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The morkoth makes either two Bite attacks and one Tentacles attack or three Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The morkoth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect magic, mage hand3/day each: darkness, dimension door, dispel magic, lightning bolt, sending

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 15 (3d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the morkoth can't use its tentacles on another target.

entries.name: Hypnosis
entries.description: The morkoth projects a Close cone of magical energy. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the morkoth for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the target tries to get as close to the morkoth as possible, using its actions to Dash until it is within Very Close of the morkoth. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the morkoth's Hypnosis for 24 hours.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the goat moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The goat has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Mouth of Chaos
entries.description: The giant is immune to the confusion spell.On each of its turns, the giant uses all its movement to move toward the nearest creature or whatever else it might perceive as food. Roll a d10 at the start of each of the giant's turns to determine its action for that turn:1–3: The giant makes three Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.4–5: The giant makes one Fist attack against each creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant makes one Fist attack against itself.6–7: The giant makes one Bite attack against one random creature within reach. If no other creatures are within reach, its eyes glaze over and it is stunned until the start of its next turn.8–10: The giant makes one Bite attack and two Fist attacks against one random creature within reach. If no creatures are within reach, the giant flies into a rage and gains advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the giant magically regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The mud hulk can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing.

entries.name: Sticky Mud
entries.description: The ground within Close of the mud hulk is difficult terrain for other creatures.

entries.name: Enveloping Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be pulled into the mud hulk's space and be engulfed by the mud hulk. While engulfed, the target can't breathe, has the restrained condition, and takes 6 (1d12) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. When the mud hulk moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mud hulk can have only one target engulfed at a time. While a creature is engulfed, the mud hulk can't use its Amorphous trait.An engulfed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the target escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Mud Splash
entries.description: The mud hulk lobs a mass of mud that splashes in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on a point within Close of the mud hulk. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13), taking 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The affected area is difficult terrain until the start of the mud hulk's next turn.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The mephit explodes when it dies. Agility Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the mephit. Failure: The target has the Restrained condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Mud Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), one creature the mephit can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Restrained condition until the end of the mephit's next turn.

entries.name: Beast of Burden
entries.description: The mule counts as one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mummy makes two Rotting Fist attacks and uses Dreadful Glare.

entries.name: Rotting Fist
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, its Hit Point maximum doesn't return to normal when finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), one creature the mummy can see within Far. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of the mummy's next turn. Success: The target is immune to this mummy's Dreadful Glare for 24 hours.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the mummy fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mummy has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If destroyed, the mummy gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, reviving with all its Hit Points. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the mummy's lair. The heart is a Tiny object that has AC 17, HP 10, and Immunity to all damage except Fire.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mummy makes one Rotting Fist or Channel Negative Energy attack, and it uses Dreadful Glare.

entries.name: Rotting Fist
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed. While cursed, the target can't regain Hit Points, it gains no benefit from finishing a Long Rest, and its Hit Point maximum decreases by 10 (3d6) every 24 hours that elapse. A creature dies and turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack.

entries.name: Channel Negative Energy
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Far. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Dreadful Glare
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (17), one creature the mummy can see within Far. Failure: 25 (6d6 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the end of the mummy's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mummy casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17), +9 to hit with spell attacks):At will: Dispel Magic, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Animate Dead, Harm, Insect Plague (level 7 version)

entries.name: Explode
entries.description: When the comet drops to 0 hit points, it explodes in a Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in the sphere must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 28 (8d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The comet doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The comet sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The comet deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The comet doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The comet makes one Slam attack and one Spit Fire attack.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Spit Fire
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The musteval makes two Bone Blade attacks.

entries.name: Bone Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The musteval casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: dancing lights1/day each: disguise self, invisibility

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the myconid has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in sunlight.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d8) Bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (11), one creature the myconid can see within Very Close. Failure: The target has the Stunned condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries.description: The myconid expels spores in a Close Emanation originating from itself. Creatures in that area with an Intelligence score of 2 or higher that aren't Constructs, Elementals, or Undead gain telepathy with a range of Close for 1 hour.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the myconid has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in sunlight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The myconid makes one Slam attack and uses Pacifying Spores.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Animating Spores (3/Day)
entries.description: The myconid releases spores at a Medium or Small corpse within Very Close of it that wasn't a Construct or an Undead. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a Myconid Spore Servant. The corpse stays animate for 1d4 + 1 weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

entries.name: Pacifying Spores
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (12), one creature the myconid can see within Very Close. Failure: The target has the Stunned condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries.description: The myconid expels spores in a Close Emanation originating from itself. Creatures in that area with an Intelligence score of 2 or higher that aren't Constructs, Elementals, or Undead gain telepathy with a range of Close for 1 hour.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Sun Sickness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the myconid has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. The myconid dies if it spends more than 1 hour in sunlight.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +1, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 (1d4 - 1) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Rapport Spores
entries.description: The myconid expels spores in a Close Emanation originating from itself. Creatures in that area with an Intelligence score of 2 or higher that aren't Constructs, Elementals, or Undead gain telepathy with a range of Close for 1 hour.

entries.name: Demonic Shadows
entries.description: The nabassu darkens the area around its body in a Very Close radius. Nonmagical light can't illuminate this area of dim light.

entries.name: Devour Soul
entries.description: A nabassu can eat the soul of a creature it has killed within the last hour, provided that creature is neither a Construct nor an Undead. The devouring requires the nabassu to be within Very Close of the corpse for at least 10 minutes, after which it gains a number of Hit Dice (d8s) equal to half the creature's number of Hit Dice. Roll those dice, and increase the nabassu's hit points by the numbers rolled. For every 4 Hit Dice the nabassu gains in this way, its attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) damage on a hit. The nabassu retains these benefits for 6 days. A creature devoured by a nabassu can be restored to life only by a wish spell.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nabassu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nabassu makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it uses Soul-Stealing Gaze.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 38 (5d12 + 6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) force damage.

entries.name: Soul-Stealing Gaze
entries.description: The nabassu targets one creature it can see within Close of it. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or take 13 (2d12) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the nabassu regains hit points equal to half that amount. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0, and if the target is a Humanoid, it immediately rises as a ghoul under the nabassu's control.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nagpa makes three Staff or Deathly Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 24 (7d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Deathly Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 30 (7d6 + 6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The nagpa casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: detect magic, mage hand, message, minor illusion2/day each: fireball, fly, hold person, suggestion, wall of fire1/day each: dominate person, etherealness, feeblemind

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The naiad can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The naiad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: minor illusion3/day: phantasmal force1/day each: fly, hypnotic pattern

entries.name: Invisible in Water
entries.description: The naiad is invisible while fully immersed in water.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The naiad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The naiad makes two psychic touch attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The naiad can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The naiad's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: minor illusion3/day: phantasmal force1/day each: fly, hypnotic pattern

entries.name: Invisible in Water
entries.description: The naiad is invisible while fully immersed in water.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The naiad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The naiad makes two psychic touch attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the nalfeshnee dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nalfeshnee has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nalfeshnee makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Slashing damage plus 11 (2d10) Force damage.

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The nalfeshnee teleports up to Very Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Infernal Tack
entries.description: The narzugon wears spurs that are part of infernal tack, which allow it to summon its nightmare companion as an action.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The narzugon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The narzugon makes three Hellfire Lance attacks. It also uses Infernal Command or Terrifying Command.

entries.name: Hellfire Lance
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) fire damage. If this damage kills a creature with a soul, the soul rises from the River Styx as a lemure in Avernus in 1d4 hours. If the creature isn't revived before then, only a wish spell or killing the lemure and casting true resurrection on the creature's original body can restore it to life. Constructs and devils are immune to this effect.

entries.name: Infernal Command
entries.description: Each ally of the narzugon within Far of it can't be charmed or frightened until the end of the narzugon's next turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Command
entries.description: Each creature within Far of the narzugon that isn't a Fiend must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or become frightened of the narzugon for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that makes a successful saving throw is immune to this narzugon's Terrifying Command for 24 hours.

entries.name: Healing (1/Day)
entries.description: The narzugon, or one creature it touches, regains 100 hit points.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries.description: If the necrichor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries.description: Unless its lifeless remains are splashed with holy water or placed in a vessel under the effects of the hallow spell, the destroyed necrichor re-forms in 1d10 days, regaining all its hits points and appearing in the place it died or in the nearest unoccupied space.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The necrichor can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The necrichor doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The necrichor makes two attacks.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be paralyzed until the start of the necrichor's next turn.

entries.name: Necrotic Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the necrichor's next turn.

entries.name: Blood Puppeteering (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The necrichor targets a creature it can see within Very Close of it that is missing any of its hit points. If the target isn't a Construct or an Undead, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or the necrichor enters the target's space and attaches itself to the target for 1 minute. While attached, the necrichor takes only half damage dealt to it (round down), and the target takes the remaining damage. The necrichor can attach to only one creature at a time.The attached necrichor can telepathically control the target's move, action, or both. When controlled this way, the target can take only the Attack action (necrichor chooses the target) or the Dash action. The attached target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, detaching from the necrichor and forcing it to move into the nearest unoccupied space on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 25 (4d10 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: bestow curse, dimension door, mage armor, web1/day: circle of death

entries.name: Skull Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Claws of the Grave
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Body
entries.description: A creature that touches the centipede or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (17)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the centipede can't bite another target.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The centipede makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the centipede, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the centipede's turns.If the centipede takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the centipede must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the centipede. If the centipede dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Needles
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +3, range Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Brain Dump
entries.description: Whenever the neh-thalggu consumes a brain, it gains the magical ability to speak and understand languages known by the brain's previous owner.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The neh-thalggu doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The neh-thalggu makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated Humanoid. Hit: 35 (10d6) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the neh-thalggu kills the target by extracting and consuming its brain.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The neh-thalggu magically emits psychic energy at one Humanoid it can see within Very Close of itself. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the target takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The neh-thalggu casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)). It must have consumed the requisite number of brains to cast the spell, as indicated:1/day each: arms of Hadar (1 brain), detect magic (2 brains), magic missile (3 brains), Tenser's floating disk (4 brains), darkness (5 brains), hold person (6 brains), invisibility (7 brains), spider climb (8 brains), fear (9 brains), hypnotic pattern (10 brains), major image (11 brains), stinking cloud (12 brains)

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The swarm can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny neogi hatchling. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Swarm of Bites
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 22 (6d6 + 1) poison damage, or 11 (3d6 + 1) poison damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The neogi makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, or it makes two Tentacle of Hadar attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: guidance, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation1/day each: dimension door, hold person, hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Tentacle of Hadar
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't take reactions until the end of the neogi's next turn, as a spectral tentacle clings to the target.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the neogi's darkvision.

entries.name: Mental Fortitude
entries.description: The neogi has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and magic can't put the neogi to sleep.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The neogi can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The neogi makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes two Eldritch Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The neogi casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: dimension door, invisibility

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: The neothelid is aware of the presence of creatures within 1 mile of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The neothelid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The neothelid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: levitate1/day each: confusion, feeblemind, telekinesis

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 11 (2d10) psychic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or be swallowed by the neothelid. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the neothelid, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the neothelid's turns.If the neothelid takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the neothelid must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the neothelid. If the neothelid dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The neothelid exhales acid in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18), taking 35 (10d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The nereid can breathe air and water.
