entries.name: Aquatic Invisibility
entries.description: If immersed in water, the nereid can make itself invisible as a bonus action. It remains invisible until it leaves the water, ends the invisibility as a bonus action, or dies.

entries.name: Mantle Dependent
entries.description: The nereid wears a mantle of silky cloth the color of sea foam, which holds the creature's spirit. The mantle has an AC and hit points equal to that of the nereid, but the garment can't be directly harmed while the nereid wears it. If the mantle is destroyed, the nereid becomes poisoned and dies within 1 hour. A nereid is willing to do anything in its power to recover the mantle if it is stolen, including serving the thief.

entries.name: Shape Water
entries.description: The nereid can cast control water at will, requiring no components. Its spellcasting ability for it is Charisma. This use of the spell has a range of Close and can affect a cube of water no larger than Close on a side.

entries.name: Speak With Animals
entries.description: The nereid can comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts.

entries.name: Blinding Acid
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d12 + 3) acid damage, and the target is blinded until the start of the nereid's next turn.

entries.name: Drowning Kiss (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The nereid touches one creature it can see within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or take 22 (3d12 + 3) acid damage. On a failure, it also runs out of breath and can't speak for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Water Lash
entries.description: The nereid causes a Very Close cube of water within Far of it to take a shape of its choice and strike one target it can see within Very Close of that water. The target must make a Strength Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, it takes 17 (4d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and if it is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to Close in a straight line or is knocked prone (nereid's choice). On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked prone.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the nergaliid can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The nergaliid's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or become poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Tongue Lash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Siphon Life (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The nergaliid magically draws the life from a humanoid it can see within Far of it. The target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). An incapacitated target fails the save automatically. On a failed save, the creature takes 10 (3d6) psychic damage, and the nergaliid gains temporary hit points equal to the damage taken. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the nergaliid doesn't gain temporary hit points. If this damage kills the target, its body rises at the end of the nergaliid's current turn as a husk zombie (see earlier in this chapter).

entries.name: Aura of Murder
entries.description: As long as the night blade is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within Very Close of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Coven Magic
entries.description: While within Close of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The hag has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Bag
entries.description: The hag has a soul bag. While holding or carrying the bag, the hag can use its Nightmare Haunting action.The bag has AC 15, HP 20, and Resistance to all damage. The bag turns to dust if reduced to 0 Hit Points. If the bag is destroyed, any souls the bag is holding are released. The hag can create a new bag after 7 days.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hag makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Nightmare Haunting (1/Day; Requires Soul Bag)
entries.description: While on the Ethereal Plane, the hag casts Dream, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting. Only the hag can serve as the spell's messenger, and the target must be a creature the hag can see on the Material Plane. The spell fails and is wasted if the target is under the effect of the Protection from Evil and Good spell or within a Magic Circle spell.If the target takes damage from the Dream spell, the target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to that damage. If the spell kills the target, its soul is trapped in the hag's soul bag, and the target can't be raised from the dead until its soul is released.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Magic, Etherealness, Magic Missile (level 4 version)2/day each: Phantasmal Killer, Plane Shift (self only)

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The scavver doesn't require air.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature that is missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Confer Fire Resistance
entries.description: The nightmare can grant Resistance to Fire damage to a rider while it is on the nightmare.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The nightmare sheds Bright Light in a Very Close radius and Dim Light for an additional Very Close.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Ethereal Stride
entries.description: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within Very Close of it teleport to the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane or vice versa.

entries.name: Aura of Nightmares
entries.description: Undead creatures within Close of the shepherd gain a +5 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When any other creature that isn't undead or a construct starts its turn within Close of the shepherd, that creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or take 11 (2d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The shepherd's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (17)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: confusion, dispel magic, hold person, suggestion

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The shepherd has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shepherd makes two attacks: one with its claws and one with its staff.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 26 (4d12) psychic damage.

entries.name: Herd the Underworld (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The shepherd pulls twisted souls from the Underworld; 1d6 shadows (without Sunlight Weakness) arise in unoccupied spaces within Close of the shepherd. The shadows act right after the shepherd on the same initiative count and fight until they're destroyed. They disappear when the shepherd dies.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: Nightsea Chil-liren can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Mount
entries.description: If the specter isn't mounted, it can use a bonus action to magically teleport onto its gloamwing mount, provided the specter and the gloamwing are on the same plane of existence. When it teleports, the specter appears astride the gloamwing along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying. While mounted and not incapacitated, the specter can't be surprised, and both it and its mount gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The specter makes two scythe attacks.

entries.name: Scythe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Mind Twist (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The specter magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 22 (5d8) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Reap Memory (3/Day)
entries.description: The specter touches one incapacitated creature and chooses 1 hour from among the past 24. Unless the creature succeeds on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15), the creature loses all memory of that hour. The creature regains the memory only if the specter dies within the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Annihilating Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Close of the nightwalker must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) or take 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. Undead are immune to this aura.

entries.name: Life Eater
entries.description: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the nightwalker and can't be revived except by a wish spell.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The nightwalker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nightwalker makes two Enervating Focus attacks, one of which can be replaced by Finger of Doom, if available.

entries.name: Enervating Focus
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 28 (5d8 + 6) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Finger of Doom (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The nightwalker points at one creature it can see within Very Far of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (21) or take 39 (6d12) necrotic damage and become frightened until the end of the nightwalker's next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature is also paralyzed. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the nightwalker's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Nilbogism
entries.description: Any creature that attempts to damage the nilbog must first succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be charmed until the end of the creature's next turn. A creature charmed in this way must use its action praising the nilbog.The nilbog can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through its Reversal of Fortune reaction.

entries.name: Fool's Scepter
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Mocking Word
entries.description: The nilbog targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or take 5 (2d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on its next attack roll before the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The nilbog casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: mage hand, Tasha's hideous laughter

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nimblewright has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The nimblewright's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Repairable
entries.description: As long as it has at least 1 hit point remaining, the nimblewright regains 1 hit point when a mending spell is cast on it.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The nimblewright has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nimblewright makes three attacks: two with its rapier and one with its dagger.

entries.name: Rapier
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nimblewright makes three attacks, using Scimitar or Clockwork Crossbow in any combination.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Clockwork Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nimblewright has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nimblewright makes four attacks, using Halting Slam or Radiant Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Halting Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and the target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Radiant Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Far. Hit: 14 (4d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the nimblewright is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails, provided it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the nimblewright moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 4 (1d8) Bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Niv-Mizzet fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Locus of the Firemind
entries.description: Niv-Mizzet can maintain concentration on two different spells at the same time. In addition, he has advantage on saving throws to maintain concentration on spells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Niv-Mizzet has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Master Chemister
entries.description: When Niv-Mizzet casts a spell that deals damage, he can change the spell's damage to cold, fire, force, lightning, or thunder.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Niv-Mizzet is a 20th-level Izzet spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, prestidigitation, ray of frost, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): detect magic, magic missile, shield, thunderwave, unseen servant2nd level (3 slots): blur, enlarge/reduce, flaming sphere, hold person, scorching ray3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, lightning bolt, slow4th level (3 slots): confusion, dimension door, fabricate5th level (2 slots): conjure elemental, polymorph, wall of fire, wall of force6th level (1 slot): chain lightning, disintegrate, true seeing7th level (1 slot): project image, reverse gravity, teleport8th level (1 slot): control weather, maze, power word stun9th level (1 slot): prismatic wall

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Niv-Mizzet makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d4 + 9) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Niv-Mizzet exhales fire in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 91 (26d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The cyclops has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cyclops makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rapier
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The noble makes three Beguiling Strike attacks.

entries.name: Beguiling Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the noble's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The noble casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Mage Armor (included in AC), Mage Hand, Minor Illusion1/day each: Befuddlement, Detect Thoughts, Fly, Scrying, Shatter (level 7 version)

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The noggle deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Sabotaging Swipe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Slashing damage. If the target is wearing armor, it is subjected to the following effect. Agility Reaction Roll (12). Failure: The armor takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The target can take an action to remove the penalty from its armor.

entries.name: Bloodied Wild Magic
entries.description: While Bloodied, the noggle has a Fly Speed of Close and it can choose for any damage it deals to be Force damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The noggle makes two attacks, using Noggling Stick or Befuddling Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Noggling Stick
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Befuddling Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Psychic damage, and the target subtracts 1d4 from the next saving throw it makes before the end of the noggle's next turn.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The nonaton can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Combat Ready
entries.description: The nonaton has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the nonaton dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nonaton makes three Arm attacks and uses Pillar of Truth or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Arm
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the nonaton can't use this arm against other targets. The nonaton has nine arms, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Pillar of Truth
entries.description: The nonaton chooses a point on the ground that it can see within Far of itself. A Far-tall, Close-radius cylinder of magical force rises from that point. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, a creature takes 21 (6d6) force damage, and the creature reverts to its original form (if it's in a different form) and can't assume a different form until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The nonaton casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The nosferatu regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight. If the nosferatu takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of the nosferatu's next turn.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The nosferatu can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: The nosferatu takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The nosferatu doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nosferatu makes two Claw attacks followed by one Bite attack. If both Claw attacks hit the same creature, the Bite attack is made with advantage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the nosferatu regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises as a nosferatu after 1d10 days.

entries.name: Blood Disgorge (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The nosferatu vomits blood in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and it can't regain hit points for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nothic makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Rotting Gaze
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), one creature the nothic can see within Very Far. Failure: 17 (5d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Cloud of Vermin
entries.description: Any creature, other than a devil, that starts its turn within Close of one or more nupperibos must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or take 5 (2d4) acid damage. A creature within the areas of two or more nupperibos makes the saving throw with disadvantage.

entries.name: Driven Tracker
entries.description: In the Nine Hells, the nupperibo can flawlessly track any creature that has taken damage from any nupperibo's Cloud of Vermin within the previous 24 hours.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fiendish Restoration
entries.description: If the nycaloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The nycaloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The nycaloth makes two Mercurial Axe attacks.

entries.name: Mercurial Axe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Force damage. Hit or Miss: The axe magically returns to the nycaloth's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the ram moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ram has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The ram has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) force damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The oblex can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Aversion to Fire
entries.description: If the oblex takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The oblex doesn't require sleep.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Council of Five
entries.description: The ghost has a trait based on who it is, as shown below:Enezesku: Enfeebling Ray. Enezesku's Innate Spellcasting trait includes ray of enfeeblement, which he can cast at will.Fautomni: Undead Fortitude. If damage reduces Fautomni to 0 hit points, he must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, Fautomni drops to 1 hit point instead.Karlov: Unnatural Vigor. When Karlov regains hit points, he has advantage on attack rolls he makes on his next turn.Vuliev: Teleportation. Vuliev's Innate Spellcasting trait includes misty step, which he can cast at will.Xil Xaxosz: Lingering Spite. When Xil Xaxosz is reduced to 0 hit points, his incorporeal form explodes in a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature within Very Close of him must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), taking 14 (4d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Ethereal Sight
entries.description: The ghost can see Far into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The ghost's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:At will: chill touch (at 5th level, and the ghost regains hit points equal to half the amount of damage the target takes)1/day each: sanctuary, spirit guardians (at 4th level)

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries.description: If the ghost fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the ghost regains hit points equal to half the amount of damage the target takes. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

entries.name: Convene the Ghost Council
entries.description: The ghost summons the other four members of the Obzedat. At the start of the ghost's next turn, the other members appear in unoccupied spaces within Close of the summoner. The ghosts each roll initiative when they appear.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The extollant makes two Crimson Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Crimson Bolt
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one creature. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The extollant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: minor illusion1/day each: mage armor, major image, phantasmal force

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Arcane Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The initiate creates an explosion of magical force in a Close-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within Very Far of itself. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (13). On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 10 (3d6) force damage and is pushed Very Close away from the center of the area. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The initiate casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: light, mage hand1/day each: detect magic, levitate

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries.description: If a creature tries to read the silvertongue's thoughts or deals psychic damage to the silvertongue, that creature must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (16) or be stunned until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The silvertongue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Crimson Bolt
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one creature. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The silvertongue casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):2/day each: charm person, mage armor, sending1/day: dimension door

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) Acid damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The octon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Combat Ready
entries.description: The octon has advantage on initiative checks.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the octon dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The octon makes three Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The octon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Whirlwind of Tentacles (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The octon rapidly extends and spins its ring of tentacles. Each creature within Close of the octon must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be pulled up to Very Close in a straight line toward the octon. Then, the octon makes two Tentacle attacks against each creature within Very Close of itself.

entries.name: Compression
entries.description: The octopus can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The oculorb has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Watchful Eyes
entries.description: The oculorb has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The oculorb makes two Dreadful Contact attacks or four Eye Beam attacks.

entries.name: Dreadful Contact
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage, or 25 (6d6 + 4) psychic damage if the target has the frightened condition.

entries.name: Eye Beam
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Antipathic Flood (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The oculorb releases a wave of negative emotions, choosing one of the following options:

entries.name: Weeping Eyes
entries.description: The oculorb weeps, releasing a wave of crushing despair. Each creature within Close of the oculorb must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature's speed is reduced to Melee until the end of the oculorb's next turn, and if the creature was concentrating, its concentration is broken.

entries.name: Withering Glare
entries.description: The oculorb's eyes unleash furious scarlet energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) necrotic damage and has the frightened condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a successful save.

entries.name: Fortune Teller
entries.description: Oddlewin can cast the Augury spell as a ritual, using cards as the material component.

entries.name: Nilbogism
entries.description: Any creature that attempts to damage Oddlewin must first succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or have the charmed condition until the end of the creature's next turn. The creature must use its action praising Oddlewin.Oddlewin can't regain hit points, including through magical healing, except through his Reversal of Fortune reaction.

entries.name: Fool's Scepter
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Cloud of Cards
entries.description: Oddlewin conjures magical cards that slash at the air in a Very Close cube within Far of Oddlewin until the start of Oddlewin's next turn. A creature that starts its turn in the cube or that enters that area for the first time on a turn takes 10 (4d4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Oddlewin casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: Mage Hand, Tasha's Hideous Laughter

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The ogre deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ogre makes two Bash attacks.

entries.name: Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the ogre can push the target Very Close away if the target is Huge or smaller.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Bolt Launcher
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d10 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Chain Smash (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be stunned for 1 minute. The target repeats the saving throw if it takes damage and at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Chain Sweep
entries.description: The ogre swings its chain, and every creature within Very Close of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Goblin Projectile
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Very Far (can't hit targets within Close of the hucker), one target. Hit: 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage, or 10 (4d4) piercing damage if the projectile is wearing a spiked helmet. Hit or Miss: The goblin projectile takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage per Very Close it travels through the air (maximum 20d6).

entries.name: Howdah
entries.description: The ogre carries a compact fort on its back. Up to four Small creatures can ride in the fort without squeezing. To make a melee attack against a target within Very Close of the ogre, they must use spears or weapons with reach. Creatures in the fort have three-quarters cover against attacks and effects from outside it. If the ogre dies, creatures in the fort are placed in unoccupied spaces within Very Close of the ogre.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (Difficulty (5) plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Battleaxe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The oinoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The oinoloth makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Spellcasting or Teleport.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Corrupted Healing (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The oinoloth touches one willing creature within Very Close of it. The target regains all its hit points. In addition, the oinoloth can end one disease on the target or remove one of the following conditions from it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The target then gains 1 level of exhaustion, and its hit point maximum is reduced by 7 (2d6). This reduction can be removed only by a wish spell or by casting greater restoration on the target three times within the same hour. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The oinoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, hold monster, invisibility (self only)1/day each: feeblemind, globe of invulnerability

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The oinoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Chameleon Skin
entries.description: The troglodyte has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature other than a troglodyte that starts its turn within Very Close of the troglodyte must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all troglodytes for 1 hour.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troglodyte makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Chilling Mist
entries.description: While it is alive, the one-eyed shiver projects an aura of cold mist within Very Close of itself. If the one-eyed shiver deals damage to a creature in this area, the creature also takes 5 (1d10) cold damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The one-eyed shiver is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, mage armor, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): mirror image, misty step3rd level (2 slots): fear

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye of Frost
entries.description: The one-eyed shiver casts ray of frost from its missing eye. If it hits, the target is also restrained. A target restrained in this way can end the condition by using an action, succeeding on a Difficulty (13) Strength check.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The oni regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The oni makes two Claw or Nightmare Ray attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) Slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Nightmare Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the start of the oni's next turn.

entries.name: Shape-Shift
entries.description: The oni shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Large Giant, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The oni casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):1/day each: Charm Person (level 2 version), Darkness, Gaseous Form, Sleep

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that touches the Ooze Master or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 9 (2d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon that hits the Ooze Master corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition that hits the Ooze Master is destroyed after dealing damage.The Ooze Master can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Instinctive Attack
entries.description: When the Ooze Master casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, it can make one pseudopod attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Ooze Master is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (15), +7 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, friends, mage hand, poison spray1st level (4 slots): charm person, detect magic, magic missile, ray of sickness2nd level (3 slots): detect thoughts, Melf's acid arrow, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): fear, slow, stinking cloud4th level (3 slots): confusion, Evard's black tentacles5th level (1 slot): cloudkill

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The Ooze Master can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Blessings of the Gods
entries.description: While the oracle is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier. In addition, a creature that hits the oracle with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The oracle's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: guidance, light, thaumaturgy3/day each: bless, guiding bolt, healing word, hold person1/day each: augury, scrying

entries.name: Eldritch Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the Oracle fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Oracle makes two Magic Flare attacks. She can also use Paradoxy, if available.

entries.name: Magic Flare
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 24 (3d12 + 5) force damage.

entries.name: Paradoxy (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Momentary warps in reality appear at three different points the Oracle can see within Very Far of her. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on each point must make a Strength Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) force damage and is pulled up to Close in a straight line toward the center of the sphere. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. A creature caught in the area of multiple warps is affected by only one, which the Oracle chooses.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Oracle casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: detect magic2/day each: dispel magic, mage armor, remove curse, sending1/day each: power word stun, scrying (as an action), wall of force

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The Oracle teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, to an unoccupied space she can see within Far of herself.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Foe Smiter of Ilneval
entries.description: The orc deals an extra die of damage when it hits with a longsword attack (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The orc makes two melee attacks with its longsword or two ranged attacks with its javelins. If Ilneval's Command is available to use, the orc can use it after these attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage when used with two hands.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Ilneval's Command (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Up to three allied orcs within Very Far of this orc that can hear it can use their reactions to each make one weapon attack.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The orc is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): bane, cure wounds, guiding bolt2nd level (3 slots): augury, warding bond3rd level (2 slots): bestow curse, create food and water

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The orc makes two claw attacks, or four claw attacks if it has fewer than half of its hit points remaining.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc commoner can move up to your speed toward a hostile creature that they can see.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The orc is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no verbal components to cast its spells. The orc has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): bane, detect magic, inflict wounds, protection from evil and good2nd level (3 slots): blindness/deafness, silence

entries.name: Touch of the White Hand
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Corrupted Carrier
entries.description: When the orc is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes, and any creature within Very Close of it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the creature takes 14 (4d6) poison damage and becomes poisoned. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A creature poisoned by this effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turn, ending the effect on itself on a success. While poisoned by this effect, a creature can't regain hit points.

entries.name: Nurtured One of Yurtrus
entries.description: The orc has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Corrupted Vengeance
entries.description: The orc reduces itself to 0 hit points, triggering its Corrupted Carrier trait.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: On each of its turns, the orc can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

entries.name: Hand of Shargaas
entries.description: The orc deals 2 extra dice of damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack (included in its attacks).

entries.name: Shargaas's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the orc's darkvision.

entries.name: Slayer
entries.description: In the first round of a combat, the orc has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet. If the orc hits a creature that round who was surprised, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The orc makes two scimitar or dart attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 10 (3d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Veil of Shargaas (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The orc casts darkness without any components. Wisdom is its spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: Orcus wields the Wand of Orcus.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Orcus fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Orcus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Master of Undeath
entries.description: Orcus can cast animate dead (at will) and create undead (3/day). He chooses the level at which the spells are cast, and the creatures created by them remain under his control indefinitely. Additionally, he can cast create undead even when it isn't night.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Orcus makes three Wand of Orcus, Tail, or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Wand of Orcus
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (3d8 + 11) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (2d12) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 29 (5d8 + 7) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Conjure Undead (1/Day)
entries.description: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus conjures Undead creatures whose combined average hit points don't exceed 500. These creatures magically rise up from the ground or otherwise form in unoccupied spaces within Very Far of Orcus and obey his commands until they are destroyed or until he dismisses them as an action.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Orcus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: detect magic3/day: dispel magic1/day: time stop

entries.name: Wand Spellcasting
entries.description: While holding the Wand of Orcus, Orcus casts one of the following spells (spell save Difficulty (18)), some of which require charges; the wand has 7 charges to fuel these spells, and it regains 1d4 + 3 charges daily at dawn:At will: animate dead (as an action), blight, speak with dead2 charges: power word kill1 charge each: circle of death, finger of death

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The oread's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: fire bolt (see "Actions" below)3/day: burning hands1/day each: hellish rebuke (see "Reactions" below), scorching ray

entries.name: Invisible in Fire
entries.description: The oread is invisible while fully immersed in fire.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The oread has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The oread attacks twice with its fiery touch or fire bolt.

entries.name: Fiery Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The enforcer makes three Dagger attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Lightning Cage if available.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Lightning Cage (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the enforcer can see within Far. Failure: 13 (3d8) Lightning damage, and the creature can't take Reactions until the end of the enforcer's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Blood Aegis
entries.description: The AC of the blood mage includes its Constitution modifier while it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

entries.name: Oriq Mask
entries.description: The blood mage wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, the blood mage can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and it adds double its proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

entries.name: Sanguine Sense
entries.description: While the blood mage isn't blinded, it can see any creature that isn't an Undead or a Construct within Far of itself, even through total cover, heavily obscured areas, invisibility, or any other phenomena that would prevent sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blood mage makes two Blood Lash attacks.

entries.name: Blood Lash
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the blood mage's next turn.

entries.name: Blood Boil (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The blood mage chooses a point within Very Far of itself, and a Close radius sphere centered on that point fills with a burst of searing, blood-red mist. Each creature of the blood mage's choice that it can see in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) necrotic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated. A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by this necrotic damage.

entries.name: Misdirecting Defense
entries.description: The AC of the recruiter includes its Charisma modifier while it isn't wearing armor or wielding a shield.

entries.name: Oriq Mask
entries.description: The recruiter wears an Oriq mask. While wearing the mask, the recruiter can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and it adds double its proficiency bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks (included above).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The recruiter makes two Psychic Knife attacks. It can use Spellcasting in place of one of the attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Knife
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one creature. Hit: 21 (5d6 + 4) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The recruiter casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: disguise self, silent image2/day: charm person1/day: suggestion

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The orthon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Infernal Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d4 + 6) force damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17), taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failure, the target is poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Brass Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) force damage. The target also suffers one of the following effects of the orthon's choice; the orthon can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:Acid. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17), taking an additional 17 (5d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Blindness. The target takes 5 (1d10) radiant damage. In addition, the target and all other creatures within Close of it must each make a successful Agility Reaction Roll (17) or be blinded until the end of the orthon's next turn.Concussion. The target and each creature within Close of it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17), taking 13 (2d12) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Entanglement. The target must make a successful Agility Reaction Roll (17) or be restrained for 1 hour by strands of sticky webbing. The target can escape by taking an action to make a Difficulty (17) Strength or Dexterity check and succeeding.Paralysis. The target takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage and must make a successful Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.Tracking. For the next 24 hours, the orthon knows the direction and distance to the target, as long as it's on the same plane of existence. If the target is on a different plane, the orthon knows which one, but not the exact location there.

entries.name: Focus
entries.description: As a bonus action, the giant can target a creature it can see within Close of it and make that creature its focus. The target remains the giant's focus for 1 minute, or until either the target or the giant drops to 0 hit points. When the giant makes an attack roll against its focus, it adds a d4 to its attack roll. If the giant attacks a different target while it has a focus, it subtracts a d4 from its attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) slashing damage. If the Orzhov giant scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries.description: Magic and other features can't determine the corrupter's creature type. If a creature tries to read the corrupter's thoughts, that creature must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (20) or have the stunned condition for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the corrupter fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The corrupter can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The corrupter makes three Whispering Blade attacks and can use Debilitating Touch.

entries.name: Whispering Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (20) or be unable to speak until the start of the corrupter's next turn.

entries.name: Debilitating Touch
entries.description: The corrupter's squirming tentacle lashes out at a creature the corrupter can see within Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Debilitating Touch for 24 hours.

name: Otherworldly Steed

entries.name: Life Bond
entries.description: When you regain Hit Points from a level 1+ spell, the steed regains the same number of Hit Points if you're within Very Close of it.

entries.name: Otherworldly Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + the spell's level of Radiant (Celestial), Psychic (Fey), or Necrotic (Fiend) damage.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The otyugh makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition. Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (15). Failure: The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by 5 (1d10) and doesn't return to normal until the Poisoned condition ends on the target. Success: The Poisoned condition ends.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)) from one of two tentacles.

entries.name: Tentacle Slam
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (14), each creature Grappled by the otyugh. Failure: 16 (3d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the start of the otyugh's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Virulent Breath
entries.description: Noxious gas from the mutate's digestion of previous meals spews from its mouth. At the start of the mutate's turn, each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mutate makes two Bite or Tentacle attacks. It can replace one of these attacks with Chitin Slam.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or have the poisoned condition. Every 24 hours that elapse, the target must repeat the saving throw, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. On a successful save, the target is no longer poisoned. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0. This reduction to the target's hit point maximum lasts until it no longer has the poisoned condition.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)) and the restrained condition until this grapple ends. The mutate has two tentacles that can grapple one target each.

entries.name: Chitin Slam
entries.description: The mutate targets one creature it is grappling, slamming the creature against its chitinous plating. The creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage and have the stunned condition until the end of the mutate's next turn.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The owl doesn't provoke Opportunity Attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The owlbear makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Beast of Burden
entries.description: The ox is considered to be one size larger for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the ox moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against poison and resistance to poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Dwarf is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence. It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, mending, prestidigitation1st level (2 slots): burning hands, disguise self, shield

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The paper bird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Sharp Edges
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny raven. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Beaks
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.Any creature swallowed by a parasite-infested behir must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (19) at the start of each of the behir's turns or be feasted upon by blood parasites, taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. This damage is in addition to the damage caused by the behir's digestive acids.If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The pari has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The pari doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The pari makes three Mace attacks.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Disorienting Futures
entries.description: The pari attempts to flood the mind of one creature it can see within Far of itself with visions of the future. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (19) or take 27 (5d10) psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of the pari's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The pari casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (19)):At will: detect evil and good2/day each: cure wounds (as a 6th-level spell), lesser restoration1/day each: commune (as an action), dispel evil and good

entries.name: Guardian of the Market
entries.description: Pazrodine can sense when an item is stolen from Seelie Market. She knows the distance and direction to stolen items, as if by the Locate Object spell.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Pazrodine fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Pazrodine makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) radiant damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Pazrodine casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):At will: Faerie Fire2/day each: Calm Emotions, Dispel Magic, Invisibility1/day each: Mass Cure Wounds, Revivify

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (21) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Pazrodine uses one of the following breath weapons:Dream Breath. Pazrodine exhales mist in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) or have the unconscious condition for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.Moonlight Breath. Pazrodine exhales a beam of moonlight in a Very Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (21), taking 60 (11d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries.description: The peacock has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The peacock has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the peacock's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The pech has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the pech has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The pech makes two Fortified Pickaxe attacks. If it hits a Large or smaller creature with both attacks, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Communal Spellcasting (2/Day)
entries.description: The pech works with three or more pechs to cast spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (save Difficulty (12)).
