entries.description: The razerblast makes three melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the blight is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. If a creature hasn't observed the blight move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the blight is animate.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The blight can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blight makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit (with advantage if the target is missing any of its hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Life-Draining Vines (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Snaking vines erupt from the blight. Each creature within Very Close of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 9 (2d8) slashing damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If at least one of the creatures that failed this save isn't a Construct or an Undead, the blight regains 9 hit points.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 force damage for every Very Close shunted.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of Reaping Scythe attacks equal to half the level of the spell (rounded down).

entries.name: Reaping Scythe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit (with advantage), reach Very Close, the creature haunted by Haunt Creature. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level necrotic damage.

entries.name: Aura of Murder
entries.description: As long as the reaper is not incapacitated, hostile creatures within Very Close of it gain vulnerability to piercing damage unless they have resistance or immunity to such damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The reaper's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: charm person, disguise self, sanctuary

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The reaper makes two dagger attacks and uses Shroud Self.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shroud Self
entries.description: The reaper magically turns invisible until the start of its next turn. This invisibility ends if the reaper makes an attack roll, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

entries.name: First Strike
entries.description: The reckoner has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The reckoner is a 5th-level Boros spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). The reckoner has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, message, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): guiding bolt, shield, thunderwave, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): blur, levitate3rd level (2 slots): lightning bolt

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the abishai's darkvision.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The abishai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The abishai makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack, and it can use Frightful Presence or Incite Fanaticism.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 38 (7d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage plus 11 (2d10) fire damage.

entries.name: Frightful Presence
entries.description: Each creature of the abishai's choice that is within Very Far and aware of the abishai must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (18) or become frightened of it for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the abishai's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Incite Fanaticism
entries.description: The abishai chooses up to four other creatures within Far of it that can see it. Until the start of the abishai's next turn, each of those creatures makes attack rolls with advantage and can't be frightened.

entries.name: Power of the Dragon Queen
entries.description: The abishai targets one Dragon it can see within Very Far of it. The Dragon must make a Presence Reaction Roll (18). A chromatic dragon makes this save with disadvantage. On a successful save, the target is immune to the abishai's Power of the Dragon Queen for 1 hour. On a failed save, the target is charmed by the abishai for 1 hour. While charmed in this way, the target regards the abishai as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. This effect ends if the abishai or its companions deal damage to the target.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 24 (7d6) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

name: Red Greatwyrm

entries.name: Chromatic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 425 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 105,000 XP (210,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Chromatic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales a blast of energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (26). On a failed save, the creature takes 78 (12d12) fire damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

original_cr: 27 (XP 105,000, or 210,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The slaad regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The slaad makes three Injecting Claw attacks.

entries.name: Injecting Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid not cursed by a slaad, it is subjected to the following effect. Finesse Reaction Roll (14). Failure: The target is cursed unawares, and a minuscule slaad egg is implanted in it. Removing the curse destroys the egg.Over 2d4 × 10 days, the egg gestates. In the final 24 hours, the cursed target feels unwell; its Speed is halved, and it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. At the end of this time, the egg turns into a Slaad Tadpole, which chews out of the host and kills it.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): misty step, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): greater invisibility, ice storm5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Iron Boots
entries.description: The redcap has disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

entries.name: Outsize Strength
entries.description: While grappling, the redcap is considered to be Medium. Also, wielding a heavy weapon doesn't impose disadvantage on its attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The redcap makes three Wicked Sickle attacks.

entries.name: Wicked Sickle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Ironbound Pursuit
entries.description: The redcap moves up to its speed to a creature it can see and kicks with its iron boots. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 20 (3d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Mucous Cloud
entries.description: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12). On a failure, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Probing Telepathy
entries.description: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries.description: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: If a creature starts its turn within Close of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.If the basilisk sees its reflection within Close of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Antimagic Cone
entries.description: The beholder's central eye creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a Very Far cone. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active. The area works against the beholder's own eye rays.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within Very Far of it:1. Charm Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be charmed by the beholder for 1 hour, or until the beholder harms the creature.2. Paralyzing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.4. Slowing Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5. Enervation Ray. The targeted creature must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.6. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or the beholder moves it up to Close in any direction. It is restrained by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is incapacitated.If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to Close in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.7. Sleep Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or fall asleep and remain unconscious for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.8. Petrification Ray. The targeted creature must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.9. Disintegration Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 45 (10d8) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a Very Close cube of it.10. Death Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or take 55 (10d10) necrotic damage. The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The carrion crawler has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison on itself on a success.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Acid Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

entries.name: Haste (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries.description: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while deafened.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Crush
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful Difficulty (11) Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using Very Close of movement.

entries.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
entries.description: A Close radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

entries.name: Avoidance
entries.description: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Displacement
entries.description: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is incapacitated or has a speed of 0.

entries.name: Web (Recharge 5–6)

As an action, the restrained creature can make a Difficulty (9) Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, is vulnerable to fire damage and immune to bludgeoning, poison and psychic damage.

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: If the golem takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.The golem's creator, if within Far of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (13) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The remorhaz makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the remorhaz's turns.If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the remorhaz must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the remorhaz. If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spores (Recharge 6)
entries.description: A Close-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vrock. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 5 (1d10) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the target also ends the effect on it.

entries.name: Stunning Screech (1/Day)
entries.description: The vrock emits a horrific screech. Each creature within Close of it that can hear it and that isn't a demon must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be stunned until the end of the vrock's next turn.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wight makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Reduced Threat
entries.description: A reduced-threat monster takes a −2 penalty on attack rolls (included in the stat block), ability checks (included in the stat block for skill proficiencies), saving throws (included in the stat block for saving throw proficiencies), and saving throw DCs (included in the stat block).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wyvern makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its stinger. While flying, it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Stinger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13), taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The shark has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the shark's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The reflection can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the reflection can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +6.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the reflection has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Strength Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

entries.name: Creature Sense
entries.description: The refraction is aware of creatures within 100 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The refraction can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries.description: If the refraction fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The refraction has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The refraction makes two Dissonant Claw attacks.

entries.name: Dissonant Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature concentrating on a spell, its concentration is broken.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Creatures of the refraction's choice within Far of it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (19) or take 33 (5d10 + 6) psychic damage and have the stunned condition for 1 minute. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The refraction casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (19)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts3/day each: dispel magic, modify memory1/day each: feeblemind, plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The refraction teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied place that it can see.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrosive Form
entries.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it takes 4 (1d8) acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical wood or metal in 1 round.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The pudding regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the pudding takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the pudding's next turn. The pudding dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The chieftain has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the chieftain hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The chieftain makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close and range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The great warrior has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Brute
entries.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the great warrior hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The great warrior makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close and range Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Shield Bash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shaman is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following shaman spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit (+4 to hit with shillelagh), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The warrior has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the warrior's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The regisaur has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The regisaur makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack. The regisaur can't target the same creature with both attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 47 (6d12 + 8) piercing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)). Until this grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the regisaur can't Bite another target.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: The reigar wears a talarith.

entries.name: Glory
entries.description: The reigar's Armor Class includes its Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The reigar can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The reigar makes two Trident attacks.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 3 (1d6) force damage if the reigar is wearing its talarith.

entries.name: Chromatic Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 22 (5d8) damage of a type chosen by the reigar from the following list: cold, fire, lightning, or radiant.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The reigar casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: light, mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: dimension door, phantasmal force1/day each: mass suggestion, sending

entries.name: Summon Duplicate (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: Using its talarith, the reigar summons a duplicate of itself. The duplicate obeys the reigar's commands and uses the reigar's statistics, except it is an unaligned Construct that doesn't have a talarith of its own. The duplicate takes its turn immediately after the reigar. It vanishes after 1 hour or when it is reduced to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the reindeer moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one prone creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Bloodheart Stake
entries.description: The impaler is magically bound to the ceremonial stake and the sacrificed corpse the ritual caster used to create it. If the impaler is reduced to 0 hit points, it disappears, then re-forms 1d8 hours later in the nearest unoccupied space to the stake and regains all its hit points. The impaler dies only if it is reduced to 0 hit points while either the ceremonial stake is removed from the sacrifice's corpse or the impaler is on a different plane of existence from that corpse.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the impaler fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The impaler makes one Spike attack and two Wicked Spear attacks.

entries.name: Spike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage, and the target's speed is halved until the start of the impaler's next turn.

entries.name: Wicked Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spike Burst (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Twisted, spectral spikes shoot out from the impaler's body. Each creature within Close of the impaler must make a Agility Reaction Roll (19), taking 40 (9d8) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the juggernaut fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The juggernaut regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn. If the juggernaut takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The juggernaut dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The juggernaut doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The juggernaut makes two attacks. It can replace one attack with Deadly Shaping if it is ready.

entries.name: Executioner's Pick
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, its speed is reduced by Very Close until the start of the juggernaut's next turn.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Deadly Shaping (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The juggernaut magically shapes a feature of its surroundings into a deadly implement. A creature the juggernaut can see within Far of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18). If the saving throw fails, the targeted creature is struck by one of the following (juggernaut's choice):

entries.name: Flying Stone
entries.description: The target takes 22 (5d8) bludgeoning damage and is incapacitated until the start of the juggernaut's next turn, and the implement vanishes.

entries.name: Scything Shrapnel
entries.description: The target takes 14 (4d6) slashing damage, and the implement vanishes. At the start of each of its turns, the target takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage from the wound left by the shrapnel. The wound ends if the target regains any hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Medicine) check.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries.description: If the slasher fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Shrouded Presence
entries.description: The slasher is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, and it can't be detected by abilities that sense Fiends.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The slasher makes two Slasher's Knife attacks.

entries.name: Slasher's Knife
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it suffers a lingering wound that causes it to take 7 (2d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. Each time the slasher hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 3 (1d6). The wound ends if the target regains hit points or if a creature uses an action to stanch the wound, which requires a successful Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Medicine) check.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). The relic sloth can grapple no more than two targets at a time.

entries.name: Heat Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the remorhaz's turns, each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the remorhaz takes 16 (3d10) Fire damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +11, reach Very Close. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Fire damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The duodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Dismantlable
entries.description: If the replica duodrone dies, its body falls into a pile of parts (gears, plates, screws, and wires), leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The duodrone makes two fist attacks or two javelin attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The monodrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Dismantlable
entries.description: If the replica monodrone dies, its body falls into a pile of parts (gears, plates, screws, and wires), leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The pentadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Dismantlable
entries.description: If the replica pentadrone dies, its body falls into a pile of parts (gears, plates, screws, and wires), leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The pentadrone makes five arm attacks.

entries.name: Arm
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Paralysis Gas (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The pentadrone exhales a Close cone of gas. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The quadrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Dismantlable
entries.description: If the replica quadrone dies, its body falls into a pile of parts (gears, plates, screws, and wires), leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The quadrone makes two fist attacks or four shortbow attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The tridrone can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Dismantlable
entries.description: If the replica tridrone dies, its body falls into a pile of parts (gears, plates, screws, and wires), leaving behind its weapons and anything else it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tridrone makes three fist attacks or three javelin attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Faultless Tracker
entries.description: The retriever is given a quarry by its master. The quarry can be a specific creature or object the master is personally acquainted with, or it can be a general type of creature or object the master has seen before. The retriever knows the direction and distance to its quarry as long as the two of them are on the same plane of existence. The retriever can have only one such quarry at a time. The retriever also always knows the location of its master.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The retriever makes two Foreleg attacks, and it uses Force Beam or Paralyzing Beam, if available.

entries.name: Foreleg
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Force Beam
entries.description: The retriever targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 27 (5d10) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Paralyzing Beam (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The retriever targets one creature it can see within Far of it. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The paralyzed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.If the paralyzed creature is Medium or smaller, the retriever can pick it up as part of the retriever's move and walk or climb with it at full speed.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The retriever casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):3/day each: plane shift (only self and up to one incapacitated creature, which is considered willing for the spell), web

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Unreadable Face
entries.description: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Fleeting Anger
entries.description: If another creature deals damage to the Returned, the Returned makes attack rolls with advantage until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Unreadable Face
entries.description: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Underworld Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 2) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the Returned's next turn. If the target is missing any of its hit points, it instead takes 17 (2d12 + 2) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Fleeting Anger
entries.description: If another creature deals damage to the Returned, the Returned makes attack rolls with advantage until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Unreadable Face
entries.description: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Returned makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The Returned has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the Returned's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The Returned has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Unreadable Face
entries.description: The Returned is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts. Wisdom (Insight) checks to ascertain the Returned's intentions or sincerity are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The revenant regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the revenant takes Fire or Radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. Its body is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Undead Restoration
entries.description: If the revenant dies, it revives 24 hours later in a different body unless Dispel Evil and Good is cast on its corpse. If it revives, it animates a Humanoid corpse elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The revenant uses Vengeful Glare and makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Vengeful Glare
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (15), one creature the revenant can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. If the Frightened target is cursed by the revenant (see Vow of Revenge), the target also has the Paralyzed condition for the duration.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage. If target is a Large or smaller creature and the rhinoceros moved 20+ feet straight toward it immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) Piercing damage and has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Card Sense
entries.description: The riffler can smell the presence of magical cards, including Decks of Many Things and other magical decks, within 1 mile of itself. It knows the direction to any such cards in that range. Effects that protect a target from divination magic block this sense.

entries.name: Riffling Step
entries.description: The riffler can burrow through any nonmagical material that isn't iron, shuffling the substance through which the riffler moves aside like cards to form a tunnel that closes behind the riffler.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The riffler makes two Spectral Card attacks.

entries.name: Spectral Card
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) force damage plus 5 (1d10) damage that is radiant if the d10 roll is an even number and necrotic if it's odd.

entries.name: Card Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The riffler magically unleashes a spray of spectral cards in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (5d10) force damage and has the restrained condition for 1 minute as cards bind it. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A restrained creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Plane Shift
entries.description: The riffler casts the Plane Shift spell targeting only itself, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the rime hulk dies, it explodes in a Very Close-radius sphere of frigid air and frost centered on itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 10 (3d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The rime hulk makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Trail of Frost (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The rime hulk moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. Each time the rime hulk enters another creature's space for the first time during this move, that creature must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) cold damage, and its speed is reduced by Very Close until the start of the rime hulk's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): chill touch, mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield2nd level (3 slots): blur, hold person3rd level (2 slots): sleet storm

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The riverine can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the riverine fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The riverine makes two Flood Strike attacks.

entries.name: Flood Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The riverine casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: control water, fog cloud1/day: greater restoration

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The roc makes two Beak attacks. It can replace one attack with a Talons attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Very Close. Hit: 28 (3d12 + 9) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +13, reach Very Close. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) Slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (19)) from both talons, and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries.description: The gnome has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The gnome is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, prestidigitation, ray of frost (see "Actions" below)1st level (3 slots): detect magic, mage armor, magic missile (see "Actions" below), shield

entries.name: Magic Missile (Expends a 1st-Level Spell Slot)
entries.description: The gnome creates three magical darts. Each dart hits a creature the gnome chooses within Very Far of it and deals 3 (1d4 + 1) force damage.

entries.name: Ray of Frost
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) cold damage, and the target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the start of the gnome's next turn.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The rooster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The roper makes two Tentacle attacks, uses Reel, and makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Far. Hit: The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of six tentacles, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the grapple ends.The tentacle can be damaged, freeing a creature it has Grappled when destroyed (AC 20, HP 10, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). Damaging the tentacle deals no damage to the roper, and a destroyed tentacle regrows at the start of the roper's next turn.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: The roper pulls each creature Grappled by it up to Close straight toward it.

entries.name: Rancid Degeneration
entries.description: At the end of each of the troll's turns, each creature within Very Close of it takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage, unless the troll has taken acid or fire damage since the end of its last turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the rothé moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (13)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries.description: In the first round of a combat, the stalker has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn yet.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: The stalker can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Ruin Dweller
entries.description: The stalker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in ruins, and its speed is not reduced in difficult terrain composed of rubble.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The stalker deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The stalker makes three attacks with its shortsword.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Trampling Charge
entries.description: If the elephant moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one prone creature. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Fire Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the ruin grinder is subjected to fire damage, it regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The ruin grinder deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The ruin grinder can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ruin grinder makes two Excavator attacks.

entries.name: Excavator
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) force damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be pushed up to Very Close away and knocked prone.

entries.name: Ruinous Acid
entries.description: Any nonmagical weapon that hits the spider corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the spider is destroyed after dealing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Sense
entries.description: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spider makes two Ruinous Bite attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Web.

entries.name: Ruinous Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage and 9 (2d8) acid damage. In addition, if the target is a creature wearing nonmagical armor, the armor takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an Armor Class of 10 is destroyed.

entries.name: Web (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: The target has the restrained condition. As an action, a restrained target can make a Difficulty (13) Strength check, bursting the webbing on a successful check. The webbing can also be destroyed (AC 10; 5 hit points; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to acid, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The behir makes two attacks: one with its bite and one to constrict.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)) if the behir isn't already constricting a creature, and the target is restrained until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The behir exhales a line of lightning that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16), taking 66 (12d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Swallow
entries.description: The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the behir's turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The colossus has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The colossus makes two Slam attacks and then uses Stomp.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (22) or have the prone condition. Until the colossus uses its Stomp again or moves, the creature has the restrained condition. The restrained creature or another creature within Very Close of it can use its action to make a Difficulty (22) Strength check. On a successful check, the affected creature relocates to an unoccupied space of its choice within Very Close of the colossus and is no longer restrained.

entries.name: Arcane Beam (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The colossus fires a beam of magical force from its chest, hands, or head in a Very Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (22), taking 58 (9d12) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Iron Scent
entries.description: The rust monster can pinpoint the location of ferrous metal within Close of itself.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The rust monster makes one Bite attack and uses Antennae twice.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Antennae
entries.description: The rust monster targets one nonmagical metal object—armor or a weapon—worn or carried by a creature within Very Close of itself. Agility Reaction Roll (11), the creature with the object. Failure: The object takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers (armor) or to its attack rolls (weapon). Armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10, and a weapon is destroyed if its penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the Mending spell on the armor or weapon.

entries.name: Destroy Metal
entries.description: The rust monster touches a nonmagical metal object within Very Close of itself that isn't being worn or carried. The touch destroys a Melee Cube of the object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Rusted makes three attacks, using Slam or Rusted Shot Put in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rusted Shot Put
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range Far. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Rusted makes two attacks, using Greatsword or Javelin in any combination.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the Rusted fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Rusted makes two Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Close. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (19), each creature and flammable object that isn't being worn or carried in a Far Cone. Failure: 45 (7d12) Fire damage, and the target starts burning. Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

entries.name: Immobilizing Fear
entries.description: When a creature that isn't a demon starts its turn within Close of one or more rutterkins, that creature must make a Presence Reaction Roll (11).
