The creature has disadvantage on the save if it's within Close of six or more rutterkins. On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the rutterkins for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is restrained. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the creature is immune to the Crippling Fear of all rutterkins for 24 hours.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) against disease or become poisoned. At the end of each long rest, the poisoned target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points while poisoned in this way, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes. The transformation can be undone only by a wish spell.

entries.name: Running Leap
entries.description: With a Very Close running start, the tiger can Long Jump up to Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tiger makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the statue is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the statue move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the statue isn't an object.

entries.name: Ghostly Inhabitant
entries.description: The eidolon that enters the statue remains inside it until the statue drops to 0 hit points, the eidolon uses a bonus action to move out of the statue, or the eidolon is turned or forced out by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the eidolon leaves the statue, it appears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the statue.

entries.name: Inert
entries.description: Without an eidolon inside, the statue is an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The statue doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes two Slam or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 43 (6d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range Far/Very Far, one target. Hit: 37 (6d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Unarmored Movement
entries.description: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by Very Close (included in its speed).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The monk makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shocking Grasp (Cantrip)
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +6 to hit (with advantage if the target is wearing armor made of metal), reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks):At will: light, mage hand, mending3/day each: comprehend languages, detect magic, identify1/day each: dispel magic, levitate, locate object, see invisibility, sending, tongues, unseen servant

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The sahuagin has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The sahuagin can magically control sharks within Very Far of itself, using a special telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sahuagin makes three Trident attacks.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The blademaster has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The blademaster can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The blademaster can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The blademaster makes three attacks with its wavecutter blade, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Wavecutter Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The champion has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The champion can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The champion can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The champion makes three attacks with its spear, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The coral smasher has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The coral smasher can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The coral smasher can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The coral smasher deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The coral smasher makes two attacks with its warhammer, or one attack with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The deep diver has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Brine Lurker
entries.description: The deep diver has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made while submerged in water.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The deep diver can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Lure
entries.description: The deep diver can cause its lure to light up or darken at will. While the lure is lit, the deep diver sheds bright light in a Close radius centered on itself and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The deep diver can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The deep diver makes two attacks with its glaive, or one attack with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Light of Sekolah
entries.description: The deep diver pulses magical light from its lure. Any creature within Close of the deep diver that can see the light must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be charmed until the end of its next turn. A creature charmed in this way is incapacitated as it stares at the light.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The swarm has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Seething
entries.description: Once it enters combat, the swarm deals 10 slashing damage to itself at the end of its turn if it did not make an attack on that turn. This damage ignores resistance, and it cannot reduce the swarm to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and it can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The swarm can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bites
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Melee, one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 14 (4d6) piercing damage, or 7 (2d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The high priestess has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The high priestess can breathe air and water, but she needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The high priestess can magically command any shark within Very Far of her, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The high priestess is a 7th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, resistance, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): bless, detect magic, guiding bolt2nd level (3 slots): hold person, spiritual weapon (trident)3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, fear, mass healing word, tongues4th level (1 slot): banishment

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The high priestess makes two attacks with her toothsome staff, or one attack with her bite and one with her claws.

entries.name: Toothsome Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The sahuagin has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The sahuagin can magically control sharks within Very Far of itself, using a special telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sahuagin makes two Spectral Jaws attacks.

entries.name: Spectral Jaws
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) Force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sahuagin casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: Thaumaturgy2/day each: Hold Person, Tongues

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The warlock has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: eldritch blast (see "Actions" below), minor illusion1/day each: armor of Agathys, arms of Hadar, counterspell, crown of madness, invisibility, hunger of Hadar

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The warlock can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The warlock can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The warlock makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its Sword of Fathoms.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Sword of Fathoms
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or begin choking. The choking creature is incapacitated until the end of its next turn, when the effect ends on it.

entries.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d10) force damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The sahuagin has Advantage on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its Hit Points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The sahuagin can magically control sharks within Very Far of itself, using a special telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sahuagin makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The wave shaper has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The wave shaper's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:At will: message1/day: comprehend languages

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The wave shaper can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Shark Telepathy
entries.description: The wave shaper can magically command any shark within Very Far of it, using a limited telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wave shaper makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d8 + 1) slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Whirlpool (1/Day)
entries.description: The wave shaper targets a body of water at least Far square and Close deep, causing a whirlpool to form in the center of the area. The whirlpool forms a vortex that is Very Close wide at the base, up to Far wide at the top, Close tall, and lasts for 1 minute or until the wave shaper is incapacitated. Any creature or object in the water and within Close of the vortex is pulled Very Close toward it. A creature can swim away from the vortex by succeeding on a Difficulty (14) Strength (Athletics) check.When a creature enters the vortex for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Strength Reaction Roll (14). On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and is caught in the vortex until it ends. On a success, the creature takes half damage and isn't caught in the vortex. A creature caught in the vortex can use its action to try to swim away from the vortex as described above, but it has disadvantage on the Strength (Athletics) check to do so.The first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage. This damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.

entries.name: Fire Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the salamander's turns, each creature of the salamander's choice in a Very Close Emanation originating from the salamander takes 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The salamander makes two Flame Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Constrict.

entries.name: Flame Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the salamander's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (15), one Large or smaller creature the salamander can see within Very Close. Failure: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Fire damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends.

entries.name: Fire Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the salamander's turns, each creature of the salamander's choice in a Very Close Emanation originating from the salamander takes 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Fire Aura
entries.description: At the end of each of the salamander's turns, each creature of the salamander's choice in a Very Close Emanation originating from the salamander takes 10 (3d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The salamander has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The salamander makes two Flame Trident attacks.

entries.name: Flame Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Fire damage. Hit or Miss: The trident magically returns to the salamander's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Inferno Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the salamander can see within Very Far. Failure: 35 (10d6) Fire damage, and the target starts burning, taking 5 (1d10) Fire damage at the start of each of its turns instead of the normal burning damage. The target gains 1 Exhaustion level whenever it takes this burning damage. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The dragon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The dragon can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and can leave a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) thunder damage.

entries.name: Debilitating Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a pulse of high-pitched, nearly inaudible sound in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) thunder damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: alarm, Tenser's floating disk

entries.name: Gem Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 400 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use its Mass Telekinesis action during the next hour. Award a party an additional 90,000 XP (180,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Gem Awakening activates.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (19)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm exhales crushing force in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature takes 71 (11d12) force damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. On a success or failure, the creature's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Mass Telekinesis (Gem Awakening Only; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The greatwyrm targets any number of creatures and objects it can see within Very Far of it. No one target can weigh more than 4,000 pounds, and objects can't be targeted if they're being worn or carried. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be restrained in the greatwyrm's telekinetic grip. At the end of a creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.At the end of the greatwyrm's turn, it can move each creature or object it has in its telekinetic grip up to Far in any direction, but not beyond Very Far of itself. In addition, it can choose any number of creatures restrained in this way and deal 45 (7d12) force damage to each of them.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The greatwyrm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attack):1/day each: dispel magic, forcecage, plane shift, reverse gravity, time stop

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Sapphire
entries.description: The sapphire has 3 charges. As an action, the golem can expend 1 charge to cast dispel magic (as a 9th-level spell) from the sapphire using Constitution as its spellcasting ability. The sapphire ceases to glow if all its charges are expended, but it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn and glows again once it has 1 or more charges.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The satyr has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the satyr pushes the target up to Very Close straight away from itself.

entries.name: Mockery
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (12), one creature the satyr can see within Far. Failure: 5 (1d6 + 2) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Enthralling Performance
entries.description: If the satyr performs for at least 1 minute, it chooses up to four humanoids within Far of it who watched or listened to the entire performance. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be charmed. While charmed in this way, the target idolizes the satyr and will take part in the satyr's revels. The charmed condition ends for the creature after 1 hour, if it takes any damage, if the satyr attacks the target, or if the target witnesses the satyr attacking or damaging any of the target's allies.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sleepless Reveler
entries.description: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The satyr makes two ram attacks or two shortbow attacks.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The satyr has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The satyr makes three Prance attacks.

entries.name: Prance
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the satyr's next turn.

entries.name: Fey Melody (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The satyr conjures a charming or frightening song. Presence Reaction Roll (14), each enemy in a Far Emanation originating from the satyr. Failure: The target is subjected to the song's effect:Charming. The target has the Charmed condition for 1 minute. While Charmed, the target has the Incapacitated condition and uses all its movement to dance in place. The effect ends on the target if it takes any damage.Frightening. 10 (2d6 + 3) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition for 1 minute. If the target ends its turn out of line of sight from the satyr, the condition ends on it.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The satyr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sleepless Reveler
entries.description: Magic can't put the satyr to sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The satyr makes three ram attacks or three shortbow attacks.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hail of Arrows (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The satyr fires an arrow that magically transforms into a flurry of missiles in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 17 (5d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the scaladar is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage, and its sting deals an extra 11 (2d10) lightning damage until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Scaladar Link
entries.description: The scaladar knows the location of other scaladar within Far of it, and it can sense when any of them take damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scaladar makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). The scaladar has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 11 (2d10) lightning damage.

entries.name: Fearsome Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) Slashing damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of the scarecrow's next turn.

entries.name: Terrifying Glare
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), one creature the scarecrow can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the end of the scarecrow's next turn. While Frightened, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Arcane Shock
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The agent casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: dancing lights, mage hand1/day each: comprehend languages, identify (as an action), mage armor

entries.name: Siege Expert
entries.description: The excavator deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The excavator makes three Thunderous Warhammer attacks.

entries.name: Thunderous Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) thunder damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mastermind makes two Arcane Shock or Dagger of the Poisoned Mind attacks.

entries.name: Arcane Shock
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Dagger of the Poisoned Mind
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mastermind casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: alter self, light, mage hand1/day each: comprehend languages, mage armor, zone of truth

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one Great Tree Club attack and two Slam attacks, or it makes three Boulder attacks.

entries.name: Great Tree Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 30 (4d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (23) or be pushed horizontally up to Far straight away from the scion and have the prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d8 + 8) force damage.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 27 (3d12 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Inhale (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The scion inhales a vortex of air in a Very Far line that is Close wide. Each creature in that area that is Huge or smaller must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (23) or be pulled up to Very Far straight toward the scion and be swallowed. A swallowed creature has the restrained condition, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the scion, and takes 24 (7d6) force damage at the start of each of the scion's turns.The scion's stomach can hold up to two creatures at a time. If the scion takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the scion must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within Very Close of the scion and has the prone condition. If the scion dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the restrained condition and can escape from the corpse using Close of movement, exiting with the prone condition.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The scion doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one attack using Cloud Morningstar or Wind Javelin, as well as two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Cloud Morningstar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) force damage plus 22 (4d10) thunder damage.

entries.name: Wind Javelin
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 42 (5d12 + 10) thunder damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Thunderous Vortex (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The scion magically creates a vortex of wind in a Far-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within Very Far of itself. Each creature in the sphere must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (24) or be pulled straight toward the sphere's center, ending in an unoccupied space as close as possible to the center. Then a burst of thunder erupts in a Close-radius sphere centered on the same point. Each creature in that area takes 52 (8d12) thunder damage and must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (24) or have the stunned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one Crystal Club attack and two Slam attacks, then uses Entombing Grasp if available. Alternatively, the scion makes two Runic Boulder attacks.

entries.name: Crystal Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: The scion can cause the club to flare with bright light, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (22) or take 18 (4d8) radiant damage and have the blinded condition until the start of the scion's next turn.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 31 (4d10 + 9) force damage.

entries.name: Runic Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) bludgeoning damage. Hit or Miss: The boulder explodes. The target and each creature within Close of it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (22). On a failed save, a creature takes 19 (3d12) force damage and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Entombing Grasp (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The scion wreathes its hand in petrifying magic and touches one Huge or smaller creature it can see within Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (24) or take 28 (8d6) force damage and have the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (19)). At the start of the scion's next turn, if the target is still grappled, the target has the petrified condition.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The scion doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one attack using Lightning Sword or Hailstone, as well as two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Lightning Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage plus 22 (4d10) lightning damage.

entries.name: Hailstone
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one attack using Lava Blade or Lava Ball, as well as two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Lava Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Lava Ball
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 29 (3d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Lava Wave (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The scion emits a wave of lava from its blade, hands, or mouth in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, a creature takes 60 (11d10) fire damage and has the restrained condition from being embedded in hardening rock. A creature can make a Difficulty (25) Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 40 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (6/Day)
entries.description: If the scion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The scion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The scion deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scion makes one Ice Axe and two Slam attacks, or it makes two Glacier Throw attacks.

entries.name: Ice Axe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) force damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 32 (4d10 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Glacier Throw
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) cold damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (25) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Glacial Upheaval (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The scion digs its hands into the ground at a point it can see within Close of itself and launches a magically conjured mass of ice into the air. Each creature other than the scion in a Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, a creature takes 36 (8d8) bludgeoning damage plus 19 (3d12) cold damage and is pushed vertically to the top of the cylinder, at which point the creature falls. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space outside the cylinder with no additional effects.At the start of the scion's next turn, a mass of ice plummets to the ground on a point the scion can see within Far of the point the scion dug its hands into. Each creature in a Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on that point must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (25) or take 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) cold damage.

entries.name: Explosive Tank
entries.description: When the guard dies, or if it rolls a 1 when checking whether its Scorchbringer action recharges, the tank on its back explodes in a Very Close radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the scorchbringer.

entries.name: Light Hammer
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Scorchbringer (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The guard's scorchbringer spouts a stream of flame in a line that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in the line must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 7 (2d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes two attacks, using Shortsword and Longbow in any combination.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes two attacks, using Shortsword or Longbow in any combination.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage, plus 10 (3d6) Piercing damage if the attack was made with Advantage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Very Far. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage, plus 10 (3d6) Piercing damage if the attack was made with Advantage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d3 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The serpentmaw can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The serpentmaw has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the serpentmaw's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The serpentmaw makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 17 (4d6 + 3) piercing damage if the serpentmaw had advantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The sea elf can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The sea elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the sea elf to sleep.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Child of the Sea
entries.description: The scout can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The scout has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The sea fury can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The sea fury's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: witch bolt1/day each: bestow curse, fear, thunderwave

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the sea fury fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The sea fury has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sea fury makes two attacks with its claws.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Death Glare
entries.description: The sea fury targets one frightened creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or drop to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Coven Magic
entries.description: While within Close of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell's normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)): Augury, Find Familiar, Identify, Locate Object, Scrying, or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

entries.name: Vile Appearance
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), any Beast or Humanoid that starts its turn within Close of the hag and can see the hag's true form. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition until the start of its next turn. Success: The target is immune to this hag's Vile Appearance for 24 hours.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Death Glare (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (11), one Frightened creature the hag can see within Close. Failure: If the target has 20 Hit Points or fewer, it drops to 0 Hit Points. Otherwise, the target takes 13 (3d8) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Illusory Appearance
entries.description: The hag casts Disguise Self, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)). The spell's duration is 24 hours.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The sea lion can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The sea lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The sea lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sea lion's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Swimming Leap
entries.description: With a Very Close swimming start, the sea lion can long jump out of or across the water up to Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sea lion makes three attacks: one bite attack and two claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The sea spawn can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged in the sea at least once a day for 1 minute to avoid suffocating.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sea spawn makes two Unarmed Strike attacks and one Piscine Anatomy attack.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Piscine Anatomy
entries.description: The sea spawn uses one of the following options (choose one or roll a d6):1–2: Bite. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.3–4: Poison Quills. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 3 (1d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.5–6: Tentacle. Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (12)) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the sea spawn can't use this tentacle on another target.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The seahorse can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bubble Dash
entries.description: While underwater, the seahorse moves up to its Swim Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The seal can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The seal has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Corrode Metal
entries.description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to −5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage.The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an oily pool or wet rock.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, its armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 3 (1d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The marshal makes three attacks, using Longsword or Pistol in any combination.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage, and the target has Disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the marshal's next turn.

entries.name: Pistol
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range Close. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Axiomatic Mind
entries.description: The septon can't be compelled to act in a manner contrary to its nature or its instructions.

entries.name: Combat Ready
entries.description: The septon has advantage on initiative checks.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the septon dies, its body disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was carrying.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The septon makes four Tentacle attacks and uses Lightning Network or Spellcasting.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The septon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: detect magic, dispel magic, mending (as an action)1/day each: plane shift (self only), protection from evil and good, sending

entries.name: Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until this grapple ends, the septon can't use this tentacle against other targets. The septon has seven tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Lightning Network
entries.description: The septon conjures a field of electricity that fills a Close cube originating from itself before dissipating. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) lightning damage and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The hoplite has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the hoplite's allies is within Very Close of the hoplite and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hoplite makes two scimitar attacks or two longbow attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Burden of Time
entries.description: Beasts and Humanoids (except elves) have disadvantage on saving throws while within Very Close of the shadar-kai.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadar-kai makes three Shadow Spear attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Shadow Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range 30/120, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 26 (4d12) necrotic damage. Hit or Miss: The spear magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: arcane eye, mage armor, minor illusion, prestidigitation, speak with dead1/day each: arcane gate, bane, confusion, darkness, fear, major image, true seeing

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadar-kai makes three Spiked Chain attacks.It can use Shadow Jump after one of these attacks.

entries.name: Spiked Chain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or suffer one of the following effects (choose one or roll a d6):1–2: Decay. The target takes 22 (4d10) necrotic damage.3–4: Grapple. The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the shadar-kai can't grapple another target.5–6: Topple. The target is knocked prone.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The shadar-kai has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Soul Thirst
entries.description: When it reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the shadar-kai can gain temporary hit points equal to half the creature's hit point maximum. While the shadar-kai has temporary hit points from this trait, it has advantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Weight of Ages
entries.description: Any Beast or Humanoid (except an elf) that starts its turn within Very Close of the shadar-kai has its speed reduced by Close until the start of that creature's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadar-kai makes two Shadow Dagger attacks.

entries.name: Shadow Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 13 (4d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 19 (3d12) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on saving throws until the end of the shadar-kai's next turn. Hit or Miss: The dagger magically returns to the shadar-kai's hand immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shadar-kai casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):1/day each: bestow curse, finger of death, gaseous form, seeming

entries.name: Wave of Weariness (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The shadar-kai emits weariness in a Far cube. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (10d8) psychic damage and suffers 1 level of exhaustion. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and doesn't gain a level of exhaustion.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The shadow can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the shadow has Disadvantage on D20 Tests.

entries.name: Draining Swipe
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Necrotic damage, and the target's Strength score decreases by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. If a Humanoid is slain by this attack, a Shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

entries.name: Amorphous
entries.description: The assassin can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the assassin can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in sunlight, the assassin has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The assassin makes two Shadow Blade attacks.

entries.name: Shadow Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, the target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4 each time it is hit by this attack. The target dies if its Strength is reduced to 0. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a shadow (see the Monster Manual) rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the demon dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Abyss.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The demon can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Light Sensitivity
entries.description: While in Bright Light, the demon has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Umbral Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Living Shadow
entries.description: While in Dim Light or Darkness, the dragon has Resistance to damage that isn't Force, Psychic, or Radiant.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the dragon has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Shadow Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Far Cone. Failure: 35 (10d6) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies, and a Shadow rises from the corpse. The shadow is under the dragon's control and shares the dragon's Initiative count but acts immediately after the dragon.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The horror can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the horror can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Shadow Stride
entries.description: As a bonus action, the horror can step into a shadow within Very Close of it and magically appear in an unoccupied space within Very Close of a second shadow that is up to Far away. Both shadows must be cast by a Small or larger creature or object.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the horror has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horror makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (16) or be frightened of the horror until the end of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Lashing Shadows (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Each creature within Far of the horror, except other horrors, must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (16) or take 27 (6d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Ethereal Awareness
entries.description: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Ethereal Awareness
entries.description: The shadow mastiff can see ethereal creatures and objects.

entries.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries.description: While in bright light created by sunlight, the shadow mastiff has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Terrifying Howl (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The shadow mastiff howls. Any Beast or Humanoid within Very Far of it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be frightened of it for 1 minute. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's save is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to any shadow mastiff's Terrifying Howl for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Terror Frenzy (Fury Only)
entries.description: The spirit has advantage on attack rolls against frightened creatures.

entries.name: Weight of Sorrow (Despair Only)
entries.description: Any creature, other than you, that starts its turn within Very Close of the spirit has its speed reduced by Close until the start of that creature's next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

entries.name: Chilling Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1d12 + 3 + the spell's level cold damage.

entries.name: Dreadful Scream (1/Day)
entries.description: The spirit screams. Each creature within Close of it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be frightened for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The agent makes two Shadow Knife attacks.

entries.name: Shadow Knife
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage, and the target's Speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The agent casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (Difficulty (14)):At will: Disguise Self, Minor Illusion1/day: Pass without Trace

entries.name: Shadow Stealth
entries.description: While in dim light or darkness, the shadowghast can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the shadowghast must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to this Stench for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadowghast makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three attacks, using Tree Club or Boulder in any combination.

entries.name: Tree Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Far. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Wild Magic Cataclysm (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point within Very Far. Failure: 28 (8d6) damage (roll 1d4 to determine damage type: 1—Acid; 2—Fire; 3—Lightning; 4—Thunder). Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Shadrix fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Shadrix makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 12 (1d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is wracked with despair and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Illuminating Shadow Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Shadrix exhales an entwined burst of blinding radiance and unnerving shadow in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, a creature takes 31 (7d8) radiant damage and 31 (7d8) psychic damage and is blinded until the start of Shadrix's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Shadrix casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (23)):1/day each: darkness, daylight, hypnotic pattern, sending, suggestion

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to Lightning damage, it regains a number of Hit Points equal to the Lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shambling mound makes three Charged Tendril attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Engulf.

entries.name: Charged Tendril
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 5 (2d4) Lightning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, the shambling mound pulls the target Very Close straight toward itself.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (15), one Medium or smaller creature within Very Close. Failure: The target is pulled into the shambling mound's space and has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)). Until the grapple ends, the target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and it takes 10 (3d6) Lightning damage at the start of each of its turns. When the shambling mound moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The shambling mound can have only one creature Grappled by this action at a time.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The roper can use its action to polymorph into a stone object or back to its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal cave formation, such as a stalagmite.

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils
entries.description: The roper can have up to six tendrils at a time. Each tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a Difficulty (15) Strength check against it.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The roper makes four attacks with its tendrils, uses Reel, and makes one attack with its bite.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Far, one creature. Hit: The target is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws, and the roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

entries.name: Reel
entries.description: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to Close straight toward it.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The Shard Shunner can use their action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into their true form, which is humanoid. Their statistics, other than their size, are the same in each form. Any equipment they are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. They revert to their true form if they die.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The Shard Shunner has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries.description: The Shard Shunner can move through the space of creatures that is of a size larger than them.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The Shard Shunner has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: The Shard Shunner makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

entries.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

entries.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The abomination has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries.description: The abomination can breathe air and water, but it needs to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.
