entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The abomination can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Boundless Movement
entries.description: The shator ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed. It can spend Very Close of movement to automatically remove the grappled condition from itself.

entries.name: Jailer (1/Day)
entries.description: The shator can cast the imprisonment spell, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (chaining effect only; spell save Difficulty (18)).

entries.name: Liquefaction Ritual
entries.description: The shator can perform a 1-minute ritual that turns all willing farastus and kelubars of its choice within Far of itself into a living liquid form. Each liquefied demodand becomes enough liquid to fill a flask. A demodand's liquefaction lasts until a shator uses an action to end it or a creature opens a container holding the liquid. While liquefied in this way, a demodand has the paralyzed condition despite any immunity to that condition, it has immunity to all damage, and any curse affecting it is suspended.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The shator has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Numbing Secretions
entries.description: A creature that touches the shator or hits it with a melee attack while within Very Close of it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (17) or have disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed halved until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shator makes one Bite attack and two Enervating Trident attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (3d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 26 (4d12) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or have the paralyzed condition until the start of the shator's next turn.

entries.name: Enervating Trident
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Inhibitory Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The shator exhales a spray of slime in a line Far long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 40 (9d8) acid damage and has the paralyzed condition for 1 minute. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shator casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks):At will: invisibility (self only), suggestion1/day each: dispel magic, plane shift (to Carceri only), scrying (as an action)

entries.name: Summon Demodand (1/Day)
entries.description: The shator has a 50 percent chance of summoning its choice of 1d4 farastu demodands, 1d2 kelubar demodands, or 1 shator demodand. A summoned demodand appears in an unoccupied space within Far of the shator, acts as an ally of the shator, and can't summon other demodands. It remains for 1 minute, until it or the shator dies, or until the shator dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The sheep has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The shark has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shark makes two bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Special Equipment
entries.description: Shemeshka carries a magic crown called the Razorvine Tiara. In the hands of anyone other than Shemeshka, the Razorvine Tiara functions as a tentacle rod that deals slashing damage instead of bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If Shemeshka fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Shemeshka has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Shemeshka uses Arcane Flux or Spellcasting. She then makes one Claw attack or one attack with her Razorvine Tiara.

entries.name: Arcane Flux
entries.description: Shemeshka causes a surge of arcane energy to burst around one creature she can see within Very Far of herself. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the target takes 45 (7d12) force damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Razorvine Tiara
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), or its speed is halved and it has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Shemeshka casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: alter self, darkness, invisibility (self only), mage hand, prestidigitation2/day each: detect thoughts, dimension door, suggestion1/day each: banishment, contact other plane (as an action), mind blank

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The shield dwarf guard has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Dwarven Resilience
entries.description: The shield dwarf noble has advantage on saving throws against poison, and has resistance against poison damage.

entries.name: Warhammer
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Bound
entries.description: The guardian is magically bound to an amulet. While the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the amulet's wearer can telepathically call the guardian to travel to it, and the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet. If the guardian is within Far of the amulet's wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (round up) is transferred to the guardian.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The guardian regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Spell Storing
entries.description: A spellcaster who wears the guardian's amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of level 4 or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian while within Very Close of it. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. Any previously stored spell is lost when a new spell is stored. The guardian can cast the spell stored with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no spell components and using the caster's spellcasting ability. The stored spell is then lost.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guardian makes two Fist attacks.

entries.name: Fist
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Force damage.

entries.name: Shifting (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: As a bonus action, the shifter takes on a more bestial form for 1 minute or until it dies. The shifter gains 5 temporary hit points. It can make a bite attack when it activates this trait and also as a bonus action on each of its turns while in its bestial form.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shoosuva makes one Bite attack and one Tail Stinger attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (4d10 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Tail Stinger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Contamination
entries.description: The sibriex emits an aura of corruption Close in every direction. Vegetation withers in the aura, and the ground in the aura is difficult terrain for other creatures. Any creature that starts its turn in the aura must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20) or take 14 (4d6) poison damage. A creature that succeeds on the save is immune to this sibriex's Contamination for 24 hours.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the sibriex fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The sibriex has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sibriex makes three Chain attacks, and it uses Squirt Bile.

entries.name: Chain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d12 + 7) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sibriex casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21)):At will: command, dispel magic, hold monster1/day: feeblemind

entries.name: Squirt Bile
entries.description: The sibriex targets one creature it can see within Very Far of it. The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (20) or take 31 (9d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Warp Creature
entries.description: The sibriex targets up to three creatures it can see within Very Far of it. Each target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (20). On a successful save, a creature becomes immune to this sibriex's Warp Creature. On a failed save, the target is poisoned, which causes it to also gain 1 level of exhaustion. While poisoned in this way, the target must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. Three successful saves against the poison end it, and ending the poison removes any levels of exhaustion caused by it. Each failed save causes the target to gain another level of exhaustion. Once the target reaches 6 levels of exhaustion, it dies and instantly transforms into a living manes under the sibriex's control. The transformation of the body can be undone only by a wish spell.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes two Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 18 (4d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Paralyzing Breath
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), each creature in a Close Cone. First Failure: The target has the Incapacitated condition until the end of its next turn, when it repeats the save. Second Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

name: Silver Greatwyrm

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Metallic Awakening (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: If the greatwyrm would be reduced to 0 hit points, its current hit point total instead resets to 450 hit points, it recharges its Breath Weapon, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the greatwyrm can now use the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 120,000 XP (240,000 XP total) for defeating the greatwyrm after its Metallic Awakening activates.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The greatwyrm doesn't require food or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The greatwyrm makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d8 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (20)) and is restrained until this grapple ends. The greatwyrm can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (26) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The greatwyrm uses one of the following breath weapons:Elemental Breath. The greatwyrm exhales elemental energy in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25), taking 84 (13d12) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.Sapping Breath. The greatwyrm exhales gas in a Very Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failed save, the creature falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of the greatwyrm's next turn. An unconscious creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: The greatwyrm magically transforms into any creature that is Medium or Small, while retaining its game statistics (other than its size). This transformation ends if the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or uses its action to end it.

original_cr: 28 (XP 120,000, or 240,000 as a mythic encounter; PB +8)

entries.name: Ink Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)):At will: dancing lights, friends1/day each: command, mage armor

entries.name: Ink Blade
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The pledgemage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: dancing lights, friends1/day each: command, confusion, mage armor, tongues

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Radiant Strike attacks. The professor can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Radiant Strike
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) be blinded until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: dancing lights, friends2/day each: bless, command, cure wounds, daylight, mage armor1/day each: hypnotic pattern, tongues

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the professor's darkvision.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Ink Lance attacks. The professor can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Ink Lance
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) be blinded until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: dancing lights, friends2/day each: bane, command, darkness, mage armor1/day: tongues

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) piercing damage, or 4 (1d8) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Jared makes three Longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) radiant damage. On a roll of 19 or 20, Jared scores a critical hit.

entries.name: Aura of Mind Erosion
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Close of the sire must make a Presence Reaction Roll (18). On a successful save, the creature is immune to this aura for the next 24 hours. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage for 1 minute on Wisdom and Charisma checks and on Wisdom and Charisma saves. At the start of each of its turns, the sire can suppress this aura until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The sire's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks). The sire can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: clairvoyance, crown of madness, major image, suggestion1/day each: confusion, mass suggestion

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The sire has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sire makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Death Throes
entries.description: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points by a creature that is Large or smaller, the draconian crumbles into dust that then forms a spectral, shrieking image of the creature that killed it. The image lasts for 1 minute. Each creature hostile to the draconian within Very Close of the image must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be frightened of the spectral image for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Serrated Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (14) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Words of Reason
entries.description: Allies in a Very Close Emanation originating from the scribe have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed or Frightened condition. This trait doesn't function if the scribe has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The scribe makes two Bursting Sigil attacks.

entries.name: Bursting Sigil
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 3) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The scribe casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (Difficulty (13)):At will: Comprehend Languages, Mage Armor (included in AC), Message1/Da y: Sending

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The skeletal alchemist has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skeletal alchemist makes two Lob Acid attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Lob Acid
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) acid damage.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the bloodfin dies, it explodes in a cloud of toxic blood. Each creature in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on the exploding bloodfin, including any creature swallowed by the bloodfin, must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. A creature inside the bloodfin when it explodes falls prone in the space formerly occupied by the bloodfin and is no longer blinded or restrained by it.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The skeletal bloodfin requires no food, drink, air, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bloodfin makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the bloodfin can't bite another target.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Disassemble
entries.description: If the juggernaut is reduced to 0 hit points, twelve skeletons rise from its remains.

entries.name: Falling Apart
entries.description: If the juggernaut does not have all of its hit points at the start of its turn, it loses 10 hit points.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The juggernaut makes two claws attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Avalanche of Bones (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The juggernaut collapses into a large heap before quickly reforming. Each creature within Very Close of the juggernaut must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this saving throw is also knocked prone.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the skeletal knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is bludgeoning or from a critical hit. On a success, the skeletal knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The skeletal knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skeletal knight makes three Enervating Blade or Throwing Axe attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Enervating Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

entries.name: Throwing Axe
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Bites
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Melee, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) piercing damage, or 3 (1d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Deafening Clatter
entries.description: Creatures are deafened while in the swarm's space.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Slash
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Melee, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The skeleton can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skeleton makes two dagger attacks.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The horror can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the horror has disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horror can use its Maddening Presence and make three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Maddening Presence
entries.description: The horror targets one creature it can see within Close of it. If the target can see or hear the horror, the target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17). On a failed saving throw, the target becomes paralyzed until the end of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the horror's Maddening Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the skitterwidget is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The skitterwidget doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skitterwidget makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled by the skitterwidget (escape Difficulty (13)).

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) lightning damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Fallible Invisibility
entries.description: The skulk is invisible. This invisibility can be circumvented by three things:Charnel Candles. The skulk appears as a dim, translucent form in the light of a candle made of fat rendered from a corpse whose identity is unknown.Children. Humanoid children, aged 10 and under, can see through this invisibility.Reflective Surfaces. The skulk appears as a drab, smooth-skinned biped if its reflection can be seen in a mirror or on another surface.

entries.name: Trackless
entries.description: The skulk leaves no tracks to indicate where it has been or where it's headed.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The skull lasher is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, message, prestidigitation1st level (4 slots): detect magic, protection from evil and good, ray of sickness (see "Actions" below), shield2nd level (2 slots): darkness, misty step

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skull lasher makes two attacks with its flail.

entries.name: Iron Skull Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage, and the target has disadvantage on all saving throws until the end of the skull lasher's next turn.

entries.name: Ray of Sickness (1st-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one creature. Hit: 9 (2d8) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be poisoned until the end of the skull lasher's next turn. If the skull lasher casts this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the skull lord is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half the damage, the skull lord instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails, provided it isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the skull lord fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Master of the Grave
entries.description: While within Close of the skull lord, any Undead ally of the skull lord makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The skull lord doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skull lord makes three Bone Staff or Deathly Ray attacks.

entries.name: Bone Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Deathly Ray
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The skull, lord casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: mage hand, message2/day each: dimension door, fear1/day each: cloudkill, cone of cold

entries.name: Abolethic Vassal
entries.description: The skum is permanently charmed by its aboleth master.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The skum can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Psychic Conditioning
entries.description: The skum is immune to the frightened and charmed conditions unless they are from effects created by an aboleth.

entries.name: Water Dependency
entries.description: The skum takes 6 (1d12) acid damage every 10 minutes it goes without exposure to water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skum makes three attacks: two with its trident and one with its Mind-Breaking Touch.

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Mind-Breaking Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) psychic damage, and the target has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws until the end of the skum's next turn.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The roc has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The roc makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its talons.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d4 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The skyswimmer can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The skyswimmer makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its slam.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (19) or be swallowed by the skyswimmer. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the skyswimmer, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the skyswimmer's turns. If the skyswimmer takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the skyswimmer must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (18) at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within Very Close of the skyswimmer. If the skyswimmer dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (2d12 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Skyweaver is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, message, ray of frost, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): feather fall, mage armor, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): gust of wind, invisibility3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The slaad has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The dog has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The dog has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the dog's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (11) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the bloodfin dies, it explodes in a cloud of toxic blood. Each creature in a Very Close-radius sphere centered on the exploding bloodfin, including any creature swallowed by the bloodfin, must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 10 (3d6) poison damage. A creature inside the bloodfin when it explodes falls prone in the space formerly occupied by the bloodfin and is no longer blinded or restrained by it.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The bloodfin can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The bloodfin makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the bloodfin can't bite another target.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit (with advantage if the target is a creature missing any hit points), reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the slithering tracker is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the slithering tracker move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the slithering tracker isn't a puddle.

entries.name: Liquid Form
entries.description: The slithering tracker can enter an enemy's space and stop there. It can also move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The slithering tracker can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Life Leech
entries.description: One Large or smaller creature that the slithering tracker can see within Very Close of it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and unable to breathe unless it can breathe water. In addition, the grappled target takes 16 (3d10) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The slithering tracker can grapple only one target at a time.While grappling the target, the slithering tracker takes only half any damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the target takes the other half.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The mephit explodes when it dies. Finesse Reaction Roll (11), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the mephit. Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Cinder Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (11), one creature the mephit can see within Close. Failure: The target has the Blinded condition until the end of the mephit's next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The snake horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spell Immunity
entries.description: The snake horror is immune to three spells chosen by its creator. Typical immunities include fireball, heat metal, and lightning bolt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The snake horror makes two longsword attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Cold Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to cold damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the cold damage dealt.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Melt
entries.description: While in an area of extreme heat, the golem loses 1d6 hit points at the start of each of its turns.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The golem doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes three melee attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Snowball
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) cold damage.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The leopard has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Pounce
entries.description: If the leopard moves at least Close straight toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the leopard can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the specter has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (3d6) cold damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entries.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries.description: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The owlbear makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its claws.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The muse makes two Beguiling Resonance attacks.

entries.name: Beguiling Resonance
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) psychic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The muse casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: dancing lights1/day each: comprehend languages, hypnotic pattern

entries.name: Divine Awareness
entries.description: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

entries.name: Exalted Restoration
entries.description: If the solar dies outside Mount Celestia, its body disappears, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Mount Celestia.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries.description: If the solar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The solar has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The solar makes two Flying Sword attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Slaying Bow.

entries.name: Flying Sword
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +15, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) Slashing damage plus 36 (8d8) Radiant damage. Hit or Miss: The sword magically returns to the solar's hand or hovers within Very Close of the solar immediately after a ranged attack.

entries.name: Slaying Bow
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (21), one creature the solar can see within Out of Range. Failure: If the creature has 100 Hit Points or fewer, it dies. It otherwise takes 24 (4d8 + 6) Piercing damage plus 36 (8d8) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The solar casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (25)):At will: Detect Evil and Good1/day each: Commune, Control Weather, Dispel Evil and Good, Resurrection

entries.name: Aura of Protection
entries.description: The knight and each ally within Very Close of it have advantage on saving throws. This trait is suppressed while the knight has the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The knight makes three Sunspear attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The knight casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):1/day each: Greater Restoration, Sending, Word of Recall (the prepared sanctuary is the Solar Bastion)

entries.name: Sunspear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) radiant damage, or 21 (5d6 + 4) radiant damage if the target is a Fiend or an Undead.

entries.name: Solar Flare (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The knight unleashes a blaze of brilliant energy that fills a Close-radius sphere centered on the knight. Each creature of the knight's choice in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, a creature takes 22 (4d10) radiant damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. For the next minute, the affected area is filled with bright light that is sunlight.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The dragon doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The dragon doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Photonic Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon exhales a flashing mote of radiant energy that travels to a point the dragon can see within Very Far of itself, then blossoms into a Very Close-radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the sphere must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14), taking 22 (4d10) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Formation Tactics
entries.description: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, grappled, or restrained while it is within Very Close of at least one ally.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The soldier makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries.description: The sorrowfish has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The Sorrowfish can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Enthralled Lure (1/Day)
entries.description: The soul shaker can cast the geas spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries.description: When the soul shaker is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes into 7 (1d4 + 5) crawling claws. After 6 (1d12) days, if at least two of those crawling claws are alive, they teleport to the location of the soul shaker's death and merge together, whereupon the soul shaker reforms and regains all its hit points.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The soul shaker doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Crushing Grasp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)). The soul shaker can have only one creature grappled in this way at a time.

entries.name: Dying Burst
entries.description: When the clown drops to 0 hit points, it pops like a balloon, releasing a splash of putrid, corrosive ichor. Each creature within Very Close of the clown when it bursts must make a Agility Reaction Roll (12), taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Squeakers
entries.description: The clown wears shoes that squeak when it walks. The squeaking can be heard out to a range of Close. The squeaking is silenced while the clown's Phantasmal Form is in effect.

entries.name: Shock
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) lightning damage.

entries.name: Ray Gun
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 7 (2d6) psychic damage, and if the target is a Humanoid with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher, it must make a Presence Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, the target perceives everything it sees or hears as hilariously funny and is incapacitated for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The clown casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability:At will: friends, mage hand, prestidigitation1/day each: mirror image, spider climb

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The eel doesn't require air.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: If it isn't attached to a creature, the eel makes one Bite attack and one Tail Spine attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage, and the eel attaches to the target. While attached, the eel can't make Bite attacks. Instead, the target takes 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage at the start of each of the eel's turns. The eel can detach itself as a bonus action. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the eel.

entries.name: Tail Spine
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the target is paralyzed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Air Envelope
entries.description: If it has at least 1 hit point, the guppy can generate an air envelope around itself when in a vacuum. This air envelope can sustain the guppy and one other Tiny creature in its space indefinitely.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The guppy doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Tail Slap
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage.

entries.name: Go for the Eyes (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (15) or be blinded until the start of the hamster's next turn.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: the hamster has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The mollymawk doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The mollymawk can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The spawn of Kyuss regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or a body of running water. If the spawn takes acid, fire, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the spawn's next turn. The spawn is destroyed only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The spawn of Kyuss requires no air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Worms
entries.description: If the spawn of Kyuss is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away, and it loses its Burrowing Worm action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spawn of Kyuss makes two Claw attacks, and it uses Burrowing Worm.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Burrowing Worm
entries.description: A worm launches from the spawn of Kyuss at one Humanoid that the spawn can see within Very Close of it. The worm latches onto the target's skin unless the target succeeds on a Agility Reaction Roll (11). The worm is a Tiny Undead with AC 6, 1 hit point, a 2 (-4) in every ability score, and a speed of Melee. While on the target's skin, the worm can be killed by normal means or scraped off using an action (the spawn can use Burrowing Worm to launch a scraped-off worm at a Humanoid it can see within Very Close of the worm). Otherwise, the worm burrows under the target's skin at the end of the target's next turn, dealing 1 piercing damage to it. At the end of each of its turns thereafter, the target takes 7 (2d6) necrotic damage per worm infesting it (maximum of 10d6), and if it drops to 0 hit points, it dies and then rises 10 minutes later as a spawn of Kyuss. If a worm-infested target is targeted by an effect that cures disease or removes a curse, all the worms infesting it wither away.

entries.name: Diabolical Restoration
entries.description: If the devil dies outside the Nine Hells, its body disappears in sulfurous smoke, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in the Nine Hells.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes two Thundering Halberd attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The devil casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts2/day each: Dimension Door, Modify Memory

entries.name: Thundering Halberd
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Thunder damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spectator uses Eye Rays twice.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Eye Rays
entries.description: The spectator randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within Far of itself (roll 1d4; reroll if the spectator has already used that ray during this turn):1: Confusion Ray. Presence Reaction Roll (12). Failure: 5 (2d4) Psychic damage, and the target can't take Reactions until the end of its next turn. On its next turn, the target can't move, and it uses its action to make a melee or ranged attack against a randomly determined creature within range. If the target can't attack, it does nothing on that turn.2: Paralyzing Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (12). Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.3: Fear Ray. Presence Reaction Roll (12). Failure: 5 (2d4) Psychic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.4: Wounding Ray. Finesse Reaction Roll (12). Failure: 16 (3d10) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The specter can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the specter has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

entries.name: Blurred Form
entries.description: Attack rolls against the spectral cloud are made with disadvantage unless the attacker is within Close of the spectral cloud or the spectral cloud is incapacitated.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The spectral cloud can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spectral cloud makes two Spectral Touch attacks.

entries.name: Spectral Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) force damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (20), or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.A Humanoid slain by this attack immediately rises as a miniature spectral cloud (use the specter stat block in the Monster Manual). The miniature spectral cloud acts as an ally of its creator but isn't under its control.

entries.name: Chilling Winds (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The spectral cloud emits intensely cold wind in a Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (20). On a failed save, a creature takes 38 (7d10) cold damage and has the incapacitated condition for 1 minute. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, that creature is immune to this spectral cloud's Chilling Winds for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Magical Role
entries.description: Choose a role for the spellcaster: healer or mage. Your choice determines which Spellcasting trait to use below.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, sacred flame1st level (2 slots): cure wounds

entries.name: Spellcasting (Mage)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (12), +4 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light1st level (2 slots): sleep

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Empowered Spells
entries.description: Whenever the spellcaster casts a spell of the evocation school by expending a spell slot, the spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the spell's damage roll or healing roll, if any.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, resistance, sacred flame, spare the dying1st level (4 slots): bless, cure wounds, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): aid, lesser restoration3rd level (3 slots): protection from energy, revivify4th level (3 slots): banishment, death ward5th level (2 slots): greater restoration, mass cure wounds6th level (1 slot): heal

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, resistance, sacred flame1st level (4 slots): bless, cure wounds, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): aid, lesser restoration3rd level (3 slots): protection from energy, revivify4th level (3 slots): banishment, death ward5th level (1 slot): greater restoration

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, light, resistance, sacred flame1st level (4 slots): bless, cure wounds, shield of faith2nd level (3 slots): aid, lesser restoration3rd level (3 slots): protection from energy, revivify4th level (1 slot): death ward

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.description: Whenever the spellcaster casts a spell of the evocation school by expending a spell slot, the spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the spell's damage roll or healing roll, if any.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Mage)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, minor illusion, shocking grasp1st level (4 slots): burning hands, shield, sleep2nd level (3 slots): flaming sphere, invisibility3rd level (3 slots): fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): polymorph, wall of fire5th level (2 slots): cone of cold, hold monster6th level (1 slot): chain lightning

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Mage)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, minor illusion1st level (4 slots): burning hands, shield, sleep2nd level (3 slots): flaming sphere, invisibility3rd level (3 slots): fireball, fly4th level (3 slots): polymorph, wall of fire5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Potent Cantrip
entries.description: The spellcaster can add its spellcasting ability modifier to the damage it deals with any cantrip.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Mage)
entries.description: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): fire bolt, light, mage hand, minor illusion1st level (4 slots): burning hands, shield, sleep2nd level (3 slots): flaming sphere, invisibility3rd level (3 slots): fireball, fly4th level (1 slot): wall of fire

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage, or 4 (1d8) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Echolocation
entries.description: The whale can't use its blindsight while deafened.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The whale can hold its breath for 90 minutes.

entries.name: Keen Hearing
entries.description: The whale has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The whale makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (14) or be swallowed by the whale. A swallowed creature has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the whale, and it takes 3 (1d6) acid damage at the start of each of the whale's turns. If the whale takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the whale must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the whale. If the whale dies, a swallowed creature can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage, or 37 (6d6 + 16) bludgeoning damage if the target is an object.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sphinx is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (16), +8 to hit with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): friends, mage hand, message1st level (4 slots): command, ensnaring strike, shield2nd level (3 slots): calm emotions, hold person, suggestion3rd level (3 slots): clairvoyance, counterspell, dispel magic4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination5th level (1 slot): dominate person

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: No magic can observe the sphinx remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the sphinx fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sphinx makes three Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Mind-Rending Roar (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (16), each enemy in a Very Far Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: 35 (10d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Incapacitated condition until the start of the sphinx's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Detect Magic, Identify, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion, Prestidigitation1/day each: Dispel Magic, Legend Lore, Locate Object, Plane Shift, Remove Curse, Tongues

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: No magic can observe the sphinx remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The sphinx has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sphinx makes three Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Curse of the Riddle.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Curse of the Riddle
entries.description: Instinct Reaction Roll (15), one creature the sphinx can see within Far. Failure: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage, and the target is cursed with a riddle. The cursed target has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. In addition, if it takes the Magic action, it must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (15) or that action is wasted. The cursed target can take a Study action to make a Difficulty (15) Intelligence check, solving the riddle and ending the curse on a success. The curse ends early if the sphinx curses another target.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Magic, Identify, Prestidigitation1/day each: Locate Object, Remove Curse

entries.name: Inscrutable
entries.description: No magic can observe the sphinx remotely or detect its thoughts without its permission. Wisdom (Insight) checks made to ascertain its intentions or sincerity are made with Disadvantage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the sphinx fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The sphinx makes two Claw attacks and uses Roar.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +12, reach Very Close. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Roar (3/Day)
entries.description: The sphinx emits a magical roar. Whenever it roars, the roar has a different effect, as detailed below (the sequence resets when it takes a Long Rest):First Roar. Presence Reaction Roll (20), each enemy in a Out of Range Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: The target has the Frightened condition for 1 minute.Second Roar. Presence Reaction Roll (20), each enemy in a Out of Range Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: The target has the Paralyzed condition, and it repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.Third Roar. Finesse Reaction Roll (20), each enemy in a Out of Range Emanation originating from the sphinx. Failure: 44 (8d10) Thunder damage, and the target has the Prone condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (20)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Thaumaturgy1/day each: Detect Magic, Dispel Magic, Greater Restoration, Heroes' Feast, Zone of Truth

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The sphinx has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the spider knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1 Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The spiderdragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The spiderdragon can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The spiderdragon ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spiderdragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (2d12) poison damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spiderling Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The spiderdragon exhales venomous spiderlings in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 33 (6d10) piercing damage and 33 (6d10) poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Aversion of Fire
entries.description: If the tomb guardian takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Berserk
entries.description: Whenever the tomb guardian starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the tomb guardian goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the tomb guardian attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the tomb guardian attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the tomb guardian goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points. The golem's creator, if within Far of the berserk tomb guardian, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The tomb guardian must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a Difficulty (15) Charisma (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the tomb guardian ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the tomb guardian might go berserk again.

entries.name: Chained
entries.description: This trait applies when two guardians are chained together.A magical spiked chain that binds a pair of guardians together prevents them from moving more than Close apart. Additionally, as long as the chain is intact, damage dealt to either guardian is divided evenly between them.
