The spiked chain can be attacked separately and has AC 18, a damage threshold of 10, 5 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage. If the chain breaks, both tomb guardians instantly go berserk.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The tomb guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Lightning Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the tomb guardian is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The tomb guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tomb guardian makes two spiked gauntlet attacks.

entries.name: Spiked Gauntlet
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Flyby
entries.description: The devil doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The devil has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The devil makes two attacks, using Infernal Fork and Tail Spine in any combination.

entries.name: Infernal Fork
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Tail Spine
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Ruinous Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (12), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 13 (3d8) Necrotic damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Time-Warping Breath
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (12), each creature that isn't currently affected by this breath in a Close Cone. Failure: The target's Speed is halved, it can't take Reactions, and it can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

entries.name: Fiendish Restoration
entries.description: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days and regains all its Hit Points. Only a Wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The naga makes three attacks, using Bite or Necrotic Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Necrotic Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 21 (6d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The naga casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Magic, Mage Hand, Minor Illusion, Water Breathing2/day each: Detect Thoughts, Dimension Door, Hold Person (level 3 version), Lightning Bolt (level 4 version)

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the spirit statue is reduced to 0 hit points, the statue crumbles, and the spirit returns to the afterlife in a burst of ghostly white flame. Each creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or take 3 (1d6) radiant damage.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Counsel of the Past (2/Day)
entries.description: The spirit statue touches one creature. Once within the next 10 minutes, that creature can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice, immediately after rolling the d20.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The troll can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes psychic or force damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) psychic damage.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Grappler
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The mimic has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape Difficulty (16)). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

entries.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mimic attacks three times: twice with its pseudopods and once with its bite.

entries.name: Pseudopods
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Spit Acid (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mimic spits acid at one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 32 (9d6 + 1) acid damage on failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Defensive Advantage
entries.description: As long as two or more of Splugoth's allies are within Very Close of him and are not incapacitated, attack rolls against him are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Nimble Escape
entries.description: Splugoth can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of his turns.

entries.name: Touch of Madness
entries.description: Splugoth has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Splugoth makes two attacks with his dagger.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Word From Beyond (1/Day)
entries.description: Splugoth remembers and repeats aloud a few words from a place he entered while walking back from the next world to this one. Each creature of his choice within Close of him that can hear him must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

entries.name: Water Breathing
entries.description: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Close, one target Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Explosive Core
entries.description: When the spore is subjected to Fire damage, each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the spore takes 7 (2d6) Fire damage.

entries.name: Rolling Mass
entries.description: The spore doesn't need to expend extra movement to move through Difficult Terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spore makes four Tendril attacks. Alternatively, it makes two Tendril attacks and uses Consume once.

entries.name: Tendril
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Close. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Acid damage. If the target is Large or smaller, the spore pulls the target Very Close straight toward itself.

entries.name: Consume
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (18), one Large or smaller creature within Very Close. Failure: The target is pulled into the spore's space and has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). Until the grapple ends, the target has the Blinded and Restrained conditions, and it takes 17 (5d6) Acid damage at the start of each of the spore's turns. When the spore moves, the Grappled target moves with it, costing it no extra movement. The spore can have one Large creature or up to nine Medium or smaller creatures Grappled at a time.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The lion has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the lion's allies is within Very Close of the target and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the lion moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or have the prone condition. If the target has the prone condition, the lion can make another Rend attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Joyful Presence
entries.description: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within Far of the eladrin must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed by the eladrin for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to any eladrin's Joyful Presence for 24 hours.Whenever the eladrin deals damage to the charmed creature, the charmed creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage plus 22 (5d8) psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The eladrin casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: Tasha's hideous laughter1/day each: major image, suggestion

entries.name: Needle Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Enchanting Bow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 1 Piercing damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the sprite's next turn.

entries.name: Heart Sight
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (10), one creature within Very Close the sprite can see (Celestials, Fiends, and Undead automatically fail the save). Failure: The sprite knows the target's emotions and alignment.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The sprite casts Invisibility on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Needle Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Enchanting Bow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Far. Hit: 1 Piercing damage, and the target has the Charmed condition until the start of the sprite's next turn.

entries.name: Heart Sight
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (10), one creature within Very Close the sprite can see (Celestials, Fiends, Undead automatically fail the save). Failure: The sprite knows the target's emotions.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries.description: The sprite has the Invisible condition for 1 minute. This effect ends early immediately after the sprite makes an attack roll or deals damage, or if the sprite has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spy makes three attacks, using Rapier or Hand Crossbow in any combination.

entries.name: Rapier
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) Poison damage.

entries.name: Smoke Bomb (1/Day)
entries.description: The spy throws a bomb to a point it can see within Close of itself. Finesse Reaction Roll (16), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on that point. Failure: 28 (8d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the end of the spy's next turn. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage, or 6 (1d10 + 1) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The ssurran can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Intellect Fortress
entries.description: The ssurran's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ssurran makes two Claw attacks and uses Defile (if available).

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Defile (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Ordinary vegetation within Very Close of the ssurran withers and dies. In addition, each creature within Very Close of the ssurran must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 22 (4d10) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The ssurran regains 5 (1d10) hit points for each creature that fails the saving throw.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The ssurran casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:At will: mage hand (the hand is invisible)1/day: invisibility (self only)

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries.description: The ssurran can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ssurran makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Poison Bomb
entries.description: The ssurran throws a tangerine-sized bomb at a point up to Far away, where it explodes, releasing a Very Close-radius sphere of poisonous gas that disperses quickly. Each creature in the sphere must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (11), taking 10 (3d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After the ssurran throws a bomb, roll a d6; on a roll of 4 or lower, the ssurran has no more bombs to throw.

entries.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries.description: The stalker can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The stalker has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The stalker makes two Glaive attacks or two Rock attacks.

entries.name: Glaive
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (19) or have the prone condition. After the stalker throws the rock, roll a d6; on a roll of 3 or lower, the stalker has no more rocks to throw.

entries.name: Erupting Horns (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The stalker causes the earth to churn at a point on the ground it can see within Far of itself. Six horn-shaped stones erupt in a Close-radius, Close-high cylinder centered on that point and then crumble to dust.Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) piercing damage and is pushed up to Close upward and then falls. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The stalker casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):1/day each: meld into stone, stone shape, wall of stone

entries.name: Avoidance
entries.description: If the star angler is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The star angler's lure sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The star angler makes three Bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Aura of Shrieks
entries.description: Creatures within Close of the grue that aren't Aberrations have disadvantage on saving throws, as well as on attack rolls against creatures other than a star spawn grue.

entries.name: Confounding Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (10) or attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of the grue's next turn.

entries.name: Psychic Mirror
entries.description: If the hulk takes psychic damage, each creature within Very Close of the hulk takes that damage instead; the hulk takes none of the damage. In addition, the hulk's thoughts and location can't be discerned by magic.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The hulk makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same target, the target also takes 9 (2d8) psychic damage and must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or be stunned until the end of the target's next turn.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Reaping Arms (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The hulk makes a separate Slam attack against each creature within Very Close of it. Each creature that is hit must also succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Return to Worms
entries.description: When the mage is reduced to 0 hit points, it breaks apart into a swarm of insects in the same space. Unless the swarm is destroyed, the mage reforms from it 24 hours later.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mage makes three Slam or Eldritch Bolt attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (19) or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Eldritch Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

entries.name: Plague of Worms (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Each creature other than a star spawn within Very Close of the mage must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (19) or take 22 (5d8) necrotic damage and be blinded and restrained by masses of swarming worms. The affected creature takes 22 (5d8) necrotic damage at the start of each of the mage's turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: mage hand, message, minor illusion1/day: dominate monster

entries.name: Ambusher
entries.description: The mangler has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mangler makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage. If the attack roll has advantage, the target also takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Flurry of Claws (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The mangler makes six Claw attacks. Either before or after these attacks, it can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Out-Of-Phase Movement
entries.description: The seer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, and its movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.Each creature it moves through takes 5 (1d10) psychic damage; no creature can take this damage more than once per turn.The seer takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The seer makes two Comet Staff or Psychic Orb attacks.

entries.name: Comet Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) psychic damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (19) or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Psychic Orb
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range Very Far, one creature. Hit: 27 (5d10) psychic damage.

entries.name: Collapse Distance (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The seer warps space around one creature it can see within Close of it. That creature must make a Presence Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, the target, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, is teleported up to Far to an unoccupied space the seer can see, and then each creature within Very Close of the target's original space takes 39 (6d12) psychic damage. On a successful save, the target takes 19 (3d12) psychic damage and isn't teleported.

entries.name: Astral Existence
entries.description: The apparition can exist only on the Astral Plane. If it is sent to a location not on the Astral Plane, the apparition is destroyed.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: While it has at least 1 hit point, the apparition sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The apparition can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The apparition doesn't require air, drink, food, or sleep.

entries.name: Radiant Eruption
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) radiant damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be blinded for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries.description: One Humanoid that the apparition can see within Very Close of itself must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (14) or be possessed by the apparition; the apparition then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The apparition now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The apparition can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the apparition ends it as a bonus action, the body leaves the Astral Plane, or the apparition is forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the apparition reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the body. If it reappears in a location not on the Astral Plane, the apparition is destroyed. The target is immune to this apparition's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the statue remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes five attacks: one with its headbutt and four with its lightning bolt blades.

entries.name: Headbutt
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Lightning Bolt Blades
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Theft
entries.description: As a bonus action, the statue targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17), or all magic items in its possession are teleported to the bottom of the pit in area 31.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The statue targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Blurred Form
entries.description: Attack rolls against the mephit are made with Disadvantage unless the mephit has the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The mephit explodes when it dies. Agility Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the mephit. Failure: 5 (2d4) Fire damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 2 (1d4) Slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) Fire damage.

entries.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 5 (2d4) Fire damage, and the target's Speed decreases by Very Close until the end of the mephit's next turn. Success: Half damage only. Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn't grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

name: Steel Defender

entries.name: Steel Bond
entries.description: Add your Proficiency Bonus to any ability check or saving throw the defender makes.

entries.name: Force-Empowered Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + 2 plus your Intelligence modifier Force damage.

entries.name: Repair (3/Day)
entries.description: The defender, or one Construct or object it can see within Very Close of itself, regains a number of Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your Intelligence modifier.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The steel predator has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The steel predator doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The steel predator makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) lightning damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d8 + 7) force damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The steel predator casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:3/day each: dimension door (self only), plane shift (self only)

entries.name: Stunning Roar (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The steel predator emits a roar in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (19). On a failed save, a creature takes 33 (6d10) thunder damage, drops everything it's holding, and is stunned for 1 minute. The stunned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned.

entries.name: Tail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 26 (6d6 + 5) piercing damage.

entries.name: Stench
entries.description: Any creature other than a stench kow that starts its turn within Very Close of the stench kow must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the Stench of all stench kows for 1 hour.

entries.name: Gore
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the stench kow moved at least Close straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

entries.name: Proboscis
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge can't make Proboscis attacks, and the target takes 5 (2d4) Necrotic damage at the start of each of the stirge's turns.The stirge can detach itself by spending Very Close of its movement. The target or a creature within Very Close of it can detach the stirge as an action.

entries.name: Turn Immunity
entries.description: The foot is immune to effects that turn undead.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Cunning Opportunist
entries.description: The stone cursed has advantage on the attack rolls of opportunity attacks.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the stone cursed is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the stone cursed move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the stone cursed isn't a statue.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The stone cursed doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Petrifying Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), or it begins to turn to stone and is restrained until the end of its next turn, when it must repeat the saving throw. The effect ends if the second save is successful; otherwise the target is petrified for 24 hours.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The statue has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The statue's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Steam Breath
entries.description: The statue exhales steam in a line that is Close long and Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 7 (2d4 + 2) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Stone Club or Boulder in any combination.

entries.name: Stone Club
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Far. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Dreamwalker's Charm
entries.description: An enemy that starts its turn within Close of the giant must make a Presence Reaction Roll (13), provided that the giant isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by the giant. A creature charmed in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once it succeeds on the saving throw, the creature is immune to this giant's Dreamwalker's Charm for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Greatclub or Rock attacks.

entries.name: Greatclub
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Petrifying Touch
entries.description: The giant touches one Medium or smaller creature within Very Close of it that is charmed by it. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the target becomes petrified, and the giant can adhere the target to its stony body. greater restoration spells and other magic that can undo petrification have no effect on a petrified creature adhered to the giant unless the giant is dead, in which case the magic works normally, freeing the petrified creature as well as ending the petrified condition on it.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Stone Rune
entries.description: The giant has a stone rune inscribed on a mineral object in its possession. While holding or wearing the object bearing the rune, the giant can use its Prismatic Rays action.The object bearing the rune has AC 18; 30 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a stone rune on an object in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three Prism Staff attacks.

entries.name: Prism Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage.

entries.name: Exploding Geode
entries.description: The giant throws a geode at a point within Far of itself, and the geode explodes in a dazzling flash. Each creature in a Close-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, a creature takes 13 (3d8) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) radiant damage and has the blinded condition until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. After the giant throws the geode, roll a d6; on a roll of 4 or lower, the giant has no more geodes to throw.

entries.name: Prismatic Rays (Requires Stone Rune)
entries.description: The giant's stone rune emits beams of light that form a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). For each creature in that area, roll a d6 to determine what ray affects it:

entries.name: 1-2: Blazing Red
entries.description: On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) radiant damage and has the blinded condition until the end of the giant's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: 3-4: Dreadful Blue
entries.description: On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) necrotic damage and has the frightened condition until the end of the giant's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: 5-6: Sapping Green
entries.description: On a failed save, the creature takes 35 (10d6) force damage and has the incapacitated condition until the end of the giant's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Thundering Stone Club or Boulder attacks in any combination.

entries.name: Thundering Stone Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage. The giant can cause the club to emit a burst of thunderous energy that deals 10 (3d6) thunder damage to each creature, other than the giant, within Close of the target. The club can emit a burst this way only once per turn.

entries.name: Boulder
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or have the prone condition. After the giant throws the boulder, roll a d6; on a roll of 3 or lower, the giant has no more boulders to throw.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem can't shape-shift.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The golem makes two attacks, using Slam or Force Bolt in any combination.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) Bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) Force damage.

entries.name: Force Bolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +9, range Very Far. Hit: 22 (4d10) Force damage.

entries.name: Devastating Roll
entries.description: The juggernaut can move through the space of a prone creature. A creature whose space the juggernaut enters for the first time on a turn must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17), taking 55 (10d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The juggernaut is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: As long as it has 1 hit point left, the juggernaut magically regains all its hit points daily at dawn. The juggernaut is destroyed and doesn't regenerate if it drops to 0 hit points.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The juggernaut deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (17) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The golem targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The stonecloak is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The stonecloak has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The stonecloak's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The stonecloak makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Slow (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The stonecloak targets one or more creatures it can see within Very Close of it. Each target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (17) against this magic. On a failed save, a target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: When the Stonemelder dies, it turns to stone and explodes in a burst of rock shards, becoming a smoking pile of rubble. Each creature within Very Close of the exploding Stonemelder must make a Agility Reaction Roll (14), taking 11 (2d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Stonemelder is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). It knows the following sorcerer spells:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, blade ward, light, mending, mold earth1st level (4 slots): expeditious retreat, false life, shield2nd level (3 slots): Maximilian's earthen grasp, shatter3rd level (3 slots): erupting earth, meld into stone4th level (1 slot): stoneskin

entries.name: Black Earth Rod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage. The Stonemelder can also expend a spell slot to deal extra damage, dealing 2d8 bludgeoning damage for a 1st level slot, plus an additional 1d8 for each level of the slot above 1st.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The crab makes two Claw attacks and one Stinger attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). The crab has four claws, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Stinger
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or have the poisoned and paralyzed conditions for 1 minute. The affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending both the poisoned and paralyzed conditions on itself on a success.

entries.name: Water Jet (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The crab exhales water in a Very Far line that is Very Close wide. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, a creature takes 27 (6d8) bludgeoning damage, is pushed up to Close from the crab, and has the prone condition. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks, using Storm Sword or Thunderbolt in any combination.

entries.name: Storm Sword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +14, reach Very Close. Hit: 23 (4d6 + 9) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Lightning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Detect Magic, Light1/day: Control Weather

entries.name: Thunderbolt
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +14, range Out of Range. Hit: 22 (2d12 + 9) Lightning damage, and the target has the Blinded and Deafened conditions until the start of the giant's next turn.

entries.name: Lightning Storm (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Agility Reaction Roll (18), each creature in a Very Close-radius, Far-high Cylinder originating from a point the giant can see within Out of Range. Failure: 55 (10d10) Lightning damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two Lightning Sword attacks, or it uses Wind Javelin twice.

entries.name: Lightning Sword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 40 (9d6 + 9) lightning damage.

entries.name: Wind Javelin
entries.description: The giant coalesces wind into a javelin-like form and hurls it at a creature it can see within Out of Range of it. The javelin deals 19 (3d6 + 9) force damage to the target, striking unerringly. The javelin disappears after it hits.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two attacks with its greatsword or hurls two rocks.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Far, one target. Hit: 35 (4d12 + 9) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within Out of Range of it. Each creature within Very Close of that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 54 (12d8) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Alert
entries.description: The giant can't be surprised, and it has advantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the giant fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Scrying (Requires Storm Rune)
entries.description: The giant can use its crystal ball to cast the scrying spell (save Difficulty (17)).

entries.name: Storm Rune
entries.description: The giant has a storm rune inscribed on a crystal ball. While the object bearing the rune is embedded in its body, the giant can use its Tempest Call action and its Scrying trait.The object bearing the storm rune has AC 17; 50 hit points; and immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. The object regains all its hit points at the end of every turn, but it turns to dust if reduced to 0 hit points or when the giant dies. If the rune is destroyed, the giant can inscribe a storm rune on another crystal ball in its possession when it finishes a short or long rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes three Lightning Blade or Lightning Lance attacks.

entries.name: Lightning Blade
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 22 (3d8 + 9) slashing damage plus 16 (3d10) lightning damage.

entries.name: Lightning Lance
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +13 to hit, range Out of Range, one target. Hit: 39 (5d12 + 7) lightning damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The giant casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21), +13 to hit with spell attacks):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts1/day each: control water, control weather (as an action), dispel magic, plane shift, sending, time stop

entries.name: Tempest Call (Requires Storm Rune)
entries.description: The giant creates an elemental vortex that fills a Far-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area other than the giant must make a Agility Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, a creature takes 43 (8d8 + 7) damage of a type of the giant's choosing: cold, lightning, or thunder. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The herald can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The herald has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The herald makes one Claw attack, one Tentacles attack, and one Trident attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) slashing damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (18)). It also has the restrained condition and takes 16 (3d10) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns until this grapple ends. The herald can have only one creature grappled this way at a time.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The herald casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (21)):At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, mage hand (the hand is invisible)1/day each: control water, control weather (as an action), sending

entries.name: Trident
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d6 + 8) piercing damage or 21 (3d8 + 8) piercing damage if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Psychic Wave (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The herald unleashes a blast of psionic energy into the minds of up to three creatures it can see within Far of itself. Each target must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, a target takes 23 (3d10 + 7) psychic damage and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.If a creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this psychic damage, it dies and its head explodes if it has one.

entries.name: Loathsome Limbs
entries.description: Whenever the zombie takes at least 5 bludgeoning or slashing damage at one time, roll a d20 to determine what else happens to it:1–8: One leg is severed from the zombie if it has any legs left.9–16: One arm is severed from the zombie if it has any arms left.17–20: The zombie is decapitated.If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points, all parts of it die. Until then, a severed part acts on the zombie's initiative and has its own action and movement. A severed part has AC 8. Any damage it takes is subtracted from the zombie's hit points.A severed leg is unable to attack and has a speed of Very Close.A severed arm has a speed of Very Close and can make one claw attack on its turn, with disadvantage on the attack roll. Each time the zombie loses an arm, it loses a claw attack.If its head is severed, the zombie loses its bite attack and its body is blinded unless the head can see it. The severed head has a speed of Melee. It can make a bite attack, but only against a target in its space.The zombie's speed is halved if it's missing a leg. If it loses both legs, it falls prone. If it has both arms, it can crawl. With only one arm, it can still crawl, but its speed is halved. With no arms or legs, its speed is Melee, and it can't benefit from bonuses to speed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zombie makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Stirge Telepathy
entries.description: The strigoi can magically command any stirge within Very Far of it, using a limited form of telepathy.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The strigoi makes one Claw attack and makes one Proboscis attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 6 (1d12) acid damage.

entries.name: Proboscis
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage, and the strigoi regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt. A creature reduced to 0 hit points from this attack dies and leaves nothing behind except its skin and its equipment.

entries.name: Ravenous Children (1/Day)
entries.description: The strigoi magically summons 1d4 + 2 stirges (see their entry in the Monster Manual) in unoccupied spaces it can see within Close of it. The stirges are under the strigoi's control and act immediately after the strigoi in the initiative order. The stirges disappear after 1 hour, when the strigoi dies, or when the strigoi dismisses them (no action required).

entries.name: Campus Knowledge
entries.description: While at Strixhaven, the guide can't become lost by magical or nonmagical means. The guide also has advantage on ability checks made to locate creatures or objects at Strixhaven.

entries.name: Univocal Speech
entries.description: When the guide speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the guide understands what it says.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The guide doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The guide makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Smile and Wave
entries.description: Each creature of the guide's choice that is within Close of the guide must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be magically charmed by the guide for 1 hour.A charmed target must move on its turn toward the guide, trying to get within Very Close of the guide. The target doesn't move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. Whenever the charmed target takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.A target that successfully saves is immune to any guide's Smile and Wave ability for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The su-monster makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage, or 12 (4d4 + 2) slashing damage if the su-monster is hanging by its tail and all four of its limbs are free.

entries.name: Psychic Crush (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The su-monster targets one creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or take 17 (5d6) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. The stunned target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Incubus Form
entries.description: When the succubus finishes a Long Rest, it can shape-shift into an Incubus, using that stat block instead of this one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The succubus makes one Fiendish Touch attack and uses Charm or Draining Kiss.

entries.name: Fiendish Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Charm
entries.description: The succubus casts Dominate Person (level 8 version), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)).

entries.name: Draining Kiss
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (15), one creature Charmed by the succubus within Very Close. Failure: 13 (3d8) Psychic damage. Success: Half damage. Failure or Success: The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: Sul Khatesh's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (26), +18 to hit with spell attacks). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: counterspell, detect magic, detect thoughts, dispel magic, eyebite, fireball, lightning bolt, shield3/day each: chain lightning, create undead, dream, hold monster, mass suggestion, scrying1/day each: foresight, gate, power word kill, teleport

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Sul Khatesh fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Sul Khatesh has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Master of Magic
entries.description: Sul Khatesh has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Sul Khatesh makes four attacks with Arcane Blast.

entries.name: Arcane Blast
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +18 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Magic Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 36 (5d12 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Arcane Cataclysm (Recharges after a Long Rest)
entries.description: Sul Khatesh conjures orbs of magical energy that plummet to the ground at three different points she can see within 1 mile of her. Each creature in a Far-radius sphere centered on each point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (26), taking 71 (11d12) force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one arcane burst is affected only once. The area of each arcane burst then acts as an antimagic field for 1 hour. Sul Khatesh and spells she casts are unaffected by these fields.

entries.name: Change Shape
entries.description: Sul Khatesh magically polymorphs into a humanoid, beast, or giant that has a challenge rating no higher than her own, or back into her true form. She reverts to her true form if she dies. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sul Khatesh's choice).In a new form, Sul Khatesh retains her alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Her statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

entries.name: Fearsome Presence
entries.description: Any non-eladrin creature that starts its turn within Far of the eladrin must make a Presence Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, the creature becomes frightened of the eladrin for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to any eladrin's Fearsome Presence for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The eladrin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The eladrin makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands, plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the giant can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The giant deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: The giant has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The giant makes two slam attacks. The first of those attacks that hits deals an extra 18 (4d8) damage if the giant has taken damage since its last turn.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 24 (4d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (18) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage. Additionally, if the sunfly is on an Outer Plane, it injects the target with a toxin, the effect of which is determined by the sunfly's location:

entries.name: Upper Plane
entries.description: The target sheds bright light in a Very Close radius until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Neutral Plane
entries.description: If the target is concentrating on a spell or similar effect, it makes the Constitution saving throw with disadvantage to maintain its concentration.

entries.name: Lower Plane
entries.description: The target's speed is reduced by Very Close until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The wererat can use its action to polymorph into a rat-humanoid hybrid or into a giant rat, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Gnome Cunning
entries.description: The svirfneblin wererat has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The svirfneblin wererat's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (10)). The svirfneblin wererat can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: nondetection (self only)1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The wererat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Stone Camouflage
entries.description: The svirfneblin wererat has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to hide in rocky terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: The wererat makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite.

entries.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

entries.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Flyby (Swan Form Only)
entries.description: The swanmay doesn't provoke an Opportunity Attack action when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The swanmay makes two attacks, using Beak, Longbow, or Scimitar in any combination.

entries.name: Beak (Swan Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Scimitar (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Longbow (Humanoid Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Very Far. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The swanmay casts one of the following spells, requiring no Somatic or Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Druidcraft, Speak with Animals (swan form only)1/day each: Animal Friendship, Beast Sense, Spike Growth

entries.name: False Objects
entries.description: If the swarm is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the swarm move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (15) Wisdom (Perception) check to discern that the swarm is animate.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Melee-tall, 8-inch-wide, 2-inch-thick object. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.name: Book Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Melee, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 6 (2d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d4 + 1) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can't regain Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points.

entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (2d4) Piercing damage, or 2 (1d4) Piercing damage if the swarm is Bloodied.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny book. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Melee, one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage, or 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: Each campestri in the swarm can mimic any voice or song it has heard, albeit in a nasal falsetto.

entries.name: Swarm

entries.name: Head Butts
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (4d4) bludgeoning damage, or 5 (2d4) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: A Close radius of spores extends from the swarm. These spores can go around corners, and they have no effect on Constructs, Elementals, Plants, or Undead. Each other creature in the area must make a Presence Reaction Roll (10). On a failed save, the creature is incapacitated and its speed is halved, both for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Death Burst
entries.description: The rat explodes when it dies. Finesse Reaction Roll (10), each creature in a Very Close Emanation originating from the rat. Failure: 2d4 Acid Damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain Hit Points.

entries.name: Swarm
entries.description: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny rat. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

entries.description: The swarm is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as to all divination spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)

Failure: The target has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn. While Poisoned, the target can take either an action or a Bonus Action on its turn, not both, and it can't take Reactions.

entries.name: Swarm

entries.description: The swarm automatically succeeds on saving throws against spells of 3rd level or lower, and the attack rolls of such spells always miss it.

entries.description: If the swarm dies in the Nine Hells, it revives with all its Hit Points in 1d10 days unless it is killed by a creature under the effects of a Bless spell or its remains are sprinkled with Holy Water.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Melee, one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. A creature damaged by the swarm must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or contract a disease.Each time the diseased creature finishes a long rest, roll a d6 to determine the disease's effect:1-2. The creature is blinded until it finishes a long rest.3-4. The creature's hit point maximum decreases by 5 (2d4), and the reduction can't be removed until the disease ends. The creature dies if its hit point maximum drops to 0.5-6. The creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls until it finishes its next long rest.The disease lasts until it's removed by magic or until the creature rolls the same random effect for the disease two long rests in a row.

entries.description: The swarm doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

If the target is a creature, scarabs burrow into its body, and the creature takes 3 (1d6) piercing damage at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can use an action to kill or remove the scarabs with fire or a weapon that deals piercing damage, causing 1 damage of the appropriate type to the target. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the swarm's piercing damage dies.

entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries.description: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves Melee on one of its turns.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tabaxi makes two attacks with its claws, its shortsword, or its shortbow.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Feline Agility
entries.description: When the tabaxi moves on its turn in combat, it can double its speed until the end of the turn. Once it uses this ability, the tabaxi can't use it again until it moves Melee on one of its turns.

entries.name: Inspire (1/Day)
entries.description: While taking a short rest, the tabaxi can spend 1 minute singing, playing an instrument, telling a story, or reciting a poem to soothe and inspire creatures other than itself. Up to five creatures of the tabaxi's choice that can see and hear its performance gain 8 temporary hit points at the end of the tabaxi's short rest.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tabaxi makes two claws attacks or two dart attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The talon beast has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Sense Magic
entries.description: The talon beast can detect and pinpoint the location of magic within Very Far of itself.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The talon beast makes two Talon attacks or a Talon attack and a Beak attack.

entries.name: Beak
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage, and if the target has any spell effects on itself or any magic items in its possession, the target must make a Presence Reaction Roll (15). On a failed save, a random spell effect on the target ends. If the target has no spell effects on it, one random magic item in its possession has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute. If the item is a potion or scroll, it becomes nonmagical instead.

entries.name: Talon
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) slashing damage, and the target has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)). Until the grapple ends, the target has the restrained condition, and the talon beast can't use Talon on another target.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The tanarukk has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tanarukk makes one Bite attack and one Greatsword attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Tanazir fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Tanazir makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 14 (1d10 + 9) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d6 + 9) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it is addled by recursive thoughts, reducing its speed to 0 until the start of Tanazir's next turn.

entries.name: Diminution Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Tanazir exhales a weakening equation in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (23). On a failed save, a creature takes 45 (13d6) force damage and 45 (13d6) psychic damage and is weakened until the start of Tanazir's next turn. While weakened, it has disadvantage on the following rolls that rely on Strength: attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't weakened.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Tanazir casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (24)):1/day each: divination, enlarge/reduce, mirage arcane (as an action), polymorph, scrying (as an action), seeming

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Tanazir teleports to an unoccupied space she can see within Far of herself.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The assassin's spellcasting ability is Constitution (+4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: fire bolt1/day: chromatic orb

entries.name: Unstable Mark
entries.description: When the assassin casts an innate spell, each creature within Very Close of the assassin must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 4 (1d8) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
