It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each creature's intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a mind blank spell, a nondetection spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ulitharid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Psionic Hub
entries.description: If an elder brain establishes a psychic link with the ulitharid, the elder brain can form a psychic link with any other creature the ulitharid can detect using its Creature Sense. Any such link ends if the creature falls outside the telepathy ranges of both the ulitharid and the elder brain. The ulitharid can maintain its psychic link with the elder brain regardless of the distance between them, so long as they are both on the same plane of existence. If the ulitharid is more than 5 miles away from the elder brain, it can end the psychic link at any time (no action required).

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 27 (4d10 + 5) psychic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) and must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or be stunned until this grapple ends.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one incapacitated Humanoid grappled by the ulitharid. Hit: 55 (10d10) piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the ulitharid kills the target by extracting and devouring its brain.

entries.name: Mind Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The ulitharid magically emits psychic energy in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Instinct Reaction Roll (17) or take 31 (4d12 + 5) psychic damage and be stunned for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
entries.description: The ulitharid casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect thoughts, levitate1/day each: dominate monster, feeblemind, mass suggestion, plane shift (self only), project image, scrying, telekinesis

entries.name: Fiendish Restoration
entries.description: If the ultroloth dies outside Gehenna, its body dissolves into ichor, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points somewhere in Gehenna.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The ultroloth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The ultroloth uses Hypnotic Gaze and makes two Mercurial Whip attacks.

entries.name: Mercurial Whip
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Close. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) Force damage, and the ultroloth can teleport the target up to Very Close to an unoccupied space the ultroloth can see that isn't in the air.

entries.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (17), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 10 (3d6) Psychic damage, and the target has the Stunned condition until the start of the ultroloth's next turn. Success: The target is immune to this ultroloth's Hypnotic Gaze for 24 hours.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ultroloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Alter Self, Clairvoyance, Detect Magic1/day each: Dimension Door, Fireball (level 5 version), Wall of Fire

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The umber hulk makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: Magic can't put the shadow walker to sleep.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the shadow walker has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shadow walker makes three Gloom Burst attacks and uses Shadow Cowl.

entries.name: Gloom Burst
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Shadow Cowl
entries.description: Presence Reaction Roll (17), one creature the shadow walker can see within Very Far. Failure: 14 (4d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Blinded condition until the start of the shadow walker's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The shadow walker casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: Dancing Lights, Darkness, Minor Illusion

entries.name: Standing Leap
entries.description: The bulette's long jump is up to Close and its high jump is up to Close, with or without a running start.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 30 (4d12 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Deadly Leap
entries.description: If the bulette jumps at least Close as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its feet in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a Difficulty (16) Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked prone and take 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (3d6 + 4) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked prone, and is pushed Very Close out of the bulette's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the bulette's space.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) against being magically petrified. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

entries.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries.description: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The shambling mound makes two slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)), and the shambling mound uses its Engulf on it.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Engulf
entries.description: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. The engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) at the start of each of the mound's turns or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The soldier makes two longsword attacks or two longbow attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one longsword attack.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the soldier's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The soldier can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage, or 7 (1d10 + 2) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

name: Undead Spirit

entries.name: Festering Aura (Putrid Only)
entries.description: Constitution Saving Throw: DC equals your spell save DC, any creature (other than you) that starts its turn within a Very Close Emanation originating from the spirit. Failure: The creature has the Poisoned condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Incorporeal Passage (Ghostly Only)
entries.description: The spirit can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. If it ends its turn inside an object, it is shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes 1d10 Force damage for every Very Close traveled.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spirit makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (round down).

entries.name: Deathly Touch (Ghostly Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d8 + 3 + the spell's level Necrotic damage, and the target has the Frightened condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Grave Bolt (Skeletal Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, range Very Far. Hit: 2d4 + 3 + the spell's level Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Rotting Claw (Putrid Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: Bonus equals your spell attack modifier, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d6 + 3 + the spell's level Slashing damage. If the target has the Poisoned condition, it has the Paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn.

original_cr: None (XP 0; PB equals your Proficiency Bonus)

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The tree deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The tree makes two slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
entries.description: The tree magically animates one or two trees it can see within Far of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option. An animated tree acts as an ally of the tree. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the tree dies or is more than Very Far from the tree; or until the tree takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The medusa's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14)). The medusa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:1/day each: expeditious retreat, fog cloud, misty step

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The medusa has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: During the first round of combat, the medusa has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that is surprised, and it deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage each time it hits such a creature with an attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The medusa makes two claw attacks. It can also use Petrifying Gaze before or after making these attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: The medusa fixes its gaze on one creature within Far of it that it can see and that can see its eyes. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (14). If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.

entries.name: Aggressive
entries.description: As a bonus action, the cerberus can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

entries.name: Multiheaded
entries.description: The cerberus can't be surprised, and it has advantage on saving throws against being knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The cerberus has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the cerberus's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The cerberus makes three bite attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

entries.name: Breath Weapon (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The cerberus exhales a Close cone of molten rock. Each creature in the cone must make a Agility Reaction Roll (15), taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is also restrained by the hardening rock. A creature can make a Difficulty (15) Strength (Athletics) check as an action, freeing itself or a creature within reach from the rock on a success. The rock has AC 17 and 20 hit points, and it is immune to fire, poison, and psychic damage.

entries.name: Aura of Radiance
entries.description: The councilor magically sheds bright light in a Close radius and dim light for an additional Close. The councilor can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action. If the bright light overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created that darkness is dispelled.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The councilor has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The councilor is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (17), +9 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, mending, sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): bless, command, create or destroy water2nd level (3 slots): augury, calm emotions, hold person3rd level (3 slots): daylight, dispel magic, spirit guardians4th level (3 slots): banishment, divination, guardian of faith5th level (2 slots): dispel evil and good, flame strike (see "Actions" below), scrying6th level (1 slot): forbiddance, planar ally7th level (1 slot): plane shift

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The councilor makes two Radiant Touch attacks.

entries.name: Radiant Touch
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) radiant damage.

entries.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
entries.description: The councilor touches another creature. The target magically regains 18 (3d8 + 5) hit points and is freed from one curse afflicting it (councilor's choice).

entries.name: Flame Strike (5th-Level Spell; Requires a Spell Slot)
entries.description: The councilor chooses a point it can see within Far of it. Each creature in a Very Close-radius, Far-high cylinder centered on that point must make a Agility Reaction Roll (17). A creature takes 14 (4d6) fire damage and 14 (4d6) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the councilor casts this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage or the radiant damage (its choice) increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.

entries.name: Illumination
entries.description: The soldier magically sheds bright light in a Very Close radius and dim light for an additional Very Close. The soldier can extinguish or restore this light as a bonus action.

entries.name: Turn Resistance
entries.description: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The soldier makes two spear attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage or 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 9 (2d8) radiant damage if the target is a fiend or undead.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the unicorn fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The unicorn has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The unicorn makes one Hooves attack and one Radiant Horn attack.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Radiant Horn
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Radiant damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The unicorn casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Detect Evil and Good, Druidcraft1/day each: Calm Emotions, Dispel Evil and Good, Entangle, Pass without Trace, Word of Recall

entries.name: Formed by the Mists
entries.description: When created, the horror's body composition takes one of four forms: Aberrant Armor, Loathsome Limbs, Malleable Mass, or Oozing Organs. This form determines certain traits in this stat block.

entries.name: Amorphous (Malleable Mass Only)
entries.description: The horror can move through any opening at least 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entries.name: Bile Body (Oozing Organs Only)
entries.description: Any creature that touches the horror or hits it with a melee attack takes 5 (1d10) acid damage.

entries.name: Relentless Stride (Loathsome Limbs Only)
entries.description: The horror can move through the space of another creature. The first time on a turn that the horror enters a creature's space during this move, the creature must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The horror makes two Limbs attacks.

entries.name: Limbs
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hex Blast (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The horror expels necrotic energy in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 45 (7d12) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the barbarian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Greataxe
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Oathbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, plus an extra 10 (3d6) piercing damage against a sworn enemy See the oathbow entry for the other properties.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if wielded with two hands.

entries.name: Shortbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Requires a Sacred Bundle)
entries.description: The shaman casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12); +4 to hit with spell attacks):At will: dancing lights, mage hand, message, thaumaturgy1/day each: augury (cast as 1 action), bestow curse, cordon of arrows, detect magic, speak with dead, spirit guardians

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The heir has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the heir's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The heir makes four attacks, using Scimitar or Lunar Wisp in any combination.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Lunar Wisp
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 9 (2d8) Radiant damage, and the target emits Dim Light in a Very Close radius and can't benefit from the Invisible condition until the end of the heir's next turn.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The heir casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Druidcraft, Light, Speak with Animals3/day each: Animal Friendship, Animal Messenger1/day: Ice Storm

entries.name: Bonding
entries.description: The hawk can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within Close of it. The bond lasts until the hawk bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hawk and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to Far.

entries.name: Keen Sight
entries.description: The hawk has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Talons
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Bonding
entries.description: The hound can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within Close of it. The bond lasts until the hound bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the hound and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to Far.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The hound has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Bonding
entries.description: The steed can magically bond with one creature it can see, immediately after spending at least 1 hour observing that creature while within Close of it. The bond lasts until the steed bonds with a different creature or until the bonded creature dies. While bonded, the steed and the bonded creature can communicate telepathically with each other at a distance of up to Far.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Explode
entries.description: When the vampirate is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a cloud of ash. Any creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The vampirate can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The vampirate doesn't require air or drink.

entries.name: Energy Drain
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one creature. Hit: 11 (2d10) necrotic damage. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this attack dies and instantly transforms into a free-willed shadow under the DM's control.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Explode
entries.description: When the captain is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a cloud of ash. Any creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or take 16 (3d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The captain can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The captain doesn't require air or drink.

entries.name: Energy Drain
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one creature. Hit: 22 (4d10) necrotic damage. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this attack dies and instantly transforms into a free-willed shadow or vampirate (captain's choice) under the DM's control.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Ship Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: A ship upon which the captain stands, along with all creatures and objects aboard it, becomes invisible to creatures not aboard the ship. The captain must concentrate on this magical effect to maintain it (as if concentrating on a spell), and it lasts for up to 1 hour. The effect ends if the captain leaves the ship.

entries.name: Explode
entries.description: When the mage is reduced to 0 hit points, it explodes in a cloud of ash. Any creature within Very Close of it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 11 (2d10) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The mage can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The mage doesn't require air or drink.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mage makes two Ray of Cold attacks.

entries.name: Energy Drain
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one creature. Hit: 22 (4d10) necrotic damage. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this attack dies and instantly transforms into a free-willed shadow under the DM's control.

entries.name: Ray of Cold
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) cold damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: mage hand, message1/day: darkness, dimension door, fly, hypnotic pattern

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries.description: If the vampire drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, the vampire uses Shape-Shift to become mist (no action required). If it can't use Shape-Shift, it is destroyed.While it has 0 Hit Points in mist form, it can't return to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it returns to its vampire form and has the Paralyzed condition until it regains any Hit Points, and it regains 1 Hit Point after spending 1 hour there.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Vampire Weakness
entries.description: The vampire has these weaknesses:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.Running Water. The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition in its resting place, the vampire has the Paralyzed condition until the weapon is removed.Sunlight. The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: The vampire makes two Grave Strike attacks and uses Bite.

entries.name: Grave Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)) from one of two hands.

entries.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (17), one creature within Very Close that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount. A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a Vampire Spawn under the vampire's control.

entries.name: Vampiric Connection
entries.description: While the familiar and its vampire master are on the same plane of existence, the vampire can communicate with the familiar telepathically, and the vampire can perceive through the familiar's senses.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The familiar makes two Umbral Dagger attacks.

entries.name: Umbral Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (3d4) Necrotic damage. If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this attack, the target becomes Stable but has the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. While it has the Poisoned condition, the target has the Paralyzed condition.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Misty Escape
entries.description: If the vampire drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, the vampire uses Shape-Shift to become mist (no action required). If it can't use Shape-Shift, it is destroyed.While it has 0 Hit Points in mist form, it can't return to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it returns to its vampire form and has the Paralyzed condition until it regains any Hit Points, and it regains 1 Hit Point after spending 1 hour there.

entries.name: Vampire Weakness
entries.description: The vampire has these weaknesses:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.Running Water. The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition in its resting place, the vampire has the Paralyzed condition until the weapon is removed.Sunlight. The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: The vampire makes two Hellfire Claw attacks and uses Bite.

entries.name: Hellfire Claw (Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) Fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (17)) from one of two claws.

entries.name: Bite (Imp or Vampire Form Only)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (18), one creature within Very Close that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 6 (1d4 + 4) Piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) Necrotic damage and the creature loses its highest-level available spell slot (if any). The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount. A Humanoid reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage and then buried rises the following sunset as a Vampire Spawn under the vampire's control.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The vampire casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)):At will: Detect Magic, Detect Thoughts, Dispel Magic, Fireball (level 4 version), Mage Hand, Prestidigitation2/day: Scrying1/day: Wall of Fire

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: The vampire takes 10 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes one Bite attack and one Shadow Strike attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

entries.name: Shadow Strike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 14 (4d6) Cold damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Vampire Weakness
entries.description: The vampire has these weaknesses:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.Running Water. The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. The vampire is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition.Sunlight. The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes two Claw attacks and uses Bite.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) Slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (13)) from one of two claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (14), one creature within Very Close that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries.description: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Shadow Escape
entries.description: If the vampire drops to 0 Hit Points outside its resting place, it teleports into its resting place unless it is in running water or sunlight. If it can't teleport, it is destroyed. Once inside its resting place, it has the Paralyzed condition for 1 hour, after which it regains 1 Hit Point.

entries.name: Vampire Weakness
entries.description: The vampire has these weaknesses:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.Running Water. The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition in its resting place, the vampire has the Paralyzed condition until the weapon is removed.Sunlight. The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes two attacks, using Grave Strike or Sickening Ray in any combination.

entries.name: Grave Strike
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +10, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) Slashing damage plus 13 (3d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Hunger of Hadar (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The vampire casts Hunger of Hadar (level 5 version), requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (18)).

entries.name: Sickening Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +10, range Very Far. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the vampire's next turn.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The vampire has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Vampire Weakness
entries.description: The vampire has these weaknesses:Forbiddance. The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.Running Water. The vampire takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.Stake to the Heart. If a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire has the Incapacitated condition, the vampire has the Paralyzed condition until the weapon is removed.Sunlight. The vampire takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.Immobile Restoration. If the vampire drops to 0 Hit Points while it doesn't have the Petrified condition, it turns to stone, regains 50 Hit Points, and has the Petrified condition for 1 hour.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vampire makes two Claw attacks and uses Bite or Guardian's Command.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +9, reach Very Close. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) Slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)) from one of two claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (16), one creature within Very Close that is willing or that has the Grappled, Incapacitated, or Restrained condition. Failure: 7 (1d4 + 5) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage. The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the Necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains Hit Points equal to that amount.

entries.name: Guardian's Command
entries.description: The vampire casts Compulsion, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)).

entries.name: Vampiric Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The ixitxachitl is a 5th-level spellcaster that uses Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (Spell save Difficulty (11), +3 to hit with spell attacks). The ixitxachitl has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): guidance, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): charm person, create or destroy water2nd level (3 slots): hold person, silence3rd level (2 slots): dispel magic, tongues

entries.name: Vampiric Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (11) or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken, and the ixitxachitl regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Immutable Form
entries.description: The statue is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the statue fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The statue makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, that creature becomes cursed by the statue. The curse lasts for 10 minutes. While the creature is cursed, the statue has advantage on all attacks against it.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The mind flayer can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the mind flayer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The mind flayer doesn't require air, food, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The mind flayer makes two Claw attacks or one Claw attack and one Tentacles attack.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 10 (3d6) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape Difficulty (15)).

entries.name: Drink Sapience
entries.description: The mind flayer targets one creature it is grappling. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (15) or take 14 (4d6) psychic damage and gain 1 level of exhaustion. The mind flayer regains a number of hit points equal to the psychic damage dealt. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the psychic damage dies.

entries.name: Forbiddance
entries.description: The mist can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

entries.name: Life Sense
entries.description: The mist can sense the location of any creature within Far of it, unless that creature's type is Construct or Undead.

entries.name: Misty Form
entries.description: The mist can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The mist can't manipulate objects in any way that requires fingers or manual dexterity.

entries.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries.description: The mist takes 10 radiant damage whenever it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, the mist has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The mist doesn't require air or sleep.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: The mist touches one creature in its space. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) (Undead and Constructs automatically succeed), or it takes 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damage, the mist regains 10 hit points, and the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Abyssal Curse
entries.description: The vargouille targets one incapacitated Humanoid within Very Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or become cursed. The cursed target loses 1 point of Charisma after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell; don't count that time. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, it dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete can end the curse. Doing so undoes the changes made to the target by the curse.

entries.name: Stunning Shriek (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The vargouille shrieks. Each Humanoid and Beast within Close of the vargouille and able to hear it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or be frightened of the vargouille until the end of the vargouille's next turn. While frightened in this way, a target is stunned. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the Stunning Shriek of all vargouilles for 1 hour.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The vargouille has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Abyssal Curse
entries.description: The vargouille targets one Humanoid within Very Close of itself that has the incapacitated condition. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or become cursed. The cursed target's Charisma decreases by 1 after each hour, as its head takes on fiendish aspects, and its Charisma can't increase. The curse doesn't advance while the target is in sunlight or the area of a daylight spell. When the cursed target's Charisma becomes 2, the target dies, and its head tears from its body and becomes a new vargouille reflection. Casting remove curse, greater restoration, or a similar spell on the target before the transformation is complete ends the curse and restores the target's Charisma.

entries.name: Horrific Reflection (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The vargouille's head mimics that of a Humanoid the vargouille can see within Very Far of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (12) or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and have the frightened condition for 1 hour or until the vargouille loses concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). If the target's saving throw is successful or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Horrific Reflection of all vargouille reflections for 1 hour.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The impersonator can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries.name: Ambusher
entries.description: In the first round of a combat, the impersonator has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

entries.name: Surprise Attack
entries.description: If the impersonator surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The impersonator makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Read Thoughts
entries.description: The impersonator magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within Far of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but Melee of wood or dirt, Melee of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the impersonator can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the impersonator's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the impersonator has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vegepygmy regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vegepygmy regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vegepygmy makes two Claw attacks or two melee Spear attacks.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage, or 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Spores (1/Day)
entries.description: A Close-radius cloud of toxic spores extends out from the vegepygmy. The spores spread around corners. Each creature in that area that isn't a Plant must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, a target takes 9 (2d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vegepygmy regains 7 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The vegepygmy makes two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Toxic Mold (2/Day)
entries.description: The vegepygmy targets a creature it can see within Far of itself. If the target isn't a vegepygmy, it must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the target takes 13 (3d8) poison damage and has the blinded and deafened conditions for 1 minute as it becomes covered in a thick layer of mold. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vegepygmy regains 3 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vegepygmy's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The vegepygmy has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The vegepygmy regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn. If it takes cold, fire, or necrotic damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vegepygmy's next turn. The vegepygmy dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Thorny Body
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the vegepygmy deals 2 (1d4) piercing damage to any creature grappling it.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or have the prone condition.

entries.name: Inviolate Presence
entries.description: The veiled presence can't be targeted by divination magic or by features that would read its mind or determine its creature type.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the veiled presence fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The veiled presence makes two Blade of Judgment attacks and can use Revelation.

entries.name: Blade of Judgment
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach Very Close or range Far, one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (22), or on its next turn, it can either move or take an action, but not both.

entries.name: Revelation
entries.description: The veiled presence reveals a glimpse of its otherworldly nature to a creature it can see within Close of itself. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (22) or have the paralyzed condition until the end of its next turn, after which the target is immune to this Revelation for 24 hours.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The velociraptor has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the velociraptor's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The velociraptor makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Velomachus fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Velomachus makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 15 (1d10 + 10) piercing damage plus 6 (1d12) thunder damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (1d6 + 10) slashing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature, it is knocked prone.

entries.name: Battle Tide Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Velomachus exhales thunderous sound in a Far cone. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (25). On a failure, a creature takes 45 (7d12) force damage and 45 (7d12) thunder damage and is pushed up to Close in a horizontal direction of Velomachus' choice. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. Objects that aren't being worn or carried take the damage and are pushed as if they were creatures that failed the saving throw.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Velomachus casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:1/day each: contact other plane (as an action, contacting a long-dead spirit), divination, move earth, wall of force

entries.name: Poison Splash
entries.description: When the troll takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within Very Close of the troll takes 9 (2d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The troll makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage, and the creature is poisoned until the start of the troll's next turn.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Venom Spray (Recharge 6)
entries.description: The troll slices itself with a claw, releasing a spray of poison in a Close cube. The troll takes 7 (2d6) slashing damage (this damage can't be reduced in any way). Each creature in the area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (16). On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) Piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The verbeeg's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:1/day each: animal messenger, fog cloud, freedom of movement, pass without trace, silence, water walk

entries.name: Simple Weapon Wielder
entries.description: A simple weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the verbeeg hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The verbeeg makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage if used to make a ranged attack or used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 9 (3d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (15) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Simple Weapon Wielder
entries.description: A simple weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the verbeeg hits with it (included in the attack).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The verbeeg makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) piercing damage, or 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage if used to make a ranged attack or used with two hands to make a melee attack.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Constricting Vine
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)). Until the grapple ends, the target takes 4 (1d8) Bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns, and the blight can't make Constricting Vine attacks.

entries.name: Entangling Plants (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The blight casts the Entangle spell, using Constitution as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (12)).

entries.name: Constricting Vine
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 1d10 + 2 Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (12)) from one of three vines.

entries.name: Entangling Vines (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Grasping vines momentarily appear on each enemy in a Very Close-radius Sphere centered on a point of the blight's choice within Far of it. Each target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (12) or have the Restrained condition until the start of the blight's next turn.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the violet fungus is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the fungus move or act, that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the violet fungus isn't ordinary fungus.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fungus makes 1d4 Rotting Touch attacks.

entries.name: Rotting Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 4 (1d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The fungus makes two Rotting Touch attacks.

entries.name: Rotting Touch
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +2, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d8) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The necrohulk makes two Rotting Slam attacks.

entries.name: Rotting Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Spore Bomb (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close-radius Sphere centered on a point the necrohulk can see within Far. Failure: 28 (8d6) Necrotic damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the necrohulk's next turn. While Poisoned, the target can't regain Hit Points. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Disintegration
entries.description: If the magen dies, it disintegrates into dust, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The magen has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The magen makes two Psychic Blast attacks.

entries.name: Psychic Blast
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close or range Far. Hit: 21 (6d6) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The magen casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: Dancing Lights, Minor Illusion1/day each: Hypnotic Pattern, Major Image

entries.name: Assassinate
entries.description: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

entries.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries.description: The assassin deals an extra 14 (4d6) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within Very Close of an ally of the assassin that isn't incapacitated and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries.name: Curse (Recharges After a Long Rest)
entries.description: The Vistana targets one creature that it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be cursed. The Vistana chooses the curse's effect from the options that follow; other Vistani curses are possible. All such effects deal psychic damage to the Vistani who uttered them when they end:The target is unable to perform a certain kind of act involving fine motor control, such as tying knots, writing, playing an instrument, sewing, or casting spells that have somatic components. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 1d6 psychic damage.The target's appearance changes in a sinister yet purely cosmetic way. For example, the curse can place a scar on the target's face, turn the target's teeth into yellow fangs, or give the target bad breath. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 1d6 psychic damage.A nonmagical item in the target's possession (chosen by the DM) disappears and can't be found until the curse ends. The lost item can weigh no more than 1 pound. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 1d6 psychic damage.The target gains vulnerability to a damage type of the Vistana's choice. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 3d6 psychic damage.The target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws tied to one ability score of the Vistana's choice. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 3d6 psychic damage.The target's attunement to one magic item (chosen by the DM) ends, and the target can't attune to the chosen item until the curse ends. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 5d6 psychic damage.The target is blinded, deafened, or both. When this curse ends, the Vistana takes 5d6 psychic damage.The curse lasts until ended with a greater restoration spell, a remove curse spell, or similar magic. It doesn't end when the target dies. If a cursed target is returned to life, the curse remains in effect.

entries.name: Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: As an action, a Vistana can target a creature within Very Close that the Vistana can see. This magical ability, which the Vistani call the Evil Eye, duplicates the duration and effect of the animal friendship, charm person, or hold person spell (Vistana's choice; spell Difficulty (11)), but requires neither somatic nor material components. If the target succeeds on the save, the Vistana is blinded until the end of the Vistana's next turn.A Vistana who uses Evil Eye can't use it again before finishing a short or long rest. Once a target succeeds on a saving throw against a Vistana's Evil Eye, it is immune to the Evil Eye of all Vistani for 24 hours.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) slashing damage.

entries.name: Light Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The captain makes three melee attacks: two with its scimitar and one with its dagger. Or the captain makes two ranged attacks with its daggers.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Dagger
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Cunning Action
entries.description: On each of its turns, the spy can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The spy makes two melee attacks.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The thug makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.
