entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The apprentice regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries.name: Verdant Talisman
entries.description: At the end of a 10-minute ritual, the apprentice can touch one willing creature (including itself) and bestow upon it a small talisman imbued with magic. Upon receiving the talisman, the creature gains 10 temporary hit points, and it can add 1d6 to its initiative rolls while it wears the talisman. These benefits last for 1 hour or until the apprentice conducts another ritual to bestow another talisman. When the benefits expire, the talisman crumbles to dust.

entries.name: Briar Vine
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the apprentice can pull it up to Very Close closer to itself.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:At will: druidcraft, spare the dying1/day: pass without trace

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: As long as the pledgemage has at least 1 hit point remaining, the pledgemage regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn.

entries.name: Verdant Talisman
entries.description: At the end of a 10-minute ritual, the pledgemage can touch one willing creature (including itself) and bestow upon it a small talisman imbued with magic. Upon receiving the talisman, the creature gains 10 temporary hit points, and it can add 1d6 to its initiative rolls while it wears the talisman. These benefits last for 1 hour or until the pledgemage conducts another ritual to bestow another talisman. When the benefits expire, the talisman crumbles to dust.

entries.name: Briar Vine
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +5 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 18 (4d8) poison damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, the apprentice can pull it up to Very Close closer to itself.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The apprentice casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:At will: druidcraft, spare the dying1/day each: death ward, pass without trace, speak with plants

entries.name: Essence Transfer (1/Day)
entries.description: The professor can cast the animate dead spell, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Mortality Spear attacks. It can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Mortality Spear
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Very Far, one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the target can't regain hit points until the start of the professor's next turn.

entries.name: Essence Pulse (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The professor creates a life-draining vortex in a Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature of the professor's choice that it can see within that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (15), taking 23 (5d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The professor then regains 10 hit points. An affected creature's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The creature dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: druidcraft, spare the dying1/day each: antilife shell, bane, feign death, speak with dead

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The professor makes two Verdant Lash attacks.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The professor casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:At will: druidcraft, spare the dying1/day each: greater restoration, lesser restoration, mass cure wounds, pass without trace, plant growth, revivify

entries.name: Verdant Lash
entries.description: Melee Spell Attack: +7 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (15) or be pulled up to Very Close closer to the professor.

entries.name: Summon Nature's Avatar (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The professor magically summons a Groff. The groff appears in an unoccupied space within Far of the professor, acts as the professor's ally, and takes its turns immediately after the professor's. The professor can communicate telepathically with this groff while it remains. The groff remains for 10 minutes, until it or the professor dies, or until the professor dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Antimagic Cone
entries.description: The woe strider's open mouth creates an area of antimagic, as in the antimagic field spell, in a Far cone. At the start of each of its turns, the woe strider decides which way the cone faces and whether its mouth is open or closed.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The woe strider makes two claw attacks and one bite attack. If both claws hit the same creature, the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)).

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature that is grappled, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage plus 16 (3d10) psychic damage. In addition, each magic item the creature is carrying that isn't an artifact has its magical properties suppressed for 1 minute.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The wolf has Advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: If the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing is motionless (except for its lure) at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing move or act (except for the lure), that creature must succeed on a Difficulty (18) Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing is animate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wolf-in-sheep's-clothing makes one Bite attack and two Root Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

entries.name: Root Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (16)). While grappled in this way, the target has the restrained condition, and at the start of each of the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing's turns, the wolf-in-sheep's-clothing can pull the target up to Very Close toward itself (no action required). The wolf-in-sheep's-clothing has four root tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries.description: The wood elf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

entries.name: Mask of the Wild
entries.description: The wood elf can attempt to hide even when they are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wood elf makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged Very Far, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Fey Ancestry
entries.description: The wood elf has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put the wood elf to sleep.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The wood elf's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (12)). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: dancing lights1/day each: darkness, faerie fire, levitate (self only)

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The wood elf is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The wood elf has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): mage hand, minor illusion, poison spray, ray of frost1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield, witch bolt2nd level (3 slots): alter self, misty step, web3rd level (3 slots): fly, lightning bolt4th level (3 slots): Evard's black tentacles, greater invisibility5th level (2 slots): cloudkill

entries.name: Staff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d6 - 1) bludgeoning damage, or 3 (1d8 - 1) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands, plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Summon Demon (1/Day)
entries.description: The wood elf magically summons a quasit, or attempts to summon a shadow demon with a 50 percent chance of success. The summoned demon appears in an unoccupied space within Far of its summoner, acts as an ally of its summoner, and can't summon other demons. It remains for 10 minutes, until it or its summoner dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Plant Camouflage
entries.description: The wood woad has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks it makes in any terrain with ample obscuring vegetation.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The wood woad regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in contact with the ground. If the wood woad takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wood woad's next turn. The wood woad dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Tree Stride
entries.description: Once on each of its turns, the wood woad can use Very Close of its movement to step magically into one living tree within Very Close of it and emerge from a second living tree within Far of it that it can see, appearing in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wood woad makes two Club attacks.

entries.name: Club
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 14 (4d4 + 4) force damage.

entries.name: Beast of Burden
entries.description: The donkey is considered to be a Large animal for the purpose of determining its carrying capacity.

entries.name: Sure-Footed
entries.description: The donkey has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it prone.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Piercing damage, and the next attack roll made against the target before the start of the worg's next turn has Advantage.

entries.name: Lightning Overload
entries.description: When the robot takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or have the stunned condition until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The robot makes two Cargo Tentacle attacks.

entries.name: Cargo Tentacle
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the grappled condition (escape Difficulty (15)). The robot has two cargo tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

entries.name: Tractor Beam
entries.description: The robot casts Telekinesis, targeting only creatures with the incapacitated condition or objects. It requires no spell components and uses Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

entries.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries.description: The wraith can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries.description: While in sunlight, the wraith has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls.

entries.name: Life Drain
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 21 (4d8 + 3) Necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, its Hit Point maximum decreases by an amount equal to the damage taken.

entries.name: Create Specter
entries.description: The wraith targets a Humanoid corpse within Very Close of itself that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute. The target's spirit rises as a Specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith's control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at a time.

entries.name: Wretched Pack Tactics
entries.description: The sorrowsworn has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the sorrowsworn's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated. The sorrowsworn otherwise has disadvantage on attack rolls.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage, and the sorrowsworn attaches to the target. While attached, the sorrowsworn can't attack, and at the start of each of the sorrowsworn's turns, the target takes 6 (1d10 + 1) necrotic damage.The attached sorrowsworn moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the sorrowsworn's movement. The sorrowsworn can detach itself by spending Very Close of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the sorrowsworn.

entries.name: Earth Tremors
entries.description: The wurm creates earth tremors as it moves overland or underground. Any creature that comes within Close of the moving wurm for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (20) or take 10 (3d6) bludgeoning damage and fall prone. Any structure or object anchored to the ground that comes within Close of the moving wurm for the first time on a turn takes 10 (3d6) force damage.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The wurm deals double damage to objects and structures.

entries.name: Tunneler
entries.description: The wurm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a Very Close-diameter tunnel in its wake.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 24 (5d6 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (20) or be swallowed by the wurm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wurm, and takes 17 (5d6) acid damage at the start of each of the wurm's turns. If the wurm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wurm must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (21) at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within Very Close of the wurm. If the wurm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d4 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Cloak of the Mountain (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: The wynling magically turns invisible, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, for 1 minute or until it makes an attack roll.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The wyvern makes one Bite attack and one Sting attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Sting
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 24 (7d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the start of the wyvern's next turn.

entries.name: Earth Glide
entries.description: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the xorn doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

entries.name: Treasure Sense
entries.description: The xorn can pinpoint the location of precious metals and stones within Far of itself.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The xorn makes one Bite attack and three Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries.description: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage. If at least one of the xvart's allies is within Very Close of the target, the xvart can push the target Very Close if the target is a Medium or smaller creature.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Low Cunning
entries.description: The xvart can take the Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

entries.name: Overbearing Pack
entries.description: The xvart has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to shove a creature if at least one of the xvart's allies is within Very Close of the target and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries.description: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Sling
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Raxivort's Blessing
entries.description: When the xvart reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the xvart gains 4 temporary hit points.

entries.name: Raxivort's Tongue
entries.description: The xvart can communicate with ordinary bats and rats, as well as giant bats and giant rats.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The xvart makes two Scimitar or Raxivort's Bite attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.name: Raxivort's Bite
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +3 to hit, range Close, one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The xvart casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (11)):At will: detect magic, mage armor (self only), mage hand, minor illusion, prestidigitation1/day each: burning hands, invisibility

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The yagnoloth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yagnoloth makes one Electrified Touch attack and one Massive Arm attack, or it makes one Massive Arm attack and uses Battlefield Cunning, if available, or Teleport.

entries.name: Electrified Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 27 (6d8) lightning damage.

entries.name: Massive Arm
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 23 (3d12 + 4) force damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16) or become stunned until the end of the yagnoloth's next turn.

entries.name: Battlefield Cunning (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Up to two allied yugoloths within Far of the yagnoloth that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

entries.name: Life Leech
entries.description: The yagnoloth touches one incapacitated creature within Close of it. The target takes 36 (7d8 + 4) necrotic damage, and the yagnoloth gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (16), or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to half the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest, and the target dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The yagnoloth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (16)):At will: darkness, detect magic, dispel magic, invisibility (self only), suggestion3/day: lightning bolt

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: The yagnoloth teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to Far to an unoccupied space it can see.

entries.name: Charge
entries.description: If the yak moves at least Close straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Ram
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one prone creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.The possession lasts until either the body drops to 0 hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The yakfolk is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save Difficulty (14), +6 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): light, mending, sacred flame, thaumaturgy1st level (4 slots): bane, command, cure wounds, sanctuary2nd level (3 slots): augury, hold person, spiritual weapon3rd level (3 slots): bestow curse, protection from energy, sending4th level (1 slot): banishment

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yakfolk makes two melee attacks.

entries.name: Quarterstaff
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Summon Earth Elemental (1/Day)
entries.description: The yakfolk summons an earth elemental. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space within Far of its summoner and acts as an ally of the summoner. It remains for 10 minutes, until it dies, or until its summoner dismisses it as an action.

entries.name: Possession (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The yakfolk attempts to magically possess a humanoid or giant. The yakfolk must touch the target throughout a short rest, or the attempt fails. At the end of the rest, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) or be possessed by the yakfolk, which disappears with everything it is carrying and wearing. Until the possession ends, the target is incapacitated, loses control of its body, and is unaware of its surroundings. The yakfolk now controls the body and can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its alignment; its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores; and its proficiencies. It otherwise uses the target's statistics, except the target's knowledge, class features, feats, and proficiencies.The possession lasts until either the body drops to 0 hit points, the yakfolk ends the possession as an action, or the yakfolk is forced out of the body by an effect such as the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the yakfolk reappears in an unoccupied space within Very Close of the body and is stunned until the end of its next turn. If the host body dies while it is possessed by the yakfolk, the yakfolk dies as well, and its body doesn't reappear.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yakfolk makes two attacks, either with its greatsword or its longbow.

entries.name: Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

entries.name: Longbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 9 (2d8) piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Yeenoghu fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Yeenoghu has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Yeenoghu makes three Flail attacks.

entries.name: Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 22 (2d12 + 9) force damage. If it's his turn, Yeenoghu can cause the target to suffer one of the following additional effects, each of which he can apply only once per turnConfusion. The target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or be affected by the confusion spell until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.Force. The target takes an extra 13 (2d12) force damage.Paralysis. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (17) or be paralyzed until the start of Yeenoghu's next turn.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) acid damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Yeenoghu casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: detect magic3/day each: dispel magic, fear, invisibility1/day: teleport

entries.name: False Appearance
entries.description: While the creeper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary flowering vine.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The creeper regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the creeper takes fire, necrotic, or radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of its next turn. The creeper dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Touch
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) psychic damage. If the target is a humanoid that drops to 0 hit points as a result of this damage, it dies and is implanted with a yellow musk creeper bulb. Unless the bulb is destroyed, the corpse animates as a yellow musk zombie after being dead for 24 hours. The bulb is destroyed if the creature is raised from the dead before it can transform into a yellow musk zombie, or if the corpse is targeted by a remove curse spell or similar magic before it animates.

entries.name: Yellow Musk (3/Day)
entries.description: The creeper's flowers release a strong musk that targets all humanoids within Close of it. Each target must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (11) or be charmed by the creeper for 1 minute. A creature charmed in this way does nothing on its turn except move as close as it can to the creeper. A creature charmed by the creeper can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 +the damage taken, unless the damage is fire or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Sunlight Banishment
entries.description: If the yeth hound starts its turn in sunlight, it is transported to the Ethereal Plane. While sunlight shines on the spot from which it vanished, the hound must remain in the Deep Ethereal. After sunset, it returns to the Border Ethereal at the same spot, whereupon it typically sets out to find its pack or its master. The hound is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane. Once it is adjacent to its master or a pack mate that is on the Material Plane, a yeth hound in the Border Ethereal can return to the Material Plane as an action.

entries.name: Telepathic Bond
entries.description: While the yeth hound is on the same plane of existence as its master, it can magically convey what it senses to its master, and the two can communicate telepathically with each other.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage, plus 14 (4d6) psychic damage if the target is frightened.

entries.name: Baleful Baying
entries.description: The yeth hound bays magically. Every enemy within Very Far of the hound that can hear it must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (13) or be frightened of the hound until the end of the hound's next turn or until the hound is incapacitated. A frightened target that starts its turn within Close of the hound must use all its movement on that turn to get as far from the hound as possible, must finish the move before taking an action, and must take the most direct route, even if hazards lie that way. A target that successfully saves is immune to the baying of all yeth hounds for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Fear of Fire
entries.description: If the yeti takes Fire damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two attacks, using Claw or Ice Throw in any combination.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +6, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) Slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) Cold damage.

entries.name: Ice Throw
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +6, range Close. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) Bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) Cold damage.

entries.name: Chilling Gaze
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (13), one creature the yeti can see within Close. Failure: 5 (2d4) Cold damage, and the target has the Paralyzed condition until the start of the yeti's next turn unless the target has Immunity to Cold damage. Success: The target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

entries.name: Fear of Fire
entries.description: If the yeti takes fire damage, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yeti can use its Chilling Gaze and makes two greatsword attacks.

entries.name: Frost Brand Greatsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

entries.name: Chilling Gaze
entries.description: The yeti targets one creature it can see within Close of it. If the target can see the yeti, the target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) against this magic or take 10 (3d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed for 1 minute, unless it is immune to cold damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target's saving throw is successful, or if the effect ends on it, the target is immune to the Chilling Gaze of all yetis (but not abominable yetis) for 1 hour.

entries.name: Keen Smell
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

entries.name: Snow Camouflage
entries.description: The yeti has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) cold damage.

entries.name: Demonic Restoration
entries.description: If the yochlol dies outside the Abyss, its body dissolves, and it gains a new body instantly, reviving with all its Hit Points in the Abyss.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The yochlol has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries.description: The yochlol can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Web Walker
entries.description: The yochlol ignores movement restrictions caused by webs.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yochlol makes two Caustic Lash attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Web or Dominate Person if available.

entries.name: Caustic Lash
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +8, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) Acid damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The yochlol casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Detect Thoughts, Gaseous Form (self only), Web1/day: Dominate Person

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: The dragon can breathe both air and water.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 16 (2d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) force damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) slashing damage.

entries.name: Singularity Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The dragon creates a shining bead of gravitational force in its mouth, then releases the energy in a Close cone. Each creature in that area must make a Strength Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, the creature takes 36 (8d8) force damage, and its speed becomes 0 until the start of the dragon's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and its speed isn't reduced.

entries.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries.description: If a creature starts its turn within Close of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12) if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.If the basilisk sees its reflection within Close of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using Close of movement, exiting prone.

Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (17). On a failed save, a creature takes 31 (7d8) force damage and is magically weakened as it is desynchronized from the time stream. While the creature is in this state, attack rolls against it have advantage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only. A weakened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on two of these saves.

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The wereraven can use its action to polymorph into a raven-humanoid hybrid or into a raven, or back into its human form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its human form if it dies.

entries.name: Mimicry
entries.description: The wereraven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Difficulty (10) Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: The wereraven regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the wereraven takes damage from a silvered weapon or a spell, this trait doesn't function at the start of the wereraven's next turn. The wereraven dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: The wereraven makes two weapon attacks, one of which can be with its hand crossbow.

entries.name: Beak (Raven or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage in raven form, or 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage in hybrid form. If the target is humanoid, it must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (10) or be cursed with wereraven lycanthropy.

entries.name: Shortsword (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Hand Crossbow (Human or Hybrid Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Ice Walk
entries.description: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. Additionally, Difficult Terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost it extra movement.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

entries.name: Rend
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) Slashing damage plus 2 (1d4) Cold damage.

entries.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (15), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 40 (9d8) Cold damage. Success: Half damage.

entries.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries.description: The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The yuan-ti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yuan-ti makes two Bite attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Suggestion if available.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +7, reach Very Close. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) Piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (15), one Large or smaller creature within Very Close. Failure: 28 (7d6 + 4) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the Grappled condition (escape Difficulty (14)), and it has the Restrained condition until the grapple ends. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Poison Spray (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Finesse Reaction Roll (14), each creature in a Close Cone. Failure: 21 (6d6) Poison damage, and the target has the Poisoned condition until the end of the yuan-ti's next turn. While Poisoned, the target has the Blinded condition. Success: Half damage only.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (15)):At will: Animal Friendship (snakes only)3/day: Suggestion

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The anathema has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Ophidiophobia Aura
entries.description: Any creature of the anathema's choice, other than a snake or a yuan-ti, that starts its turn within Close of the anathema must succeed on a Presence Reaction Roll (17) or become frightened of snakes and yuan-ti. A frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this anathema's aura for the next 24 hours.

entries.name: Six Heads
entries.description: The anathema has advantage on saves against being blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, or knocked unconscious.

entries.name: Multiattack (Anathema Form Only)
entries.description: The anathema makes two Claw attacks and one Flurry of Bites attack.

entries.name: Claw (Anathema Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

entries.name: Flurry of Bites (Anathema Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 27 (6d6 + 6) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Constrict (Snake Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Close, one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (16)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and it takes 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns. The anathema can constrict only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Anathema Form Only)
entries.description: The anathema casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)):At will: animal friendship (snakes only)3/day each: darkness, entangle, fear, polymorph, suggestion

entries.name: Reckless
entries.description: At the start of its turn, the broodguard can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The broodguard makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

entries.name: Claw
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

entries.description: The yuan-ti has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yuan-ti makes two Scimitar attacks.

entries.name: Scimitar
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) Slashing damage.

entries.name: Poison Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Very Far. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) Poison damage.

entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) Piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

entries.name: Poison Ray (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Very Far. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Poison damage.

entries.description: The yuan-ti makes two Poison Burst attacks, and it can use Spellcasting to cast Suggestion if available.

entries.name: Poison Burst (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close or range Very Far. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) Poison damage.

entries.description: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: Animal Friendship (snakes only)2/day: Suggestion

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

entries.description: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Malison Type
entries.description: The yuan-ti has one of the following types:Type 4: Human form with one or more serpentine tailsType 5: Human form covered in scales

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13)). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: animal friendship (snakes only)3/day: suggestion

entries.name: Sseth's Blessing
entries.description: When the yuan-ti reduces an enemy to 0 hit points, the yuan-ti gains 9 temporary hit points.

entries.description: The yuan-ti makes two Bite attacks and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede the yuan-ti's darkvision.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The yuan-ti makes one Constrict attack and one Scimitar attack, or it makes two Spectral Fangs attacks.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (14)) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The yuan-ti can constrict only one creature at a time.

entries.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Spectral Fangs
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Invoke Nightmare (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries.description: The yuan-ti taps into the nightmares of one creature it can see within Far of it and creates an illusory, immobile manifestation of the creature's deepest fears, visible only to that creature.The target must make a Instinct Reaction Roll (13). On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of the manifestation, believing it to be real. The yuan-ti must concentrate to maintain the illusion (as if concentrating on a spell), which lasts for up to 1 minute and can't be harmed. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the illusion on a success or taking 11 (2d10) psychic damage on a failure.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):At will: animal friendship (snakes only), mage hand, message, prestidigitation3/day: suggestion2/day each: darkness, fear

entries.description: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spectral Fangs
entries.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range Very Far, one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) poison damage.

entries.name: Merrshaulk's Slumber (1/Day)
entries.description: The yuan-ti targets up to five creatures that it can see within Far of it. Each target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or fall into a magical sleep and be unconscious for 10 minutes. A sleeping target awakens if it takes damage or if someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake. This magical sleep has no effect on a creature immune to being charmed.

entries.name: Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (14)):At will: animal friendship (snakes only), guidance, mage hand, message3/day: suggestion2/day each: hold person, invisibility

entries.name: Shapechanger
entries.description: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Medium snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The yuan-ti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Malison Type
entries.description: The yuan-ti has one of the following types:Type 1: Human body with snake headType 2: Human head and body with snakes for armsType 3: Human head and upper body with a serpentine lower body instead of legs

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (13), +5 to hit with spell attacks). The yuan-ti can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: animal friendship (snakes only), eldritch blast (2 beams), minor illusion, poison spray3/day: suggestion

entries.name: Multiattack (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: The yuan-ti makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

entries.name: Bite (Snake Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

entries.name: Constrict
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape Difficulty (13)). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

entries.name: Scimitar (Yuan-ti Form Only)
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.

entries.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries.description: The rakshasa's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save Difficulty (11)). The rakshasa can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:At will: detect thoughts, disguise self1/day: shield

entries.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries.description: The rakshasa can't be affected or detected by spells of 1st level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

entries.name: Magic Weapons
entries.description: The rakshasa's weapon attacks are magical.

entries.name: Martial Prowess (1/Turn)
entries.description: When the rakshasa hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 11 (2d10) damage of the weapon's type, and the creature must make a Strength Reaction Roll (15). On a failure, the rakshasa can push the creature up to Very Close away from it, knock the creature prone, or make the creature drop one item it is holding of the rakshasa's choice.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The rakshasa makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelins.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage if used with two hands.

entries.name: Javelin
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the zaratan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Siege Monster
entries.description: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures (included in Earth-Shaking Movement).

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zaratan makes one Bite attack and one Stomp attack.

entries.name: Bite
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Stomp
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, reach Close, one target. Hit: 26 (3d10 + 10) thunder damage.

entries.name: Spit Rock
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +17 to hit, range Very Far/Very Far, one target. Hit: 31 (6d8 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Spew Debris (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The zaratan exhales rocky debris in a Far cube. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (25). A creature takes 33 (6d10) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is knocked prone.

entries.name: Devil's Sight
entries.description: Magical darkness doesn't impede Zariel's darkvision.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Zariel fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Zariel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries.description: Zariel regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn. If she takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn. Zariel dies only if she starts her turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Zariel makes three Flail or Longsword attacks. She can replace one attack with a use of Horrid Touch, if available.

entries.name: Flail
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) force damage plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Longsword
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) radiant damage, or 19 (2d10 + 8) radiant damage when used with two hands, plus 36 (8d8) fire damage.

entries.name: Horrid Touch (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: Zariel touches one creature within Very Close of her. The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (26) or take 44 (8d10) necrotic damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is blinded and deafened. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Zariel casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (26)):At will: alter self (can become Medium when changing her appearance), detect evil and good, fireball, invisibility (self only), major image, wall of fire3/day each: blade barrier, dispel evil and good, finger of death

entries.name: Teleport
entries.description: Zariel teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to Very Far to an unoccupied space she can see.

entries.name: Hooves
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries.description: Zegana can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Zegana fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Zegana has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Zegana is a 15th-level Simic spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save Difficulty (18), +10 to hit with spell attacks). She has the following wizard spells prepared:Cantrips (at will): acid splash, druidcraft, ray of frost, shape water1st level (4 slots): color spray, expeditious retreat, fog cloud, shield2nd level (3 slots): enlarge/reduce, gust of wind3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, fly, slow4th level (3 slots): control water, ice storm, polymorph5th level (2 slots): conjure elemental, creation6th level (1 slot): move earth, wall of ice7th level (1 slot): prismatic spray, teleport8th level (1 slot): control weather, dominate monster

entries.name: Prime Speaker's Trident
entries.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach Very Close or range Close, one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage, and the trident emits a thunderous boom. Each creature in a Close cube originating from the prongs of the trident must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, the creature takes 9 (2d8) thunder damage and is pushed Very Close away from Zegana. If the creature is underwater, the damage is increased to 13 (3d8). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

entries.name: Deluge (Recharge 4–6)
entries.description: Zegana conjures a wave of water that crashes down on an area within Very Far of her. The area can be up to Close long, up to Very Close wide, and up to Very Close tall. Each creature in that area must make a Agility Reaction Roll (18). On a failed save, a creature takes 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. The water spreads out across the ground, extinguishing unprotected flames it comes in contact with, and then vanishes.

entries.name: Brave
entries.description: The adept has advantage on any saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Halfling Nimbleness
entries.description: The adept can move through the space of a medium of larger creature.

entries.name: Unarmored Defense
entries.description: While the adept is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The adept makes three unarmed strikes or three dart attacks.

entries.name: Unarmed Strike
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, the adept can choose one of the following additional effects:The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (13) or drop one item it is holding (adept's choice).The target must succeed on a Agility Reaction Roll (13) or be knocked prone.The target must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (13) or be stunned until the end of the adept's next turn.

entries.name: Dart
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries.description: The thug has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the thug's allies is within Very Close of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The thug makes two melee attacks

entries.name: Mace
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range Far, one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) piercing damage.

entries.name: Aura of Dread
entries.description: Creatures in a Very Close Emanation originating from the Zhentilar have their Speeds halved while in the Emanation. The Zhentilar can designate creatures to be unaffected by the aura.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Zhentilar makes three attacks, using Dooming Blade or Oppressive Ray in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

entries.name: Dooming Blade
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +5, reach Very Close. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) Necrotic damage.

entries.name: Oppressive Ray
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +5, range Far. Hit: 16 (3d10) Psychic damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: The Zhentilar casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (13)):1/day each: Command, Fear

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The Zhentilar makes two attacks, using Shortsword or Pistol in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Knock Down.

entries.name: Shortsword
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) Poison damage.

entries.name: Pistol
entries.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +4, range Far. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) Piercing damage.

entries.name: Knock Down
entries.description: Strength Reaction Roll (12), one creature within Very Close that the Zhentilar can see. Failure: 4 (1d4 + 2) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the Prone condition.

entries.name: Disembodied Voice
entries.description: Up to three times in its life, the zodar can cause a message of up to twenty-five words to issue from the air around it. It speaks only when it has something profoundly important to say, and the message can be understood by any creature that has an Intelligence score of 2 or higher.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If the zodar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Transport Inhibitor
entries.description: The zodar can't be teleported or sent to any plane of existence against its will.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The zodar doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zodar makes two Crushing Fist attacks. Before or after these attacks, the zodar uses Forced Teleport.

entries.name: Crushing Fist
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 21 (2d10 + 10) force damage.

entries.name: Forced Teleport
entries.description: The zodar magically warps space around one creature it can see within Far of itself. The target must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (21). On a failed save, the target takes 22 (4d10) force damage, and the zodar teleports it, along with any equipment it's wearing or carrying, up to Far to an unoccupied space that the zodar can see and that can support the target. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't teleported.

entries.name: Wish
entries.description: The zodar casts the wish spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (17)). After casting this spell, the zodar turns to dust and is destroyed.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 Hit Points, it makes a Constitution saving throw (Difficulty (5) plus the damage taken) unless the damage is Radiant or from a Critical Hit. On a successful save, the zombie drops to 1 Hit Point instead.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Attack Roll: +3, reach Very Close. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) Bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Deathly Stench
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the zombie must succeed on a Finesse Reaction Roll (14) or take 9 (2d8) poison damage and be poisoned until the start of the creature's next turn.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The zombie makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Flesh Entomb (Recharge 5–6)
entries.description: The zombie flings a detached clump of corpses at a creature it can see within Close of it. The target must succeed on a Strength Reaction Roll (16) or take 16 (3d10) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it becomes entombed in dead flesh.A creature entombed in the dead flesh is restrained, has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the dead flesh, and takes 10 (3d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can be freed if the dead flesh is destroyed. The dead flesh is a Large object with AC 10, 25 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

entries.name: Undead Fortitude
entries.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

entries.name: Unusual Nature
entries.description: The zombie doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Viral Aura
entries.description: Any creature that starts its turn within Very Close of the plague spreader must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12). On a failed save, the creature is poisoned and can't regain hit points until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this plague spreader's Viral Aura for 24 hours.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: The plague spreader makes two Slam attacks.

entries.name: Slam
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) necrotic damage.

entries.name: Virulent Miasma (1/Day)
entries.description: The plague spreader releases toxic gas in a Close-radius sphere centered on itself. Each creature in that area must make a Finesse Reaction Roll (12), taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Humanoid reduced to 0 hit points by this damage dies and rises as a zombie (see its stat block in the Monster Manual) 1 minute later. The zombie acts immediately after the plague spreader in the initiative count.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: The zorbo has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries.description: The zorbo magically absorbs the natural strength of its surroundings, adjusting its Armor Class based on the material it is standing or climbing on: AC 15 for wood or bone, AC 17 for earth or stone, or AC 19 for metal. If the zorbo isn't in contact with any of these substances, its AC is 10.

entries.name: Destructive Claws
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 8 (2d6 + 1) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature wearing armor, carrying a shield, or in possession of a magic item that improves its AC, it must make a Agility Reaction Roll (11). On a failed save, one such item worn or carried by the creature (the target's choice) magically deteriorates, taking a permanent and cumulative −1 penalty to the AC it offers, and the zorbo gains a +1 bonus to AC until the start of its next turn. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield or magic item that drops to a 0 AC increase is destroyed.

entries.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries.description: If Zuggtmoy fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries.description: Zuggtmoy has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries.name: Multiattack
entries.description: Zuggtmoy makes three Pseudopod attacks.

entries.name: Pseudopod
entries.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach Very Close, one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) force damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

entries.name: Spellcasting
entries.description: Zuggtmoy casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save Difficulty (22)):At will: detect magic, locate animals or plants3/day each: dispel magic, entangle, plant growth1/day each: etherealness, teleport
